reviews.review: This was the answer to a several month long search for a simple but ass kicking great tasting Italian meal. It was a busy Tuesday night, so we took a bar seat and enjoyed the great bartending by Mike. We asked him about a wine, he said it was good. When he brought the bottle it was a screw top... I was a bit concerned with the screw top. We had the wine with dinner and enjoyed a great meal. We met some nice peeps next to us and had some great conversation and a most enjoyable evening. Thank you Mike and Buddy V"s for a most enjoyable time and meal. We'll be back. Highly recommend for great tasting authentic style Italian food, with a classy twist.

Very good meal, timely reservation and service!  My only complaint would have my balsamic salad dressing was below standard although the ingredients of the salad were good quality.  The Lasagna is a mega-meal onto itself.  The Tomato Basil soup was good and my wife loved her Spaghetti Bologanese.  The Raspberry Sorbet was excellent!

I'm never entirely happy with my brunch choices in Vegas, possibly because we pay so much and my standards then are equally high. Buddy V's fulfilled my brunch expectations and was trully wonderful. Each bite was amazing! I will absolutely come back on our next visit. Don't leave Vegas without coming here, and specifically Sunday Brunch. Try everything!!

Loved this restaurant! My friend and I came here for dinner on my birthday weekend before going to see Mysteré across the street. We had the garlic cheese bread as an appetizer, which was AMAZING. Seriously we both moaned upon the first bite. For my main entrée, I got the Chicken Rigatoni and it was soooo good! The portion size was perfect and the pasta was very delicious! For dessert I got the italian donuts which were also delicious! My favorite was the strawberry one, but the chocolate was a close second! Our server was awesome too, he was very attentive and we never went too long without seeing him. I would definitely come back to Buddy V's!

So I love the food! Food is fantastic. Service was subpar. Our server Deanna seemed irked by our presence. If this is suppose to be a family friendly restaurant I definitely didn't get that feel. Half our party arrived and sat down and began eating. Then the rest of us joined them about 15 minutes later. We stood there waiting to be seated with our group for about another 10 by that time some of our group had finished eating stood up and left so we could sit. No one came to ask if we needed help as we stood next the table. Like I said food Amazing service Subpar at best.
The best Italian food I've ever had in my life. The environment and service is amazing. This is a dinner night my family and I will remember

Went there for dinner on the way back to California. First of all, we were greeted when we went in. We were sat down right away. I had the Blackberry Collins (drink) and it was delicious. My brother had the drink with Jalapeño and mango and it was so good. Alex Rivera was thee best server I have come across. His skills with explaining the menu to giving us options on what is the "thing" to eat. I ended up eating the Osso Buco. It was soooo tender and the flavor was impeccably mastered. I highly suggest going here. Ask for Alex to be your server! I was impressed, hopefully you will be too.

We came here for dinner on a Sunday without a reservation; they were busy but we only waited for about 20 mins. Our waiter brought us the drinks and dinner menu and took our orders right away. I ordered the creamy tomato chicken pasta (forgot the exact name), my hubby ordered a meat source pasta and we ordered a Mac and cheese for our toodler. Before the meal, they gave us a piece of freshly baked bread to start with. Our meals came fast and it looked and tasted very good. We finished everything fast. Our waiter was very attentive and the restaurant was nice with live music. 

oyster bar at harrah's, this restaurant only charged me 9 dollars for the kid meal with a much better service and food. And you charged us 11 bucks for a plain white rice and a piece of dry chicken breast.

Buddy has done it again! Not only is his bakery next door amazing, but his restaurant is great too. I've been here both during lunch and dinner, but at night it has a more dark tone with warm lights, great for a romantic night but good too for families. No matter what table you are seated in, you will have a view of the kitchen and the chefs. 

Our server Brittany was really nice and bubbly. I was having trouble deciding between the scallops and the chicken parm, she recommended the chicken parm and assured me that in case I didn't like it that I could order something else. 

But she was right! The chicken parm was delicious! I personally don't like chicken, but this was juicy and crunchy, covered with hot marinara sauce and cheese covering it all.  It also came with spaghetti marinara on the side. 

My friend was jealous and wish she had gotten mine. She ordered the seabass, which was flaky and good  too, but I still liked mine better.

Everything was like eating at mommom sophie's. From the chopped salad to the garlic bread and bowls of fresh made meatballs!  Recommend it to anyone!  And im going across to carlo's bake shop for a cup cake!

Overall love this place! When I come to Vegas I have to come here to eat Grandma's Meatballs and Cannolis for desert. Great service. Is a little pricey but a good option is Happy Hour 4:30-6:30pm everyday in the bar and lounge.

Located in the Palazzo Hotel, it's not the best Italian food on the Strip, plus the service was poor. We spotted this restaurant, after seeing the huge line for Carlos' Bakery. That's the bakery from the TV show Cake Boss. Honestly, who would wait 30 minutes for a pastry, when Sprinkles Cupcakes is down the street and pure perfection. Anyway, we saw Buddy V's and read the menu at the front door. The prices seemed reasonable for a Strip restaurant, so we made reservations for 7:00 p.m. We arrived on time, only to wait 30 minutes while they took walk-ins before us. Once seated, the greeting was non-existent. I actually had to stop our waiter, and ask what his name was. It was Chas. After bringing our beverages, he quickly recited the one special, and he asked what we wanted. Totally rushed. I stopped him right there, and began asking questions about the restaurant. "Chas, who is Carlos?" "If Carlos and Buddy V are famous for their cakes, why did they open an Italian restaurant?" As he became increasingly annoyed with my questions, he explained that the restaurant is based on Buddy V's grandmother's recipes, not Buddy's recipes. Naturally, I commented that Buddy V shouldn't have his name on the restaurant if they're not his recipes. Oh well, just a logically conclusion. The veal Marsala came with a side of pasta. The pasta was good, but the veal Marsala was tough and the sauce was tasteless. Really salty and bland. Our dining experience lasted a quick 35 minutes...even with my insistent questions. Don't waste your money or 35 minutes eating here. There's lots better Italian restaurants on The Strip.

The food was excellent and with it being a newly opened I expected some issues. When we first arrived the waiter was not my favorite and was extremely rude, once he realized that we were there during restaurant week. But I spoke to the manager and she switched us to a new server. This guy made our night and I would go back just for him to serve us again. The chicken parm was the best I have ever had and lobster tail dessert was amazing. The only other issue was that we got a child's pizza for my son and it arrived after the rest of us were done with our meals. But the problem was fixed again by same manager and they took it off our bill.

Maybe I expected a lot more because of the name behind it. I Have to admit I was pretty excited to try this place out and not that I was disappointed but more so I wasn't wowed or left with a "can't wait to come back" feeling. A couple friends were in town and like any vegas visitor wanted to try something new. We came for Sunday brunch and instead of ordering off the regular menu they offer a Sunday brunch buffet. Though the selection was more than enough to fill me up, don't expect a lot of food (the idea most might get when thinking of a vegas buffet).  The food was ok. Nothing spectacular but very well presented. First time ever seeing dragonfruit and lychees (served in original shell and "hair") in a restaurant so that was new for me. Disappointment #1 for the price you are kind of better off checking out one of the other casino buffets.

The restaurant itself was cute, family like and had a really open feeling. Love the concept of the open kitchen! 

As for service, this would be disappointment #2. Our server sold us the idea of unlimited drinks for an upgrade (of course) but the fact we only saw him 2 times our entire visit, limited the drinks we could order. We had to ask our busser on 3 different occasions for more water. Plus side though the bloody mary bar was pretty neat, lots of hot sauce options, vegetables and additions to choose from...good touch! We could tell they were a bit short handed since we only saw 3 servers (from what we could tell) covering the entire floor and they were fairly busy.  So we cut him some slack because he was very nice. 

Hostess staff was a little rude and not very personable but our interaction with them was short enough to make it tolerable. 

We wanted to visit the bakery but the line was so long we decided against it. I'm a local so not sure I would visit again unless visitors from out of town really want to go, but even then I might suggest another spot.

Being the owner is a cake boss and I'm from Delaware only 1 hr from the original location. I was spectacle about coming here for good Italian food but we were in Vegas and hungry so we gave it a shoot. First we didn't have a reservation but they sat us in only 15 min wait time. So while at the bar I seen they have a signature The Cake Boss Martini and let me tell you it was best martini I have had in a long time! The garlic bread was awesome, portions are huge and the desert is wonderful. We even talked to the manager Stewart and expressed what a great place this was to visit!

We recently visited Buddy V's before seeing a show on a Saturday. The restaurant didn't seem too busy for a Saturday night, the view was pretty nice as the sun was setting. The noise level was a little high and we weren't thrilled by the seating. A lot of the tables were up against a very long bench seat which they all shared. This created a situation where we felt like we were having dinner with the two sets of people on each side of us.

Our waitress wasn't too attentive, but our bus boy was pretty awesome! The food was really good and the potion size was huge. After eating my lasagne it looked as if I didn't even touch it. 

The most awesome part was the dessert... I love canolis! They were fabulous!! Perfect hint of cinnamon in the pastry and super yummy cream! My husband has the tiramisu which he said was also great.

AMAZING DINNER! I went to Buddy V's with my family and was a bit nervous at first. I love the show and have been dying to try this restaurant since Buddy announced he was opening it. It was probably one of the best Italian meals I have had in a long time, the meatballs were amazing, great portion size and lots of flavour. The caesar salad was also good, very garlicky which I like. Next was the mains, we got a few but the most memorable were the shrimp pasta and the spaghetti and meatballs. Both had tons of flavour and great portion sizes. We were celebrating my 25th birthday and all I wanted was to try something at Carlos Bakery. The manager was incredible, he went across to the bakery and got me a cupcake because he knew how much I wanted to try it and the line was crazy. For dessert, we also had the apple pie, this was the only item we ordered I was not crazy about. It came out like a hard cookie shell and it was nothing to write home about. The waiter was very annoying, he kept trying to push us to order things and he didn't take no for an answer until we said it more firmly. However, overall, it was a great meal. The manager Adam was very nice and seemed to really enjoy his job. He was all about customer service and customer satisfaction. 
My only recommendation is people who dine at the restaurant should also be able to go to the bakery.

I just returned home from a trip to Las Vegas with a girlfriend of mine. One of the highlights of our trip was to go to the Carlo's Bakery and Buddy Restaurant. Although the treats at the bakery were amazing we were extremely disappointed by how we were treated by one of the male wait staff at the restaurant. We are in our mid twenties and I feel like he didn't respect us as customers. We ordered a few cocktails as well as the cheeseboard. It was not a pleasant experience and I don't know if you will see this but I think everyone should be treated fairly dining at the restaurant (also the opening time on the website is wrong). That part of our trip was ruined. I love the show and am a huge fan.
This place is the best Italian food every! Everything was great. I come from a Sicilian family straight off the boat.  Just like Nona's cooking.  Would give it 10 stars if I could

I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars!! From start to finish it was the best experience in dining both my husband and I have ever had!! Arrived a bit early for our reservation and were greeted by two extremely friendly and gracious hostesses who said they were happy to seat us early!! The restaurant is beautifully decorated and very clean, looks brand new inside although it's a couple years old! We were seated in a lively bustling dining area. And a young man immediately, upon us sitting down, took our drink order and poured us water. Right after that Caleb (our waiter) arrived, wished us a happy anniversary and asked if we would like to move to a more private table with a special view..we agreed of course and within 2 minutes he had checked with the hostess stand and ushered us to the back of the restaurant where the bustling was at a minimum and sat us at a beautiful table looking out over the palazzo and the strip. Was already amazed at this point and we hadn't even ordered yet! Caleb then spent a few minutes chatting with us and made some recommendations, we ordered the recommended appetizer a crispy mozzarella bread in red sauce..OMG they brought it so fast and it was to die for...could have just eaten that for dinner. I had the 3 course special, chose Caesar salad(amazing), chicken parm(light and Delish..ate the whole thing) and the Nutella chocolate cake with salted caramel ice cream(words can't describe how Devine) hubby ordered the bone in veal parm chop. He was in heaven!! Throughout the meal Caleb gave us just enough attention but was careful to give us space to enjoy our meal, the wait staff had our drinks filled any time they were half empty...never had to ask for a refill and even completely cleared and wiped down our table before bringing desert. I've dined at many 4 and 5 star establishments who could take a lesson in customer service and good food quality from Buddy V's. Thank you Caleb and the staff for a meal and experience 2nd to none, and for making our Anniversary dinner one we will never forget!

Was disappointed with the food and service, all I can say about this place is OK.... 
I had the chicken parmigiana, it was good, but the sauce was very acidic, way too strong for me, I had asked the server prior to ordering and she said it was very mild.
My friend had the carbonara, she said it was average.
Our other friend had the scallops and she liked it.

Where to start...

Location is awkward (end of a mostly deserted hallway) and was certainly of no help to former occupant FIRST Food and Bar.

Ambiance inside the restaurant itself is quite nice, although tables thrown in the hallway seem strange.  Outdoor seating is laughable and ill-conceived.  It's essentially at the top of an escalator leading up from Walgreens/down to the Strip so plenty of foot traffic will get to check-out your food.  The outdoor view is obstructed by a wall.  This area was never intended for restaurant seating and has emerged as a hot spot for Grand Canal Shoppes' employees to congregate and smoke.  Enjoy!

Service is slow and uninterested, perhaps even worse than FIRST.  Maybe the same staff?  A friend of mine said he and his date waited 15 minutes at an empty bar to be acknowledged, let alone served.  He was so aggravated they left without eating.  He's a bartender in the Venetian and understands the importance of timely service.  My experience wasn't much better.

My food was bland, we're talking CPK bland.  A penne dish was swimming in flavorless oil and assorted vegetables that looked to be left-over from some other dish and the chicken parm was just as bland.  Skipped dessert which was probably my mistake given that's the namesake's claim to fame.  Speaking of, who thought naming an Italian restaurant after a well-known PASTRY chef was a good idea?

I've already spent too much energy on this place.  Maybe it will improve and it seems others have had better experiences, but I won't give it a second go.

I must admit I was a bit reluctant to try this place. After all, this guy is a baker not a restaurant chef and every celebrity food person has a place in Vegas and most aren't anything to write home about.  This place is outstanding. Their Cesar salad is a must. They serve it with warm polenta croutons. Talk about a bowl of heaven. Crispy on the outside and full of warm polenta goodness. Yes, I wrote 3 sentences about croutons. They are that good. After that I moved onto the scallops. Sweet, briney with the perfect sear on the outside. Delicious. This has become our must eat at place every time we pass through town. Great wine list, fair prices, excellent service. Worth a visit.

We made a stop for lunch and found the treat of a 3 course meal for $22. I got the Cesar salad, chicken parm with salted caramel gelato. The chicken itself was okay but the pasta was delicious. The gelato was worth a stop in itself.

OMG!!!! My wife is a HUGE fan of cake boss we have been to Buddy's cake shop in Hoboken and she has been to a decorating class at Lackawanna, so Buddy V's was next on her list. She made a reservation for a Sunday night lucky as they were really busy. We were seated within 5 mins of arrival at a table beside the kitchen, within 2 mins our waiter came over to offer us a quieter table in the corner near the window and had our drinks within 5 mins. I ordered caesars salad for appetiser my wife had Grandmas meatballs, both meals were amazing you could see the herbs in the meatballs and the flavour was incredible, my Caesars salad was fresh and croutons were not to crunchy but fresh. We ordered off a theatre special menu which was $38 each for a 3 course meal which we thought was pretty cheap ( being from Australia its hard to find an entree for around that price so this was cheap for us). My Entree was chicken parma and my wife had Buddy SNR Bucatini carbonara, dessert was Nutella cake and a cannoli which we took desserts back to hotel room as we were full from our mains. All in all this restaurant was AMAZEBALLS  we will be returning again in the future and to top it off we went to Carlos bakery  right across from the restaurant.

Beware alcohol is pricey....

BONUS our waiter looked like THE ROCK!!!!!

For Strip dining this is VERY good and very good price point too!
    They offer a lunch special menu with Gr8 selections 3 courses $22.00 soup/salad, main & dessert, not including drinks 
    Started with the Caesar salad, which is killer~ the croutons are deep fried corn meal & the creamy dressing is not over whelmed by anchovies . My gf had a spinach salad beautifully presented w/ red cherry tomatoes, red onions, grated parmesan. 
    Main courses ~ mine was the spaghetti Bolognese, flipping fantastic!!!!! The sauce or gravy depending where your from is "Outta Site!" My gf had the salmon generous portion (cooked to perfection) over sautéed veggies, again both were beautiful to look at and tasted equally DEEEELISH!!!!!!
   Dessert ~ I had tiramisu, excellent with a cappuccino & my gf has the raspberry sorbet with coffee .
   All in all just a great stop and quite good for the kiddos too!!!

Buddy V's is one of, if not the closest you'll ever get to legitimate New Jersey dining. You get the plaid napkins, Torino breadsticks, a wide variety of Italian entrees and desserts. The desserts are from none other than Carlo's bake shop so you'll be in for a fine treat. I personally ordered the Sunday Gravy entree and it was one of the best Italian dishes I've had in awhile. It's tomato stew served with tender veal, homemade Italian sausage and meatballs served with rigatoni. Think of it as spaghetti with meatballs but more variety of meat for you meat lovers. A great experience overall!

We had a very enjoyable dinner at Buddy V's in the Palazzo Hotel. the prices were very reasonable, the service was good, and the food was delicious.

I had the chicken parmigiana and really enjoyed it. It was a very large portion with two large cutlets. The chicken was so tender, I didn't even need a knife, as I could cut it with a fork.

My wife had linguini with claims, and she also enjoyed her dinner. There were plenty of claims with the pasta.

We will definitely return during our next visit in Vegas.

5 stars for being the best meal in our week long trip to Vegas. A couple people in our party really wanted to eat here. I could care less thinking it was just a cash in on the cake boss thing. I was wrong. This place is legit. 
Food was great, service was pretty good, and prices not really bad if you compare them to other joints on the strip. I paid almost $20 for a terrible cheeseburger at the TI. I paid $24 for some of the most amazing chicken parmesan at Buddy Vs. I know which I'll be going back for next time. 
We started with the salumi and cheese board. Everything on the board tasted great. You really get a lot. We had a party of six and didn't eat all of it. I loved the pickled peppers that came with it. 
I had the chicken parmesan. Crispy breaded chicken with delicious marinara sauce covered in gooey cheese. So freaking good! It came with a side of spaghetti which I don't normally care for (don't shoot me), but theirs was really good. I just couldn't eat it all, and I'm a big guy. 
My wife had the chicken piccata. It was a big portion and delicious. Also served with pasta. 
We both loved this place and will most definitely be back! Next time we'll try to save some room for that awesome looking Nutella cake.

From the service to the food, I was extremely pleased with my dining experience here.  I had caprese salad, which was very nice and the lasagna- delicious!! Portions were on the larger side but that's ok with me. It should make a nice late night snack. 
I sat at the bar since I was here alone (traveling for work). The bartenders were lovely, accommodating and attentive. I would definitely come back!

When arriving we had a huge joyful greeting from the hosts. We had reservations but I want a widow seat for my party.  They quickly when into action to make my request happen. They said it would be 20min but was only 10. Wow the appetizers are very flavorful we had mom's meat balls and eggplant, I recommend both. Very diverse wine and drink list. Main dish was cooked to perfection, the steak and the veal was our choices both very well prepared and delightful. Server has very good and attentive too. 2 piece music group in bar area was outstanding. This is a great pic for a good meal. Peace out!!

We ordered the veal marsala for 24 bucks, not sure if we got veal or pork, it was way tough than any other veal I have had. Sauce was over powered by wine sauce and that's pretty much all I tasted. Probably won't come back here again

Who's not a fan of Buddy V? I drool over the eye candy on Cake Boss (the food eye candy!).  When I realized that Buddy brought Jersey to Vegas, I couldn't wait to try it. It's difficult to find a restaurant on the strip that has character, good food, and great service. Buddy V's has all three. We made reservations on a weekday evening and the restaurant was about 3/4 full. The ambiance was casual with an upscale Italian vibe; translation: fine dining without leaving a hole in your pocket. Win Win. There were two people taking care of our table, so we got double the attention and service. Both our waiter and waitress were friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered "My Wife's Eggplant Parm" as an appetizer and chicken rigatoni alla vodka and Nonna's lasagna al forno as our mains. 

My Wife's Eggplant Parm- clever! I like how Buddy gives cred to those who deserve it. The eggplant parm was pretty much a tower of crispy goodness. Eggplant, melted mozzarella, tomato parm, eggplant, melted mozzarella, tomato, parm...you get the picture. The eggplant was had a nice crunch and the melty cheese and tart tomato sauce were a delicious combo. I'm using to a more traditional baked eggplant parm as opposed to the deep fried dish that was served. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious, but I was missing the deep flavors of the eggplant that was fried away. 

Chicken rigatoni alla vodka- rigatoni, pancetta, grilled chicken swimming in a decadent tomato cream sauce was heaven. I really enjoyed the creaminess of this dish. The sauce was a perfect combination of flavors (it's all about the sauce). This pancetta was a nice touch of smokiness. Super filling, you will have leftovers! 

Nonna's lasagna al forno- YES. CHEESY, MEATY, traditional lasagna with a ton of flavor. This hefty lasagna had Italian sausage, beef and pork, ricotta cheese, mozzarella, provolone and parmesan baked to perfection. Four types of cheeses people. It was cheesy. If you are looking for a classic and delicious lasagna, look no further. The only thing I was missing was a bit of sweetness in the tomato sauce. Otherwise, I would absolutely order this item again. Totally big enough to split. 

I truly enjoy traditional Italian food. Big portions, big flavors and lots of sauce. Warning, you will be in a food coma after you finish your meal. Come with an empty belly and be prepared to eat. We had a ton of leftovers which is what should happen when you go out for Italian food. I enjoyed the decor of the restaurant, the ambiance, as well as the service. We let our waitress know that we were on a time crunch, and she got us in and out of the restaurant in no time with full bellies and smiles on our faces. This restaurant was closer to Palazzo then Venetian and somewhat of a mission to find, but we found it and we were glad we did. A very solid option of casual Italian food in the heart of LV.

Looking back at this experience, I'm actually angry. Maybe it deserves a 2, but this is the worst experience I've had on strip, I expected much better. I feel used, dirty. We had a party of 8, 4 couples. I brought 2 bottles of wine (tempranillo and a cab/syrah) intending to pay the corkage fee, which turned out to be $35 (highest I've ever encountered). The waiter said that since we were Seahawks fans and he was too (night before the super bowl) he would waive one of the fees if we tipped him more, more or less, even though he'd rather see us enjoy an Italian wine with dinner.  After examining the wine list we opted for the ones I brought. The waiter also informed us that since we were a big party we should take advantage of an "appetizer platter" for us all to share, meats, cheeses and salad, sold to us as a family style Italian sharing experience. We talked it over and all agreed it sounded good. Then we ordered our entrees, 1 couple opted to split the ravioli, my boyfriend ordered the lasagna and I planned on ordering the small margherita pizza so we could share. When I tried to order my margherita the waiter told me it was really small, just an appetizer, I told him I wanted small because I wasn't terribly hungry and didn't want leftovers, he insisted I should get the chicken alla vodka because they had just won an award for it, I asked if it was small, he said "oh yes, very small" and gestured with his hands. I caved, and ordered it, after all, I do love pasta and vodka sauce.  Appetizers came shortly after, 2 different salads, 2 meat/cheese/bread platters, calamari, and the meatballs (6). It was all ok, nothing spectacular, but one of the salads was pretty good (it had arugula, yum), and the meatballs were pretty good (nothing compared to Casa di Amore's off-strip though). The entrees came and my pasta was huge (bigger than he implied at least, average dish size for most restaurants though). My noodles were undercooked and the chicken was incredibly dry, sauce was decent, but not enough to make the chicken palatable.  I gave away most of my dish to the couple who split the ravioli, as they were pretty underwhelmed with theirs too, and thought mine was a slight improvement. I took one ravioli in exchange and nibbled my boyfriend's lasagna which was actually pretty amazing (in comparison), meanwhile kicking myself that I didn't just stick with the pizza.  The check came, north of $400, turns out the appetizers were all billed separately, so we should have just ordered what we wanted to begin with.  Looking back I'm convinced that the waiter only wanted me to have the more expensive entree, not the one I'd be happy with, and it angers me that he wouldn't just take my order as I intended. I suppose I've learned my lesson, stay away from gimmicky strip restaurants, stick to your guns, and recognize the upselling. What a swindle, this waiter put used car salesmen to shame, I've never felt more used after a dining experience, and the food was mediocre at best. I'm pretty sure he wasn't really a Seahawks fan either. Buyer beware. We'll stick with Casa in the future.

I was so looking forward to trying this place bc I love watching cake boss when I saw that he had a restaurant here in Vegas I had to try it. The hostess was nice and sat us down quick but overall look of this place I wasn't impressed at all, waitress was slow and took forever and when our food came out I wasn't falling in my chair in love with it. Taste like every other Italian restaurant every where, nothing special or wow factor about it. It was really disappointing to come here and think that the food would be over the top to die for yummy and turns out it was nothing to recommend to friends. Probably my first and last time here, also it is pretty price for the quality of food.

The bread! The pasta! The desserts!! I don't know where to start, but I do know that Italian food is one of my favorite genre of food (other than Thai or sushi) and I can be a picky one when it comes to taste. I must say the service at this restaurant was impeccable, and the food was all sorts of delicious. Their wine selection was pretty impressive so that is another plus. I recommend the Calamari for an appetizer or the mozzarella en Carozza, which is basically fried mozzarella. I have only been here once so the dish I had was the lasagna. I make lasagna from scratch at home so I know good lasagna, and it was delicious.

My wife and I were dying to go to Buddy's new place in Vegas. So I made reservations ahead of time and couldn't wait. We went earlier in the day just so we could know where in the mall it was located. I'm glad we did since it was off a corridor from the main forum shops. We liked how the place looked. Well set up and inviting. They had a long row of outside tables in front of the restaurant. 

So we go to the place and they found our reservation and went to seat us. They brought us into the bar and sat us in the corner with a view of the strip. I didn't mind the view but if I made reservations why was I sitting at the bar? Kinda of set the mode already. It was not to crowded for a Friday night which we were very surprised when most restaurants are hopping. There were bread stick on the table already but they were prepackaged ones and not from Italy, they were made in New Jersey. 

We wanted the best from Buddy so my wife ordered his wife's linguine and clam sauce. While I had Buddy's chicken rigatoni "ALLA VODKA". My wife's meal was plain and not worth the $26 that they charged for it. It tasted like my wife made it herself nothing fancy or fantastic taste. Mine had maybe 6 pieces of chicken in it and the pasta was kind of chewy. It was like my wife made it also. Not saying I wouldn't eat it but not real fine dining. We have been to several restaurants in Vegas since we go 4-6 times a year. So I'm no newbie. 

Oh I missed the garlic bread we ordered before the meal. Which consisted of three pieces for 9. Nothing special and little over priced again. My wife and I agreed Buddy should of opened a café type restaurant and not fine dining. The food is more family food but over priced for Vegas. It would be totally packed everyday if the prices were lower and family orientated. 

But not to jam on Buddy over his place. We had the Italian birthday cake and let me tell you it was no disappointment. We loved it and that what Buddy is famous for Cakes. I wish he had a bakery with the restaurant because that would go no stop. Hope this helps you guys out. thanks

This is the place to go for Italian! I made a reservation online so we didn't have to wait for a table.  I would advise doing that if possible as it is a very busy place! 

The wait staff is incredible! There is the main waiter and then they have another waiter working for the main waiter.  Setting tables, refilling drinks, bringing bread, etc.  It was a very unique concept that I had never seen before.  It made things run so smoothly. 

They start you off with some amazing complementary focaccia bread. It is seasoned with some Italian seasonings and cheese. It was piping hot when delivered to us in a very cute basket.  I ordered Nonna's lasagna AL forno. The waiter asked if I was ready for the most incredible lasagna I've ever eaten?! To be honest I was kind of thinking "ya right."  well...  He was right! It really was the best lasagna I've ever had! The presentation was great as well.  It came in a cute little cast iron skillet. We also ordered the garlic cheese bread.  It was good but I honestly liked the focaccia bread better! 

You will not be disappointed coming here. The relaxed family atmosphere was very nice! There were pictures of buddy's family on the walls which made it feel like home.  Can not wait to come back here!

AMAZING! This place is delicious. The service is fantastic. And you have to try the CANNOLIS! I had the chicken parm for dinner and it is easily a plate for two; you will not leave there hungry. At. All. 10/10

Dinner last night with 3 very close clients. Overall very good, excellent spin on Italian with references to Buddy V's heritage. We shared a variety of appetizers, the signature dried meats and cheese board was excellent. For entree's a couple of us opted for pasta, cooked perfectly, flavorful. We also shared a couple of desserts of which the Canoli was very creative and extraordinary. The Canoli is kind of deconstructed which makes it fun to eat. Overall highly recommended!

Ate here twice during our stay because it was so good. Fantastic Italian food and feel-like-family service. So many restaurants disappoint, but this one lives up to the hype. Ordered an appetizer, salad and entree each time and loved 'em all. The spaghetti and meatballs were the best evah! 
Also, be sure to order dessert!

We paid more and less in Vegas, but Buddy's was the best.  The "Parm" was a cheesy dream, The grilled salmon was cooked perfectly.  I guess it is the simple combination of the best ingredients with the presentation skills and technical excellence of a master baker that makes it so good.  This was the only restaurant we visited on or near the strip that didn't seem to be charging a location premium.  It was not inexpensive, but it was reasonable.  Oh-ya, save room for desert OMG!!!!

We came here for the brunch buffet and it was honestly the most amazing food I've ever had. Everything was so delicious and fresh. A lot of buffets have an overwhelming amount of food and you don't get to try it all. Buddy V's had the perfect amount of food. I was able to try everything that I wanted! I would highly recommend the brunch buffet. It was amazing!

My boyfriend and I went to this restaurant for our 6 year anniversary on Friday 9-11-15, he had made a reservation with a special request for desert as a surprise to me! I have been wanting to come to this place for some time as I'm a huge fan of Buddy!! 

We show up and get seated very quickly it was about 8:45-9:00pm we are sitting for five minutes when a biased comes to the table and asks us if we would like some water...sure he brings us water...we've never been here before so we are taking our time with the menu and decide to order mozzarella as an appetizer when our server finally arrived at our table we had already drank our glass of water it was a good 15 minutes after we sat down...unacceptable if you ask me! I don't know his name cause he talked so fast and was trying really hard with what seemed like a fake accent to be "cool" and laughed at himself....we told him we've never been here and that we would like to order the mozzarella...he then said are you ready to put on your Order for dinner...I said could I have a few minutes he then proceeded to say that I wanted the Veil Parmesan without giving me time to look uhh ok I guess I'll have that since you are in such a rush for me to order when you haven't even put in my appetizer...my boyfriend ordered lasagna...
I never saw my server again...well not willingly anyways...I had to flag him down for more water...the buss men were passing out cheese bread and vinegar and oil to every table that was there...except us not once were we offered anything nor where my drinks refilled without having to ask!! I wanted to order a soda and nope didn't even get to do that!!!
Our appetizer came was different and so yummy!!! Server never came to see how we where....our food came no server nothing...what if I didn't like my food...oh but I had to flag a biased down again for more water even though they have walked by my table 100 times and I know they seen my water empty!!!
So on with it...I had to yell for my server who had been ignoring us after I've asked for him 3 times by a bus man he came I said may I please have a box...10 min later my box arrived...he asked if we wanted desert I said may I see a menu!!(been wanting Buddy's lobster take for years almost went to New Jersey just to try one!!) then my boyfriend asks for a manager cause the special request he set up was to have a lobster tail desert show up to the table as a surprise with writing on the plate saying happy anniversary....my boyfriend was so upset that they ruined the surprised when he talked to the manager he kind of still felt like it was no big deal!! A new server delivered our desert and the comped it(didn't asked them to nor did we want them to) 

At the end of everything the SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE! I have been in customer service my whole life never would I treat someone the way we were treated!! We felt abandoned when the people around us where being well taken care of!!!

I give a HUGE SHOUT OUT TO THE KITCHEN THOUGH!! FOOD WAS AMAZING!!! I don't eat leftovers never have my whole life but I did eat the left overs for dinner Saturday!! That says something!!

Just disappointing about the service kind of heartbroken cause j was so excited to finally be going to BUDDY V's

Gosh, I hate to do this but honestly Buddy, you need to know. First, we went for lunch...ok, so its lunch. The bread was dry and stale. We mentioned to the server and she explained to us
we are here at lunch and bread is make in AM so it is older. The "FRESH BREAD" IS FOR DINNER". Yikes~ We understood we have to ask for it at lunch but honestly, dry/stale bread?
ok, so even gets better. I ordered a Stella, took 15 minutes to reach me. ONLY ASKED AFTER desert arrived is I'd like another Stella? WHAT???? keep the alcohol coming. Its Vegas. 12 minutes for desert. They had to make it fresh...We were laughing that perhaps the staff was in the long bakery line outside the restaurant. Food was good/fair, SERVICE HORRIBLE. Your staff is going to kill your business and should not be tolerated. Our bill was wrong. you name it. and....the best of all--our friend ordered spaghetti/meatballs. He opted for sausage instead. So, he was $6 for CRUMBLED SAUSAGE? WHAT? We discussed with waitress and she was defensive telling him "i distinctly told you it was crumbles" Well, she did not tell him $6 for crumbles. Whole sausage are only available at DINNER? Not cool at all. His family needs to get over there and educated their staff or this place will FALL! I will NOT be back. We ate appx 3pm so not too off for dinner. Very disappointing experience :(

My husband & I just got back from our Vegas trip & before arriving, we had decided to go on a mission of finding the absolute best happy hour on the strip. We were staying at the Palazzo & let me tell you to not look any further!!!

The hostess enthusiastically escorted us to the sexy lounge area adjacent to the dining area.
This is not your typical "sit at the bar" experience, it's more like a "VIP club experience" with stellar views of the strip. Our super friendly waitress made our experience memorable. The food is totally authentic grandma cooking & the prosecco is a delicious brut, not sweet. The drinks were $4 & the appetizers were $5.
 Just as we couldn't drink or eat another bite, my husband was closing the tab & we quickly realized WTF are we doing turning down desert?? We are in the cake boss restaurant. As we were deciding between cannoli's or tiramisu, our adorable waitress suggested the Nutella cake with espresso ice cream. What a slice of heaven!!!!!!

As soon as the bubbly started to hit, an amazing jazz band ( The fabulous baker boys) arrived & blew us away with their great jazz/Italian hits. They were more than happy to accommodate requests. Dino, Frank, Bobby Darin, they know it!

The vibe reminded me of an old school Italian "Goodfellas" experience & because of that, 
This is my new go to spot when I am in Vegas.  : ))

Best meal in Las Vegas in recent memory. Great service - thank you, Georgio.
Amazing lasagna and linguini with clams. The croutons in the Caesars salad were warm and made of polenta. And the desert! the cannoli is what dreams are made of.
Here for the Super Bowl, if you are thinking a great combination good food and football big mistake the food and waiters service along with the tv size is a big disappointment don't waste your time

This is a good plan to take the family for grub. Typical American version of Italian food, nothing special. Would have preferred bread with linguini and clams over breadsticks. Decent liguini dish but nothing to be wowed about.

Solid Italian dining option at the Venetian. The staff is all top notch and the food was pretty good. We had sangria to drink which was good and then a really fresh and delicious salad for an appetizer. My entree was the chicken rigatoni alla vodka - I thought this was ok although I have had better vodka pasta elsewhere. My two friends rated their entrees highly. Overall, a solid option that probably won't dissapoint but it did not blow me away.

I went to Buddy V's with some out of town guests who love Italian.  The location is good, the ambiance nice, the service was decent. The food was just OK; Not great by any means. Maybe I had high expectations, but I was seriously disappointed and so were my guests. I had the carbonara, it was super salty. My husband had the clams. He was not impressed.  The ceasar salad was excellent. For the price, not a great value.

Overall the food was good, the service was friendly, but a bit bumpy and the wine was disappointing.  
For appetizers, we shared the mac & cheese, salumi and mozzarella en carozza.  These were all solid dishes, with the mozzarella probably being my favorite.  Our entrees were brought out before we were even half way through the appetizers, but when I said something they took them away.  I was a little worried that our meals would be sitting under a heat lamp, but kudos to the staff for bringing us fresh dishes when the time came.
I thought the wine list was rather lame.  I like wine, but am not an expert, so when I recognize a bunch of the wines as the variety I can find at my local Smith's, I am a bit let down.  I finally ordered a bottle of an Italian variety I liked, but when it came time for the sample taste I was almost tempted to refuse it.  It wasn't spoiled, but sure did taste as though it had been stored at the wrong temperature.
For entrees, we tried the lasagne, Dad's Bucatini and spaghetti and meatballs.  Again, all the dishes were good.  I especially loved the Bucatini and would get it again.  Desserts were not quite as good as I expected.  The cannoli were fresh, but the filling was lighter than the ricotta I expected and overall had a strong cinnamon oil taste.  The Nutella cake was your standard lava cake that has been around since the 80s.  The coffee was nice and strong.

My husband and I come to Vegas often and have been wanting to try this restaurant. Walking towards this place you could smell the aroma of garlic! 
We were seated within minutes and had a great waiter. Wish I could remember his name. He was very friendly and accommodating. He recommended great dishes. We ordered a variety of different foods which were all delicious. 
We sat in a comfortable booth overlooking the whole restaurant and enjoyed watching the chefs cook while we ate. Overall, a great place to eat. Great service, great food. We'll definitely be back!

We amazing got a order to go chicken piccata and it was amazing. I also went over to Carlos's bakery and took baked items to go and chocolate strawberries they were awesome thank you so much service was great and the bartender was very friendly.

After reading some positive reviews I wanted to try Buddy V's for some decent Italian food. It's a nice place with a nice view of the strip, with the neon lights flickering in the background. Here is what we had:
- Grandmas Meatballs. These were pretty tast but our order was cold. I know they are not made to order  but you expect them to be warm.
-Calamari Fritti. You basic calamari with 2 slivers of a banana pepper and grilled lemon. Another dish that came out cold.
-Lisa V's Linguini and white clam sauce. This dish has the most balanced flavors and a decent amount of clams. This was the 3rd dish in a row that was cold. I would have mentioned it to our server but he wasn't around much.
-My mother in laws shrimp scampi. The one dish that came out warm . It had pretty good flavors but not the best scampi I ever had. My mother in laws is much better!.

Where most authentic Italian restaurants might offer you freshly grated parm you had to ask for it and it took a few minutes to let the food get even colder. We also asked for some bread, mainly for the scampi since it had a nice broth build up in the bottom of the bowl. The waiter looked as if I was asking for ketchup at a steak house. Another dissapointing Italian meal in Las Vegas, my search continues!

We were in Las Vegas and stopped in for an early dinner. We were extremely impressed with the food and service. We ordered a healthy amount of food, our bill was $95. We will return for sure if we're in the area again.

Came here this past Sunday night to celebrate my sister's bachelorette event in Vegas. There was 10 of us ladies. I must say the ambiance was relaxing, semi formal-casual. Our server Peter was very attentive to our needs. They gave us this fresh rosemary garlic bread with balsamic vinegar and olive oil and it was amazing. We ordered the chicken picatta and added mushrooms and it was quite tasty, chicken marsala, lasagna, linguine with clams, mac and cheese, chicken rigatoni alla vodka, the caprese salad,  caesar salad, and veal marsala. Everything was pleasing to the palate. I also ordered the salted caramel ice cream to go and it was delicious. I would definitely come back here again to get my Italian fix the next time I'm in town.

Buddy V's Ristorante is located within The Venetian hotel. My best friends parents treated us out to lunch here on a Saturday. It wasn't too crowded and I wasn't sure what to expect. We were seated promptly given we had a reservation for 10. After looking at the menu a few of us decided to get a few different items and eat family style. 

// FOOD //
Margherita Pizza: sliced tomatoes, basil, fresh mozzarella. Simple and light. It's a medium sized crust, not crispy or too doughy. I really enjoyed this one with a little grated parmesan and crushed red pepper. 4.5/5

Buddy's Favorite Pizza:  spiced sausage, caramelized onions, fennel, four cheese. I didn't care for this one too much. The sausage and the blend of cheese didn't go well together. I would definitely go with the margherita pizza instead. 2.5/5

Spaghetti Central with Meatballs: Your basic and simple spaghetti with five meatballs. It was simple, but I thoroughly enjoyed the tomato sauce. I thought it had excellent flavor. I would definitely order this again and maybe try it with the bolognese next time. 4/5

Chicken Parm: Provolone, mozzarella, spaghetti marinara. This dish was excellent for sharing. It would have been too heavy if one person just got it, but it was great for our group. They give two chicken breasts with a decent portion of spaghetti on the side. The chicken parm was deliciously cheesy! 4/5

Overall, I was extremely pleased with the service and food at Buddy V's Ristorante. I will definitely be back for more of that tomato sauce goodness. The only thing that can possibly make this place any better is if they served you some fresh break with oil and balsamic in the beginning. Just saying... 

ENJOY!

Very good... So much food we had a lot of leftovers. And the next day it was still awesome. I had lasagna and my husband had the chicken Parmesan (both our meals were so good). Nice place. Sucks cause we were too full to eat or have room for desserts. Happy note is Carlos bakery is right across the way. This place is at the Venetian.

It was delicious!! We were here twice and all the time the food was perfect! Pasta and chicken are deliciously good! In my opinion, this is the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas...and in San Francisco! Highly recommend to try it!

Perhaps I went during the wrong time. My husband and I visited, unbeknownst to me, during restaurant week. Perhaps they prepared their food ahead of time. All I have to say is that I was disturbed by my meatballs. I was flat out disappointed by my meatballs. Those were not good meatballs. 

I had spaghetti and meatballs. My first cause for concern was that our dishes came out insanely fast. Never a good sign in my book. I'm not at Burger King, I do no expect my food to arrive in less than five minutes. The meatballs were small and when I split one with my fork, it did not crumble like a freshly made meatball should. It was hard. And I bet you anything it had been frozen at one point. Sauce was incredibly bland. I was incredibly disappointed. 

Main cause for disappointment? This was not my first time here. I've had their meatballs before. They were heavenly, delicious, tasty and FRESH! 

Saving grace was their Italian Cake. That was pretty good. But as for the meal, all I can say is how corporate of them.

I had a reservation for 930 and the hostess was just crawling each time she took somebody to a table she was gone for at least 5 minutes.. I don't entirely blame her I would probably have a bad attitude if I was all by myself on a Friday night . The part that really mad me mad was that there were 2 managers just standing around doing nothing. When I asked one of the managers if he could help he said we had to wait for the the hostess and he couldn't help us. When we finally did get seated we were sat in the bar. That would of been fine but in the bar they had one waiter to take care of the entire bar area while the two managers sat and ate at the bar. The food took for ever and they even showed up with the wrong food for my mother and that took 15 minutes to get her food while we starred at are food till she got hers .the food was just alright and way over priced. I was disappointed

We made reservations for 9pm we ran a bit late but ended up nabbing a great booth facing the main street. The servers are prompt and polite, we had very delish bloody mary's (mine was virgin) really flavourful. My date had the chicken parm, he described it as cooked perfectly. I had mama's chicken holy smokes! Juicy and bursting with a medley of flavours. Loved the restaurant, a definite highlight. I look forward to the next trip.

I was extremely afraid that Buddy V's Ristorante was going to end up being a case of "never meet your heroes." But luckily the food that they're serving was amazing and the service was even better. We had a designated person besides are waiter taking away our plates, bringing us refills on our drinks, and giving us the best service possible. The only problem was how long the kitchen took to bring our main courses to us. After waiting about 45 minutes after we ordered for our food it finally came, and with an apology from the manager. For desert we ordered the famous lobster tail which was amazing. Definitely go if you don't mind spending the money.

Against my better judgement I went to eat here because I assumed that even if the food was mediocre at least the dessert menu should be stellar. Not the case. Two thin,appetizer sized pieces veal and some third rate lasagna for almost $60 in a space that only poor people wont mind dining in. I thought the dessert menu would make up for this but boy was I wrong. About 6 underwhelming options from the "Cake Boss". WTF? I ordered two items that were as pathetic as the food. Steer clear of this place.

Went here a couple times already. Perfect date spot. Great customer service! The food is just like my friends mother's cooking back in Jersey! The pasta was cooked perfectly. I wasn't surprised with the dessert but his bakery across the restaurant is a must try!!

Eat here!   Food is fantastic.  Service is top notch.  A don't miss in Vegas.  The carbonara was excellent.  The cheesy garlic bread is a great appetizer.  Meatballs are fantastic. Chicken Parm is more than one person can eat.

Just returned from Vegas. Had reservations for 5pm before seeing Rock Of Ages Show.  Went personally at noon to confirm reservations, as the two ladies in our party of four were celebrating birthdays, and wanted to make sure we would get window seats.  The original reservations were made at the same time room reservations were made by the pallazo hotel.  We were told we would be given window seats. Well the hostess said she could not guarantee, but made a note of the request as well as the birthday celebration.
We arrived at 4:45pm fifteen minutes early, and found an almost empty restaurant.  As luck would have it, the original hostess was there.  She said she would be able to seat us "near" a window table.  I laughed and said, well it looks as though you have lots of tables.....her comment was to go sit in the lounge "bar" area until our reservation time.  Trying to sell drinks I suppose.  We sat there , not ordering drinks, and she started to seat us away from the window....again I reminded her, and miraculously she found a table.. It dawned on me later (after my wife explained) she was fishing for a tip to "find a table"
Anyway, we ordered.   The Lasagna came, large portion, lots of cheese and meat, little skimpy on the sauce.  Wife had Chicken Parmesan which was overcooked and little sauce.  The other couples order consisted of a new York steak which she raved about, but her husband had steak and lobster, and said the steak he had was tough, but the lobster was good.  
Table service was good, lots of flat bread, water refills.
Oh....if you happen to like a nice fruity White Zinfandel (the fastest growing wine category in the US) you will not get it there.. They don't carry one,  I know some restaurants are a bit snobbish because its a "blend"  

So regarding the birthdays?  Well most restaurants will make an effort to do something to acknowledge a celebration.... Desert came and went, nothing...

Anyway, I know they have not been open for very long.  Our waiter was good, food runners ok...The Floor manager spent his time looking from a distance, but made no contact with the customers.  

Place looks nice, food ok, price ok....but Buddy......you need to instill a little passion in your place...Your gonna have to step it up to compete with the upscale establisments located in the same building.

We were super excited to go to Buddy's and were definitely not disappointed! Portion sizes were great and everything was presented beautifully. Our server, Georgio, claimed to be Buddy's godson and produced a picture of Buddy holding him as a baby, but I'm a natural born skeptic and wonder if it's true :) Nonetheless, Georgio was very attentive and knowledgable about the entire menu. He even told my friend that what she was planning to order was too boring and she would probably prefer something else! He made a recommendation and she ended up loving it! My dish was nothing short of fantastic and next time I'm in Vegas will definitely be going back! The bread before dinner was served warm with traditional oil and tasted soooooo good. 

My only suggestion is definitely talk to them ahead of time about how the checks are going to work. We felt bad making him split it a couple ways because it took a while in the system.

Stopped in for some dessert and an after dinner drink with a large group. I liked what I had but take issue with the fact that he has an Italian spot in Vegas. I mean, come on, you are known for a crappy TV show that has an emphasis on desserts and you "film" in Hoboken. I dont care if your grandmother cooked Italian...mine did too.

This place features fo-talian food with a of Carabbas feel. Hmmmm, I wonder where you got the idea? 

In their defence though, their lobster tail pastry was delicious. Everything else was underwhelming. 

Will I be back? NO. Im tired of all these wannabe TV culinarians.
Great place.  The marinara sauce was excellent and the motzerella appetizer was amazing.   We went between dinner and lunch so it wasn't crowded so,the service was very good.
Great food, great service from Crystal.  The meatballs were fabulous,  ravioli was great and their tomato basil soup was excellent.
My boyfriend took me here this past weekend in Vegas, we sat in the bar area. Good food, good service, cute restaurant and ambiance.

Buddy V's has absolutely become the Italian restaurant gold standard on the strip. Not only is it an affordable meal but the food is exquisite. It's "real" Italian food that tastes homemade but is served in a Strip-type location and atmosphere. I especially love the ravioli. We've tried the Sunday gravy, the lasagna, the spaghetti, the Veal parmesan, the kale (which is amazing) and my favorite the parmesan polenta (delicious). Really I have never had anything that wasn't good at Buddy V's. The tiramisu is excellent (although I admit I was very disappointed when they went away from the traditional large portion down to the small mason jar). They used to have an amazing portion tiramisu  with surprisingly moist chocolate cake at the bottom. I have eaten a LOT of tiramisu all over the country and this is hands down the best. Even better than the great restaurants I enjoyed in NYC. If you'er a local or are in Vegas for a vacation, go to Buddy V's.

Loved us some Buddy V's!

So, full disclosure...I've never seen Cake Boss. I ate here because they had great reviews and sounded like the homey kind of Italian restaurant I prefer.

Bestie and I were in a major hurry to catch our flight but had a hankering (and a reservation!) for Italian before we left Vegas.The hostesses were incredibly accommodating and let our server know we had a tight timeline.

As a result, we sat, ordered and ate - including dessert to go - and drinks in a mere 30 minutes! Clearly a dining world record.

Our server Kristin had impeccable recommendations. We started off with the caprese salad and then had lasagna and spaghetti and meatballs for our entrees. The pasta was cooked al dente as it should be. Everything was piping hot, fresh and flavorful. After the complimentary bread and breadsticks, there was no way we could eat all that food. Portions are this side of ginormous.

The manager Adam came by to check on us and chatted about other Vegas restaurants we had been to even offering future menu suggestions for a steakhouse we had been to the night before. He clearly runs a tight ship while making sure guests are well taken care of and well fed.

Will definitely be adding Buddy V's to my list of Vegas faves!

Day two of the restaurant being open so all the staff were on their toes.  Tried the Buddy's Salumi & Cheese Board (olives, pickled vegetables, grilled Italian bread, genoa salami, spicy capicola, proscuitto di parma, grana padano, tuscan pecorino, and gorgonzola).  The capicola and proscuitto were the best I've ever had and the gorgonzola was epic - bleu cheese flavor with the texture of brie.  Cheeseburger at an Italian restaurant?  You bet because the Pat Lafrieda Burger (brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone cheese, tuscan fries) was really tasty.  The tiramisu was the best I've had anywhere.

Ask for a table bordering the outside perimeter windows for great views of The Strip.  Bring your camera to take pictures of the incredible entree cakes Buddy and his team made.

It was good but not blow-your-mind good. We had the calamari appetizer (great), caesar salad (ok, thought the croutons were weird), chicken parmesan (good, didn't care for the spaghetti that came with it, big portion), and shrimp scampi (wasn't a creamy type scampi, I liked the noodles but thought the shrimp were really salty), and the cannoli (good). Overall pretty tasty but not amaaaaazing.
Great appetizers the calamari was exceptional with a good lemon flavor.....chicken parm was on point

So sad!  We had such high hopes for this place.  We eat out a lot (in fact we are trying a new restaurant every day this winter break!)  This restaurant cannot compete with anything else nearby.  Maggiano's -fabulous, Brio - lovely, Buddy V's -meh.  We had the meatball sand and the vodka sauce pasta.  Both were bland, small and overpriced ($23 for a very small plate of pasta.). No hot bread and butter, no attentive wait staff, no one asked how are meals were, we were invisible.  Then we come to the real reason we went - the lobster tail pastry.  At $15 we were sure it would be crazy good.  It wasn't. The cream inside was luscious and the presentation was beautiful, but the pastry itself was so hard and overcooked we couldn't cut it and that made sharing difficult.  Worst of all, I left my commemorative photo of my little girl and I from  the National Geographic exhibit on the table.  When we realized this 2 hours later we rushed back to the restaurant.  They had thrown it out!  Who doesn't keep people's forgotten things for at least the rest of the day?!  A very bad $64 lunch and a sad tale to tell.

5 stars for service. Team work, communication, a sense of urgency, and very polite. Our food was SALTY (chicken piccata and pasta with vodka sauce)!!!!! 
My boyfriend and I have worked in hospitality for years and understand that mishaps.....happen. We don't rush to complain but the food was not made for consumption. HOWEVER, the service and quick replacement of meals made all the difference. Server and manager were fantastic in having us leave there very satisfied. I ended up getting a new chicken piccata with less salty sauce on the side and my boyfriend opted for lasagna which was awesome (light and airy and full of flavor).
Octopus appetizer was very good and not too salty! 
We shall be back Buddy!
By the way, great team you have.

Decided to have Italian on a Friday night and made reservations.  It was painless and pleasant.  

We were seated promptly at the reservation time and greeted for drinks and water immediately.  I also noticed some plastic packages on the table that resembled chopstick containers and discovered they were mini breadsticks.  Yum.   

We ordered salads and the calamari appetizer and they also brought out complimentary bread and olive oil.  Everything was perfect as was the Pino Noir and Cabernet we were drinking.  

For the meals everyone tried different dishes which were almost all shared by the time the dinner was over.  We had eggplant parmigiana, chicken parmigiana, spaghetti and meatballs and cheese ravioli.  Everything was spot on and delicious. 

I finished my meal off with an espresso and two others shared a butterscotch creme brûlée.  As expected everything was perfect.  

As you may see from my reviews, I eat out often and across the globe.  This meal, service, ambiance and decor were as good as it gets.  Me and my 3 other guests all had a memorable time and will be back again.  If I can complain about anything, it would be that they should have linen table cloths on the tables instead of the rustic looking wood surface.  

Enjoy!

First off... Buddy V's food...  Always amazing!  Service usually amazing as well.  However, this review is for the waiter Kaleb.  Who wasn't even our waiter.  We made a reservation and were seated at one of the two chef's tables.  After giving us the details on the family style meal not on the menu our waiter filled our drinks.  Then we met Kaleb... Nope not our waiter.  He informed us we were being moved because they wanted to use our table for a 12 top.  There were six of us.  He didn't ask he told us we needed to get up and move and leave our drinks on the table.   We asked what was going on.  He just kept saying we had to move.  So as we were being basically pushed to another table at the back of the place he was being a jerk through the process.  Then he tried to switch us from the lunch menu to he dinner menu without explaining what the difference was.  Also telling us he would get a free desert for one of us.  Apparently the menu change is basically a higher price and more items.  Luckily he wasn't going to be our waiter at the new table.  As most should do we called the manager over.  He apologizes and asks us if we want a different table.   Which we didn't care about the table.  He was missing the point Kaleb was being a jerk.  He offered at least free desert to all of us.  We even confirmed it was all of us and not one of us.   Our waitress Kristy... Was amazing!!! So again take note this 1 star rating is not the norm... we generally would give it 5.  Kaleb should get a 0.  Even a few of the staff agreed and confirmed Kaleb was a jerk.  The manager was subpar.  When ordering the apparently free desert we were told it was for 4 of us.   Our waitress went and made sure it was adjusted to what was promised.  Again, We would request Kristy because her service was amazing and she dealt with the situation better than the manager.  When we left 2 hours in... The 12 top never showed up.  We were going to order the family dinner.  So they lost out on probably twice bill and still would have been able to seat the 12 top.  When we told the manager on the way out that that party never showed he said they had to save the reservation and we should be happy because he bought us over $100 worth of desert.  We reminded him that 6 people x $9 doesn't quite equal that.  He says ... "Well I tried." We didn't care about the free desert.  It was how the restaurant handled it.  The point is how this situation was handled.  In our opinion ... It was terrible.

Wasn't bad, but doesn't come close to actual Italian food. Basically a few steps above an Olive Garden. The service was great though and our waiter was attentive. Should have went next door and tried the desserts.

All I can say is the best!!
Lasagna is bomb!!! Spaghetti is perfect no to saucy but just right!!!
Lobster tail and cannoli are sooooooo goooood!!
I wish there was in LA!!!!

There are too many Italian restaurants on the strip or in the Venetian for that matter to waste your time here. Service was kinda crappy. I was severely underwhelmed by the lunch menu and felt like I was at universal studios at buca di beppo. Tourist trap. 3 stars because it wasnt bad and price was fine. Just not great and certainly not worth trying while in Vegas. Oh and the entrees are splitable despite their up sale attempts. Again think buca's

HORRIBLE...I went there yesterday to celebrate my birthday.  I'm a Cake Boss fan.  I'm 100% Sicilian and thought it would be fun to try.  VERY DISAPPOINTED.. OK tell me what Italian Restaurant doesn't serve bread... you have to order garlic bread full of grease flavor garlic not even real butter flavor and smothered in melting cheese... how about some nice Italian bread you can dip in olive oil ...the Caesar salad didn't have any anchovies on it,,,, HELLO Italian eat anchovies,,, the portions were very small and just NOT GOOD.... the Lobster Claw said it was filled with Canoli filling and cream... sorry it was just straight whipped cream with baileys in it.... very disappointing.  I'm a NYer and I know what a real lobster claw is supposed to be..., I will never go there again and OMG the prices were very expensive.... 2 for lunch came to $100.00 and it wasn't good at all... Sorry Buddy... you need to get those people trained right... and get some good bread in there...

Was in Vegas for a fun weekend and then a conference, so I got to try Buddy V's twice. The first time was for a late Sunday brunch, but we just got there too late for the buffet brunch, which looked really good. Gonna definitely have to come back for that some time.

Me and my date tried the salumi plate, which was pretty good, especially since it came with crispy grilled baguette slices. Schmeared some of the blue cheese on a slice and then layered the salumi and prosciutto for a nice little open face mini-sammy. Yum! I ordered the chicken parm, which came with a side of spaghetti marinara and my date ordered the caesar salad and we split them both between us, which was more than enough food since the caesar was pretty good size and the chicken parm came with two equal sized filets covered with cheese and sauce. The caesar came with polenta croutons, which were amazing and would have been a great appetizer on their own with a side of red sauce! Crispy on the outside and warm and fuzzy in the middle. Almost took away from how good the caesar was. My date thought there was too much dressing, but I like it that way. The chicken parm was awesome! Probably the best I've ever had anywhere. Good thick tender piece of chicken, nice breading, and great cheese to chicken ration with a nice marinara on top. But the coup de grâce was the unassuming side of pasta on the dish. I don't know what it was, but it was just spaghetti marinara but the size and texture of the pasta was just amazing. It was like the unknown actor stealing the spotlight from all the big name actors in a movie! 

I went back for lunch later in the week and got the Express lunch for $22 which included a 3 course selection. I got the caesar, spaghetti bolognese, and lemon sorbet. All were awesome, expecially for the price. But the spaghetti again was amazing. And the bolognese sauce was nice and thick and held to the pasta like glue. Easily the best spaghetti dish I've ever had. Again, I don't know what it was about the pasta (size? texture? taste? perfectly al dente?) but it was like crack in pasta form. I can't wait to go back! And this is from a guy who try's not to eat pasta much because it's a carb bomb. And I don't think I've ever had a more perfectly balanced sorbet. Not too sweet, not too tart (lemon sorbet). And 2 big scoops! What a great way to finish the meal and cleanse the pallet!

Well done, Buddy V! Well done!

Wow wow wow, is all I can say! This place is heaven on earth! Ask for the express lunch menu if available, best bang for your buck. For $22, you get a three course meal. For dessert I recommend the cannoli or the tiramisu.
This place has amazing food and excellent service! We were seated right away at our reservation time and had a great visit. I would definitely come back!
Had the Philly sandwich for lunch and it was amazing..  Service was great.. Diffently want to come back for lunch again..

Delicious. Casual restaurant that's great for family or date night. Quick service with a friendly smile and small talk. Had the lasagna it was huge and delicious. The shrimp scampi has large fresh shrimp. Sauce was just right and not too heavy. Also tried the scallops they were delicious except they were small. But the dish was overall filling.

Best Eggplant Parmigiana I have ever had. My sisters (shared the steak) also loved their meal. The host was absolutely fabulous - didn't get his name but he is Buddy's cousin. He had an eye on everything and was always dropping in to all the tables to make sure everyone was having a good time and if anything was needed. Always managing to take away a stray glass or refill an empty one as he chatted. I asked for the appy Eggplant Parmigiana as I wasn't too hungry. When he brought it out he said "don't get upset now but I upgraded you to the entree size, no charge, but it is just too delicious to eat just a small bit". He was right - best ever and since my sisters took a fair bit off my plate, it worked out well. For dessert we ordered one cannoli to split. We were so full! Anyway what does he do but come out with 3 (no charge) because it would be "terrible" if we couldn't pick them up with our hands and  eat one each to ourselves. He was right again and they were incredibly delicious! Best host ever! Great dining experience!!!!!!

Okay, the hostess took awhile to sit us down.  On the phone but didn't even look at us to smile.  This is they reason why I gave 4 instead of 5 star.  But overall, our waiter was nice and prompt.   The order were fast.  The food is alright.  We heard about the bakery and always see a long line.   We decided to give their dessert a try.  It's not the best we've tried but it's alright.

We're there sat at 830. No one waiting. The lady ask us to wait for a bit. After 10 mins, the other girl lead us sitting outside of the restaurant. We asked if there is any table inside. She replied. Oh inside, it will be another one and half hr wait. (But clearly there have several tables open inside and it was not a busy night). Then we politely said we will go somewhere else. The lady said. Really, are you sure.       :)  There are lots of choices in Vegas..  We end up with another Italian restaurant.   Thanks but no thanks buddy.

Great Italian food for a fair price! We started with the house salad (Panzanella) which was delicious and the perfect size for our party of 4. Meals ordered amongst the table included: chicken marsala, Sunday gravy, and lasagna. All were great, but the Sunday gravy was definitely the surprise hit! 

Our waiter was a bit of a fast talker and up-seller, so we weren't really sure what all exactly we ordered, but luckily everything was delicious and we enjoyed our dinner very much! 

We would love to come back to try the Sunday brunch on our next trip!

In Las Vegas for several days and headed to the strip looking for a dining establishment...just because we were in Las Vegas.  Now here is the problem for one that does not know Las Vegas...it can be very overwhelming by the selection of dining establishments and trying to walk to / find another option than those in the casio/hotel complex you are in, can be challenging given the distances involved.  We were in the Venetian and enjoyed walking along the Grand Canal.  And we ended up at Buddy V's and very glad we did.  Unfortunately it was a Friday night and there was a 90 minute wait for a table.  There was seating in the bar / lounge area and it shares the same dinner menu, so off we went.  

Ordered the $40 price fix menu which included an appy, entree, and dessert.  I selected the caesar salad, chicken parmesan and for dessert, the cannoli.  I will start with the good.  The chicken parmesan is good, really good...nicely breaded and covered with a nice tangy tomato sauce then melted cheese.  The cannoli was okay...very rich and a nice end to a dinner.  The portion size of both were quite large and one will not leave hungry.  Unfortunately there was no taste to the caesar salad dressing and the polenta croutons were simply awful...really terrible.  I had higher expectations for their caesar salad.

Our server was pleasant and attentive and the food was brought out fairly promptly after each course.

All in all, it was a positive food experience and happy to recommend Buddy V's...just not their caesar salad.

Only thing better than the food was the service. A taste of Italy in Nevada! Made a reservation for a Friday night and got right in with no wait. Hostess staff was warm and welcoming. Started off with a nice Brunello and Caprese with burrata cheese and organic heirloom tomatoes,  accompanied with grilled Italian bread. The manager Kristina was very attentive and brought us their nicest red wine glasses for our Brunello, which we really appreciated. The Caprese was one of the best my husband and I have ever tasted. We have been blessed to spend lots of time in Italy and have had some spectacular Italian meals. Buddy V's was right up there with the best we've had in Florence, Rome and Tuscany. The pasta was perfectly al dente, prepared by Executive Chef Bryan, who we had the pleasure of meeting. We finished our meal with their spectacular cannoli's that were clearly made fresh to order based on their crunchy shell. We can't say enough about our experience at Buddy V's.....from the hostess, busboys, server, managers. This group definitely worked well together just like a big Italian family.

If you know what authentic Italian food is... Don't go to Buddy V's. For $22 each, (lunch special) you can get an appetizer, main, and desert. While the portions are appropriate, the food itself was not. My meatballs ("grandma's meatballs" appetizer) were great, they tasted homemade! The "Spaghetti Bolognese" was incredibly basic, the sauce tasted like it came from a can, and the spaghetti noodles were simply basic. The biggest disappointment was the cannoli. Obviously I had high expectations not only because of the price, but because of the insane hype that surrounds this restaurant, because of the fact that it is owned by Buddy Valastro and family, from the show Cake Boss, which regularly features and highlights their cannolis as a staple item. It was so incredibly stale on the outside, I had to literally smack it with my knife to knock a chunk off of it to eat, which would have been okay if it wasn't just a greasy, dried up piece of crust. The filling was sub-par as well, I'd have rather had some cool whip inside there, at least it would be somewhat pleasant. Overall, the food was poor.

Our service was phenomenal, both of our waiters/ servers were very kind, fun, and knowledgeable. 

If you're looking for good food, go somewhere else.
