I came here Friday evening for my birthday.it was kinda hard to find,but when I did it was well worth it.very nice restaurant,open,clean and great atmosphere.we had a booth by the window with an amazing view of the strip.our waiter was awesome!! Be prepared to spend some $ for two pple it was 98.00. We got a Caesar salad,lasagna,lobster tail and shrimp dish.the lasagna was to die for...so amazing and dishes are very filling.most people were dressed in just shorts and thirst I felt overdressed.

We are back!!! Express lunch was delish as usual. We shared meatballs and caesar salad (love polenta croutons!) Carbonara hands down....they kill it here! Just wish they served bread or soft breadsticks instead if crunchy packaged sticks...Buddy V is a "baker" after all. Need to wipe the sauce off the plate. A tiramasu and canoli to hold us over until next time.
CIAO!

Buddy V's is mall food at best.  Not bad but not great either.  We were a group of 12 and our waiter was in overdrive pushing the bill up.  We asked about ordering family style, he had us each order an individual dish and we left a ton of food behind.  He recommended the veal to each one of us (the most expensive item) and when I ordered chicken picatta he asked if he could bring veal picatta instead.  Same for wines.

My husband & I dined here 11/17 to celebrate my bday. First off the place is difficult to find. They are so new the restaurant wasn't listed on the directory. We had a hard time finding it & even after asking an employee at palazzo they had no idea where it was! We called buddy v's and they directed us where to go. I was disappointed where they seated us, we had a seat facing the kitchen while the gorgeous view was behind us. I thought since we had a reservation& a bday to celebrate we should have been able to enjoy the view. The food definitely made up for the bad seat. My husband ordered the chicken Parmesan and I ordered chicken Marsala. Both were excellent, but the chicken Marsala was the best I've ever had. Service was awesome, no complaints there. Can't wait to go back!  Hopefully we'll have a better seat next time.

AMAZING. Been watching cake boss and drooling over their food for years looking at it on the show, and tonight we finally got to go! Everything was fantastic! Had 2 three course dinners (Mama's meatballs, salmon, and a cannoli and then the chicken parmesan, and nutella cake) and at 38 bucks each, you can't beat that for huge portions at a relaxed atmosphere on the strip. The staff was super accommodating and made us feel welcome and relaxed as well. If I could give more stars, I would! :)

Had been at the Venetian for 2 days and realized that I have't eaten any Italian food. Walked past Buddy V's several times and decided to make reservations for later in the evening. When I arrived I was seated promptly. The menu was short and sweet covered all of the classics. I usually order Chicken Parm but I was in the mood for Spaghetti. The noodles were great and the meat sauce had great consistency. Buddy V's is very approachable and a solid choice for classic Italian cuisine. I will be coming back.

The food was good. The child's cheese pizza was big and delicious. The chicken piccata had a great white wine sauce and the capers were delicious. My wife enjoyed the chicken Parmesan and couldn't finish the lunch portion. The price was decent for Vegas (lunch, about $17 per person). 

The only reason it didn't score higher was the service was VERY slow. We had to ask for water multiple times and generally had to follow up with our waitress quite a bit. 

We would come back again.

A friend and I went here after a show -- we were pretty much just starving and wanted pasta and this was the first place we saw. The wait was about 20 minutes so we just grabbed a seat at the bar easily which was great, however we were pretty much ignored for 15 minutes until the bartender finally came over. My friend asked for the wine list and the way she rolled her eyes you would think that's a dumb question (is that a dumb question?). When she finally came back another 10 minutes later to get drinks I asked for a food menu and that was also apparently really labor-intensive for her because she seemed crazy annoyed. The place wasn't that busy but I could tell she was the only one behind the bar which I can sympathize -- I'm a pretty patient person so if I have to wait it's not usually a big deal as long as you're pleasant when you do get to me. So that whole exchange was sort of a bummer. 

All that said the food was pretty good. Not the best Italian food I've ever had but it was straightforward pasta and good sauce. I had the rigatoni and my friend had the orecchiette and both were good enough that we finished them. 

Will I go back? Meh. But I am pretty excited the bakery is opening across the hall!

Total waste of time and money.

They get a star for service - our waiter was quite personable and competent and the bartender made some tasty drinks. But that's where the praise ends. I ordered something simple: spaghetti and meatballs. It was very...ordinary. As in "I've had better at my junior high school cafeteria." Absolutely nothing to praise about the dish. I make better at home. So does the wife. So does Chef Boyardee, for that matter.

The wife ordered the veal parmesan. It was a huge hunk of meat, on the bone, pounded way too thin and then burnt under the cheese. The cook obviously put it on too high a heat and forgot it for a bit. Totally inedible.

For a place opened by a "cake boss," you'd think the desserts would be exemplary. Guess again. The rum birthday cake was so-so, and the cannelloni were stale and flavorless. Again, worthless food served in a nice room with good service.

Save your money and taste buds and go anywhere else for dinner. Maggiano's is just down the block and light years better tasting. Heck, go to Battista's. It's a dive that's over-rated and still better than Buddy V's. Or just stay home, heat a can of Chef Boyardee and eat it while tearing up $20 bills. In the end it's the same experience.

Another fabulous meal with superior service from Randy! Each dish was delicious....we ate the Pasta E Fagioli, Sea Scallops, Veal Parm Chop, Chicken Parm, & My Mother-in-Law's Capellini Shrimp Scampi.
The Italian Birthday Cake was tasty & so cute!

Had heard good things and wanted to stop by before seeing a show however the hostess was on a major power trip and wouldn't even FATHOM letting us sit at the completely empty bar in the completely empty restaurant (no joke this was 5pm and there were maybe 3 people in the entire thing). All we wanted were some appetizers and drinks and they wouldn't even let us in because they were "completely booked" that night and people were coming "at any second". Since when do restaurants book spots at the bar?? We were completely incredulous and the hostess could not have been ruder. She definitely gets off on shooing people away, but honey this isn't an exclusive club it's the Cake Boss's restaurant...
Was here a couple years ago. It was great then and still great today. That kind of consistency is rare in Vegas. Highly recommended.

Had my second visit to this place this past weekend and I'm glad I made the choice to have dinner here on our last night in Vegas. 

The service was amazing. Everyone who came by the table was nice and friendly; there was a lot of personality and charm in the staff which made our time here fun! They were very attentive without being overbearing. 

Everyone loved their food. The chicken parm was a crowd favorite and I finished my shrimp scampi even though the button on my pants was about to pop off. 

Although I don't come to Vegas often because it's not my thing, I would come back here because I know the food and service will be memorable.

I was hoping that this restaurant was gonna be good... Big fail;( well we went for sunset menu ( 3-5pm) . We started off with the Buddy's Salumi n cheese board($19) as an appetizer...nothing special for the price. Then waiter asked if we wanted garlic bread (FYI not free it was $9 for 3 pieces) bread wasn't even warm, great Italian bread is a precursor to a great meal, not even close.  Menu was limited which isn't bad bc that usually means that the stuff on the menu is usually great...Uhm not the case. The linguine n clams ($25) portion small & there was spaghetti noodles instead of linguine??? Caprese salad($14) there was a whole tomato on the plate which was like boiled n peeled, unimpressed. The angus burger had no flavor n the French fries were overdone n cold, really??? 
Ok so after being disappointed by the food I was really looking forward to dessert... The XL lobster tail ($15) was so disappointing bc the pastry shell was hard as a rock n hard to eat. As you bite into it all the cream would shoot out bc the shell was so hard. The cannoli shell was hard as well, like a hard cookie ($9). If you had real cannolis you know that they are not supposed to taste like that. To top it off the coffee yes the coffee tasted horrible, like it's been sitting in the pot all day. For 3 people and sunset menu which is cheaper than dinner total $153 and that's with no alcohol..for that total there was not one thing I could say anything nice about. I had leftovers that weren't even worth taking home. 
Yes, I should of known better to go to a gimmicky restaurant. But I liked the show and I'm from NYC and was hoping for some good Italiano food n dessert. No love in the food at all. Don't waste your money n time going all the way to the crazy strip for this place. 
Buddy .....if your reading this or your PR person lets you know what's going on with your restaurant. This place is giving your familia a bad name. I've had your pastries in NJ. This place is not giving your bakery any justice. People who travel to Las Vegas and who will never go to your bakery in NJ are going to think that your desserts taste like this ( specifically in the restaurant) not good.

This place has everything from great food, amazing ambience, incredible service, and live music as the icing on cake.  I came in for brunch for a friends birthday and was blown away.  They have 3 different buffet stations as well as a Bloody Mary station to build your ultimate Bloody Mary which I did.  I am stuffed and can't wait to come back.  Well I have returned and the experience was incredible once again.  The manager came by I believe her name was Milly.  Great suggestions and I loved the Nutella cake.
Normal, fama devido ao programa de tv. A sobremesa foi o melhor. Pratos individuais mas bem servidos

Delicious food!!! I'm sorry I don't remember my waiters name but he was super nice and made great recommendations. The panzenella salad is a must try. Beautiful restaurant, amazing food and atmosphere. Can't wait to go back.

I wanted to start out by saying Buddy V's Ristorante was highly recommended to me by my son from the night before on Mother's Day. My boyfriend suggested we dine there for my birthday the next night. Being raised in an old fashion Italian family that cooked a lot, I usually do not like to eat out at Italian restaurants because the food usually taste too Americanize and falls short of true Italian cuisine.  Well, I must say I give Buddy V's a big 5 stars. Their food, Charred Octopus, Orecchiette & Italian Sausage (pasta), Roasted Branzio (seasonal fish), Italian Greens (Tuscan kale, garlic oil, plum tomatoes) was the best ever!! My whole crazy Italian family would approve! Be warned the tropical drinks are very delicious but very strong. I got cockeyed 1/4 of the way drinking from my glass. I ended the evening with a cannoli which I give a 4 star because I still think my Mom's cannoli were a bit better. I was a little disappointed they did not offer a SMALL comp birthday dessert however they did write happy birthday on my Cannoli plate with chocolate. Coffee was great tasting and the serves rocks! Everyone is friendly and attentive.  I love this place, I may have to come back for brunch!

A little hard to find if you're in the casino but a great place to eat. Service was good but not polished. The meatballs were perfect. Very flavorful. Sea scallops were delicious. Ambience is nice but it's more bustling than relaxing. Italian birthday cake is something I'd highly recommend if you're in the mood for dessert. Skip the drinks, they looked overpriced and sugary.

Great family style Italian restaurant and bakery.  Food, service, drinks, ambiance and prices are all great.  Loved the pasta, octopus, meatballs, sausages,  appetizers, kale side dish, fish and bread.  Desserts are to die for and awesome coffee and espresso drinks.  Speaking of drinks the bar menu is fantastic and the wine list is right behind it.  I don't go down to the Strip much for Italian, but, when I do, I go to Buddy V's.

The smashed meatball sub was amazing and the rosemary seasoning on the fries was delicious. Loved the vibe in there too! 

I noticed that our server gave the table beside us different attention. He asked them if they had been there before and when they replied no, he gave them an intro speech of sorts, describing who Buddy is and how the restaurant came about. I was a little disappointed that he didn't bother sharing that with us. I'd suggest that it was because  we looked like tourists, but you know...they ARE located on the strip!

I will definitely go back for dessert. They looked phenomenal.
The food was great and the service amazing! You feel at home and very welcomed as soon you walk in the door.

The food was amazing. Served in a timely manner and with extremely fresh ingredients. HOWEVER, the staff is extremely unpleasant. The hostess had an intimidating face and seemed like she didn't like her job. The waiter was polite but not friendly. I would not come here unless I was dying for the food.

Bone in parm chop baby - that's where Vegas life starts to get really good.

Had dinner with a group of friends last Vegas trip - I was impressed! Solid classic Italian. Very good food - prices aren't bad for the Strip.

Dessert - I have been avoiding them lately but the Lobster Tail Thingy (really, I think that's what it's called) was awesome.  No lobster in it (not a bad thing) just simple, buttery shreds of puff pastry filled with a slightly sweetened pastry cream.  Simple, but very good.  Totally rocked in fact!
Kind of a disappointment, we had the chicken parm and the chicken was very dry! Everything else was very mediocre not worth the price, kinda expected more from buddy
Ate there for lunch and it was perfect. Had the mozzarella bread for starters and the chicken parm for the meal. We added some meatballs to it and it was out of this world.

what an amazing dinner and unexpected surprise!!!  I took my wife here for her birthday thinking what else than the "Cake  Boss" can suffice for her birthday celebration.  We were seated and after a few minutes our server Georgio approached our table.  unbelievably upbeat and personable.  We were blown away by his descriptions of the menu items and took his recommendations wholeheartedly, and it was amazing.  His table service was incredible while making us laugh the WHOLE time!!  At the end he sang to my wife in Italian as she sat there ready to burst with tears of joy.  By far more memorable than her last birthday where we spent 3 times the amount and half the quality of food and service.  Thank you for the super memorable night Georgio and the Buddy V staff.....The Klausberg Family

We went to Buddy V's on our anniversary for wine and cheese.  We were very impressed with the portions on the cheese/salumi platter.  The wine was delicious and the service we received from Pete our waiter was outstanding.  We will definitely be back.

We made it to Buddy V's at the Venetian!  Tip: Park at Palazzo Valet, walk down to strip and up escalator next to Walgreens for a shorter walk!

We came during Happy Hour, 4:30-6:30 pm 7 days a week. We were here Memorial Day weekend, and it wasn't too full on a Sunday afternoon. The seating in the bar was really comfy with stuffed chairs and couches, high top bar tables with padded seats and bar seating with padded seats with backs. 

We tried one of everything on the Small Bites for $5 Happy Hour menu!!!  We also had the Butterscotch Creme Brûlée for dessert for $9. So creamy and great butterscotch flavor! It's a good sized bowl, but only about 1/2 inch thick, so not as many calories!

Ricotta cheese was smooth and creamy. It came with grilled buttered bread, and was a great accompaniment to the Olives and Pickled Vegetables, which was served with the same bread. There was enough cheese to also put some on the amazing and Must have Grandma's Meatballs. 3 large beef, veal and pork meatballs with about 1/2 of tomato sauce, sprinkled with a good amount of parmesan cheese. Our other favorites: the Calamari had some big tender pieces that I loved, there were crispy big pieces that that the little tentacles that our friend loved and some fried banana peppers that the spicy food lover liked. My wife's favorite was definitely the Mac and Cheese Carbonara, with smoked mozzarella, fontina, egg, pancetta and peas with a creamy sauce and golden bread crumbs. We got Roma style Gnocchi, which are little fried cubes of polenta with a little metal tub of marinara mixed with pesto dipping sauce-delicious. Crunchy on outside  and smooth inside, great sauce. The smashed meatball sliders was a fun little 2 bite sandwich with peppers on top. Same for Sausage and pepper sliders, which are a bit spicy. 

Loved the little to go novelty light up cup for the soda with unlimited refills for $7. 

Krystal waited on us, and was very happy and attentive. Manager Kristina Poole visited the table and sat and visited us for a nice chat. We got an update on the restaurant, it's sister restaurant in Bethlehem, PA and Buddy's moms health when we asked. The Assistant General Manager, Sean Fiori, came and whisked her away after a quick picture and check to make sure we were happy. 

Very nice evening, could be quick, but this time we stayed and enjoyed ourselves and they were not pushing us out after we paid the bill.

We are here again on 12/18/16 and it's all the same-menu, Krystal the waitress, me and my wife and Flower. She's having the Sangria. No hot chocolate for Tutu, they need to add it to the menu during cold weather.  She got some across the way at Carlos Bakery. Along with Cannoli and a strawberry cheesecake.

Buddy V's wins for best happy hour on the Strip! The bartender was super helpful and fast. The portions for HH aren't that large but allow for a taste of a variety of options. We had the meatballs, calamari, ricotta and polenta-all delicious! The sangria was AMAZING! If I was eating on just the HH it would have received five stars!

After HH we sat down and had dinner. The majority of the courses were excellent. I didn't like how the waiter pushed more food than was necessary. I also had the veal piccata and it wasn't that good. Eating starved baby cows only happens once a year for me and it wasn't worth it on that meal. The cheesy garlic bread was very delicious. I would definitely return for the HH but probably wouldn't eat in the main restaurant.

I normally don't order spaghetti and meatballs, but it was included in the Prix Fix meal, and I wanted a salad.  So,  I reluctantly ordered it.   Man oh man, am I ever glad  I did.  It was just like my aunts, if not better.  The most succulent meatballs ever!! The sauce was so good too.  I almost ate the whole bowl.  I left  a few bites because I was so stuffed.  I thought about it he next day, that's how I know it was good!!!

This is a perfect low key Italian joint.  The best chicken parm I have had, which is saying something.  Also, the pasta was a perfect al dente.  

Kid friendly, reasonable prices(for Vegas, anyway), good portion sizes.

Casual, non-spectacle joint, which is needed once in a while when visiting this town.

All the food we had was spectacularly....meh. Nothing was horrible, but nothing was even above ordinary from what you'd find at most italian chains. We had the spaghetti bolognese and chicken parm. 
Our waiter was beyond terrible though. It wasn't one specific thing, just a lot of little things that added up to a poor experience. 
The bus boy/bread deliverer/water guy was great, and that's the only thing I can say positively about the place. At these prices, we definitely won't be back.
Had a blast with two others I was with. The server, Danielle was great. Very knowledgable and attentive. The food was very good, pizza and pasta. The two I was with enjoyed the deserts also.

We were excited to see that Buddy Valastro had a restaurant in Las Vegas & had to try it out. Definitely were not disappointed! 

Both of our servers were excellent. Went with the recommendation for the Caesar salad as it included polenta croutons that were out of this world good! Salad was crisp, bright & fresh. Hubby greatly enjoyed the mac & cheese, while my eggplant parm was fantastic! Will definitely come back on our next trip West!

Food was very good. Waiter was outstanding! Although a little pricey, its Vegas, you get what you pay for. The service was excellent and the food was very good. It was a little noisy, but all in all, I would visit again.

Not a fan of Buddy Valastro as a tv chef personality; however, his restaurant did offer some delicious and memorable appetizers. 

Pros

Macaroni & Cheese Carbonara: One of the most decadent and rich mac & cheese I've had. Although the pancetta was lacking, the cheese sauce was pure heaven and the penne pasta was cooked just right. 

Aunt Nina's Mozzarella Corozza: It's pretty much a delicious version of the grilled cheese sandwich filled with plenty of mozzarella and pesto that is placed on a chunky bed of ragu. The only dislike I had about this appetizer was that the sandwich was drench in too much olive oil for grilling. 

Margherita Pizza: A simple pie that was baked to perfection with a perfect ratio of mozzarella, tomato, and basil. 

Overall great dining experience with delicious food to start off the day. I definitely will return and also will be saving room for dessert to try out his popular bakery, Carlo's Bakery that is located across the restaurant.

This used to be one of my favorites in LAS.  Went there tonight with a friend all the while telling him how great the food and service was going to be.  Boy was I wrong.  While the food was adequate, the service was non-existent.  To get anything, we had to constantly flag down staff members.  While some may accuse me of being too picky, I think the fact that the restaurant did not have fresh grated parm cheese available (they claim their wheel broke) is a major blunder for an Italian themed restaurant.  I mentioned how poor the service was to one of the floor managers on our way out, and all she could say was "Please don't let that stop you from coming back."  Really?  That's it?  Spend a couple of hundred dollars on dinner only to be told that?  I think it will be long time before I head back that way.  Which is too bad because the bone-in veal parm, with our without parm cheese, is really a wonderful dish. Ironically, shortly after we were seated, a table of 10 or 11 was seated next to us.  The wait staff fawned all over those folks and the chef even came out to meet the leader of their pack.  I guess we weren't high enough rollers to get the attention that we expected.
Very good food! Service was very attentive! We ordered the smashed meatball sandwich and it was very good.

The dessert was delicious! My chicken rigatoni was raw. The chicken was chewy so I cut all the pieces and sure enough it was pink! Super disappointed. The pasta wasn't bad at all...a little salty for my taste. The chicken Piccata was cooked nicely. The cannoli was very good. The cheesecake was amazing!!! The manager took care of us...free dessert. We will go back for dessert and a no-chicken dish :)

It was mine and my husbands 14 year anniversary and I was looking for a fantastic restaurant for us to go out to for a romantic evening! I was recommended by a friend to try Buddy Vs because she works as a concierge on the strip and said it has been a pretty popular choice among tourists.... Let me start by saying people must like this place bc of the fact that it's owner has a tv show because I was very unimpressed! 
Ok, let me say that it is a beautiful restaurant but not much for a romantic evening... My husband and I were sat at a table barely large enough to hold out plates on, and we were in between 2 other larger parties! We felt completely cramped and not the least bit romantic! However we decided to try to make the best of our night and ordered some of our favorite Italian dishes! When our food arrived I wouldn't put it too far past a fast food Italian taste! There was nothing great about our food and most definitely not worth the price! We are locals who love good Italian food and there are many, and I do mean many, that we have tried off the strip who far exceed Buddy Vs! We will leave this restaurant for the tourists!

Had tomato basil soup, chicken Parmesan and cake. Everything was ok but comparable to Buca de Peppo or Eastside Marios. Actually the later two I would consider going to before buddy vs. I love his Sunday gravy recipe so I thought this would be an excellent place. Spaghetti was a little underdone. Server was nice. Beer selection was ok. Probably wouldn't recommend or go back.

We had Thanksgiving dinner for four at Buddy V's Ristorante.  According to our internet search for top Las Vegas restaurants for Thanksgiving dinner 2015, Buddy V's was showing a delicious menu including a squash soup to start and a main plate, all for $28/person.  When we arrived, it was $10 for soup and $29 for the main plate.  They explained that somehow, it was the 2014 menu and pricing showing online.  The soup arrived and it was way too sweet.  It should have been served as dessert, not an appetizer.  I barely had three spoonfuls and when  they took it away, they didn't even ask if it was ok.  The main course arrived and it was tasty, but cold.  We sent it back and asked for it to be hot.  When the second plate arrived 10 minutes or so later, it was still cold.  We hoped that the third time would be a charm, but it wasn't.  Half the plate was hot, half was cold.  I'm sure they must have microwaved it.  The really scary thing was that half the turkey and sausage was gone, so I'm still wondering if they served me my plate or someone else's plate.  We spent over $250 for four with a $40 bottle of wine, before tip, and were tremendously disappointed with the service, and the fact that they're incapable of serving hot food, despite several attempts.  The flavor was good, but that is not sufficient to give them our business a second time.

I recommend stopping here if you want some Italian, in Las Vegas. It's located by the Shops in the Venetian.

We both got the Prix Fixe and it was so good! It seemed a little pricey at $40/person, but for what you get, it's better deal than you would think at first glance. 

The complimentary bread they bring for you to dip in oil & vinegar is as a type of a focaccia, so delicious. I don't care for Balsamic vinegar, so the waitress kindly brought some marinara for me, and that sauce was perfect. I chose the panzanella side salad, which was so huge and packed with goodness. They didn't just throw some salad mix on a plate! Very fresh, croutons made in-house and packed with flavor. The cheese, the tossed-in dressing, all in perfect proportion to the greens. Also noted that they halved the grape tomatoes, which is a sign to me that they pay attention to detail. (I love the taste, but hate biting into a whole grape tomato and having it burst.) 

As entree, I had the Bucatini Carbonara, which is a dish I am super picky about, and it was the best I've ever had! Pasta was perfect and I could have easily saved half, if I was a little less hungry, or it was less delicious. As it was, there was such a generous portion, I didn't finish it. 

My guy had Orecchiette and Italian Sausage. It looked lovely, and had some red peppers, broccolini, roasted tomatoes, and the spicy Italian sausage. Really, all the flavors he loves. I tried a bite, and it was fantastic. 

The wine  Paolo Scovino Dolcetta d'Alba 2013- was great pairing with pasta, just enough sweet and mild acidity and richness to be a wonderful accompaniment to the meal. It's a variety I hadn't tried before, so I have a new love. 

Tiramisu was beautiful and flavorful, not too much of any of the ingredients, and a couple of lady fingers on the side. My guy finished his cannoli in about 3 minutes, as well, so I'm assuming he liked it. 

All in all, Excellent! We were stuffed and happy, and the service was attentive and friendly.

Awesome, awesome, awesome.  That is how I would describe every aspect of this restaurant.  My wife is a huge cake boss fan, and we were told Buddy opened a restaurant.  Of course, she thought we should try it and I was glad she forced the issue.   We started with grandmas meatballs, and they were tender and delicious.  Followed this up with the Lasagne and I will say that I am a bit of a Lasagne snob and am very picky.  Up to this visit, I openly stated that my home made lasagne was the best I have ever had, and I now have to admit that Buddy's was a bit better.  A very healthy portion that I could not finish, and the mix of cheeses, meats, pasta, spices and sauce was a true delight.

The waiter we had was great and was extremely helpful with the menu and wine choices.  I would suggest to anyone to go here for a good hearty, filling meal.  Great job Buddy!
Lisa's warm nutella cake is exceptional and so are the people who work here. Emily was super sweet and made my day.
HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! And the food was not great either. I would be happier grabbing some burgers and fries at In-N-Out instead of this crap.

Ate dinner here last night and let me say..it was perfect!. We did make reservations even on a Tuesday because we had theatre tickets and did not wanna be late. We asked to sit at a booth by the window but was informed that was for guests with a party of 6 but she did seat us at another booth that was smaller. Ok no big.
 Our waiter was excellent and very prompt! His name was Chaz according to the ticket. Great service, very knowledgeable about the menu and had great recommendations. He also never let our drinks get very low because he was bringing out a fresh one which I feel is hard for other servers to do anymore. I opted for the Margherita pizza while my mom got the Shrimp Scampi. While waiting they had fresh bread that just came out of the oven and was delicious.
 Our food was great and looked good too :) they also start live music at 530 so that was a nice touch. After we were stuffed from dinner we had to look at the dessert menu because let's face it it's Buddys! The dessert menu had pictures of Buddy and his family which was a wonderful touch! We ordered Lisa's nutella cake and holy crap it was heavenly! I highly recommend it.

All in all we had a great experience and would definitely be back!

Had reservations for 4:30 and didn't realize that they had a sunset menu, with limited choices, that was from 3pm to 5pm. With some finagling, our waiter, Michel, got us dinner entrées. We had the calamari appetizer (very good) and the garlic bread with mozzarella (very good). The fresh focaccia with olive oil and balsamic vinegar was excellent. Our entrées were rigatoni ala vodka with chicken (excellent), chicken parmigiana (excellent), and chicken marsala (excellent).  The portions were perfect. We didn't get dessert because we'd eaten at Carlo's bakery earlier in the day. Dessert menu did look good. 

I'd rate Buddy's 4.5 stars, but because of our waiter Michel, I went up to 5 stars rather than go down to 4.

Wow, did I say wow? WOW! As soon as you've put your order in. The order is at you're table! How do they do that??? Start off with fantastic meatballs. The rigatoni with red sauce was outstanding! The carbonara dish was out of this world. Would it be bad to say go ahead and lick the bowls at the end?
My family and i went for brunch. The services and drinks were great, but the brunch menu was limited. There wasn't much of a variety.

The food was pretty good! Their birthday cake was totally awesome. The busboy Victor M was more helpful than our waiter! The hostesses are rude, nasty & lazy! They were so busy talking about what they were going to do that night that they actually got upset with the people in my party for interrupting their plan making! Put these girls in the kitchen to wash dishes where they belong! Get some one better out front please!

The RJ did a review on this restaurant and I had no desire to visit until I read it.

We came for a late dinner on a Monday night. I didn't think we would need reservations. Walking down the hall, we were met with a huge line and I hoped it wasn't a dinner rush. I suddenly second guessed my decision to gamble on a walk in. We got closer and realized the crowd was for the bake shop located directly across the hall from the restaurant. Still, there was a good amount of people in front of the host stand. Turns out, Buddy and some of the guys were there! He was near the bar that was sectioned off for a private party, but it was still pretty cool to see them there none the less!

We were seated right away and really liked the decor and vibe of the place. Caleb was our server and he pretty much made our night. He offered bottled, sparkling, or tap water to start while we looked over the menu.

We started with Aunt Nina's Mozzarella en Carrozza as suggested by the RJ review and also by Caleb. Be sure to order this when you come! Think fried mozzarella, but done the way it should be. The outside provided a perfect crunch and the inside had all the ooey-gooey-ness you hope to find when you get fried mozzarella. It comes dressed with a tomato sauce and pesto sauce drizzle. After our first bite, we immediately contemplated ordering another. We held off as we planned on saving room for dessert.

My fiancée ordered one of the specialty cocktails as well. I don't remember which one..it had good flavor, but the alcohol was a little strong for her liking. Caleb was attentive enough to notice she wasn't drinking it and asked a couple times if she would like him to get her something else. Being in the service industry herself and not wanting to create more hassle, she declined and figured she would drink it with her entree. Caleb came over once more and took the glass and said he wanted to get her a glass of his favorite drink on the menu. He brought back a cocktail the was tequila based and had a sprig of rosemary. My fiancée doesn't care for tequila but I enjoyed the drink very much. We were very appreciative of Caleb's initiative to make our experience the best it could be.

My fiancée was torn between the chicken parm and the chicken rigatoni "alla vodka". Based on the descriptions and recommendations of our server, she went with the latter. I ordered the Agnolotti. The rigatoni was perfectly al dente and the sauce was very well prepared. The Agnolotti was so hearty from the flavorful meat filling and the brown butter sauce was a perfect compliment. 

We somehow managed to save some room for dessert. My fiancée has a weakness for cannolis so her decision was made fairly quickly. I came in with the intention of ordering the XL lobster tail pastry. After the meal I just had, the "XL" part turned me off of that idea. I was torn between the birthday cake and the Nutella cake. I turned once more to Caleb for advice trusting he would once again deliver and not turn us astray. I ended up with the Nutella cake.

The cannoli was very flavorful and had a nice touch of cinnamon. It was served with a side of chocolate sauce. The Nutella cake was actually a lava cake. It was very moist which is often lost on such a dessert. It was served with a scoop of salted caramel ice cream which perfectly balanced the sweetness of the cake.

All in all it was a great experience. The dinner menu is a little bit smaller compared to other Italian restaurants, but if every item is executed well, who cares?? Be sure to ask for Caleb and be sure to order Aunt Nina's mozzarella. I am convinced that everything on the menu is delicious and we will definitely be returning to test that theory.
Loved this place.  My choice of pasta taste like it was home made.  I finished every bite!  We had a nice view to the Vegas strip

Discovered Lunch Express Menu

I had done some research on Buddy V's Restaurant and found about their lunch express menu. For $22, you can choose an appetizer/soup/salad, your choice of entree and dessert. We had - the Caesar Salad - yummy and creamy. Salad was well tossed. OMG the cheese croutons! I could pop these nonstop! - the meatballs - quite yummy and tasty sauce - Spaghetti Bolognese - mum liked her meal a whole lot - Margherita pizza - fluffy and light pizza. - Bucatini Carbondale - the waiter recommended this dish. It is indeed one of the best carbonaras I've ever had. - Tiramisu - OMG - you don't taste the bitterness of the coffee very much. - Cannoli - crunchy she'll with a cream filling- it was OK Gelato - chocolate and vanilla - cools you down Thinking of coming back for their Sunday Brunch next time.
Boring average Italian food that lacked adequate service.  There are much better places to spend your vacation dollars.
I had the chicken parm which was good. My husband had the scallops and they were delicious!  Not to heavy, just right portions. The garlic cheese bread was very good. The service was great!

Went at 4:30 with some friends for the happy hour specials.  Service was sincere and friendly. The drink prices were killer for happy hour, and the food was great. I recommend the calamari, not to spicy, and the sauce is great.

This place is legit. Great space with tons of seating and a nice lounge area where you can wait for a table. The service is impeccable and the food is absolutely amazing. Fine dining is what it's about here. They have tons of tables with a great strip view. If you're in town and need a place to have a wonderful dinner, Buddy V's is where it's at!

Nice looking place, nice staff, but the food.....the food was tasteless. Meatball sub had no seasoning and the fries were just....fries. my wife had the pizza and it was just bland and subpar. I asked for a Coke and the waiter brought me a cherry coke. I asked him for a Coke again  and he brought me what tasted like a mix between Dr Pepper and cherry coke. My went on to try the canoles, and they tasted like chalk.  We were really disappointed. We were rooting for the "cake boss", but he just didn't deliver.

I've always been a huge fan of Buddy so my friend and I decided to try it out. Service was exceptional, and we were suprised at how fast we got our food. The chicken marsala was good, but nothing more special than the others I have tried. The real reason we came was for the lobster tail and cannoli. It was amazing and even better then we imagined.  A definite must try when visiting this restaurant.

Our waiter was the best, funny and point. We were there around 8pm. Place was packed. Once waiter took our order it long to get our food. The food was ok. I ordered the Lasagne it was good. I had better.  Their portiions are big. I was not able to eat half of it. Also to heavy to have this late. I could not sleep.
The desserts were very good. I will for sure be back for the desserts.

Kickass Italian food. This is one of the best Italian meals I've ever had. I have my favorite places in Chicago and San Francisco's Little Italy, but Buddy V's is every bit as good as they are.
The grilled octopus was one of the most delicious dishes I've ever had in my mouth. My entree was the "Sunday Gravy" and I can't imagine ordering anything else. It was Fan-freakin-tastic!
Service is top notch.
Go. Here. Now!

Really really wanted to give more stars because I am such a fan of the Cake Boss, but our meal was mediocre at best for the amount we paid for it.  The spaghetti and meatballs were extremely salty with little flavor otherwise.  

We did not have any dessert, but the cute pictures in the dessert menu we so wonderful!

The service was acceptable and friendly, but I'm not sure we will return.  Sorry Buddy

PS... Okay I decided to go back  2 nights later to give it a second chance. We heard the tiramisu was wonderful so we asked to get some to go, and they said they were unable to do so...... What a disappointment.  Two strikes and your out!

Well to begin with the restaurant was almost empty at lunchtime so not only was there no wait time but also we got a table with a view. 
My husband and I decided to share an antipasto and a pasta. We started with Grandma's Meatballs. I typically don't like red sauce or meatballs but this was soo soo good. 
Then came Nona's Lasagna Al Forgo. They gave it to us in 2 separate dishes which made it a lot easier to share. The portion size was extremely generous especially for lunch. But we felt that it was very similar in taste to Grandma's Meatballs. Maybe ordering similar sauce dishes wasn't the right decision.
A bit overpriced, but hey- it's Vegas. The food was definitely good- HUGE and too filling GOR us to get to try the desert, but it hit the spot.

There food was delicious! There sauce was soooo good, but the the portion sizes are extremely small, very pricey for the size but other than that this place is perfect, great atmosphere, great food, what more could you want.
Awesome!  Food was some of the best Italian we've had, Krystal took great care of us, price was unexpectedly reasonable and atmosphere/music was enjoyable. Will come back.

Spaghetti was the overwhelming choice at the table and it was worth it.  The sauce is not a strong tomato taste as most Italian restaurants, almost had a light cream added to it.  The meat was perfect.  A lot of crumbled beef on the sauasage.   Excellent.  

Would have been 5 stars with better service.  It seems to be a common theme in Vegas, mediocre service at the restaurants.  I think we asked for coffee 7-8 times before being served.  Just not very attentive and no sense of urgency.  

5 star food and 3 star service gets you 4 stars.

Great Italian food and great value!

I found Buddy's on Yelp and was so happy that I gave the restaurant a try. We got there during happy hour and there was a variety of small plate appetizers for $5 each and a full menu as well. 

I ordered the fried calamari happy hour small bite for $5 and the sea bass for $29 as entree. The calamari was crispy and flavorful and for $5, it was a steal. 

The sea bass entree came with an arugula salad on the side and the fish came deboned and was crispy outside and perfectly tender inside. 

The ambiance is casual and the wait staff was very friendly. The restaurant was right across from Carlos Bakery and it is a great stop after dinner. 

Highly recommend!

I loved the atmosphere, the decor, everything. Server's are extremely nice and the food is beyond phenomenal. However, they lost a star because I asked for the dessert menu for more than 4 times, that's about it from my experience. GOOD JOB BUDDY

The chicken parm was delicious. However service was not the greatest. We waited 10 mins at our table before someone even came to our table. After ordering The waiter never came around to ask if we needed anything, we finally had to stop another waiter to ask for a refill on our water.

One of my Italian Food places ever! First of all, the best dessert I've ever tasted in my life....Italian Birthday Cake is the bomb and a must have! I just wish Buddy would open a place in LA, so us Southern Californian's could partake in the flavors of his families recipes ! His Chicken Parmigiana is outstanding, (order extra sauce!) and the Chicken PIccata is my husband's favorite. We love the feel of the restaurant, the view is beautiful, (although we hate that it's in Sheldon Adelson's place), and we try to make sure we stop there every time we're in Vegas. We even ordered meals to go last time we were there....and the restaurant packaged everything up beautifully for our drive. Order your desserts when you're dining at the restaurant, and you can skip the line across the way at the Bakery.

The service was outstanding !  My wife was given a complimentary glass of wine for what they called a delay. There was really no delay they were just on top of Service so much that they apologized up-and-down for the delay!  The veal chop was hot and tasty and the lobster tail was out of this world. My wife's veal Picata was outstanding as well will definitely be back.

We are Cake Boss fans, so we enjoyed this restaurant. We had a half hour wait on a Thursday night, not too bad. Good kids menu & a pretty good selection of Carlo's Bakery desserts.  Probably the best meal we had in Vegas.

I had a surprisingly solid lunch here the other day. First of all, the view is a big selling point., overlooking the strip. They have lunch specials and they are relatively reasonable in price for a restaurant on the strip. 

I ordered the Italian hero with Caesar salad and my friend ordered the meatball appetizer. The sandwich was really good. Perfectly cooked bread, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The meat was flavorful and had a nice kick. The tomato tapenade added a nice spiciness as well. I tried some of my friend's meatballs and they were great. Moist and well-seasoned. Some of the better meatballs I've tried in town.  

We couldn't stop by without trying some dessert, so we gave in and ordered a tiramisu as well as a Nutella cake with salted caramel gelato. The tiramisu was enormous, large enough for four people to share. The Nutella cake was not overly chocolatey and wonderfully paired with the caramel gelato. I'm not typically a fan of Nutella or cake but this was the perfect combination. 

They are opening a Carlo's Bakery across from Buddy V's, which will be a great addition to accompany this restaurant.

A must try when coming to Vegas! I tried the chicken Parmesan it was perfect, as well as the chicken piccata which was the best I've had so far. Meatballs were tender & flavorful as well as the polenta which tasted like butter. Waiter paired our wine to our meals & you have to try the Bombolinis!!!!! Amazing!

We had a 5:30 dinner reservation but had to wait to be seated.  Not sure why, because the place had lots of empty seats.  The service was good and the food excellent.  We ordered the shrimp scampi which was made with a tomato base sauce and caesar salad.  The croutons were very different...they were served arm with cheese filled inside of these huge croutons.  It was very delicious!!  The breadsticks in packages in a holder on the table were also delicious.  We wished we stayed for the lobster dessert, but we were too filled.   We will be back the next time we're in Vegas visiting.

Very good and wonderful service. I like the decor. I feels like you're in a home and the food is very filling. It is like a home cooked Italian meal. Great experience and good food. I would definitely recommend it.
Came here for dinner. The Bucatini is the best Ive ever had! Could eat it again and again.

Skip the restaurant and enjoy the Bake Shop across the hall instead.

I thought this place looked interesting and who doesn't love Cake Boss so I tried them for lunch. Had a tough time find them at first. I was traveling solo and dining alone not for whimps. This place seemed to cater more towards families and was not that comfortable here; don't know how to explain it but almost like it was a bother that 1 person was taking a table. Food was average (meatball sub and tomato basil soup). Service was meh. Overall I was under impressed. Hit the bake shop up on the way out and that pretty much saved the trip. 7 layer rainbow cookies, yum!!!

I got the cheese ravioli and the Portion was sorta small for the price. Atmosphere is casual and very family friendly. I'll come back an maybe try something else. Servers we're VERY attentive and even gave us appetizers on the house!!

Pretty decent little restaurant and we will be back. That being said I think this place is entirely overhyped due to its celebrity association. We came here at a weird time and only had a choice of like 5 real food items. A bit oddd. I am sure my review will be better if I eat during a different time.

Not easy to find, but no big deal.  Had the Meatball Sub (Hero) and the problem I had was that it came on a toasted roll?!  It does not say that in the description on the menu and to me, changes the whole delicious simplicity your watering mouth is expecting. Taste of the Meatballs were good and I ended up just eating them.  Now YOU know.
Great service.  Excellent seat by window on Strip.  Super low lighting only negative.  Great value.  Mains are huge.  We shared.

I had very bad experience here. The price is a little bit high，but it tastes good. The most worst things that I want to say is the poor serice. The serious woman waiter wrote the final total payment for me and asked me to sign my name. She wrote 25% tips for me and she did not even smile to me. Maybe I look like Asian and she think that I would never come here twice. After she asked me to sign my name for paying，she just left and did not give me a chance to ask her the question. Maybe I look young and Asian. I am studying in America and I just finished my final. I want to have great time in Las vegas，but this experience really made me upset. I just want to share my true experience here. I would never come here again. Thank you.

Stopped in here with my family of five as we cruised through the Venetian for a late lunch. We were really headed to Carlos' Bakery but were hungry and went in to Buddy's.

Two kids got meatball sandwiches, one got the margherita pizza, and my wife and I split the salumi and cheese plate with a couple glasses of house red. Happily I got a few bites of the meatball sandwich and it was probably the best I've ever had. The salumi and cheese plate was a great split for a light meal, with excellent meats, cheeses, and I loved the olives. Not normally an olive fan. My daughter really liked the pizza, too.

The bill was about eighty five bucks and the service was good, not great.

Tip: If you want to hit the bakery, grab a number before or during your meal. There was a significant wait for the bakery, although perhaps the novelty will have worn off after a little time has passed.

I used to watch Cake Boss. While I haven't seen an episode in recent times, I recall not only being amazed by Buddy Valastro's cake designs, but wishing I could try some of those hearty Italian meals that he and his family would cook up as well. I finally had my chance to try both the sweet and savory while my husband and I vacationed in Las Vegas. 

Buddy V's restaurant and Carlo's Bakery are right across the way from each other inside The Venetian. The line for the bakery was a mile long, so we opted to have lunch and enjoy one of the desserts in the restaurant instead. I loved the feel of the place. It was cozy and warm with large windows to view the gorgeous strip. 

They serve warm focaccia bread with olive oil to start. It was so light and fluffy... We both asked for a second piece even though we promised each other we would save room for that dessert! They offer a prix fix lunch special for $22, which is what my husband ordered. You can choose from a few slightly smaller portions of appetizers or salads, entrees or pastas, and desserts. He went with the meatballs, chicken parmesan, and cannoli. I had the whole wheat penne primavera, which included all sorts of tasty grilled veggies. My husband split his cannoli with me... I really didn't give him a choice. :p It was stuffed with sweet ricotta and dipped in chocolate chips and pistachio. Not to diss my hometown of St. Louis, known for its Italian foods and restaurants, but this was the absolute best cannoli I've ever had in my life! 

My husband and I both left Buddy V's completely satisfied and determined that we would definitely return on our next trip. Thankfully, we visit Vegas often, so I shouldn't have to wait too long for another cannoli!

Soooooo pleasantly suprised by this place. Went to the famous Cake Boss bakery since there are only 2 stores world wide! After standing in line at the bakery we found ourselves starving and impatient so we decided to just go into this sister restaurant right across the hall. Went in with no expectations and having read nothing about the place and was totally blown away! 

I had the chicken ceasar salad cause after spending 3 days in vegas all I wanted were vegetables and water. The romaine was crisp, the dressing was yummy, and the crutons were the star of the dish... parmesan polenta crutons!? That's a thing? You're damn right that's a thing and it's amazing! Would give it a full 5 but they were a bit skimpy on the chicken. 4.5/5

The man ordered the Philly Cheese Sandwich which was also delicious. Crisp and soft bread, ooy-gooy cheese, juicey thin slices of perfectly seasoned meat. It's not a traditional Philly in any sense but it's truely one of the best I've ever had. 5/5

Might I add they offer the dessert we were standing in line for at the bakery. Kind of wish we had just dined here and ordered a pastry for dessert!

Would definitely dine here again give it a shot for sure!

My wife and I went to Buddy v's (in Las Vegas) because we knew we were going to have a great cannoli but we ended up having such a great time. The staff was so warm and friendly we decide to go there the next day for dinner; so we canceled our other reservations and it was five stars across the board. I would recommend this restaurant to any person.

AMAZING Restaurant with an AMAZING crew! Joy, Thank you for being amazing! You gave the best service i have seen ever. My friends and I came to this restaurant not too long ago and Joy gave us the best service I have got ever. I highly recommend this place to everyone. The whole team was incredible.

Food was ok nothing to write home about. We sat down and drink order was taken right away. Two min later a different person gave us the drink list and tried to take our drink order. Two min after that a 3rd person did the same thing. Portions were VERY small but taste was good. Service was terrible! They seriously took our plates away as we were still eating--like fork in hand headed toward the mouth and they take the plate away. We went for lunch and the restaurant was very empty so this type of rushed service was unnecessary! Probably will never go back.

So disappointed. Not what I was hoping for. This was my very first experience at a celebrity chef restaurant. I had high hopes. The atmosphere was nice, homey touches here and there, nicely decorated, and cute touches like whisks for the light figures. My disappointment was with the food. I ordered the chicken Marsala on the advice of our server.  Unfortunately, my chicken was not properly trimmed, and had a large strip of fat on both pieces. In addition, the chicken was overcooked and chewy. (A patron at the next table had chicken rigatoni, and felt his chicken was overcooked as well). It seemed like the chicken breasts had been cooked earlier in the day and then reheated. The Marsala sauce did not have the sweet flavor you usually taste with Marsala, and tasted more like a simple brown sauce with very little flavor. The side pasta that came with the Marsala was well cooked, well seasoned, and quite tasty. My husband ordered the lasagne, as it was a "specialty" according to the server. The lasagne was fine, although not really any better than other Italian restaurants I have tried. It is heavy on the veal, and heavily seasoned with anise.  If you really like anise, it's definitely the lasagne for you. We ordered the famous lobster tail for dessert.  It was a very small portion for the price ($9 for a piece the size of a very small pear) and did not taste fresh. The cream filling was very good, but the pastry was very chewy and even hard to cut through.  On the plus side, the service was very good, and the focaccia before dinner was also very good.  I was just disappointed that the food was not better quality for the price.

Nothing special - it's like Maggiano's or Carmine's but not as good

Best parts are the service and the desserts
This place had a very modern homey feel, good menu selections, make sure to ask for the bread it was great.

Ate at Buddy V's for lunch yesterday. Ordered the calamari and Garlic bread for appetizer. The bread was crispy and cheesy, it was good. Calamari was big and the jalapeños in it gave it a nice flavor. My husband ordered the meatball sub. The meatballs were lacking a little flavor and I would have liked more cheese, but the sauce had good flavor and the roll it came on was soft. I ordered the chicken piccata. I really liked it. The chicken was pounded thin and the sauce was a little thick and it was the perfect mixture of lemon and capers. I LOVED the Italian birthday cake! It was vanilla cake with a chocolate filling and there was cannoli filling too. It was to die for. It was not overly sweet either and it's definitely big enough to share, but I wouldn't...;)

I don't even know how to explain how horrible service was. After being seated, we waited about 15 minutes for our server to take drink orders! He was hardly apologetic and to make matters worse, he was so rude while I asked him a few questions about the appetizers. 

After 45 minutes of ordering, we finally received our food. It was okay. Not worth the bad service. 

I have been to many restaurants and I have never felt so uncomfortable or treated so rudely from a server, ever.

I'm a huge fan of Buddy, Cake Boss so we tried his restaurant. Food was amazing! Portions are very small for their price. We ordered pasta, thought the serving was too small for $28. 

But you can never go wrong with their desserts. Really the best!!! Cannolis and lobster tails are scrumptious! Tried them in Vegas and New York.

Took the family for lunch as a Christmas treat. Service was good, especially friendly even with three small children including accommodating special requests. We tried the calamari, meatballs, Hoboken chopped salad, carbonara, kids Mac and Cheese and pizza. For dessert we had cannoli, nutella chocolate cake and Cheese & Cake. First, the Nutella Cake is insanely amazing! Everything else was very good as well. Honestly their kids Mac and Cheese was one of all our favorites! It should be available for adults. The meatballs were prefect. Loved the flavor combination of the chopped salad but my 19 year old daughter who likes things simple, thought it was too much. The cheese & Cake, a take on cheesecake was good not super sweet but definitely not the top choice of the three we got.
great service, great food, great experience, great ambiance, even general manger stopped by to say hello and check on us.

The wife and the children enjoyed this place. The ambience is chill with an open kitchen. Right across from it is Buddy V's bakery but didn't get a chance to try their pastries. The food was good. We ordered the calamari which is a very generous portion. It was fresh and tasty. The kids enjoyed their pizza and we ate the spaghetti bolognese. The sauce was to die for. For desert the Nutella cake with caramel salted ice cream was the finisher and we were in heaven. We went twice in 4 days. That should say something considering the options in Vegas.
It was well worth the wait. Incredible  food. The wait staff was incredibly friendly the food was homemade Italian like my grandmother used to make I am in heaven especially for here in Sin City

The hubs and I RARELY go out for Italian food. Why? Well, because we can make most of the dishes at home with high quality ingredients. Well, when I had some family in town, I suggested all of us going to Buddy V's only because :1. Pit stop at Carlo's Bakery; 2. It's easy for me to get back on the I-15 to head back to suburbia. 3. Italian food is always safe when entertaining guests.
Well, my cousins decided to day drink while waiting for me to get off of work, so by dinner time, they were fighting off a massive hangover. And it wasn't even 5 PM. Then they blew us off. 
The hubs and I decided to take advantage of our time together with our diva because we both had lobster tails from Carlo's Bakery on our mind. We figured, dinner was going to be a bonus, so I don't have to cook and clean, and we made the trek from suburbia to the Strip. 
We checked in for our reservation and was seated within a couple of minutes. When I made the reservation, I requested a table along the windows for the view. I noticed all the tables along the windows were designed for larger parties and I was prepared for them to seat us at a smaller table since our party decreased from 6 to 3. But no, they get a high five for seating our party of 3 at the  primo table that had a view of the Strip as well as a view of Carlo's Bakery so we can keep an eye on our number. 
Our server, was personable, just a tad slow. I'll take 'a tad slow' over crappy personality any day.
We ordered:
Kids Margharita Pizza
Grandma's meatballs
Caesar salad
Chicken Parmesan
Agnolotti

I enjoyed  everything that we ordered. I thought the pizza crust was outstanding; thin, crunch AND chewy, perfect amount of sauce and cheese. The meatballs were heavenly. The Caesar salad took us by surprise. When it arrived at the table, we thought the salad looked dry. But when we took our first bite, we understood why it looked like it was dry. It was one of the best Caesar salads I've ever had. It didn't need all that dressing because each bite had the perfect amount of acid, garlic, cheese and saltiness from the anchovies. The croutons were unique; I forgot to ask but I think it was made out of polenta. The croutons were perfect to dip with the meatballs. I had the Chicken Parmesan; it was good not great. MY hub's agnolottis were divine. Hand made, they were filled with veal shank, sausage and pork with a creamy, sage brown butter. The one complaint I had was I thought the agnolotti pastry was a tad thick but the flavors were very good. 
All together, we spend $113 with tip for 2 adults and a princess. A tad high for a family dinner, but overall, it was a great experience for us. Too bad my cousins were too drunk. But that's what you do in Vegas.

I have visited Vegas twice this month on business and had to eat at Buddy V's both times. I love the classic Jersey Italian dishes. I had the Chicken Piccata the first time. Skipped Appetizer and Salad since we didnt want to risk getting too full for dessert. Chicken was the perfect amount of Piccata. Dessert was the star of the night with the "Italian Birthday Cake". I consider this the perfect dessert. Beautifully presented on a signature chocolate signed plate and pedestal. The perfect balance of not too sweet and not too rich layers of rum soaked sponge cake and cream filling. Coffee was good too. 

Skip Maggianos Little Italy across the street and go to Buddy V's Instead. Far better quality and flavor.

I didn't know Cake Boss had a restaurant here and I actually found it through Instagram. My friend and I came on Saturday and we sat at the bar since it was happy hour. We ordered the sausage and pepper sliders, mac n cheese and Italian birthday cake. And we were very pleased with our order. The sliders tasted like what you would expect typical sausage and peppers, but tasty. Mac n cheese had chicken and veggies, which is more like a entree versus what most Americans think of it being a side dish.  Service was standard and considering we sat at the bar I've never had a bartender treat me poorly, but I must admit she was kind of awkward towards us. Lastly, the Italian birthday cake was really moist, but not dippy. I can't wait to come here again and try the Chicken Parmigiana, a customer next to us ordered this and it looked delicious. I highly recommend Buddy V's to anyone especially if you're at Venetian already.

Ordered their cannoli dessert since on Buddy's "Cake Boss" T.V. show, it's the best thing ever. Tried it, but it was very stale. I'll give it another try next time to taste their main dish to see if they're any good but the real reason why I'll be returning is their phenomenal service.
The food and staff here are fantastic! Some of the best Italian my wife and I have ever ate!

Wow!  What a fabulous meal we had last week. My husband and I are major foodies and have eaten at some of the best Italian places in the USA. We loved the best of course in Boston little Italy and Buddy Vs is as close as it gets.  I had the Osso Buco and my husband had the ravioli,  and both were amazing. We had to keep sharing with everybody at our table.  The only trouble we had was finding it.  It is on the second floor, but we kept asking for directions from everybody in the Venetian  and nobody could tell us.  Finally a drink server put her full tray of drinks down and went to a wall phone and got directions for us. You would think they would have training on directions in the hotel on how to get what you are looking for.  But it was definitely worth the navigating.  We will be coming back again!

Buddy V's Ristorante is a lovely place to go for home-style cooked Italian food.  The menu offers a variety of appetizers, salads, pasta, chicken, veal and seafood.  Last but not least, the cakes are insanely delicious- not surprising, seeing the restaurant is owned by the Cake Boss himself.  Do whatever you have to do to save room for dessert!

Our server brought us a tray of freshly baked focacia before the meal.  It was so fluffy and warm.  i could have eaten a whole tray myself!  My sister and her boyfriend shared some of their fried calamari appetizer.  It was great!

The cocktails were wonderful.  I tried my sister's martini called the Cake Boss- red velvet cake, chocolate liqueur and Bailey's.

The restaurant sadly did not offer any Alfredo entrees, which are typically my favorite, but my Chicken Piccata (breaded chicken cutlet in a white wine & butter sauce) was excellent!  The side of pasta was also very good.

I tried my mom's Eggplant Parmesan and was very impressed!  The food truly tasted like we were eating a homemade dinner at a family member's dining room table.

Even though we loved our meals, the best course of the meal was dessert.  I had trouble deciding what to order.  The Cannoli, Butterscotch Creme Brulee and Nutella Cake all sounded so good.  Our server recommended that I try the Italian Birthday Cake- Rum soaked sponge cake with cannoli filling, chocolate pastry cream and toasted almonds.  It was heavenly!

The restaurant's ambience is perfect for a nice family dinner.  It is beautifully decorated with a combination of vibrantly colorful kitchen items and upscale decor.  The restaurant has an energetic and happy atmosphere,  They commonly have upbeat live music playing, but at a reasonable level so you can hear the people at your table talking to you.

The service is also amazing.  The employees make you feel like old friends of theirs- definitely the ideal Italian kitchen.

We had the Roma Gnocchi, Mac & Cheese, Lasagna, and Cheese Ravioli. All were amazing! We sat in the bar area watching the game. Our server, Christian, was top notch! I'm talking Disney trained top notch. Had the Butterscotch Creme Brûlée for desert. It was to die for! So glad we came here to eat.

We enjoyed everything about this place!  We sat in there "outdoor" seating. It was freezing out when we were there so it was nice to pretend to be outside. While we were sitting their was a cute little skit/show. The bread and olive oil that came out was exceptional. The olive oil had a deep yellow-green color, there was no salt and pepper on our table. I would have liked to add a little for dipping. 
Chris ordered the pasta of the day, lasagna. SOOOO GOOD! The béchamel was layered thin with a great nutty flavor the sauce was light but flavorful and the cheese was gooie with small charred bubbles that still had their crunch when it got to our table. 
I ordered the charred octopus salad OH MY GOODNESS so so so so SO SO SO SO SO GOOD! I was a little iffy about the potato but I should have never doubted whoever made this salad lol. It was excellent.

Long review: First off let me start by saying this review is not about the food. The food is amazing. I've been coming here for 3 years in a row for my birthday and once for our anniversary and the food has not disappointed once. 
This is about their service. Like I stated I, with my family, having been here 3 years in a row and have received excellent service and food, until this last time in August. I originally called to reserve a table for 8 guests and a baby. I was later informed that one more person was to be added, so I called to see if I can get a bigger table. I was told I couldn't because it was a busy night for them, that maybe we could squeeze another chair, that was fine since it was for a kid. When we sat down there was so space for a car seat sling, my cousin's baby was on the floor behind her chair. The manager did not want to move us to a bigger table, which there were plenty of! The whole time we sat and ate and left there were bigger tables all around us! How is having a baby sitting in a car seat on the floor behind the chairs next to another table safe? We asked if this was a hazard or safe or a fire hazard and she kept saying no. We felt uncomfortable leaving him there (he was 2 months at the time) so my cousin had to hold him the whole time we dined. Then came time to pay. We could not do split. He la according to the waiter, the "computer" wouldn't let him. So we all wrote down our amounts and the card number on the back of the receipt. He then came back to say we were short. He was talking about the SUGGESTED gratuity. When then explained we would add gratuity when we signed the receipt. He said again that the "computer" would not let him because the total of the bill was the amount with the SUGGESTED gratuity includes. How is this even possible? My cousin tried arguing with him other wise but the waiter would not budge! He was determined to get his suggested gratuity. My cousin was getting rather upset so we budged and paid the total and walked away. Happy 30th to me! Sad to say that even though I LOVE the food here, this will no longer be my annual birthday dinner spot.

Well, we've been here the last three times we visited Vegas!  This place definitely hits the spot if you're looking for an Italian fix.  It's traditional Italian food.  I love the lasagna!  The cheesy garlic bread is delicious too :)

This is the first time I didn't bite into a tiny pice of rock in my clam linguine  The service was excellent. I would tell my friends who like to eat to come here.  Buddy's bakery is right across from the restaurant. Yum yum. .

Absolutely loved this place! It reminds me of family from the moment you walk in! Te atmosphere is remarkable. The decor blends perfectly with what Buddy stands for and who he is. The most memorable aspect would have to be the chandeliers. They had whisks handing from them as well. That shows creativity and passion. The food was amazing! The flavor profile was on point and we got to try the canolis. 

Overall  service was great,  the place was clean, the dishes were affordable, and the environment felt like home. Thanks Buddy for a great experience in Vegas!

Everything about this place is fantastic! I googled best chicken Parm in Vegas and this place popped up... It did not disappoint. We got a great view from our table looking towards the strip. The bread they give before the meal is good. Our food came out in under 5 minutes. It was some of the best Italian food I've ever had. It didn't hurt our waitress was amazingly good looking as well. Overall great experience and I'll definitely be going back again. I think my favorite part is that it is underrated and not a lot of people know about the place.

My husband and I, are locals, celebrated our anniversary there tonight and it was fantastic. It's a little piece of the Italian family we have back east, complete with Sunday Gravy---highly recommended!! Also they make their own mozzarella & ricotta (you'll want to make a meal out of those alone).

Food: A
Service: A
Ambiance: B
Price: A-
Layout: B+
Location: A


Sat in the bar lounge area. Host welcomed us in even with PBR tallboys in hand. Felt at home.
Ordered a pizza and calamari app.
Great calamari, excellent service.
Can't wait to try the other items on the menu.
Will definitely be back.

I went here on our last trip to Vegas. It was convenient because we were staying at the Venetian. The food was amazing!! So yum. I got the ravioli and it was amazing! I was trying to save some for later that night but ended up eating it all! I definitely want to go back and try the other meals. The only downside was the waiter wasn't as nice, a little rude.

Wow! What a gorgeous, cozy restaurant with beautiful views of the Las Vegas Strip! I absolutely ADORED the decor, from the lighting fixtures to the brick walls displaying real photos of Buddy Valasco's family, to the STUNNING open-air kitchen!! I just felt HAPPY being in engulfed in the ambiance of this restaurant! 

The staff was so friendly and the food was classic, comfort and delicious. (don't miss that salumi/cheese board! YUMMMMMM)

This will be the next place that I plan a big get-together because it is PERFECT for large parties. Can't say it enough... I LOVE it!!!!!!

My boyfriend and I were so looking forward to the food and the experience.  I will say it was very busy and we got right in to our table.  The wait staff is amazing!!! they were so attentive and they were never missing in action.  The lasagna was to die for and the portion was enough for 4 people.  If anyone is going there get the lasagna you will think you have died and gone to heaven.   For dessert we had the lobster claw with cream and berries again outstanding and enough for two people to share.  They also let you reserve on line. 

I would suggest that you take full advantage of that.  Some days are harder to get into the restaurant than others.  And online reservation makes it more convenient.    I would also suggest that you don't go home with out visiting Carlos Bakery which is located just across from the restaurant   I am going there again very soon and they also have a Happy Hour menu with lots of specials especially for all the locals.
Went a few weeks ago.  Just had an appetizer:  the Mac and cheese.  Made with fontina cheese, it was very rich and delicious.  Enjoyed it better than Yardhouse Mac & cheese.

In the Venetian, this place was so good, we ate there 2 out of a 6 night stay. Reasonably priced (1 drink, 1 appetizer, 2 main courses and 1 dessert for 97$ without tip), service was attentive, food was delicious and the cannoli's are fantastic! We had Chicken Parm and Chicken Marsala, both dishes tender and delicious. I would definitely go back if I ever get to Vegas again.

Made a reservation here because it was close to the theater where we were seeing a show.

We showed up 30 minutes late and they accommodated us and sat us quickly anyway.  Awesome!  Further, told the busboy that we had a show to catch and could he please tell the server we had to move fast.  Within 2 minutes, server appears to take our order to ensure that we could make our show.  Excellent!

Food:  
Garlic Bread:  Good
Buddy's Caprese:  Very Good
Chicken Rigatoni "Alla Vodka" :  Very Good
Valastro Sunday Gravy:  I did not try, but my husband claims it was Excellent.  In fact, he insists I write this in here because he wants to encourage others to eat it.  (He insists that others dip the Garlic Bread into the "Gravy".)

We had a bottle of Chianti and it was very good, as well.

Great service, great food and would definitely go again.  So thankful, they were so accommodating to our tight schedule!

Was expecting more from this dining experience. Had a charcuterie plate and they went with boring, everyday cheeses. Poor garnishments. Not what you'd expect for $19. My son had the Hoboken Cheesesteak and the meat was excessively greasy. He couldn't finish it without fear of gastrointestinal issues. I had the spaghetti with meatballs. It was good. Not great. Certainly not what I expected from a celebrity chef.
Great service, wonderful desserts. My veal osso Bucco was good, lasagna was great! Enjoyed our experience

The food was not bad here but definitely did not have that wow factor. Mostly just skip the spaghetti and meatballs, the meatballs were quite the let down :( the calamari is great and the shrimp scampi noodles were on point but the rest of our food (spaghetti and garlic bread appetizer) was just okay. Ambience is cute and servers were nice and on top of drink refills and checking on our table.

I went to Buddy's for the first time last week and I was very impressed! My mom and I shared Buddy's Favorite Pizza I believe was the name. And I actually think I fell in love. Everything about it was amazing. We actually shared with the random group next to us. The atmosphere is great! There is a fantastic view of the Strip. You can watch the cooks make meals which is fun for the kids! The service was also very good! The Assistant General Manager Adam was as nice as can be. The only problem is there isn't a Buddy's where I live!

I have eaten here twice so far this year and can't wait to come back in August. The veal parmesan is the best I have ever had. Appetizers and salad also great. I am always with a group and everyone always raves about the food. Good job guys.

Awesome Restaurant! You must get the Caesar Salad with the polenta croutons then get the appetizer of the polenta croutons to go. The service is always good and you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu.

Made lunch reservations while in Vegas! I was super excited to try Buddy's restaurant! The place was casual, not very busy and our table wasn't ready. Ok fine. We were seated and it took us 15 minutes before anyone came to us. Mind you it wasn't very busy. Finally, waitress came over and filled our glasses with water and took our order. We got our appetizer which was like breaded mozzarella, still no beverages. :/ we had to ask the bus boy for our drinks. I ordered lemon piccata, dh ordered chicken Parmesan. It was all decent, but the terribly slow service really ruined the whole experience. With so many better options I won't be returning.

Food and service here is great! Lunch prices are pretty decent and portions are more than enough for one person. Our server recommended some of their best dishes for our group and they were all delicious! The buddy pizza, lazagna, mozzarella appetizer, chicken BLT sandwich, YUM! :)

We've always loved watching Buddy V on TLC's Cake Boss.  While standing in line for Carlo's Bake Shop, we noticed that Buddy V's Ristorante looked like it had a great environment so we made reservations for dinner.  We couldn't have been happier.  The food had a true Italian flare to it.  I had the Chicken Parmesean & my wife had the Shrimp Scampi w/ Angel Hair pasta.  We'll definitely being paying Buddy V's a visit the next time we're in Vegas.

Our initial plan was to stop by Carlos' Bakery at Venetian, buy some cannoli and leave. However the line was kind of long and we decided just to have an early dinner at Buddy V's cross the hall and get the deserts at the restaurant.
