The hostess was courteous and the waitress was very nice. We ordered Calamari appetizer, clam linguini and mac & cheese. Linguini was al dente and kids liked the mac & cheese. But the deserts were the reason we stopped by. We ordered cannoli and lobster tail. Sure they did not disappoint, the cannoli's filling was fresh and crust was crispy. The lobster tail's skin was crunch and filling goes very well with the fresh fruits. 
The price was the average Las Vegas casino meal price and the overall it was pretty good dining experience.

Food was a 4 star but the service was a 3 at best. We used open table to book a reservation for 2 at 9pm about 30 min before we arrived on a Friday night but other people were walking in with no problems. Cheese Bread was good, lasagna was excellent, grilled chicken was good and Ceasar Salad was great. Other servers looked more engaged with their tables than out blonde waitress but maybe just luck of the draw. For $120 for 2 people before tip I'd rather go to Buchon.
This place is excellent!!! Last night I was craving Italian food and noticed this restaurant across the street from my hotel. I'm so glad we found it. The food was great and the service was awesome.

Buddy V's Ristorante is a lovely place to go for home-style cooked Italian food.  The menu offers a variety of appetizers, salads, pasta, chicken, veal and seafood.  Last but not least, the cakes are insanely delicious- not surprising, seeing the restaurant is owned by the Cake Boss himself.  Do whatever you have to do to save room for dessert!
The lasagna is very good, and you must try the Italian birthday cake.  It is expensive, but service was good.

This restaurant was just ok for me.  We went on a Saturday for lunch.  Service was ok, but not great. The food was ok, but nothing outstanding.  Finally, the prices were high for what was served.  Now for more detail. 

My husband and I both had salads.  I had the panzanella, which is mozzarella and grilled bread on a bed of greens.  The bread was wet and mushy.  The greens had way too much dressing.  The good news: the tomatoes and cucumbers in the salad were delicious.  

My husband got the Sicilian charred octopus. He said the octopus was nice.  The problem is, with so many outstanding restaurants close by, "nice" just doesn't make the grade.  

Sorry Buddy!

Was in Vegas for work and took the family with me. My daughter who is a huge Buddy fan wanted have dinner here. She is 10 and she loved it. The place is charming, very cute. The food was very good as well. Service was friendly and fast. I would definitely come here again if I am ever in Vegas again. If you are looking to have a nice dinner at a place that  is kid friendly, this is a good choice.

If I was on death row and got to choose a meal it would definitely be Buddy V's at the Venetian in Las Vegas.
OMG this meal was absolutely AMAZING! No I did not count calories or point. We started at the bar awaiting our table with sangria's and an app of meatball sliders. (We could have stopped there... but no we continued)
At the table we chose to go for the cheesy toasted garlic bread and the price fix "before show" meal. Michael chose the meatballs for an app, the  Orecchiette & Italian Sausage as an entrée and for dessert the cannoli and I chose the Caesar salad, the chicken Parmesan and for dessert Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake with chocolate sauce and hazelnut praline crunch with salted caramel ice cream and a cappuccino too.
We could have been rolled out the door we were soooo stuffed, but we chose to walk up the Las Vegas strip back to our hotel to "burn off some calories". I will definitely need to hit the hotel gym in the AM to work off this dinner.
But it was worth every bite and calorie.

Really lovely restaurant -- once you find it!  We asked four employees and most looked puzzled!  We eventually got there and settled in for happy hour -- which lasts till 6:30 pm. Great deal -- $4 wine/proseco/sangria and $5 appetizers.  We enjoyed the calamari, meatballs, and mac n cheese (it was delicious).

Headed to the front desk at 6 pm for our dinner reservation and they assigned us a table right outside the open kitchen hub.  When I requested something quieter?  She walked me back to the bar area!  First I was a little annoyed -- why did I make a reservation if I'm still in the bar?  But turns out it was for the best, a quiet window table in the bar area with a view of the strip.  Perfect.  We were able to order another round of happy hour drinks and their pre-theater menu for $38 pp!

Opting for light choices, we had the tomato soup, salmon, and cannoli.  Salmon was cooked perfectly and the cannoli was a perfect ending.

Both servers in the bar were EXCELLENT, friendly, and attentive.

Sadly, our only disappointment was the quality of the happy hour drinks.  The chardonnay was very dry, which is great for some people, but the big issue was the sulfites in the wines.  Really didn't enjoy the chardonnay or the proseco.

Otherwise, lovely restaurant with good food and great service!

Casual place. Smells are fantastic. We sat at a window and had a nice view of the strip. Eats okay. Had the veal marsala. I hate to say it, but it is true, this doesnt hold a candle to the same dish at Caraba's.

5 stars for the delicious food and the fantastic service I got!!! Its always nice to walk around the Venetian, but the location of this restaurant is quite strange to me, I thought it would be at the heart of Venetian.                                         But anyway I've heard of this place through a client of mine who went to the grand opening, I watch cake boss on tv all the time and I've been curious about this place so I had to check it out for myself.So the wait time for our table on a Saturday night was only 15 minutes, our waiter was great and the amazing client service we got was from our busboy Jamal. He was very attentive,efficient, and he just paid attention to everything. He should definitely get a promotion and a raise! Ok so now the review of the food. We started with a charred octopus (recommended by our waiter)as appetizer and it was seriously delicious, I love squid so this was perfect. For our drinks we got the brooklyn ipa and prosecco which went perfect with everything we ordered.For entreè we ordered Eggplant Parmesan with marinara pasta, Meatball Spaghetti and Garlic Bread on the side. Everything was so delicious. The garlic bread was a meal by itself. The portions here are huge, so you better go here with a huge appetite.And lastly we got the lobster tail and this was the cherry on top it was light,airy, and yummy! I'm very excited that the cake boss opened a restaurant in sin city! Now I don't have to drool all the time while watching him make amazing pastries on tv, I can just stop by Buddy V's ristorante instead! I will definitely go back because the experience and service I got was excellent.

The most uncomfortable, worst dining experience I've ever had. 

We (a group of 4) were seated in the "lounge" area near the bar because they didn't have any regular tables available. It was like sitting at a coffee table to eat dinner. Between that and the giant  LED screen outside the window blinding half of our party, it was quite uncomfortable. We were there a good 20 minutes before the waiter came to take our drink orders and it went downhill from there. 

The garlic bread was disgusting, and the chicken parm tasted like a frozen TV dinner. 

And that brings us to the service... Our waiter was the rudest server I have ever had. I was on a business trip and needed to have the checks split, which took him 3 tries and about 25 minutes to get right. Then, when he didn't bring me an itemized receipt (which I need for business trip expenses), I asked for one and the reaction I received was rolled eyes and gritted teeth. He did eventually bring it, but it was served with a lot of unnecessary attitude. 

I would give 0 stars if I could.

Peter made out night! What a great fun evening. The lasagna was AWESOME and I had 1/3 and shared the rest with the group. Grandma meatballs were way SALTY! My guess is that they sit in a bath of constantly evaporating liquid that just gets more and more salty.  We wanted to try famous desserts but were carb'd out after bowls of tasty pasta. Easy OpenTable reservation and to note is was Valentines day but we ate at 5pm.

We wanted to try dessert from Carlo's Bakery, but the line was extremely long.  Instead we decided to come to the restaurant which is across from the bakery. We sat in the lounge/bar area.  The desserts we had were the Buddy V's XL Lobster Tail (custard cream, flaky pastry shell, and seasonal fruit), and the Cannoli (cinnamon pastry, sweet ricotta cream, cocoa drops, pistachios).  LOVED the lobster tail!  If you're dining here, save room and share this incredible dessert!  I will come back for dinner the next time I'm in town.

Best value for lunch.  Appetizer, main corse and dessert for $22. For the Venetian or anywhere on the strip it was a great deal and very good food. I had Caesar salad, carbonara pasta and tiramisu - all great. My friend had salad, pizza and cannoli - again excellent.  Service was good also.

Had an early dinner here last weekend. The service was outstanding and the good was good too. The Focaccia bread they serve for their bread service was moist and flavorful. I took our server's suggestion and ordered the Chicken Parm dinner. The pasta was good but not great. The chicken however was cooked perfectly. I would certainly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a new place for Italian in Vegas.

As a Las Vegas local, I try to avoid the strip restaurants as much as possible.  They're usually over priced, and over crowded, but when I found myself at the Venetian with my wife and daughter, we swung into Buddy V's on a whim for lunch.  

My wife and I are typically appalled by kids menus because everything tends to be fried, or bathed in cheese; Buddy V's was no exception.  With that said, I ordered the kids chicken parm, however I requested the dish be with a grilled chicken breast, and no cheese. Our waitress gladly made the change, and my daughter loved the food. $12.00 for a kids meal is a little pricy, but it is the strip after all, and the food was a big hit with my daughter. I don't mind paying for quality.

The lunch menu is a little small, and I was wishing I'd looked at it before getting a table, I figured I'd just grab something with little expectation.  Big mistake! I ordered the adult chicken parm, and my wife had the chicken blt.  The pasta with the chicken parm was slightly al dente, and perfectly cooked. The chicken breading was crunchy with juicy chicken inside. 

My wife was a big fan of the thin piece of chicken that came on her sandwich, and the perfectly toasted bread.  The basil was fresh and tomato not mushy, another big hit.

I would have given a higher rating of not for the poor service.  Our waitress, Bethany, disappeared from our table for 20+ minutes. She took our order, and didn't come back until it we'd been finished eating for quite some time.  All in all, we'd come back for the food but the service needs some work. Out total bill was $57.62.
Fantastic food and service. The place has a nice atmosphere and a live band. When you step out of the restaurant you can smell the fresh cakes out of Carla's bakery

Love this joint! Carlos - why don't you open one of these in NJ? The Sunday sauce is to die for. Also loved  the shrimp scampi & the Nutella cake.  Thank you Peter (our waiter) for making the evening! You are the best!

A small group of us went to try this place out for dinner and overall we loved it! The food was good and so were the cocktails. I liked that the menu was kind of small because as it was I couldn't even decide what I wanted to eat, lol. I finally decided on the chicken Marsala and the sauce was yummy.. The noodles that were served with it were a little salty for my taste but I still liked the dish. We also had the pizza and spaghetti and meatballs, which they said it was good too... I recommend the calamari for a starter.

We've been here for dinner and Sunday brunch...we always forget the exact location of this place is: 2nd floor, walk towards Las Vegas Blvd side. The food here is ok and service is great. If the Carlos Bakery line across from here is crazy, you might as well eat here and order bakery items for dessert.

I like how they have "healthier' options here. The portions are perfect - which means, if you're starving or have hug appetite, you'll be hungry if you eat just 1 entree.

***DINNER***

Roasted Sea Bass:
Branzino with cured lemon, arugula salad and pine nuts.This was just ok. 3/5

Italian Greens:
Tuscan kale, plum tomatoes in garlic oil. Tasty but a little too oily. 2/5

Caramelized Sea Scallops:
Perfectly seared scallops with crispy prosciutto, parmesan polenta in tomato vinaigrette. 3.5/5

Seared Salmon:
Crisp salmon with charred broccolini, pickled vegetables in balsamic reduction. 4/5



***BUFFET BRUNCH***
Muffins, croissants, pan au chocolat, bacon, ham, sausage, scrambled eggs, French toast, crepes, nutella, jams/preserves, mascarpone, chicken parmesan, meatballs, orochiette with sausage, mac n cheese, salad, veggie frittata, garlic bread, tiramisu, cannoli, bread pudding, zeppole, red velvet cake, cookies, etc.

It's a pretty good spread. Definitely get the French toast, meatballs, mac n cheese and veggie frittata. I drizzled Nutella on my French toast....mmmmm...however, I don't think I got my $35 worth.

Finally made it to my 200th review!!  I decided to use this special spot for a review on one of the best plates of spaghetti I've ever had, EVER! Hubby and I had been excited to visit Buddy V's since the construction announcement. We are big fans of Buddy's so we were curious to see what his restaurant would have to offer. 

This restaurant is located in the Grand Canal Shops. I'll give you a shortcut - if you enter from the side Walgreens is on, just go upstairs and you'll see the signage. Go in through the glass doors for the shops area and you're there. No need to go through the entire casino. His bakery is right across the hall. 

Hubby and I decided beforehand that we were going to split the Chicken Parmesan and split a Lobster Tail for dessert. We got a great seat over by the window in the main dining area. The entire restaurant is decorated really cute, and I loved the family photos. Service was attentive but only by our waiter's helper - our waiter took our order then went missing until time for the check. The assistant was great, he deserved all of the tip but I doubt it ended up that way. 

Chicken Parmesan was huge, definitely big enough to share. We each got a chicken breast and a large portion of spaghetti so I'm glad we split it. The spaghetti sauce was amazing, I'm still dreaming about it. Noodles were cooked perfectly. Chicken was cooked nicely, no complaints about the meal at all. Our Lobster Tail was a little hard though, like it was either over cooked or a few days old. Not flakey in a good way, more like shards of hard bread. And the pastry cream tasted like whipped cream, not what I was expecting for the price. We'll definitely be back but only for the Chicken Parm. Might try a different dessert next time.

We came by earlier on a Friday night after we got off our flight. We thought this was just going to be a touristy spot with mediocre food off the Vegas strip... and we were delightfully mistaken. The food was actually great. The calamari was fantastic, and the Salmon was terrific. Our server and bus boy were all super friendly and very fast accommodating us. The prices weren't terribly expensive either, so overall it was a surprisingly great experience! Others have mentioned to make a reservation, and I'd recommend that! I think we got lucky to be able to walk in. Either way, great place to eat if you're nearby!

I'm sorry,  a restaurant of this calibre and it ran out of honey to serve with tea....  Unacceptable.  Oh yes,  I forgot to mention that no milk was served with coffee... It had to be asked for after trying to hunt down the server.. 

Although this may seem like a small thing the attitude of the server goes a far way to contribute to the star rating given. 

The whole experience was marred with slow service,  inefficiency and smacked of a back street joint rather than the upmarket restaurant it is supposed to be. 

Guys it is the small things that that matter,  big name but small on performance....  Won't be back!

Indulgent Italian fare that hit the spot for our family celebration feast! My sister got married in Vegas and we choose this place for our reception, so to speak, and had a fantastic time. The food was amazing with huge portions. The apps we all shared included the meatballs  (EXCELLENT! And I know my meatballs lol), calamari and the focaccia. Everything came out at the same time (bravo!) and we had wine chilling next to the head of the table.

The chicken parm was just like home and was so good after trying it someone else had to have it as well and changed their order. Definitely one of the best things on the menu. There's a great deal where for a set price you get an app, soup/salad, meal and dessert: WORTH IT. I enjoyed my carbonara pasta: SO much flavor. 

You could take home leftovers, but you'll just eat them at 4am without regret and it'll still taste good!

My husband & I came here for dinner, they sat us by the window, which had awesome view of the  strip. Our waitress was pretty good, knowledge of the menu. Started with the calamari, which was good & soft. Then I had nonna 's lasagna, so good & cheesy. I would go back again.

We went at prime time for dinner. The place was so full we had to wait 45 minutes for a table.

Once we were seated though the place was great. Service was good though a bit slow at times, the waiter was really passionate about the food and was able to recommend several options for my parents who don't normally eat Italian. 

We ordered the osso buco, the shrimp scampi, and the gravy with rigatoni. All the food came out hot, and parmesan was very quick to be offered.

The food tasted great. Like the waiter said, the osso buco literally fell off the bone, I didn't need the knife at all. It was a bit oily, but otherwise very good. The polenta it was served with was creamy and well seasoned. I felt some vegetables/salad would have gone down nicely, but it was very good overall.

The shrimp scampi tasted very good, but the pasta seemed slightly overcooked (by maybe half a minute) and the sauce a little scarce. Flavour wise it was brilliant. 

The gravy was probably the least impressive in my opinion, the sauce just needed something extra in terms of flavour to really make the meat stand out.

Portion sizes were generous, originally we were keen for dessert or a visit to the cake store just opposite, but it was a bit too much. 

Overall it was a very good meal and one of the few decent Italian places I've been to in Vegas or anywhere else and it shows in how busy they were, but it seemed slightly let down by some small details.

Bad experience.  They put a single diner in a corner table. No server ever showed up.  The place wasn't busy but they just kept walking past the table.  No one cared until I left. 
The bakery is busy but the restaurant needs some work.

I came back for the croutons...wait, what? You read that right. Croutons. The little, dried-up bread scraps on salads. I ordered a Caesar salad to start with before my entree, completely unaware of the discovery I was about to make. When my salad arrived, I was immediately intrigued by the croutons - they were unlike any I had ever seen. These croutons were perfect, one-inch square cubes, caramelized to a perfect golden brown on the outside. Biting into one, I discovered a filling of warm polenta - also known as grits in some parts. It was apparent that these croutons had just come out of the oven, and they were HEAVENLY! I wished I could  have ordered a whole plate of them - they were that good. The rest of my experience at Buddy V's was outstanding - the main course, the service, the ambience were all great. It was those croutons, however, that brought me back for dinner the next two nights in a row.

UPDATE: I stopped in for lunch on a Thursday with the family. They had a three-course lunch special. I started off with a Caesar Salad with those heavenly polenta croutons...WOW. My main course was the Chicken Parm, which was delicious. An order of Tiramisu and a cup of coffee was the perfect finish. The service and atmosphere were impeccable. I may have discovered one of the world's best Italian restaurants. I will not miss an opportunity to return!

Had the $22 three-course prix fixe, "express lunch." Started with the panzanella, and it was amazing. This place probably has the best croutons in the world. Next time I go, I might just ask for a side of croutons with my salad because WOW. Because I split our main courses with someone else, I got to try both the Bucatini Carbonara and the Spaghetti Bolognese. I personally preferred the Carbonara, because I thought the sauce had struck the perfect balance and the noodles were great, but the other person slightly preferred the Bolognese. Moral of the story: both were excellent. We finished with cannoli and tiramisu. Both were, as you could have guessed, fantastic. Moreover, the servers were very friendly and we felt that they paced the meal perfectly. I can't wait to go back.  However, before you do, make sure to call and ask if the prixe fixe is on the menu that day because, when we first arrived, even though it was a Thursday at noon, the waiter said that he had to check.

UPDATE: I came back, and learned that we are not limited to their packaged breadsticks for lunch. Instead, they have (free) focaccia bread. All you have to do is ask for it, and then someone will come around with a big pan of focaccia bread. Make sure to ask for the olive oil and vinegar too!!

Lunch leaves a lot to be desired. Service was very slow and not friendly.  Lunch menu has nothing really on it. My chicken was cold and salad was drowned in dressing. I couldn't even eat it. I was very disappointed and out seventy five dollars.

A wonderful meal!  We chose to go with the family style and allowed them to bring us the selection.  Worth it.  I would go back just to have more of the marinara sauce.  Everything was amazing.  Great experience.

Buddy only knows cakes and cannoli's right? Wrong! We had a great time at Buddy V's. The food was excellent and it was a really fun environment!

My wife had the egg plant parmesan for the first time and loved it! I had the Capellini shrimp scampi.

We loved it all. Even hit Carlo's Bakery on the way out. Fun night!

We had a reservation there a few weeks ago and were seated right away.  Service was attentive -at first. We got our drinks, went straight to the entrée. After that, our server wasn't very present. The chicken Marsala was pretty good; however, the pasta carbonara was very rich. My friend ordered it and I felt overwhelmed after two bites. Dessert was wonderful -we got the lobster tail and it was decadent. Great flavor and texture. The pit of night was when our waitress, Kacey, dropped the bill and told us the gratuity was already added so all we had to do was pay the total noted at the bottom. 
  The problem there was that we were a party of 3. We looked at the bill and printed directly on there was something along the lines of:
"No gratuity has been added to your bill. For your convenience, here are some preset gratuity amounts, just circle the one you'd like to apply.
- 15%
- 18%
- 20%
- 22%"

Kacey had circled the 20% option and wrote the new total at the bottom because I guess she thought that that was what she deserved. After she dropped the bill, we noticed she was constantly circling our table, waiting for us to provide a method of payment. We were a party of 3 and even though we are young (early 20s) we know how to tip. It was pretty insulting. I get it, you work in the heart of Vegas where many international visitors aren't aware of the customs. But that doesn't mean assume everybody is like that. After talking it over amongst ourselves, I got her attention and pointed out what the receipt stated and said that if it says that, then the gratuity amount should really be up to our discretion. She tried to cover it all up by saying something like, "Oh, that was just a suggested amount, if it's that big of a deal I can just take it off." And she ripped off the bottom of the check. 
  I've worked in the restaurant industry and servers face heavy disciplinary action for that type of behavior. We still left a tip but the whole ordeal really just left a bad taste in our mouths.
Great food. Great service. Excellence at its best. The Assistant General Manager Adam Margolies was very professional and made my daughter's 12th birthday a very special occasion. Highly recommended

The ambience and staff made our dinner memorable. We arrived a bit early for our reservation and they were able to seat us in no time. Since it was obvious that we were going to be seated at the bar section, Kelly reminded me that bars likely do not allow minors in their section since Katharine is only 17 so I informed the hostess. She apologized and asked us to return to the front for reassignment. For the next 10 minutes three other similar sized parties are seated ahead of us. We end up sitting in a table next to the waiters' cashier station. Not much of an issue since we were still towards the front of the restaurant. We open two of the three menus and the entrée pages are missing. Kelly walks over to the hostess station to show them this and picks up new menus. This slight hiccup at the beginning of the evening would've been disastrous for most establishment but Buddy V's made up and bent backwards to ensure our satisfaction. GM Christopher and his manager kept checking on us to make sure we were ok. We ordered the Caprese to start and had the Shrimp Scampi, Spaghetti and Meatballs, and Spaghetti Bolognese. All fantastic! We finished with the Apple Pie topped with a scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream. They do a really good job with their food. If you ever get the chance to visit one of their restaurants, it is well worth it!

Stayed at The Venetian and made a reservation for 5:15pm on Saturday night.  When we were to be seated, the hostess tried to sit us right opposite the open kitchen, which is brightly lit, noisy, steamy and certainly not where we wanted to be. She then went back to see where else we sit and we got a table for 2 in the bar. The food was good. Foccacia was warm and they offered oil and vinegar as well as butter. We found the service was fast, maybe a bit too fast.  Maybe Saturday night is a busy one,and they try to move their diners along. We had the beef medallion, $38, cooked a little too rare for medium, but it was tasty. The mashed potatoes and sauteed spinach that it was placed on, could have been a bit more generous. Very skimpy on those portions. We also had the price fixed dinner for $38, which gave you choices. We had: Grandma's meatballs, chicken parm with spaghetti and they were tasty but they skimped on the sauce so although it was good, it could have been better. The chicken parm was very crispy and tender but the spaghetti was a bit dry. The meatballs had a nice portion of sauce served with them, so we should have kept that dish, just for the leftover sauce. The desserts you could choose was a cannoli or a Nutella cake with salted carmel ice cream.  Nah...didn't appeal to us, but we were told you couldn't substitute from that menu.  Really?  I can understand the entrees but the desserts? We were told that they had a 'full dessert menu' but our waitress never offered to show it to us. Carlo's Bakery is right across the hall from the restaurant, but by the time our meal was done, so were we. There was quite a long line waiting to get into the bakery, and it wasn't moving very quickly.  What we did notice, was that when you go to sit at the bar, there are 2 steps up, and there is no handrail in the middle of this wide expanse. We saw two patrons stumble, and one of the waiters actually took a flat out fall. We may go back to give Buddy V's another try and since we now know the lay of the land, so to speak, we will be specific about where we want to be seated, and will order with a request for "additional sauce on the side". I'm from Jersey City NJ originally, so come on, Buddy, take a little constructive criticism to heart, from a neighbor who loves ya'!  :-)

2 stars based on decor alone. Everything else was really unsatisfactory.  We were seated at a dirty table with napkins, a receipt and straws on the sticky floor. The hostess grabbed a towel and wiped it off but not entirely.  Still sticky and gross. We ignored that but the wobbly table was obnoxious. The server came over and ignored the garbage at her feet so I pointed it out and asked for something to even out the table. The busser brought by our share plates and mine had a nice long hair attached to it under my napkin. We ordered the garlic bread and meatballs. The garlic bread wad just that. Simple, not exciting, garlic bread, and the meatballs were very dence. We are both Italians and they weren't the soft flavorful moist meatballs we were use to. Just dence and dry. The sauce wasn't memorable either. The wine was fine, but we were just kind of turned off by then. I asked for the bill and got the wrong one. All together I really don't think we'd be back.

Such a great restaurant! Great vibe, great food and even better people! The food was fresh and incredible! Especially the croutons! The wine selection is great. Service is great. And to top it off, we got to meet the Cake Boss himself.

Cake Boss Restraunt? Really?!? Yes. Bunt cake tins and rolling pins decoration. Not bad. They even got a good Dogfish IPA on tap!! Yay!!!! 
Pasta aldente. Look. I'm not Italian but I consider this home cooking by any standard.  I had the veal. Good stuff. 
Pricey but you are in the canal shops (whatever).
Service great! I'll come back!

This place was awesome. We went about 4pm and had the sunset menu which had enough choices for us. Has the fried mozzarella appetizer which was different from normal mozzarella this had so many flavors going on. It was really good. Kids portions were big but also 12.00 a piece. Husband had chicken parm said it was good and had lots of flavors going on as well. Chicken was not dry. Had the Caesar salad was saving room for dessert. Salad was good and just the right amount. Desserts are awesome. Must have is the tiramisu the lady fingers are on the side and you dip them in the mason jar of stuff. My daughter had the apple pie it was ok not too sweet came with vanilla ice cream. Would have liked a little warmer. If your in the area would definitely try it.

Not bad for on the Strip, but far from the best Italian you can get within the Strip, let alone the Venetian/Palazzo - where Buddy V's can be found.  

It's in a great spot on the Strip with some killer views of Las Vegas Blvd.  At night though prepare to be blinded by video screens that are within close proximity of the restaurant.  As far as food goes...We went fairly straightforward with our dining choices. 

Grilled Garlic Bread - We did this because you are not served complimentary bread,  
Bucatini Carbonara - Probably the best thing we had to eat out of our 3 dishes.  Pretty good flavor and the pasta was al dente.  
Chicken Marsala - This was just very meh.  Not much flavor going on, but at least they give you a decent sized portion.  

Buddy V's fits a 3 star rating perfectly.  It's not the cheapest place, but it's also not the most expensive.  It's not the best, but it's not the worst.  As long as you know this going in, you will have a pleasant dining experience.

From beginning to end, the food and service was amazing. The live band was good as well. The Caesar salad was great! The croutons were hot and soft...and so good. Definitely coming back here in the future.

It's ok. Had lasagne and it was better than any franchise. But pieros is still the best Italian food and this didn't come close. My blend-wine was the best I've had since being on this trip out to Vegas. Service was decent. Piano player/singer was everything!!! Loved it :))
Outstanding from start to finish. Caprese salad was great. The gravy dish was loaded with veal, meatballs and sausage. And the best part, the desserts!

Came in for the happy hour specials and a drink or two... Loved the grandma'a meatballs!!! And would go back just for that.. We got Mac & cheese, ricotta cheese, and the calamari.. Also a cannoli... The food was great and the service was awesome..

I do not like being cheated out of my money, and sadly, guys, that's exactly what they did to me here. This is the first time I have stopped by in years after claiming they have the best tiramisu. It was so HUGE. And now.....it comes in a mini mason jar. 

I understand businesses have to make money, but some dishes and desserts have become painfully small and remained at expensive prices, which is just plain sad. 

Furthermore, they try to trick you into paying for water now. Instead of offering tap water like they used to, they get rid of the option in their speech. 
--SO if you DON'T want to pay for nestle water, and they say "Still or Sparkling?"...SAY TAP. Don't pay for water unless you really want to. Because that is just a damn waste of $10 folks. 

They never used to trick me before, so I was totally not expecting this. I can't even rate them like I normally do, because I was so mad. 

The big points are: 
1) Their food is just average, so just skip it. 
2) The dessert is the better part of the meal, so if you want some, just go to Carlo's Bakery. 
3) They do have really good service, but they tricked me, so that was a little messed up since they didn't used to do that. It's totally what you expect restaurants that serve $80 per head to do. If you're going to do that, can't you at least do it during the more expensive dinner time?

I'm pretty mad, so it'll be a while when I come back, if ever.

Not gonna lie the cake boss annoys the crap out of me but we decided to try this restaurant for a few reasons: proximity to our hotel, cuisine, and price point. Well, everything was delicious and service was outstanding! Highly recommend for Italian comfort food (red sauce menu) that won't cost a fortune. Bartender was so nice and attentive, we decided to eat at the bar instead of wait for our table. Enjoyed this meal much more than the $$$$ dinner we had the night before.
The best chicken parm there is! And their cannolis are so delicious. You must eat here in Vegas!

My husband and I had brunch on Sunday and it was one of the best brunches we have ever been to in Vegas.  The brunch price was fair $32.95 and then for $14.95 you could have unlimited mix and match drinks from a good selection of adult beverages.

The brunch had quite a few items from the menu and everything was exceptional.

Also the wait staff were really fantastic.  Everyone was friendly and ready  to help in any way.  Dirty plates were removed quickly.

We live in Henderson so we don't usually go to the strip but we will be going back to brunch in the near future.

A friend who also travels often to Las Vegas asked me to do one thing on this visit...and that was visit Buddy V's and just sit at the bar for minimum one drink.

Everything she said about the bar was accurate: Comfortable, great view of The Strip and really friendly employees.

Honestly, it was not easy to find this place and I know my way around The Venetian as a longtime fan of Grand Lux Cafe and that casino floor where I once played blackjack with 90210 hottie Lindsay Price.

My bartender at Buddy V's was a tremendously nice guy named Mike and he poured me a strong vodka cocktail.

The entire place just smelled too good to not at least look at the menu while sipping so Mike steered me right in a modest order of Grandma's Meatballs with some delicious bread that was exactly the right amount of food.

This simply was not your typical Vegas bar or restaurant experience...and that's why I will be back on my next visit.

Oh, and the place has some nice windows that overlook The Strip and a few tables are right against these windows if you want to just eat, drink and take it all in.

Buddy V's wasn't too loud, wasn't too snobby, wasn't too busy and wasn't too expensive either.

Maybe the fact that it is not easy to find is a good thing for those of us who already know about it.

This place surprised us with how good it was. We just shared a ton of appetizers between 4 of us-salumi & cheese board,  mozzarella carozza and meatballs. The sauce was out of this world and the mozzarella carozza was all around amazing, to the point that even as full as we were I couldn't let any be left over. I hear they have a great happy hour which unfortunately timing wise we missed. This was definitely a winner and would be interested to try some of the actual entrees and pizza/pasta.

The food here is delicious and the service is 5 star. Very friendly and enjoyable atmosphere. Christian was the best server. We will be back on our next trip to Vegas.  Great location across from Carlo's Bakery.

Staying at the Venetian and craved Italian without breaking the bank. Found Buddy V's thanks to yelp! Never watched Cake Boss, so didn't know anything about the celebrity status of the chef. We didn't have reservations and tried to get a table around 6:45pm on a Saturday for 2 people. Apparently there was a private event so they couldn't seat us til after 9pm, but luckily there was a table at the bar, so we took that. The bar is a bit noisier than the restaurant, but totally worth it to not wait. Before 7pm, they have a 3 course menu  for $38 which includes an appetizer, entree, and dessert. 

Loved the moist and soft Grandma's Meatball appetizer. You only get 3 and they are half dollar sized. For my entree, I got the bolognese. Absolutely delicious and extreme chunky sauce. I also loved the fact that they were very generous w/the sauce so that I actually had plenty of sauce for my pasta! Even had some sauce left over to dip a piece of bread! Got the nutella dessert and thought that it was a tad sweet. Very decadent, but just a tad sweet.

My mother and I came here for the Sunday Brunch Buffet. Everything was amazing! From the fresh made crossants, to the chicken Parmesan and all the yummy desserts! We will definately be coming here again.

We were so excited about eating here, and the food was excellent.  I can't give it a higher rating because the service was absolutely terrible.  We were seated in about 10 minutes during lunch hour (1240ish).  We were seated at a table overlooking the strip (great) in the bar area (no problem).  The problem was that our waitress was the bartender, and despite only having one or two people at the bar the whole time we were there, it took ages to get anything done, including ordering drinks, our meal, dessert, etc.  It took almost 2 hours to have an app, a split meal, and a dessert.  The hardest working person in there was the busier, who was busting his butt the entire time!  He deserves a raise. :)

My mom and I went in here tonight around 7. The hostess was very polite and seated us right away. We sat ignored at our table for over 20 minutes, we were never even offered water. We finally left and found another place to eat. Very disappointing, we were excited to eat there and the food looked delicious.

I will let you know up front I usually do not like celebrity restaurants because they are overhyped and don't seem to deliver value for the price.  There are a few exceptions to this rule and Buddy V's is one of them for the following reasons.

1) As celebrity restaurants go, Buddy V's doesn't try to be trendy, rather it sticks to rustic italian fare and is very successful at it.
2) Pricing is actually more on the reasonable side than ultra expensive.  For $38.00 you can get a fixed price meal of an appetizer, entree and desert.  I had the Grandma's meatballs which were incredible, light fluffy balls of flavor in a red sauce; a pasta dish consisting of Bucatini, a thin tube spaghetti with pancetta black pepper and egg(this was my favorite dish of the night and is worth going back for more), and closed the night with nutella cake which was delicious.  Everyone at the table enjoyed their meals.
3) The service is fantastic. The waiter was very knowledgeable, guiding us with knowledge of all the dishes on the menu and providing prompt drink service and bread service. 

All in all a great experience for the simple Italian cooking.
Amazing food!!! I ordered off the kids menu, Alfredo and mushrooms with chicken parm. OMG I didn't even eat half, SO RICH.

I give this place a two star because of the following 


1- this message is to the manager: there are ridiculously less amount of staff working in the restaurant,  i was waiting forever to get the check and i had to literally ask for everything. My water was not getting refilled and easily 30 min of our time got wasted for lack of management.

If you want customers to come back hire more staff and be professional, you also impact the poor staff by getting less tip and more work load.

When someone comes to your restaurant expects great experience


2- the food was good but there was so much fat in the chicken... 


The reason i give it a two star is because of friendly staff. I wont go back to this restaurant again.

The food was okay( something you can get at a regular Italian restaurant), the service was amazing, very friendly. Me and my husband were celebrating our one year anniversary and a day that special I would of prefer spending it some where, where they don't take your plate when your not finish. It was a Sunday and not that busy but it was like they were trying to kick you out. Not the best experience, never coming here again!

Great for lunch. Hubby had meatball sandwich and diet Pepsi, I had the Hoboken cheesesteak sandwich and a Brooklyn summer ale. Both sandwiches came with fries, which they top with a little bit of shredded cheese. Hubby didn't want cheese on the sandwich or fries.... Orders came out perfect. Sandwiches are large enough to share. Service was a good. Water refilled often, free refills on soda. Cute decor. Would definitely return when visiting Vegas again. Thanks Buddy V for the real homemade Italian food!!!
The customer service is excellent. Our waiter was very attentive. The food is super good. The experience was so worth it.

One of the best birthday dinners, ever. The server and busser were so attentive, they could not have been more wonderful. In addition, the food was incredible. Homemade ravioli, yum. Oh and obviously, you're not allowed to not have dessert there :) Thank you. Delizioso!

Sorry, I couldn't tell you about the food since we didn't get that far....

 Buddy might make this food for his family, but not allowing them to sit until the entire party is present is rude!!  I fully understand when it is busy, but there were so many open tables it was almost alarming.    We asked both the hostess and the manager (both rude and short) if we could sit and have a drink and we were told no, but you can go to the bar and get a drink.  Since a few of us worked in the industry, we understand the policy when it is busy, but when it is not I would think a good manager would make the right decision.  We felt like Greg Focker in Meet the Parents when he wanted to board the plane. 

That's OK, Canaletto happily sat us (they were slammed btw) and enjoyed taking our $250 lunch tab along with the 2 additional friends who came when we were finished of our referral.
The food was great and the friendly service even better. Thanks to Caleb, Rasberry, Adam, and chef Bryan Forgione for making our dinner for six a fantastic memory.

We had dinner at Buddy Vs with a group of 8 and it was amazing!!!!! We did the Imperial family style tasting... I think that's what it was called. They brought out a tasting of all their specialty items from start to "sweet" finish and it was unbelievable!!!!! Now to the best part which is hard to almost impossible to find in Vegas.. SERVICE!!!!!! Our waiter Giorgio was probably the most incredible waiter I have EVER encountered in all my 40 years of dining 3 to 5 times a week. Astounding and personable, funny stories were shared between him and all my clients and he single handedly made the night... one of my potential clients enjoyed the evening so much he whispered on the way out that anybody that has great taste in dining establishments like Buddy Vs is someone he can see himself in business with.. THANKS GIORGIO!!!!!!!! See you next time in Vegas for sure!! A must visit!
The food... Eh, what your paying for is the view and the establishment... Drinks are over priced as well as the food. But it is a place for big groups with $ to spend

One of the best places for a lasagne on the strip! This place was honestly not the first place we had picked to go for dinner that day, but some how we ended up there and we were not disappointed! The service to begin with is AMAZING. Our server told us that one lasagne would be good for the 3 of us, but we were being naive and didn't want to believe it. So we got 3 lasagnes, because of the high praise from the other staff as well. Our server was not joking, that lasagne is one plate you might never finish in one sitting. All three of us finished only about a quarter of our lasagnes before we were stuffed to our eye balls. We literally couldn't move. But it was so delicious, form the sauce to the meat and the cheese! They also make fantastic drinks and offer great insight on the various dishes. The restaurant offers great views, and even though we didn't get to try it, we heard the high praise of their cheese cake!

TLDR: Get one lasagne for 3 people, you will all be stuffed!

Had a fabulous evening at Buddy V's last night. Sat in the bar with my husband and enjoyed the meatballs, caprese salad, shrimp scampi pasta and lasagna. We got all the food at once so we could have a little bit of everything at once. 
Everything was cooked to perfection and OMG the mozzarella was amazing. 
Definitely worth a visit if you like Italian cooking!

Truly impressive restaurant with Strip view. 
I've been coming to Buddy Vs for a few years now. No weekend trip to Vegas has been complete for me without Sunday brunch here. Their Bruch buffet features high quality breakfast and lunch dishes, fresh premium fruits, cheese, Italian cold cuts and best of all: the desert bar. The service has always been good and the overall value is reasonable for a major resort Strip front restaurant. 
Today I came for regular lunch. We ordered the salami and cheese platter, spaghetti Bolognese and tiramisu. As always, the food was outstanding. The three cheeses and three meats were of the finest quality and paired with freshly open-fire grilled garlic butter feloni bread. The Bolognese, while a simple dish, has always been one of our favorites here, as they do it perfectly. Saving the best for last, the tiramisu by itself is worth coming here for (and it's served as part of the Sunday brunch buffet as well !!). I also loved their new coffee from Fonte, which is a perfect pair with the tiramisu. 
The weeks before Christmas are always slow, so we were able to get a table by the window with excellent Strip view. Danny did an outstanding job taking care of us and making this a truly enjoyable lunch at one of my favorite restaurants.

Went here with my wife during our anniversary trip to Vegas. I have nothing bad to say about this place. It's not necessarily a romantic atmosphere but that's just Vegas in general. Doesn't matter where you go, there's always someone in shorts and a crappy t-shirt and flip-flops. Having said that, we still managed to have enjoy a nice romantic evening. The waiter was great. The chicken parm was great, the corozza was great, the lobster tails and Italian birthday cake were of course great. And just because I needed to try the tiramisu, we came back a few days later. And of course, that was great too. Nice touch with a little bit of chocolate cake in the bottom. I liked that the place wasn't overly crowded and we could go and sit down pretty much whenever. It was certainly one of the highpoints of our trip and I very much look forward to going back. And next time, I'll look forward to stopping into the Carlos Bakery shop opening up just next door. I know some complained about the pricing. I would argue that once again, that's just Vegas. Cocktails cost pretty much $14 wherever you go, unless you're sitting at the slots, and restaurant food is pretty much always $20+ for entrees. That's just the way it is.

Can't for the life in me figure out how this place has eeked out 4 stars. I give it 1. 

Ate here for lunch. Very limited menu at lunch. We ordered the carbonara bucatini for $23 a plate. Next to no sauce and only a few chunks of pancetta. Had to flag down the waiter and order more sauce. "Garlic" bread appetizer came as 3 slices of dried out cheese bread with I swear not an ounce of garlic taste to it. The next table to us ordered garlic bread also and got 4 slices; not that I WANTED more but really.....


Place looks nice and clean however.

First time here at the Cake Boss' restaurant. Quiet Monday so the place was not crowded. We were seated tight away in a nice circular booth with a great view of the Wynn.

Our waitress was very helpful and went over the menu with us and brought us some hot bread while we made up our minds on what to order.

We ordered the Shrimp Scampi and the V. Family Sunday Gravy. Delicious! The best Italian food and good value for the money.

In addition to the restaurant, there is a bar and a bakery for take out desserts.

Overall a five star experience...
This place was amazing the food was so good! Sunday gravy was the best Italian dish I've ever had and I'm from Chicago we are known for the best food! I recommend coming here . Grazie

I guess I missed the part of the show where Buddy went to Vegas to start a restaurant??  I'm a huge fan who occasionally watches episodes of Cake Boss and dreams about going to Hoboken to taste his food.  So when I heard about Buddy V's Ristorante during this recent birthday trip, my heart skipped a beat and I told my husband we HAD TO go!

From the outside, the charming decor mimicked that of a quaint cafe nestled in the corner of somewhere in Italy (or so I'd think, since I've never been).  It drew me in!  I love how it felt homey yet upscale inside.  We had a reservation and were seated promptly.  Our food took a while to arrive but the taste more than made up for it!  I ordered Nonna's Lasagna.  Oh my!  It was as if I've never had lasagna before!  There were so many layers with meat and cheese that just melt on your tongue.  That good!  I wished my stomach were bigger just so I could have more of that lasagne.  It was a very generously portioned dish.  My husband ordered Mama's Style Chicken.  He loved his dish too!  

Oh and don't get me started on the dessert!  Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake was perfect for my birthday treat - chocolate cake drizzled in chocolate sauce with caramel ice cream.  Scrumptious, to say the least!  They decorated with "happy birthday" and our server sang to me in Italian.  It was the perfect ending to a perfect meal.

The customer service was amazing.  Our server was funny and accommodating.  We had our baby with us and enjoyed a memorable dinner out.  What more could you ask for in Vegas?!  Definitely one for the books!

Excellent dining experience! We reserved a table through Open Table and we didn't have to wait at all. We had a nice booth near the open kitchen. The wait staff was attentive and nice. Both of our dishes, chicken piccata and chicken Marsala were both amazing, film of flavor and perfect portions. Definitely recommend.

Came here with a group of 10, overall consensus was that we expected it to be better but glad that the prices weren't steep. 

I had the spaghetti and meatballs, the pasta was perfect consistency but the sauce was a bit runny and the meatballs nothing to write home about.

APPS: 
MAC AND CHEESE CARBONARA
MEATBALL

ENTREE:
VEAL CHOP PARMESAN

everything was amazing!! With all the different Italian restaurants and being this was the last dinner we had in vegas it was hard to choose but so glad we came here! Meatballs were scrumptious, carbonara was rich and decadent and the veal Parmesan was so tender and perfectly fried....veal chop was huge hubby and I shared the entree and it was perfect, and of course the pasta was perfect as well. Will def be back to eat here when we return to vegas.

I was really surprised. I thought it would rely in its name to generate business. First thing is the service was excellent. Drinks were never empty and servers were friendly and prompt. The food was very good too. My son had Mac and cheese and said it was the best he's ever had. I had an Italian sub and Caesar Salad and both were delicious. We didn't have dessert but from what we saw that was probably a mistake. I'll definitely be back next time in Vegas.

We went back this morning for Sunday brunch and it was good. Not great but good. It was lacking in variety. The Mac and Cheese was yummy, as was the hot pasta salad. There was a small selection of cut meats and cheeses and some tasty meatballs and my husband was thrilled with the carving area. But the crepes weren't very good (no matter how much Nutella I loaded on) and the blueberry muffins and chocolate croissant were dry and tasteless.

This review is for the hostess. She turned me away with an elderly person and my 2 children. I could not get a table and order a drink. She said I had to order food and turned us away. My father in law has a few medical conditions I will not list but to be turned away is a joke. This place will never earn my business again!

Due to the amazing spaghetti and meatballs, we had to come back! Again, the food was amazing! We did try the chicken parm and the caprese this time and were impressed with those as well. Definitely put this place on your list when in Vegas!  The service was great, we were well taken care of and left very happy! Just make sure to get spaghetti and meatballs!

I was slightly skeptical thinking it would not be good. The apps are average. The pastas...exceptional! Pomodoro was perfect, the lasagna is super huge and delish and the pasta alla vodka was amazing! All of the pasta is perfectly cooked. Oh, and make sure you leave room for dessert. The tiramisu had a chocolate cake surprise at the bottom. I hate the word moist but that's exactly what it was...MOIST. I couldn't stop eating it. Nice views so ask for a table by the window. The restaurant is not easy to find so just ask for directions...don't wander around.
The food was delicious. We were there for our anniversary. Best Italian food ever,fast service and very friendly waiters.

I was looking for a quiet place to do a web meeting during my trip and saw this place so I stopped in.  I took a seat on the couches in the bar area and quickly ordered an ice tea and some cannoli.  Once my meeting started, the server checked in on me quietly once or twice to refill my ice tea.  I didn't realize that he didn't know I was in my meeting already.  Oops.  Anyway, this was a nice place to sit and relax away from the crowds in the shops area.  The cannoli was a treat, which I enjoyed one and took the other back to my hotel for a late night snack.  I'll have to try Buddy V's place again so I can check out the whole menu next time.

Wow. We stopped in for some lunch here and our expectations were nothing short of exceeded. We ended up having a few appetizers. The eggplant and fried motz (not on menu)  and some ceaser salad. It was fresh and flavorful. Down to the croutons on the salad everything was crafted perfectly. We were gonna go grab dessert next door and the bakery and we're glad we didnt. Our enthusiastic server named Georgio recommended us to have the dessert there. They brought us the desert menu which was adorable like a photo album with family photos in it as well. They had what we would have gotten next door and served it garnished with extra cream and chocolate and even fresh fruit. This place is a must to stop in.

I would like to thank Buddy V and his staff for making my sons high school graduation dinner exceptional . The food was unbelievable and the staff outstanding,  this is the place to go if you want to have a memorable dinner with a wonderful group of people , they truly were the icing on the cake ..

Visited this restaurant on a Sunday evening as a party of two. The maître de was accommodating to our needs and had very good suggestions in accordance with our likings. The service was cordial and quick and not pushy. Personally we tried garlic bread, cheese ravioli with a white sauce ,and a pasta al la vodka. The garlic bread had the perfect portions of additives making it a great addition to our meal. The ravioli with our requested white sauce tasted phenomenal. Great cheese blend with an accommodating white sauce that was buttery but not too heavy. The vodka sauce was a phenomenal mix and just the right portion of red to white. Customer service was great, we look forward to coming here again!

So this is the second time we go to Buddy V this week. We loved the Sunday Gravy but it is a lot of food, so come hungry. We went in a Thursday night so the band was planning, those guys are great, music was good and they really make an effort to play the music you want to hear. Hersh was our waitress, she's awesome. Props to her, very nice and came by to make sure we were good many times. She deserves a raise. Lastly, the location is great and it is a nice resturant so I highly recommend you try it.

WOW My husband and I have been here 5 times already, Our server Rocco has been the best of the best, the food is delish and the desserts are to die for, a must is the Lobster Tail Pastry with fresh fruit, the cannoli's come in second best but all are good
Every visit we ordered something different to try and we have not been disappointed
one of my fav's is the margarita pizza, last night we had the sunday gravy pot, meatballs, pork, lamb, sausage with a bowl of rigatoni, so yummy, we had friends from NJ visit last month and this was the first place we took them, they can not wait to return
matter of fact I can't wait for our next visit, so until then I will have to patience but it won't be long,  thanks Buddy for opening on the strip
see you soon

Went for a birthday celebration and they made it nice with Happy Birthday written in chocolate on the dessert that my daughter selected. Food was fantastic--cheesy garlic bread to die for, meatballs yummy, eggplant parm and dad's bucatini great. Flatbread pizza wonderful too. Portions are very generous. Several people had chicken piccata or chicken marsala and said there was too much chicken but that's a good thing! Had cannoli and warm nutella cake for dessert--great!

Now my concerns---service left a lot to be desired starting with the bar. We arrived early and had drinks then were ready to move to dinner but the bar made a huge thing of needing to close out our tab there first (3 drinks, one of which was a happy hour drink, so not a big tab!). Okay that's fine but then it took forever to get the waitress to come so we could close out. Not good.... and then at our table the waiter was very nice (Rocko) but not very efficient nor was his helper. We had to ask for olive oil and vinegar for the bread and they brought one for the table of 6 so we asked for another and never got it. Later in the evening we asked for two decaff coffees and those never came. 

We were not in a hurry so it was fine but they need to look into these issues. Would definitely go back for the great food!

Absolutely awful customer service by the manager here. He treated me very poorly when I spoke with him about our server (who was wonderful). He accused me of taking a bribe from the server to give him a compliment. I'm highly disappointed.

Came here with high expectations and they fell flat fast! Service slow and the food nothing like what I expected after reading positive reviews? The caprese salad was $16.00 and literally was 2 ounces of buffalo cheese with some wilted basil and a small spoonful of cherry tomatoes no seasoning big disappointment! The chicken parm that everyone raved  about tasted like something from Olive Garden but no seasoning and the Spaghetti on the side came cold no flavor .    Did not order dessert since everything was a big let down went to Bouchon for dessert! The bakery across the way looked very busy maybe should try that next time.

I attended Buddy V's brunch in mid April after out-of-town friends asked some Strip brunch suggestions. I was really pleased with their choice and so were they. The selection was smaller than a typical strip Buffet, but everything I ate was high quality and tasty, unlike a lot of dishes on a typical Buffet. The shrimp cocktail we're huge and plentiful, the meat and cheese selection was awesome and the crepes with berries were excellent. The dessert table allows you to try many versions of Buddy's pastries, my favorites were  zeppole(zonuts), the cannoli and the Italian cookies. I was so impressed with this brunch, that the following month when my mother and Aunt came to town, I brought them there as a treat. On my second visit I did the Bloody Mary bar, which was excellent and I was pleased to learn that I could choose from other alcoholic drinks as part of my $15 all you can drink price. I also tried the Bellini and the sangria and both were excellent. I will be bringing many people to this brunch when they come to town. $35 for a Strip brunch of this quality is very reasonable.

Would have given this place five stars because my husband and I really enjoyed our dinner when we dined there on our vacation last week. But we felt our waiter although very nice was not totally truthful and sneaky. We had ordered a salad and the fried mozzarella for an appetizer, both were delicious! But our waiter casually asked if we wanted cheesy garlic bread and the way he asked it came across that it was complementary...it wasn't $9.00 :/ the other thing was that my husband and I had both ordered beers, and when I had ordered mine he pulled out the menu and pointed to two choices and asked which one I wanted...I just pointed to the smaller of the two choices. When we got our bill it turned out he had added on a souvenir glass (an extra $5.00) without informing me that was what he was doing. So we felt we got a little bit scammed into adding on all these extras. So ask questions before you just say "sure!" to something.

Came here after watching a show expecting something wonderful considering the prices.
Came on a Wednesday night expecting a wonderful experience considering this is Buddy's rest. Who we have loved for many years on TV. The service was slow and not up to what we usually get at a good resturant. As far as the food. It was good not great. SORRY BUDDY.
But we won't be coming back to your resturant.

Everything was perfect except it was extremely loud. And our souvenir glasses. 
We ordered the drinks in very nice souvenir glasses. We usually do this at all the tourist places that offer this. We thought our daughters would love them. They love watching the cake boss. Usually they will bring you a new glass wrapped up and you're set. 
When we got back from our trip we gave the boxes to our daughters and they opened them and here they were the glasses we drank out of and had beer residue and lemonade residue in it. How embarrassing. The beer one smelled so bad. I thought we were getting new glasses. They could have at least washed them. Good thing we gave them to our kids and not someone else. They were horribly dirty. 
Our Server was explaining the appetizers and I heard absolutely nothing he said. 
We were sat at a small table for two and I maybe said 5 words the whole time. Because it was too hard to carry on a conversation. 
It was our last night in Vegas and I wanted something romantic and memorable. 
When I think of Italian food I think romantic and intimate. 
It was not. That's the only thing I didn't enjoy. 

Food and drinks were amazing.

I am not an Italian food snob or claim to know how, "good Italian food should taste."

The not so good - Calimari. It was very chewy and may have been a little undercooked. The sipping sauce was pretty good, had a bit of chipotle/spicey flavor to it.

The good - my wife and I split a plate of Chicken Rigatone A La Vodka. This meal was very flavorful. The noodles were large and had chunks of chicken mixed in with it. The vodka cream sauce was very tasty, I would order this again.

They are a little cheap with the bread but it is great and quite frankly I dont need to eat it anyway.

The service - friendly but a little slow.

I would go back!

Fantastic! First time here and it was for a friend's birthday. We had an amazing view overlooking the strip. First, the decor was super fun with bundt cake pans decorating the walls, rolling pin room dividers and light fixtures that looked like giant whisks. Like entertainment too. Although we couldn't see him, his piano and voice could be heard throughout. And a nice variety of music too! Everything from Frank Sinatra to Maroon 5. Now for the food... For appetizers we got some amazing Jersey mozzarella dish as well as a grilled cheese garlic bread. Both were amazing but now looking back perhaps we shouldn't have ordered two cheese appetizers. Cue in the awkward silence... Just kidding! No such thing as too much cheese! For entrees I highly recommend the lasagna, Sunday gravy and orecchiette with Italian sausage and broccoli I. For desert we had some amazing lemon raspberry cheesecake and the Italian birthday cake. Both were excellent! Will definitely go back!

My husband and I had the chicken parm and lasagna, he said it was one of the best if not the best chicken parm he'd ever had, and I absolutely loved the lasagna. And we both agree the Nutella cake and salted caramel ice cream is up there with one of the top desserts we've ever had. And our waiter Giorgio was wonderful he took care of us with a great friendly smile and personality.

My experience with BuddyV was terrible. I ordered house salad and the house special of shrimps with fettuccine. I told the waiter that I cannot have any bacon or pork products (due to religious reason); he understood but didn't care to mention that the salad has bruschetta on it. Well when the salad came I raised concerns and was told another salad is coming without meat.. but after ten minutes and rest of my party already had their salad finished; my salad never came. Later the manager came asking the same questions and promising another salad; to which I told him no since I didn't want start on salad while my party is on their main entrée'. I was hoping the food would be good, but no.. The pasta was not fully cooked, hard to chew, dry and only 3 shrimps!!! For a $30 entrée' I was expecting some good.  But no! This place is over rated; like many other things in Vegas.

So I went here with my family and everyone ordered different dishes. I tried a little bit everyone's dishes because I just love sharing food, and I must admit this place is amazing. I ordered salmon and it was cooked to perfection. My nephew had macaroni and cheese and it was the best I've ever had. Service was even better. The view is just incredible of the strip and I loved the big windows with natural sunlight coming in. It perfect and I cannot wait to go back!

Holy crap! Coming from a "enlarged family" through a recent wedding, I am part of an Italian family and we eat a lot of italian food. We were on a Girls Trip to Vegas, each celebrating something different but together and wanted to dress up for a ladies night out. We were able to get a reservation same day, the wait was so short once we got there and we were able to get some great group shots thanks to some other guests. We got an amazing window booth that over looked the strip and could see the gondolas below - it was not too loud and had a great vibe. 

Our waiter Chaz - was amazing! Quick and efficient, he recommended his favorites and we took his advice - food was perfect and portions were definitely Italian Style!
Share plates so you can try a little of everything! and still have room for Buddy V's award winning desserts.

Peter is amazing! The service was great and Peter, our server, was so accommodating and sweet! He made a recommendation for the linguini with clams which was delicious! We had a blast and Peter even gave us canolis to go! Thank you Peter for making our first visit to Buddy V's so great! We'll be back!

Amazing food and service!This restaurant has the best service by far and our server, Peter was simply outstanding! The GM Christina also was exceptional! My husband and I will definitely be back again!

Best kept secret in Vegas. I brought prospective customers here during Shot Show 2015 and it was an overwhelming success. We ate in the bar area during happy hour. $4 American beers (16 oz) and $5 appetizers. The food consisted of the best meatball sliders I have ever tasted, sausage and pepper sliders, calamari and ricotta cheese with garlic toast points. Outstanding food, great staff (especially Mike the bartender from The North End). What else would we expect from the Cake Boss?

Food and service were great.  We reserved ahead of time, we were accommodated quickly upon arrival and given a nice view of the strip.  Fresh baked focaccia was great.  Grilled octopus was a little spicy but good.  Best dish of the night for us was the Orecchiette & Italian Sausage.

We love Italian Food, and we felt like treating ourselves. We had heard so many good things about Buddy V's, being locals, so we decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. The service was impeccable - friendly & attentive. The server was knowledgeable and described the dishes well. We are "Wine Snobs" so we were worried about the wine selection, but to our surprise they had a great selection of Italian and Californian Wines, and the Server seemed fairly knowledgeable and recommended a suitable Italian Wine. And the food was everything we hoped it would be - classic, fresh, simple and delicious.  The restaurant was busy and vibrant.The kitchen is situated right in the middle of the restaurant, and you can watch the action. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Overall probably 3 is fair. The space has gorgeous views and is worth the short walk from venetian or palazzo. The food is above average Italian, but not spectacular. The focaccia should've been warm, and why do we need to ask for olive oil? That's not authentic . We had chicken parm and pasta. We said we were sharing but plates were just dumped. Had a very nice bus boy but the waiter was creepy and a little scary. The chicken parm was good, pasta was a little on the creamy side. Overall pretty mediocre for the Boss, hope the cakes are better and they hire some pleasant waiters

I have eaten here recently a couple times. One time the service was shitty and the other it was great. The food gets 5 stars easily. You get what you pay for here. 

Grandma's Meatballs: beef, veal, and pork. Good flavor and easily shared but you wont want to. 

Free Bread: dude came around once with bread and that was it. I wanted more bread! He poured some oil and vinegar for us (a lot of it) and gave us 1 piece of bread for it. That's ok I made up for it by eating all the bread stick thingys that are in the cups on the table. 

Buddy's Salumi and Cheese Board: damn yo this was real good. I didn't care for the olives but I'm not a fan of them anyway. The meats and cheeses I could have ate all day.

Orecchiette and Italian Sausage: This dish had sausage in its name so I ordered it. It was not as heavy as a spaghetti with sauce which was nice. I ate every bite and would order it again. 

Spaghetti Bolognese: I was very surprised to like this. When it came out I expected some sort of red sauce on it but that wasn't the case. My wife took a bite and really liked the taste too. Winner winner bolognese dinner!

Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake: Came with salted caramel ice cream. This was hot and good and everyone should order it. 

Zeppole: I guess a spiced sugar is outside of these but I didn't taste anything but fried dough. I didn't like this.

Received a gift card and was really excited about going to this restaurant , place is very nicely decorated the staff is  wonderful, but the food can really use some help. My husband and I were so disappointed in the quality of the dishes I was contemplating writing  a letter to Buddy because I don't think even he would be happy with the flavor or non flavor of the dishes.  Might be helpful for him to go undercover to try his restaurant himself.

Cake Boss? Where's the cake? They barely serve cake. The ravioli with tomato sauce on kids menu -which they were not serving until 5p and we were there at 4p. My Margarita Pizza was to thick and tasted like something I could make in the oven out of a box. We ordered a $9 apple pie for desert and Sara Lee does better.

I am a big fan of the cake boss and when I found out that he opened a restaurant I was over the moon. Good parts the food and portions are excellent, the price is pretty comparable considering it is on the Vegas strip. Unfortunately the service was horrible!!!!! The server never paid attention to her tables. It took a lot to get refills on drinks, our check, and our change. She didn't even check our table to see if our meal was tasting ok. I will go back for the food, just hope they can fix the service.

We had lunch there 11/10/14 while at the Venetian for a few things before we left town. The food was 4.5 stars, but the service was 3. Our actual server was a unfriendly dud. She was not pleasant and acted as if we and the table next to us was an annoyance. The servers' assistant however, was perfect! He was very polite and friendly, he took our drink order and kept them filled as well as boxed up my leftovers. The server took our food order (Hoboken Cheesesteaks - Delish!) but a runner brought our meals from the kitchen, she stood around leaning on the servers' station while we waited for our food and ate, then she turned around as if she were offended when I declined the dessert menu, then she literally dropped our check folio on the table. Yes, I realize they are famous for desserts with Carlo's Bakery across the hall but I had 2/3 of my meal boxed up because of the generous portions, we were stuffed! I hope they split the tips with the assistants because she was awful and the young man took very good care of us the entire meal, even my hubby commented several times about her demeanor and expressed that he wished the assistant was our actual server.

Got to try Buddy V's today with some co-workers... The atmosphere is open and has a modern with a hint of old world vibe going on. I had the Chicken Parm, which was a huge portion and was a great dish I will enjoy for dinner too! The smashed meatball sub and the Salmon were ordered by the others in the party and all said they really enjoyed their dishes! We also got an order of the garlic bread which was the right amount of garlic and cheese! The service was good and nicely paced! Overall great experience, great food and I would recommend this place to others! Sadly we were too full to order dessert.

Came for my mother's birthday. Let me tell you about my mother:
- She was born in Calabria, Italy
- Loves Italian food (given), but almost never goes out for Italian food since we have it with family often and her standards are high.
- She does not like to spend money, everything is compared to a cheaper alternative and rarely thinks money is well spent at restaurants. 

Our waiter hyped up the family style dining experience, which we usually do on our own. The fact they had a program to do so was great to hear, and it did not disappoint.

The food was amazing. Exceeded all of our expectations. We had a great spread that really covered all the bases from the menu. One dish was better than the next.

The waiter, Georgio, was the best in the business. I've eaten at great restaurants around the world and had great service but he was truly world class and made the night. He was funny and entertaining but did not overdue it. Sometimes you get a funny or personable waiter who you like but they are too busy chatting they forget a request or get distracted, but not Georgio. He even sang happy birthday to my mother in Italian which really was the icing on the cake. 

It was a night to remember, thank you to Buddy V's for making it special!

I didn't know until just this moment that we were there only the second week they were open.  We had no idea this was there, but were at the Venetian and followed our noses.  Service was excellent, attentive, but not invasive.  We weren't that hungry, but proceeded to order the octopus appetizer which was great.  The octopus was cooked perfectly.  

My husband ordered the (I think it was called the Sunday gravy or something).  It was a pot with red sauce, sausage, veal, and meatballs.  He said it was very good.  I ordered the eggplant parmesan appetizer and the creamy polenta side.  I was too full to finish it, but it was delicious.  The eggplant had a wonderfully crisp coating and was not mushy at all.  The polenta was creamy and wonderful.

I also had a frozen Bellini that was yummy.  We are talking about going back to Vegas just to eat there again!

What a wonderful experience! The veal Marsala melted in my mouth and I mopped up all of the sauce with the perfectly cooked spaghetti it came with. The lobster tail for dessert was amazing! The filling was perfect and held together by a perfect, flaky pastry. Our waiter Rocco was more than accommodating with my multitude of requests and questions - always responding with a pleasant smile and great attitude. Thank you Buddy Vs! We will be back.

Delicious food and superb service. Our waiter Peter provided us with excellent and impressive service.  We ordered the grilled salmon, shrimp scampi, clams with linguini, and the cheese ravioli. Would definitely recommend!!!!
One of best restaurants in Vegas!!!!

One of the newer restaurant that opened here at The Palazzo, it is located on the second level of The Grand Canal Shoppes, next to Barney's New York.

Came here on a date and yes, I do agree with a fellow Yelper that it IS a big spacious restaurant so it doe not give you the intimate, romantic/family style a Italian restaurant should be. But hey...it's located in a 5 diamond hotel right ON THE STRIP...what else can you expect?

To sum it up, everything we ordered was delicious. The service was great, our waiter was attentive the entire time keeping our drinks filled, napkins/utensils were delivered quick. 
We got an order of their famous meatballs as an appetizer. I believe it came with six. Perfect to start off with. The meatballs were very flavorful and they weren't puny little meatballs either.
For our entrees, I ordered chicken Parmesan and my date ordered a pasta dish. Let me tell you, like most restaurants here on the strip, portions were pretty big. I definitely had leftovers for the next day. My chicken Parmesan wasn't dried and they put the perfect amount of melted cheese on top.
