We also ordered dessert. Not a big fan of sweets to begin with and I was already full from dinner. But my date suggested we share something soooo....sure, why not? We ordered the canoli and it was wayyy toooo sweet for my liking. The cream filling....bleh....over powering. I much prefer a gelato or something if I ever get a chance to come back here.

Overall, this is a really good restaurant and I can see it thriving here at The Palazzo. Prices aren't as expensive as say, Dal Toro or Bouchon. If you're in the mood for Italian and kind of on a budget.....I definitely recommend Buddy V's.

(P.S.) Heard Buddy V is going to open up a bakery shop at the Venetian sometime in March 2014. Stay tuned!

This was our second stop at Buddy V's while visiting Vegas.  First you can't beat the location if you are a shopper.  The restaurant is located in the Canal Shoppes which is one of our favorite haunts while visiting.

What always blows me away is the line across from the restaurant for his bakery, it usually is formed at least halfway down the corridor.  All I can say is the bakery must be delish....but I digress.

We only had to wait 10 minutes for a table at lunch which you can sit in the bar or wait in the corridor.  We were seated in the bar area.  The best way to describe the vibe here is casual chic.  The restaurant feels very open yet has a Brooklyn restaurant feel to it.  Servers are dressed casually and make you feel very comfortable.

I would have liked the server to be a little more friendly...don't get me wrong she was very efficient...just didn't seem happy to be there.  However she gave us great service and everyone has those days so it did not take away from the experience.

I had the eggplant parmesan  which was HUGE and delicious.  No way I could eat it all or even half of it...but I sure did enjoy trying.  Hubby had the spaghetti and loved it.  The cheese garlic bread is like an entree on its own...perfectly toasted with yummy gooey cheese.We both enjoyed the menu as all of the entrees have special ties to the owner like My Wife's Eggplant Parmesan or Lisa V's Linguine, this just gives you the feeling of being in an Italian grandmas kitchen.

Hubby ordered a Buddy V's lobster tail for dessert and I can tell you they look just like they do on his tv show...big and stuffed full of tasty goodness.  I only had a bite as i was still trying to tackle the eggplant parm but it was magnificent.

This is definitely going to become a lunch tradition when we are in Vegas.  Great food at reasonable prices
Excellent food, great service. Had dinner there with the family while in Vegas. Everyone was very happy with their dishes and drinks. Definitely recommend!!!
Spur of the moment choice but well worth it. Entertainment was good & food was excellent. Nice happy hour special & the garlic bread was terrific

Very disappointed!!!! We came here for my sister-in-laws birthday dinner and with all the great reviews we thought it would be a great experience but boy was I wrong. We got seated pretty quickly without a reservation so it did start off good. We placed our drink order and thats when it all went wrong. We got our drinks but after that did not see our server for 20 min even after asking other workers for him and that we were ready to order. He finally came back and we placed our order. Our appetizers came first and after finishing they cleared the table completely taking all napkins and utensils. The food finally arrived to the table and we all were starving but couldn't start eating because we did not have any utensils to eat with. After asking for our waiter and waiting another 15 minutes and having our food get cold we finally got our waiter and he grabbed the utensils. Finally we told them it was my sister-in-laws birthday so they brought out a cake which was not that good and we sang to her. We then received the check and they charged us $10 for the cake we didn't even eat. Definitely will not be going again.

My wife loves Creme Brulee.  She has it at any restaurant that serves it.  I like Creme Brulee.  My wife likes butterscotch.  For me is butterscotch is just ok.   Who would have ever thought we would both love the Buddy V's Butterscotch Creme Brulee so much we have it every time we are in Vegas.  Multiple times!   Now Creme Brulee at other restaurants just doesn't quite measure up.  The Grandma's Meatballs are also the best I have ever had.  The Mediterranean Sea Bass was good.  Service was excellent.

4 stars for food

I had the Chicken Parm/Garlic Bread/Caesar salad

2 stars for service

20 minute wait so we sat at the bar...big mistake, I think they forgot about us or didn't have enough staff

Needless to say, worth stopping in!

I am definitely a fan of this place.  The whole restaurant reminds me of classy establishment that will not scare you away from wearing jeans and a tshirt.  The food is Great and the service is excellent.  Our waitress yesterday was I believe Graciela and she did an excellent 5 star job !  Nuggs had the classic cheese pizza.. of course.. and although the presentation was nice the sauce tasted like it was straight from the can (in my opinion).  It did not compliment the pizza at all and I could only compare it to what would seem like Hunts canned tomato sauce accompanied with good pizza dough and cheese.  My friend had the Chicken Parm , and I had the Bucatini Carbonara which I hoped I spelled correctly.  Definitely NO complaints on those two dishes!  I would definitely try those if you are not sure what to get.  Cheesy Goodness accompanied with the subtle flavor of bacon and texture of what seemed to be bread crumbs in the Bucatini are going to have me coming back in July for a double order!  Super deliciousness! My only sadness is that for 23.00 nugget stole most of it from me and there wasn't enough for me.  It's a portion size designed for an average person I would imagine but being that I'm on the bit larger side of the spectrum I could have eaten two plates easily.  Chicken Parm with spaghetti was demolished by my friend so I would imagine that should tell you how good it was.  The Cheese board is also a good add to your list of things to get while you are here.  Great selection of meats and cheeses but the bread was not enough for the amount on the board.
Desserts I might have to say are phenomenal !  I would have to say a best choice would be the Nutella cake and ice cream.  I say this only because after our meal the nugget had finished most of her pizza and half of my pasta so when I asked her if she wanted a dessert she replied NO.  I received my nutella cake and after having one bite I asked her again .. Are you sure?  It's nutella cake.. and the result about dessert is in my picture for this place.

Was there with family last night, the food was even better than the 1st time we were there.  I booked a reservation on open table & requested a view for my visiting cousins; they gave us a beautiful booth with an amazing view of the Spring Mtn corner.
I can't speak highly enough of the server & buser...so on the ball that we never had to ask for ANYTHING! 
My cousins LOVED the experience; not just the food...it was a great night:)

A dream come true after watching Carlo's Bakery on TV for years.  Service was good and food was amazing from the bread to the entree to dessert.  Had Madeline's Whole Wheat Penne and then Cannoli for dessert.  Just as good as I had hoped it would be.  Clever interior with rolling pins hanging and whisks on the light fixtures.  Family photo album in the dessert menu.  Great option for getting dessert since the bakery across the hall is always so busy.

We wanted to try their happy hour, unfortunately when we went here last weekend around 515 pm the hostess said we need a reservation they are expecting 400 something reserved guests so they can't accommodate us. So I'm like it must be really good. I just find it weird when the time we tried to check in, the place isn't crowded inside there are even opened seats outside. So we decided to go the next day for their weekend bunch. It was a bit pricey $34.95 including drinks. Our server was nice and very attentive. Selection was not that many but it is a good food. The tomato basil soup was superb. Their apple sausage was tasty. I like how they have a small portions for kids meal too. I was able to get  Reese chocolate. I was a big fan of sweets so dessert is big deal for me. They have red velvet cake and bread pudding not to sweet but it was good.

Plainly speaking, this restaurant looks nice, the food is fairly good and the service is above par, but you pay a very high price for eating here.

So, if you are okay with or need to impress someone by spending about double what you would normally pay for a good, but rather run-of-the-mill and somewhat small portioned Italian meal, then you will likely be satisfied with your experience here.

Otherwise, you'll probably feel like what I felt afterwards. No longer hungry, but not particularly impressed.

We had the panzanella, turkey dinner, linguine and clams, cannolis and apple crostata. The panzanella was good, but we wished there was more than the four small slices of cheese on it. The turkey dinner was good. Was it $24 good? Not so sure. The linguine and clams was somewhat overpowering with the spices. Is linguine and clams supposed to make you sweat? Apple crostata was pretty darn tasty. Easily the highlight of our meal. The cannolis? Seeing as how the cannolis are seemingly a signature type thing, you'd think they would wow. They didn't wow us. They're good cannolis for a Hoboken bakery. But for a $$$ restaurant in the Venetian? For $$$ it needs to be BETTER than "home cooking".

Casual family friendly restaurant in the Venetian. My husband is a huge fan of Cake Boss, so we had to stop here and Carlos's bakery when in town.

No reservations were needed for lunch and there are many tables. Casual Italian fare of sandwiches, pastas, and some meat dishes. We shared the eggplant starter and each had one of the sandwiches for lunch. The eggplant was okay - presentation was on the sloppy side though. My BLT was nicely presented with grill marks on the bread. Service seemed a bit forced and over cheerful. Food was a little slow to arrive given that it wasn't particularly busy when we arrived.

Overall a-ok but there are much better spots in town for mid-range pricing. The main plus is that it's family friendly if you have kids in tow.

Met a group of peeps for lunch.  Our first discussion at the table was where is the best place to park. Well, it wasn't the Venetian, where I was lucky enough to park and walk from. Grrrr!  After getting the waiter to confirm, use the Palazzo Valet, but it's still a little trek. 

The waiter was super friendly and nice, even when I returned my soda, because it had a funny smell. I promise it wasn't me...I made half the table confirm it smelled bad. 

I asked the waiter what was good and he said many things. I mentioned the chicken parm, because so many people on yelp ordered it, and he said that was a good option. So I went for it.  Buyers remorse!!  It was decent, don't get me wrong, but the guy across from me got a burger that looked amazing!!!  Who would have thunk it...a burger at an Italin joint?!  Next time!

The parm was ok, and most would probably love it, but I am super picky about my sauce, being raised in an Italian pasta sauce making family. It did have two big pieces of chicken, fried well, and not dry with ample cheese on top. I wouldn't throw it away, but it wasn't OMG, I am ordering this again.  I already know I will be ordering the burger next time. :P

I also wish I had room for the lobster tail dessert, but I just don't. :(

I would come back again, because I think this place could make me happy.  Just not a good start with the strange soda this time.

I came to this restaurant because I read a review of burgers and they said this was the best burger ever. Even if it was in an Italian restaurant. It took us forever to find the restaurant. It's not well signed. When we got there a nice lady took us to our table. We waited quite awhile to be noticed. Finally a snoody server came over. He tried to upsell us bottled water. We declined. Of course I didn't order the burger. Instead I had the smashed meatball sandwich. It came on a crisp french roll. It also had ricotta cheese on it. That just ruined it for me. The meatballs were dry and very little sauce. All I could taste was the ricotta. It came with french fries that were nothing spectacular. My friend had the vodka rigatoni. He said it was very good. It should have been for $23.00!! That was the lunch price. I think this place is over priced and to snoody for me. I would have much rather gone across the street to Mangiano's. I never have a bad meal there. No, I won't be back and won't recommend it.

Terrible service from the time I called the restaurant to be put on hold for 10 minutes to  make reservations to the host who answered the phone and snottingly responded, "what's this regarding?"  really? Its regarding me eating at your restaurant and paying your paycheck.  Really snotty servers and hostesses. Due to possible poor management?  Buddy V would be ashamed.  Really disappointing because the food was great....
Had the lasagna, was to die for and the lava cake for dessert was heavenly!

The Cake Boss is everywhere these days and I am glad to see a place in Vegas. 

I made a reservation which you can do on line so getting a table was a snap. 

The chicken Parm was amazing, perfect breading and plenty of food. They give you spaghetti also. The food is absolutely fantastic. 

The lasagna is amazing also, perfect. The portions can be large however. 

Tried the garlic toast also and it was a perfect match. 

The staff are absolutely amazing, the waiter made a perfect recommendation for a wine to pair with the chicken Parm and knew the menu and food. There was also a couple assistants that kept everything flowing. This made everything work like a well oiled machine. The Cake Boss did an excellent job and I will be back if in Vegas again.
This place is amazing!! I asked for best tasting dessert and they delivered. Mouthwatering!!

Sorry Buddy but everything as just Ok for me. Had the meatballs, lasagna, and a antipasti lasagna was the best out of the 3. Also had the red velvet alcoholic bev. Just ok. I was really rooting for it to be good. Good luck and good eats!!!

We were seated quickly. The staff are great. Friendly, professional and attentive but not overbearing. 

The food is outstanding. My daughter is a very picky pasta enthusiast and she said it was the best pasta she has ever had.

Had a Chicken Parm that was off the charts amazing!  A friend that was eating with us ordered the Veal parm, I had never seen a piece of veal that big, I thought they had brought out a small breaded pizza.  The veal was also amazing. 

The atmosphere was casual but the view of the strip was incredible.   We had a great waitress that not only had great recommendations and fast service but also gave us directions on the quickest way to get a cab for our next adventure of the night.

After a lengthy research online we picked Buddy V's at the Venetian for our Easter Brunch. The selection was not huge but all the items were fresh and had amazing flavor. The salad and bread selection even featured a traditional hot cross buns. Carved meat station had slab bacon along with an incredibly tender leg of lamb. The pastas and meatballs were an excellent nod to the Italian side and made me want to go back for dinner. My kids favorite item was the French toast. The cake boss did not disappoint for the dessert. Individual tiramisu was perhaps the best I ever had and the mini cannoli's had very flavorful filling but we're probably made a bit too early and the shells were already a bit soggy. Unfortunately the only downside to our meal was the grumpy servers and unfriendly host staff. It is a family atmosphere place and they all acted annoyed to be serving children. A pleasant attitude and a smile goes a long way to make you feel welcome. Overall we are glad we picked Buddy V's to celebrate Easter at. As locals we will most likely be back.

I have many food allergies and our waiter took great care in taking note of them. Then the manager came over and informed us that the chef would be making all of my food himself and fresh. They did an amazing job keeping me healthy and made me feel like a queen. They treated my 3 children like little kings and queens. Such a great experience!

The prices were reasonable and the food was very good. The waitress was just ok, I had asked to do a  doggy bag which she forgot. She was also supposed to find out a having a cake sent to my little girl, but she never did find out. I finally just left. I would definitely go back

First off - the food was good.  I recommend the Mac & Cheese.  It all went sideways from there.

A group of us decided to give it a try last week.  We got right in and the service was fast.  The server knew nothing about where she worked nor any details about the cake boss himself or the famous bakery across the hall.  We informed her as to who Buddy is.  Bad start for this employee we thought.

Later that night we decided to give the bakery a try and experience the famous treats we had only seen on the TV show.  We waited in the long line and ordered our treats.  After we paid, I heard some construction noise and realized that a construction person was knocking bricks off the wall some 15 feet behind us.  In fact the debris actually hit one of our guests.  In the small bakery their is a small bar to sit at, but in this case that was even closer to the construction guy.  We asked the cashier if we could sit across the hall at the Buddy V's to enjoy our treats.  She said ok but to inform the host.

We crossed the hall and asked the host if we could sit in the dining area that was in the hall, she said no that area was closed.  The restaurant was near empty and I clearly pointed out the construction mess as it was only 30 feet across the hall.  I then asked if we could sit anywhere inside to eat our already paid for treats.  She said no, I should go eat it at the bar inside the bakery.  Needless to say we left and found some tables out in the mall.  

I can not believe that the same establishment from across I the hall would treat people so negatively.  I will not return given their lack of service.  Too bad, the food was pretty good.  They really need some training as to who they work for as well as the true value of a customer.  I will never go back for that reason.

"I think good things happen to good people."
Buddy Valastro

A good thing happened to my wife and I. We were driving down Las Vegas Boulevard and were trying to decide where we wanted to eat lunch.

Heart Attack Grill ? Been there, done that. Please see review.
Carson Kitchen ? Been there, done. Please see review.
Lagasse's Stadium? Been there, done that as well. Please see review.

Lola's Louisiana Kitchen?
Rock N Noodles?
Grimaldi's Pizzeria?  
Been... there... done... that...
Please... See... Review.

Long story short, we found Buddy V's Ristorante and we enjoyed it a lot!
I ate a Hoboken Cheesesteak. I love cheesesteak, but have never been to Hoboken. I'm not really sure what Hoboken would taste like? But the sandwich was delicious.

My wife ate a Chicken BLT and said her's was delicious as well. 
Service was spectacular. Our server, Danny was one of the best we have had along Las Vegas Boulevard. If you don't believe me please see my review for Mon Abi Gabi. 

The bill was under $40.00! But then again that was without alcohol. That's right it is possible to eat on Las Vegas Boulevard and not consume alcohol!

I have two concerns about Buddy V's Ristorante. One, the bakery across the hallway is over the top and smells addicting. Two, there is a kid's menu, but I have a feeling, Buddy V's Ristorante would not be good for kids in the later hours of the day. Lunch or early dinner, sure. 

Great Place. Great Service. In closing I would like to suggest reading my review for Buddy V's Ristorante... but you just did.

I went here for Valentines Day and it was the best Italian food I've had in Vegas! Great service and pretty fast. A nice view no matter where you sit and pretty atmosphere/good music. I had the Chicken Parm and it was soo good. The Chicken Marsala was so tender too. And the fried mozzarella appetizer was delicious. Highly recommend!

My wife and I had a really great experience here for lunch.  I wanted the Sunday Gravy, which was the special, but it turns out it is a dinner item.  The waitress insisted on going back and checking with the chef and he agreed to make it for me.  I'm glad he did, it was amazing.  We also had the cheese sticks for an appetizer.  They were delicious, though a bit unorthodox, it was more like a grilled cheese sandwich in tomato sauce.  Service was great and friendly.  The restaurant, for lunch, was relatively empty, but everything was amazing.

Took my chic here last night for her birthday because she heard Buddy on 98.5 and asked if we could go, so off we went. I have been to the best places in Vegas and some are over hyped and some under hyped. I went into Buddy V's not really thinking anything was gonna be all that amazing but I was wrong on a few things.

One, The mussels they have are the best mussels I have ever eaten in my life. The mussels were so good I ordered another order after dessert.

Two, The surf and turf I ordered was cooked to perfection.

Three, The XL Lobster dessert is probably one of the most amazing things on this planet.

I love to watch new restaurants as they open just to see who really has their shit together and I think Buddy V's did a pretty good job on their opening. Staff was nervous and If I worked there I would be too. Not only is it opening day but the owner, owners business partners and the owners parents are all there. 

We were greeted by Adam Margolies who is the asst G.M. and it was really great to talk to a guy who is really into the property enough to where he had an answer for every question. I know to people reading this that may not seem like much but being from Vegas it is really hard to find knowledgeable people that know things even at the places were they work. We asked him how the XL lobster is made, where the cuts of beef were farmed from, if the scallops are flown in or driven, if the broccoli is organic, if the chocolate chips in the Gelato was made from scratch or store bought. 
We asked all these questions and he answered all of them with no hesitation. 

The decor is 10/10 for the type of restaurant it is and I think it will do well here in Las Vegas. I love eating at places that don't feel stuffy as I don't believe you should ever feel uncomfortable anywhere in Las Vegas.

Welcome to Vegas Buddy V!! Your gonna do great here and we are glad you chose Vegas to serve. Gonna get more mussels now !

This Place Is SHADY!!! Our server was the biggest swindler of them all. We ordered a Stella and he said "medium or large" we go with the smallest being the medium. When the bill comes the Stella Beer was $16. I inquired on why so much and they said because you keep the glass. I said we wanted the beer with no glass and they said that's the only option. The bus boy came around to clear off the table and he said they do have a smaller 12oz version without the stupid souvenir glass for which we weren't given the option.

Then for dinner my daughter asked for a white pasta instead of the kids spaghetti. Waiter said he could do a kids Alfredo. Come the bill was a charge for a $20 Alfredo when the other kids entrees were $12. We had to ask the manager which quickly took care of the problem.

I personally ordered a Caesar salad and as the waiter walked away he said he would being enough to share. Bill comes and were being billed for a huge family portion for which 2 people ate and more than half was left.

The cocktail we ordered was too sweet and liquor. We could have got a better value and experience and mastros for the cost paid. We dine out 3-4 times a week and know the routine of value, quality, service and overall customer appreciation. This place provided NONE!
 
The overall experience sucked, service sucked and we were left feeling like we were takin advantage of.

Steer clear of this over priced and over rated restaurant.

No complaints about this place. Everything we had was quite good. We came here on a weekday afternoon and it was pretty empty. My husband had the Philly cheesesteak and i had the lasagna. The decor was very nice and the waitstaff was helpful. Nothing was overly amazing...simply good food in a very nice place. I'd go again.

Great Place to eat!!! Wifey had me try the garlic cheese bread.....OMG!!! was so Freaking GOOD!!! Highly recommend this place. Staff was great! Service exceptional! Ask for one of (Caleb's Tables). Food Amazing! I will keep coming back any time I am in Vegas.

Not a bad experience, but definitely didn't meet my expectations. I'm a Cake Boss fanatic and have stood in line for hours to get in to Carlos Bakery in Hoboken when it was the only location, so Buddy V's was a no brainer. 

A long line outside the bakery across the hallway, but no wait for the restaurant, possibly just because it was FILLED with exhaust/smoke. They assured us it was not normally that way and let us pick our table in the least-smoky area of the restaurant, which overall got better as we went. Not sure what the issue was.

The octopus salad was super small, so I was glad I wasn't that hungry. More so, the octopus smelled like tuna in a can. I've never had octopus that smelled bad, and almost didn't eat it, but took a chance. The special Cake Boss dessert cocktail was strong, gross, and the red velvet crumbs on top weren't even red. 

There are two cakes on the dessert menu, and we got both. The chocolate cake was underwhelming, but the Italian Birthday Cake.... oh my gosh amazing. Is this really what Italian Birthday Cake is like? We have been DOING. IT. WRONG. Chocolate ganache filling AND cannoli filling, covered with mounds of fresh whipped cream, sliced almonds. Definitely Top 5-10 desserts of my life.

Our waiter Charlie was very nice, but he was overbooked it seemed as it took 12 minutes for someone to take our drink order, and we often waited and waited just to have someone walk by so we could grab their attention. I also asked him 3 separate times to bring the check before he did. 

It all felt extremely, extremely overpriced, too. $100 for 2 entrees, a cocktail, and 2 desserts, that mostly were not very good? Meh. 

Pro-tip to you people standing in line at the bakery: if the dessert you're planning on ordering there is on the Buddy V's restaurant dessert menu... why are you waiting? Order it here. (But skip the food.)

We came for dinner before seeing Human Nature.  I didn't watch the Cake Boss show but I knew about it and wanted to try the restaurant.  We were early and they were still serving lunch so we ordered an appetizer so we could order off the dinner menu.

We got an order of Nina's mozzarella en carozza.  It was like having a toasted cheese sandwich with mozzarella cheese with some tasty marinara.  It was very good.  We shared the order and each had two wedges.

For our mains, my wife ordered  Nonna's lasagna.  It came with beef, pork, sausage, and four kinds of cheese and it was huge.  We could have split this between the two of us had we known how large it would be.  It probably weighed a pound at the very least and it was very good.  We brought 2/3 of it home and have it frozen for a meal for the two of us.

I got the Sunday Gravy.  How could I not go with his signature dish.  It's meatballs, sausage, lamb, and pork simmered in a Sunday gravy and served with a bowl of rigatoni.  The rigatoni was a sensible serving size, but when you added all the meat, this also was a dish that could have been shared.  This dish is worth the praise it gets from reviewers.  The Sunday gravy is excellent and the meat is so tender from the hours of cooking in the gravy!  Saving room for dessert, we opted to have part of this boxed also.

For dessert, we wanted something small and went with our server's recommendation of the Nutella Cake, cake with a warm Nutella center, chocolate sauce, some praline crunch, and served with salted caramel ice cream.  It was delicious and perfect to share at the end of the meal.

Our server, Graciela, was a gem.  She was around often to check on us.  The bus people refilled iced tea glasses quickly,  Service was very good!  The only drawback was the large Palazzo sign along the Boulevard which was at the level of the windows and was extraordinarily bright.  They have a shade which was partially lowered but it should have been lowered more or we should have changed our seating position at the table so our backs were toward the sign.

A very pleasant evening in a really good restaurant!

Buddy V's was truly one of the highlights of our family get-away trip to Vegas. The staff were superb, the food was quickly served and amazingly delicious, and the atmosphere was very warm and inviting. Felt like we were one big family chatting with the staff and the people seated around us. It was the best meal and dining experience we had the entire trip. I would definitely recommend Buddy V's to all my family and friends, and can hardly wait to get the chance to go back there again. We love and miss you Buddy V's!!

It's a pretty good Italian place.  Good atmosphere, reasonable prices for Vegas and super great waitstaff. I'm a pretty snotty Italian reviewer so for most people this may be a 4 star. It has a fairly mainstream flavor. Do try the garlic bread and buddy's Sunday gravy.  Both really good.

The food here was good, but wasn't anything to rave about.

We started with the fried calamari.  It was served with banana peppers, which I love.  The calamari itself was tender and not rubbery.

We both went for the chicken parmesan.  My husband loved it, I thought it was just average.  I wasn't in love with the flavor of the sauce, so had to doctor it up with red pepper flakes and parmesan.

The service was not that great.  Our waitress was pleasant, but never came around.

You can get a decent meal here, but for the price, you will not be blown away.

I was at the Sands Expo for ISC West and waited way too long for lunch.  Every place I went to had a super long wait so I was happy when I got into Buddy V's with a 5 minute wait.  
   The service was very good with the waiter being perfectly attentive.  The restaurant has a nice interior and despite  a busy lunch service was very clean.  
   I ordered the Veal Marsala which was priced at $26.  It came with garlic butter spaghetti noodles.  The garlic butter noodles were the highlight of the plate.  The veal was not even lightly salted and had no flavor.  The Marsala sauce was overly sweet.  It was ok but I have had much better.  I was starved so it filled the void.  
   I wasn't impressed so this was my last and only visit to Buddy V's.

The meatball sliders and sausage sliders were very tasty. The bread on the sliders  melted in your mouth... The Nutella Cake was great, especially with the ice cream it came with. The manager Shawn, was so nice and  professional and made sure we had good service. He gave us a complimentary dessert because they were short staffed.

This review is only for my pre-shopping Sunday drink experience :) I was just about to order a mimosa and the bartender was pouring what looked like a fresh pink-ish juice of some sort then topping with champagne. I asked what it was and she told me white peach juice. I had her make me a drink with the juice and it was delicious. She was very generous with the champagne and I really appreciated that. I hate paying for a drink of mostly juice. My mom and I had a couple of them and took off to do some shopping. 

I'd love to return to eat the brunch buffet because it looked delicious.

I'm a cake boss fan and I keep it real! I have visit the Hoboken bakery, New York, and now Vegas! In my honest opinion majority of the desserts are very good but price wise they are overpriced! I remember going the first time and spending over $50 on a couple treats! Now let's talk about the brunch! It is totally worth $34.95! ALL YOU CAN EAT for a reasonable price! I rather go eat for brunch than spend that money on a few desserts! Think about it! You can eat as many tiramisu, red velvet cake and so on for one price! Not to mention the delicious grandma meatballs, mac and cheese, chicken, french toast, Italian sausage, and so much more!! The service is a PLUS everyone was awesome and I will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas!

Place was phenomenal,
We even saw Buddy walking around with his wife, such a great experience.
We went for the Brunch Buffet, I really cant find anything that I didn't like, all around a great package meal, plus we did the bottomless Drinks, from Mimosas to Bellinis and great beer. Awesome views and the service was excellent.
Emily the Bartender/Server was on point, we broke two glasses and no one made a fit or said anything, they only care about your satisfaction. Ill most definitely be back for any meal on my next Vegas visit.

Nice Italian restaurant located in the Grand Canal Shoppes. I was craving spaghetti and meatballs and I was very pleased how good it was here.  The pasta was perfect and the sauce complimented so nicely I could have had it without the meatballs. But who am I kidding, those meatballs just took it up a notch! Definitely freshly made, juicy with all the right spices. I was so full that I had one meatball left and yes..I took that fist sized meatball in a doggy bag! No shame here. 

My kids enjoyed the oven baked Mac & Cheese gooey on the inside and crispy on the outside & the gourmet burger on freshly baked brioche bread with aioli and side of fries. Happy campers with full bellies! 

Of course being so full we had to take our cannoli to go. It looked so darn good that to my surprise tasted even better than I imagined. We ordered the chocolate chip and pistachio nut toppings. The cannoli stayed crispy/flaky even after eating it hours later. The cream and chocolate sauce was sheer perfection.  Definite must! 

A casual, hearty establishment for the entire family.  Bundt cake molds for wall decor as well as kitchen utensil inspired lighting and fixtures.  Booth seats overlook the Vegas strip. Since lunch was a hit, I would definitely come back here and check out their dinner menu.

We love the food, but today the service was terrible! The chicken parm is FANTASTIC! My husband loves the meatballs and the kids swear the pizza is the best. Usually the service is wonderful, but for whatever reason today the server was totally inattentive. Luckily the food is so good, we will come back.

I'm a big fan of Buddy's but not a fan of Buddy Vs... over priced for mediocre food... the highlight was the garlic bread...spaghetti was runny... pizza was a little too hard... hopefully Carlos bakery will be better... stick to what you know Buddy. ..

Food and service were both top notch. We sat at the bar and ate because we were in a bit of a rush. I got the chicken penne alla vodka and it was delicious. The fresh bread they provide is awesome as well. Our bartender was extremely friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend this restaurant
Best Caesar Salad I have ever had! Polenta croutons are an amazing touch. Dinner portions are small for the price but they still get 5 stars for the salad! Will be back every time I am in Vegas!!

Sunday Gravy was AMAZING!!!!.  I have had many excellent dishes at this restuarant but this was by far the best thing I have ever eaten.  Being Italian I don't understand the review that said if you want authentic Italian don't go here.....that person does not know Italian food at its best.  The Cannoli is amazing and I don't know what he is talking about.

Seriously really delicious food. Must orders:
Calamari - one of the best we've ever had
Lasagna- the best we've ever had
Meatballs- better than mine and the best we've ever had

We also had 
Parmesan chicken- moist and yummy probably the best one we've had as it has a tendency to be dry but this one wasn't.

Linguine and clams- very good
Cheese pizza - kids liked it

I will definitely come back!!

Tried the bakery earlier and discovered this gem.  

Don't forget to ask for Rosemary fresh bread and dip into oil with Parmesan....
Best place ever! We tried the express menu, from the soup to the dessert, everything was awesome. Definitely worth trying if you are on the strip.

Very good meal! My friend and I were satisfied with what we had while on a trip to Vegas.  After several mediocre/disappointing meals, the items we had at Buddy V's left us very pleased! 

Definitely recommend the calamari fritti (something similar to that spelling) it is the option hat is breaded and comes with green peppers and lemon aoli. It was fabulous and perfectly cooked. 

We also shared the veal Marsala.  The noodles and the actual marsala sauce on the veal were VERY good.  Thumbs up! 

Their canolis looked amazing but we were too full to get any. Next time though! :)

AFFORDABLE DELICIOUS BUFFET! We did the Sunday brunch Buffet the weekend after Thanksgiving (2015). This was one of the cheaper buffets in Vegas. Cheap in price ($34.95 per perosn), but not in quality that is. The food was delicious and there was such a good variety of Italian food, breakfast food, seafood, desserts & fruit. Not to mention, it wasn't your typically fruit you find in your local market. The garlic cheese bread was Heaven! The pasta dishes were great as well. The seafood was fresh and great quality. Honestly, I'm not a big fan on buffet's but this was a great way to try out several of the dishes at this restaurant. ALSO...The pianist really added to the ambiance of the place. We will definitely go back again.

You tawkin' to me? You tawkin' to me? Fahget about it! Buddy Valastro's Italian accent makes my heart skip a beat, and the delicious dishes he's serving up at his self-named restaurant in Vegas will do the very same!

Work trip.  Boooo.  But in Vegas? Hell yeah.  I stayed at the monumental Venetian hotel and had the most luxurious suite of suites.  It was late.  I was tired.  I was hungry, and to make matters worse, I was indecisive of what to eat. (Don't you hate that feeling?)  One of my suppliers suggested grabbing a bite at a place called Buddy V's.  "Oh like Eddie V's brother?" I asked.  "Nooo.  Buddy V's as in Buddy Valastro.  The Cake Boss," she replied. Ahhh.  How did I not know this?  

We grabbed a table towards the back, and I acquired the perfect view.  It was about 10PM and I was facing the Las Vegas Strip--the beaming lights shining down on the commotion of pedestrians as they scurried towards the various hotels and casinos.  For my first time in Vegas, this, ladies and gentlemen, was a sight!  

I gulped down the most delicious glass of cab, and ordered the spaghetti carbonara and added Italian sausage, per the waiter's suggestion.  It used to frustrate me watching Diners, Drive Ins and Dives because every other episode, Guy Fieri exclaims "this is the best ________ I've ever had!"  When you say that about every dish, what makes one different from the other? Driving my point home, the Spaghetti Carbonara at Buddy V's Ristorante was THE BEST PASTA DISH I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!! And I'm not Guy Fieri-ing you.  The pasta is obviously made in-house, and that sauce is ridiculously rich and creamy.  The Italian sausage just drove the dish right on home for me.

Buddy V's is... Simply put? OUT OF BOUNDS, and I can't wait to get back to Vegas and eat there again and again!

My husband and myself researched this place before we came on our trip. This place looked like it would be delicious. Since I liked watching buddy v's show I expected big things. Well I was soarly mistaken. We ordered the carving board. The cold cuts at my local Kroger's are way better. All of the food we ordered was terrible.

Love the chicken and the veal parm. The apps are great. I had quick service and they actually have a pretty good view especially if you go sit in the bar.  The only downside it you can tell they don't have a homemade pasta but whatever they do serve still tastes great.

O M G. If you are looking for homemade, delicious, traditional, NY Italian food- this is where you need to be. The food in this place tasted like home in Brooklyn in my mother in laws kitchen. The restaurant is in a wing of the Venetian and across the way from it, is Carlo's Bakery. (You can easily access the restaurant from outside the Venetain. Its above the Walgreens close to the Deuce stop. Almost like you are leaving the Ventian and walking towards Palazzo). The restaurant was very pretty with gorgeous views. The vibe is very causual, laid back, like you stopped by a friends house. Any clothing goes. No dress code. Not at all stuffy and pretentious like Giadas. (see review). We had a friend with us from Texas who had never had NY Italian food, so we had to take her there and see if it was authentic. Authentic it was. We started out with the mozzerella and Carozz that was amazing. I got the "Sunday Gravy"- which is exactly how we make it here. You get a bowl of pasta, with a seperate skillet of red meat sauce with meatballs (OMG delish), pork shoulder, lamb. My husband had pasta bolongese. Insanely good. My Texas friend had the lasagne. It was huge and she ate it for 3 days. All portions were big. The food was not pricey. The dessert menu comes in what looks like an old photo album, and it contains pics of a young Buddy and family with his dad, and then pics of him with his own kids. The whole place is decorated in family pictiures in frames on the walls. For dessert, we had the Nutella (yes Nutella) Lava cake!! OMG. Melted Nutella runs out of the center of this lava cake served with Salted Caramel ice cream. There are no words. Get yourself there  ASAP. You will not be sorry. It was so good, we went twice during out 10 day stay. Had to go back for lunch and got more meatballs, eggplant parm and 2 amazing salads. My new fav place in Vegas. Buddy needs to franchise these places out across the country. I hear Buddy is there monthly. Sadly he was there as soon as we got home to Nyc. Cant wait to go back.
Loved the food. The portion sizes are very large. We had to split. The staff were super friendly. I could eat here again
My wife and I had dinner at buddy vs this weekend and it was pretty good. Except my chicken Parmesan had VERY salty cheese on it. Calamari was pretty good and they give pretty good portions.

Excellent food and service!  We were seated quickly, ordered promptly, food came out quickly, and the wait staff was attentive throughout our experience!  The chicken parm is excellent and the tiramisu is second to none!

I love Cake Boss & Buddy so we went to his restaurant on our recent trip to Vegas. We were a group of 5 vegetarians. We ordered a couple antipastos & pastas. The service was good but the food was ok. Nothing was spectacular. We went with high expectations but were not impressed at all. For dessert we ordered Lisa's Nutella cake which was good. I will add that I liked the decor of the restaurant but that won't bring us back.

I didn't have my phone with me last night. Forgot to check-in. Bf & I wanted to go to Trattoria but it was closed because they were expanding. So we ended coming here. And it turns out that it was Buddy's place! Cake boss!!! Awesome!! Wait time was an hour, we put our name down and went shopping around to kill time. We got sitted in front of the kitchen. It was awesome to see the cooks say "yes chef!" Decoration had whisk, bundt pans, and rolling pins hanging off the ceilings. Cool! Yelpers said the portions are big so bf and I decided to share. No splitting fee. We got the calamari and chicken Parm. The focaccia bread was warm, soft, and perfect. The dipping was olive oil & balsamic vinegar. It was well balanced. Our order was taking soo long. Then our waiter came back with the wrong order for our appetizer. He was so confused. We were confused. He goes back to the kitchen and we hear the head chef get angry and started to yell at the waiter. The manager comes to our table apologize and pays for our appetizer. Great service!! Finally our appetizer arrived! Our calamari was perfect. Lightly battered, soft, and the sauce was great! It wasn't chewy! I hate chewy calamari! Our entree chicken parm was perfect as well. Well seasoned, lightly battered, juicy, thin, and huge!! No room for dessert this time.Next time we will come back and try the dessert too!

Buddy V's place , after watching cake boss I had to try this place on my visit to Vegas and I am glad I did :)

We ordered :
Ice tea : refreshing
Vegetarian Pasta: one of the best I have had till date 
Eggplant parmigiana :  super yum ! 

Service : 5/5
Food : 5/5

Only regret I have is I didn't try the dessert , will have to come back for that :)

One of my favorite restaurant. I ate the shrimp scampi and it was amazing. The portions are very big so make sure you're hungry. For dessert the nutella cake is super delicious the cake super moist and soft.

I have eaten here twice and have been very impressed both times! The service was great!
The food is amazing. Best pizza ever. The crust is the perfect combination of soft and crisp. Tomato sauce has just enough spice. My kids, who aren't sausage lovers, thought the sausage was amazing!

I have also had the vegetable salad which has just a little lettuce and TONS of vegetables. The steak - tender, juicy!

I can't wait to return!

The atmosphere was nice and the decore is beautiful.  I love the way the kitchen is open so you're able to see the food being prepared.  The surf & turf was good the steak was very tender. The olive oil  mashed potatoes were to die for! The staff was super friendly and made sure that our glasses stayed full and all of our needs were met. Excellent experience.

After losing a small fortune in a matter of minutes I didn't think I could be so happy so quickly. Buddy V's was literally on of the best restaurant I have been to in Vegas. To start the lobster tail (dessert) could make a grown man cry of joy, I literally would have been happy to stick a straw in it and suck out all the cream out instead of actually ordering a meal (Which is what I did the following day, pretty sure i gained about 10lbs just off of lobster tail filling)

Enough about the dessert (I'll be talking more about it more when I write my Carlos Bakery review, yes it was that good!) The entrees are not something to overlook either. Let me start out by saying I am a somewhat food snob when it comes to classier restaurant. While I have left some places questioning the quality based on what I paid this is certainly not one of those times. As far as Italian food goes it doesn't get much better, the quality is spectacular and there is nothing that I would have changed. To top it off the portions were HUGE! Being a guy in his early 20's of course I forced myself to eat every bite. However most people would have probably took half of it to go.

If you are ever in Las Vegas do yourself a favor and stop by Buddy V's for dinner.

Excellent food!  I had the chicken parm.  The chicken was good but the spaghetti side that came with it was fantastic!  The pasta was perfect and the sauce was the perfect amount and a great taste.  I look forward to returning.  Great environment too.  Yum!!!!

The design of the place is awesome and cozy..so many cool details. Service is on point...very friendly and attentive staff. Food isn't anything you haven't had before but simple and good, nonetheless. I wouldn't come here for a special occasion..more of a casual lunch spot in my opinion. Tomato soup is excellent and so was the pasta with vodka sauce..worth a visit. Enjoy!
Absolutely amazing!! The spaghetti and meatballs and chicken parm were the best I have ever had! The Nutella cake was chocolate heaven!!

The last two times in Vegas I've eaten at Buddy V's. Both times I've had the smashed meatball sandwich. Big thumbs up! Meatball subs are, in my opinion, generally too dry, but the two I've had at Buddy's have been pretty moist. The parmesan fries are hot and crispy, they were very good. Sevice has been good, no problems in that area. My one complaint was the first time I went I got breadsticks, second time none. I am not a fan of Cake Boss so I was really just there for the food, next time I might try something different like chicken parm. Both times I was there it was a weekday afternoon right when they opened so it was not crowded. There was a lot of people at Buddy's bakery across the hall though.

Went for lunch - I would give it 3 1/2 stars.

The sauce was good, meatballs OK and service very good.

If I had to go back, I would, but I would not seek it out.

Very pleasantly surprised.  Granted, my friends and I stopped by just for a light lunch, so we didn't have any entrees.  But the eggplant parm appetizier, garlic bread and panzanella salad were superb!

Stopped for a few drinks and appetizers. 

Service was good. We ordered 2 specialty drinks to try something new and they were great. Mine was the sweet tea vodka drink. Yum!  I wish I had the names. 

We had the garlic bread and meatballs and they hit the spot.  The meatballs were perfect. Very tasty and not dried out. 

Would go again.
Best tomato basil soup I have ever had! I also had the margarita pizza, it was not the best pizza I was disappointed. My wife had the Chicken Parmesan it was fabulous.

This place has quality Italian cuisine. The salumi and cheese board are high quality ingredients and a must have! This appetizer would feed up to 4 people. The chicken with vodka sauce was delicious. The sauce was perfectly seasoned and the chicken was tender. I did get the famous dessert "Buddy V Lobster Tail". It was a croissant style pastry shaped like a lobster tail filled with cream. It looked really fun, but the pastry was so hard I couldn't cut it with a fork. Other than the dessert everything else was great!

Nothing to write home about. The food was good, but the service was a bit odd. Maybe it was because we were seated in the bar area and it was just a server "free for all" but we had probably three or four different people helping us. You would think "hey, awesome! You must have been really taken care of!" But no, we found ourselves repeating orders or answering the same question to several different people which became annoying. Prices were Vegas high, which is no surprise. So yeah, just a "meh" experience!

I will say this, it is nice to see service return to Veags in a big way. From the minute we walked in we felt like family. Awesome, awesome, awesome friendly folks and they really care. Food is fabulous.
Service was amazing and they were very attentive. I tried the chicken parmesan and spaghetti which was delicious. There lasagna was humongous. Overall a 5 out of 5.

I love it when a place holds up to expectations. Not that I had anything to compare it to, other than fancy, but family style strip Italian places. I can't wait to return. I will take the long annoying walk from valet for it, it's that good. 
My sister and I took my dad here for his 60'th birthday. We didn't want to be too fancy, but still wanted authentic Italian food. I am so glad we went out on a limb and tried Buddy V's! 
They have a selection of appetizers, most named after a family member. Then for entrees they offer pasta, meatballs, veal, chicken, tons of Italian classics! As a family of 6 Italians at the table, I can tell you we were very satisfied. My dad wanted a veal picatta. They have chicken picatta, and veal angelo, so they didn't hesitate to make him the dish he wanted. 
I went with a Sunday gravy dish, and it exceeded expectations. The appetizer platter of select meats and cheeses was phenomenal! Literally the best prosciutto and blue cheese I ever tasted. 
We skipped on dessert because of course we went across the hall to Carlo's! I am sure it was the same cannolis, but it's the point! 
This will be an Italian place I continue to come to over the years. It hit the spot!

Amazing service & food.
We were served by charles and he was the best server ive ever had. He really knows whats hes doing . Buddy should be greatful he has him representing his business!! 

Charles gave us advice about vegas attractions, and gave us advice about the menu... boy was he right. Get the bolanase speghitti amazing!!!!

Poor service, over-priced and mediocre food at best. They were not accommodating to special requests such as a different pasta sauce or adding cracked red pepper to a dish. People come here for the name but leave thinking Buddy V should stick to cake instead of restaurants.

Had chicken parm with a side of rigatoni. The chicken was dry and fair tasting. Not a great example of traditional Italian chicken parm. The rigatoni was very tasty, though could have used more sauce. Overall not a bad meal, but was expecting more from them. Pricey, but typical for Vegas.

Pass...  We love Cake Boss, so this place was a no brainer, despite bad reviews on Trip Advisor and some here.  The service was wholly underwhelming, except for the thin older gentlemen who filled our water and brought us bread, he was the only good part of the evening!!!!  The server was courteous but rushed she paid us little attention and it took forever to place an order, to get a dessert menu, and get the bill.  We definitely did not feel like Famiglia:(  Sorry, Buddy, this place needs LOTS of customer service training.

Food: Meh, the lasagne was forgettable, my wife liked the Sunday Gravy OK...  Portions were HUGE, Italian Birthday cake was AMAZING!!!

Traveled to Las Vegas and had dinner at Buddy's!
Restaurant was super nice and clean, open kitchen in the center of the restaurant. My wife and I had spaghetti and meatballs, a Caesar salad and garlic bread. Food was great and reasonably priced based on the quantity and quality. Staff was great and the manager on duty was very friendly.

Let me start off by saying that I did not know that Buddy can cook.  My overall satisfaction is definitely five stars I love his salad I would have never imagined that a Salad could taste so delicious; especially with the croutons and fresh mozzarella I even tasted the ground peppers on that salad.  I'm so glad that I went to his restaurant at Las Vegas it was once in a life time experience and the first time is always the best.

The sea bass was very tasty. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars was that all I had on the plate was the bass and an itty bitty salad....more of a decoration. A small vegetable garnish would have made the plate. I think the plate was $29. It was overpriced for what was received

I had the panzanella salad, and it was delicious!!!! I was looking for something light to eat but with substance since I was going out to drink later that night (vegas, go figure). Perfect amount of veggies to cheese. Yum!!!

For dessert, we ordered the lobster tail! So good. We came for my bachelorette dinner so they even decorated it for me!! Although the "flaky pastry" was a little too crunchy for me, the custard cream and fresh fruits were perfection!! 

Definitely get the lobster tail next time you're here!!

Das Restaurant ist im Hotel Venetian gelegen. 
Wir sind dort spontan aufgetaucht und haben auch ohne Reservierung noch einen Platz bekommen. 

Allerdings nur im Bereich der Bar an einem kleinen Tisch für Zwei mitten im Raum. 
Etwas ungemütlich platziert. 

Die Geräuschkulisse ist extrem anstrengend. Man muss sich ziemlich laut unterhalten. Dabei ist es egal, wo man genau sitzt, da der ganze Laden einfach laut ist. Das wird auch nicht besser, wenn die Live-Musik aus Schlagzeug und Keyboard wieder anfängt zu spielen. An der Stilrichtung der Musik ist allerdings nichts auszusetzen. 

Wie zu erwarten ist das Essen typisch italienisch. Man kann sogar zwischen der uns bekannten Bolognese-Sauce und der Soße mit Meatballs wählen. 
Wir haben die erste Variante genommen. Die Nudel waren schön al dente und die Sauce sehr lecker abgeschmeckt und mit reichlich Fleisch. Portion war auch angemessen. 

Für den Preis muss man halt Vegas-Maßstäbe ansetzen, aber immer noch erträglich. 

Abzüge gebe ich aufgrund der Lautstärke. Nach dem ganzen Trubel am Tag wäre es schön beim Essen Abends mal etwas die Ohren entspannen zu können. 
Zu beachten ist auch, dass der Laden schon um 22 Uhr schließt. Wir haben gerade noch Glück gehabt, kamen aber auch schon in den Genuss des abendlichen Aufräumend um uns rum.

I had a couple of friends in town to celebrate a 21st birthday. We tried a few options; the club, people watching, etc but it wasn't living up to The Experience (although I am local) for my friends. We ended up stopping by at Buddy V's and Joy, the bartender there, completely turned our night around... From her wonderful personality to the detail she put into creating and explaining our cocktails - THAT is what Vegas is about. The experience. We didn't plan on being there last night but we spent a good 2-3 hours there having a wonderful time and joy ended up giving my friend the experience we were all looking to get.

I'm a big fan of his bakeries, so I had high expectations and this place definitely delivered. Nice, swanky look to the place, GREAT view of the strip and even a giant billboard against the backdrop of the Wynn and Encore that was pretty cool to have there. I actually don't really like Italian food, but I thought the food was great. Great service too. The clientele was nice and above-casual. The desserts were amazing. Would definitely come here again. Best part is, when you leave, Buddy's famous Carlo's Bakery is right there!

Good Italian food with a fun, casual atmosphere.

When we are in town we love to go to Buddy V's.

My first Buddy V's experience was truly amazing! It was Sunday Brunch so I was expecting the typical all you can eat eggs and bacon. There was nothing typical about the fabulous offerings. 

First the all you can drink package included way more variety than what you usually get at a "champagne brunch". The options included certain wine, beer, bloody marys, mimosas, sangria AND bellinis. We ended up trying almost everything and I can't say a bad word about any of it. The fruit was so fresh and delicious in the sangria and the red wine and champagne were top quality. 

 The service was prompt and the waiters and bussers were extremely attentive. Our glasses were never empty, our table was never dirty. The staff was also helpful in making sure we knew where everything was and offered suggestions on the food and drinks. 

Speaking of food... The first thing I noticed was that the food was put out in small batches to keep everything fresh. You could really taste the freshness. The Italian offerings were obviously great and I couldn't believe the antipasto area. Everything was so delicious from the fresh, perfectly cooked shrimp to the very flavorful meatballs. I barely left room for dessert. I was able to take one little bite of most things and well... there are no words!

I can't wait to go back

My friends and I decided to stop in buddy v's for our last night in Vegas to get some homemade Italian food. 11/4/16. We had made reservations for 8pm for 7 and by the time that came around we still had to wait half an hour for them to clear the table and what not. After being seated we were giving menu and drink menu. Everything sounded really good and look delicious! I order the madiline penne and my friends all ordered something different. The food came out fairly quick, but it seemed like our waiter kept on forgetting what we had. The service was okay, but it was as they were almost rude. The food was also okay it wasn't as expected. I've actually had better! So overall buddy v is just hype because of the TV show. At this point it was an experience and that it's really up to you if you'd like to try it out. Give it a try and see what you think.

Did you know the owner of this place is like a famous chef or baker or something? Yea, I didn't know either....but I was schooled by my boyfriend's 60-something year old mom. Learn something new everyday!

Our party of 8 came here around 10:30pm on a Sunday evening. We got seated quickly, even with our big party. None of us were very hungry, so we ordered all appetizers or small dishes and a couple of drinks. 

My boyfriend and I shared a Margherita Pizza (definitely big enough for two -- has about 8 small pieces). Both my boyfriend and I agreed that the pizza was really tasty! We happily ate the whole thing. It was cooked just right and was hot and steamy when it got to our table. Just the way I like it! I also ordered a Salad...I don't remember the name of it, but it was decent sized and tasted fresh. I was so full on pizza, I couldn't eat my whole salad. I definitely could have just done one or the other. 

I don't remember what the rest of my party ordered. There was a variety of dishes, but they all must have been good because I don't remember anything left on anyone's plate when we were done. This means the food was delicious! Or else we were all just hungry. Either way, it was good overall. 

Service was great. Our server was friendly and personable. I like that when it comes to servers!

My only gripe was that our food took forever to come out. We waited a good 15+ minutes before anything came out. That was a long time considering they weren't that crowded or busy when we were there. They may need to work out some kinks in the kitchen. 

On a side note, this restaurant has good views of the strip. I really liked that, and I spent awhile gazing out at the bright lights and the busyness of the strip. Good people watching!

Overall, I enjoyed my time at Buddy V's. I would definitely come back here again on another visit to Vegas!

Cheers!

My brother claims the garlic cheese bread takes like its made by Jesus... And it does. Most amazing garlic cheese bread ever. Although, fettuccine Alfredo is not on the menu.. You can order Alfredo with other noodles and chicken. My brother rated that a 5. My mom got the chicken Parmesan and said it was a 5 star meal as well. I got the spaghetti with meatballs and I have to go with my mom and brother and say mine was 5 stars as well.

Much better than expected...thought it was another gimmick restaurant.  Very happy with all our dishes, we ordered 3 different appetizers and 5 entrees and 2 kids plates.  Would be 5 stars but hostess made me wait in front of her for over a minute before acknowledging me...not cool....just raise your head up and say I'll be with you in a second.

My wife and I were in Vegas from Atlanta, relaxing and enjoying her birthday weekend. 
Bobby V's was one of the eatery's I specifically wanted to visit while we were here. Upon being seated we were met with welcoming and friendly customer/guest service. 
Caleb was our server and hit a Grand Slam in doing so. He was very attentive to our request and even provided suggestions when I seemed unsure. 
I ordered the Tomato & Basil soup and my wife ordered the  Aunt Nina's Mozzarella en Carozza for appetizers. At first bite, the authenticity of the food was evident and the Riesling and Moscato wine that followed were right on time. 
Shortly after finishing the appetizers, our entrees showed up and my wife's Capellini Shrimp Scampi and my Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno  dishes pushed the experience over the top. 
All the while being treated like relatives by Adam, the Asst. General Manager. I pulled Adam to the side and mentioned that I had a confession and that was, that my wife and I eat out a lot, while home and this was the best all around experience we've had in a long time and thanked him for the wonderful experience. 
The cherry on top was when they brought out a piece of Chocolate Expresso cake, on the house, for the Mrs.'s birthday and a couple of lattes.
This customer service is what I strive to exemplify in my own business at Ambassador Barbershop, Atlanta, GA, because long term relationships are better than short term money, any day. 
Adam and Caleb, we'll see you next time we're in Vegas.
Thanks again,
K. Jones

Came here with clients our company brought to vegas. Wanted a place with good food and low cost. Very satisfied! Good service, good food, nice view of the strip from certain parts of the restaurant, cosy family feel. Ordered the bone-in milanesa and it was AMAZING! overall great fun and good food. :)
Food was ok. Host sat us at the bar when she said that the dinning room was full. After us a bigger party came in and they were sat in the dinning room.

After trying to get a table at other places, we went here. It's not that we didn't think it would be good, but didn't want to go to yet another celebrity-associated restaurant. Enough with the names and prices to go with it. We were pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed it. 

There was a wait at 8pm on a Sunday night, so reservations help. We were told the wait would be an hour. We made reservations on-line and only waited 25 minuets! 

The decor is nice-- the ceiling light fixtures are cool. Big whisk attachments-cool use for them. They have an open kitchen and it smells wonderful. Lots of red and dark wood, feels very comfortable. 

We ordered a Caesar salad, garlic bread and panzenella salad to start. The Caesar salad was the best I've had in a long time. Very garlicky, croutons that were warm, soft with a little crunch and a hint of fennel in the salad.  Just the perfect amount of fresh Parmesan cheese. The panzenella was delicious with the same lovely bread, fresh tomatoes and a great dressing. The garlic bread was cheesy, dense and delicious. Just like you imagine good garlic cheese bread should be. 

For dinner, we ordered the spaghetti Bolognese ( for the little one), lasagna, and the Sunday Gravy. The little one wanted lasagna instead, so I traded with him. The kids' spaghetti was plenty for an adult ( I left half of it at that) and incredible. Some of the best I've had that I can remember. The lasagna, although expensive for what it is, was equally delicious. Baked in a cast-iron pan, it was warm, gooey and delicious, with a light tomato sauce on top. The Sunday Gravy was good, but he agreed that  the Bolognese and lasagna were infinitely better. 

We didn't order dessert, but those around us who ordered got cannoli, which looked fantastic. By the way, Carlo's Bakery is across from Buddy V's if you want something for later. 

We would definitely go back and definitely recommend!

Mike was our busser...nuff said...that's how good the service was, we remembered his name!

Ah yes...the chicken parm was off the chain!!!

Herb bread has a very strong flavor. Lots of herbs. Their cheeses on the adult Mac n cheese is out of this world. There is ham an peas in it. I am a vegetarian so I was surprised that there was ham bits in the Mac n cheese. Salad was very fresh and dressing definitely homemade. Spaghetti bolognes was a very generous portion and tastes of Italy! Excellent ambiance!

Sorry...not a fan. We opted to do Sunday brunch and the food was just not good. The hot offerings had 2 types of eggs, chicken parm, frittata, and pastas. It was cold and gummy. Mac and cheese was saturated with oil. Carving station had your choice of apple sausage, Italian sausage, and Ham. They were so stingy with the meats only giving you one piece of meat. Nothing special about that. Peel and eat shrimp was good and the panzanella salad. The salad was very light and refreshing. Desserts pretty to look at but sadly, disappointing, even the famed cannolli's not enjoyable. Waitress was too busy flirting with guys instead of serving us. Not acceptable nor enjoyable for brunch.

My Fiancé and I had dinner here on a weeknight. The service was prompt and attentive...perhaps a bit awkwardly overly attentive, but no complaints here. The food was discouraging though - It was only so-so. Afterward we moved onto dessert and had the birthday cake and it was mind blowingly good. I have never had better. Although a fan of the show, I can now say I've experienced why Buddy is called the Cake Boss. The disappointment came at the check...we split all dished: an appetizer, main dish, and desert with ice cream and had no drinks....$76. I probably won't return to the restaurant, but I sure will hit the bakery when it opens up next door.

thankfully it was right where we entered the hotel (from the pedestrian walkway/bridge), so we didn't have to walk far into the venetian lol... there's a lil tables w/ chairs and umbrellas section by the windows near the entrance of the pedestrian walkway/bridge (it's right by huge open windows, no screens so birds literally flew in and ate crumbs off the tables!! idk if u like birds w/ ur meals but i sure wouldn't.. idk y they don't have screens on the windows! but yeah this is their version of an outdoor patio i guess) and also  there's even more extra seating outside the restaurant if u wanna be in the venetian hotel corridor and do people watching (but this section was roped off when we were there). anyway so we find out we didn't have to wait either :))) we got a nice table by the window so we got a nice view of the strip. our waiter was very nice and informative all around. the bread provided was errr different lol but VERY soft which i appreciated, but def do NOT use the oil concoction provided, OMGOSH it has a horrible taste!!! it only lasts a couple secs but man i was tempted to spit it out lol and my husband actually did.. i dunno, maybe the waiter did the concoction wrong? anyone else get bad flavor w/ it?? i really don't see the appeal of that stuff *shrugs.. anyway, i ordered the 'valastro sunday gravy' which is rigatoni pasta w/ various meats: meatballs, sausage, pork, and lamb.. everything was really soft and tender! however, the meatballs didn't taste like i like em (oh well) and the pasta sauce looked a bit orange rather than red, i don't wanna be insulting but my husband did say 'chef boyardee' when he tried my rigatoni lol.. it was still good tho and great portions. also, the server who brought it actually took the meats out of the lil pot they come in and placed em on my plate of rigatoni for me, i thought that was a nice touch :)...
  
i also got 2 desserts which the waiter suggested i do cuz i asked him if it was better to get desserts in the restaurant or across in the bakery (price-wise, etc). he suggested the restaurant for the lisa's warm nutella cake (i love nutella so this was a must and tasted very good when i had it later that nite). the lil cake has a filling of peanut butter (if i remember right) in the middle, it was thick lol, i wish i had eaten it when i was in the restaurant still... also, it comes w/ salted caramel ice cream which i wasn't a fan of the taste.. i like my ice cream sweet lol, not salty so that was an adjustment for my taste buds but i ate most of it nonetheless.. the crunchy bits that came w/ it were tasty tho IMO... and of course i had to get the tiramisu (i LOVE tiramisu so i was having high expectations w/ this!) it came in this lil jar deal w/ a few lady finger cookies on the side. i was pretty satisfied w/ the tiramisu but i do wish it was more traditionally plated (a square freely on the plate.. idk what it is about vegas strip restaurants putting desserts in jars lol). a nice lil touch is, they give u an italiany postcard saying thank u on it w/ the check which i appreciated and brought home as a souvenir! :) overall, the food wasn't to die for IMO, w/ buddy's shows and cooking/baking being his forte, u'd think his restaurant would be amazing food-wise, but idk maybe the chefs were having an off day or it should've been cooked by buddy himself lol... either way, i still adore the guy and will continue to watch his TLC shows happily as i have been since day 1!

Had a delicious dinner with my husband. The Venetian Hotel is a sight to see and the food at Buddy Vs was incredible- possibly the best I've ever had. I had the Bronzino and my husband had the chicken parm- Wow. My martini was incredibly good. No dessert- we were super satisfied from our dinner.

Usually we find with celebrity places that the impression outweighs the quality of what we anticipate we are going to have. 
Such is not the case with Buddy V. The food was amazing from grands meatballs to egg frittata and red velvet cake. We went for brunch and between both of us tasted all we could with no complaints at all.
The service was great and everything tasted homemade from family recipes. We didn't eat again the rest of the day and there was something for everyone (except fish) since its Italian.
I do have a suggestion though:
If you are eating at Buddy's how about providing a menu for the pastry shop across the way and having those to go orders ready and waiting. Having to wait in line shouldn't be something you have to do if you have already splurged on the meal.
Pricey but worth it. Reservations recommended'

Wow what can I say about this place. Let me start by saying we had high hopes for this place. However, the reality is that this place was mediocre at best. I will start with the good. The service was good, the meatball appetizer was good, and the fresh bread was great. This is where it stops, the spaghetti was somewhat chef boyardee tasting and the chicken parmigiana lacked flavor. Consequently the only flavor from that dish was from the cheese, which was all cheese no chicken. At this point the wife and I chalk it up to a loss and believing the hype and figures hey the desert has to be good, after all it's the cake boss right. WRONG!!!! This was probably the most disappointing part of the meal we got the cannoli and tiramisu. The cannoli was bland and lacked any depth and the tiramisu was also boring lacked any real flavor and to boot was but in a small Masson jar. Oh let's not forget the cookies that were served with the cannoli they were as hard as a biscotti. Now I can chalk up the good as a loss but the desert really?! That should have been second to none. The bottom line, if you want good Italian food and dessert go anywhere else but this overrated excuse of an Italian restaurant!!!!

Surprisingly delicious! My son and I dropped by Buddy V's for lunch and really enjoyed it. We sort of expected a "cheesy," chain style feeling. We were wrong!  The restaurant is spacious and nicely decorated. He had the $22 Express Lunch (he chose meatballs, chicken parm and a cannoli) and I chose the Caesar salad with grilled shrimp (included these amazing polenta croutons!). Everything was tasty and the portion sizes were filling and just right for lunch. The service was extremely friendly and attentive from the servers, hostess, busboy, etc. We look forward to visiting Buddy V's again next time we're in town and would recommend it for anyone looking for a casual, low-key, fair priced and tasty meal.

My last meal before heading back to oc was here during summer. It's so hard to leave Vegas when you are having fun and with family. I celebrated my mom's bday early here and service was beyond exceptional. We 5 of us were seated in a booth, dinner was about to begin, it was a Sunday but eating here made it feel like we were really away on vacation. The calamari was well seasoned, not too much battered, and crispy. We had Moretti's and it went well with our meals. I love Italian food and the pasta was cooked perfectly and not too al dente.  For us cali drivers, a heavy meal is not the way to go before heading home. Plus the 100 degree weather doesn't help so much. We were stuffed and with to go boxes. They gave us a little cute cookie plate for dessert. I want to come back here for a romantic dinner next trip. Thank you Buddy V's!!

I was a little worried about dining at Buddy's since he's know for his pastries, but my experience was superb.

My friends treated me to Buddy V's for my birthday. We went in on a Sunday around 5pm with no wait. 
We ordered from the prix fixe menu which I believe was $39 for three courses, and we also order the highly recommended lasagna. We ordered meatballs and Caesar salad our starters, chicken parm for our main and ended with Lisa's Nutella cake for dessert. We were also given complementary bread.

In one word, go! Everything was unbelievably amazing. Even the croutons on the salad, which are made to order with a crunchy exterior and warm, soft interior. I always seem to go to Italian restaurants for my birthday, and this is by far the best that I've been to. It's a little pricey, but so worth it.

After spending most of the day in the sportsbook, I was ready to chow down and my belly was craving some Italian food. Upon check in at the Palazzo, my wife and I were handed a coupon book to select restaurants, bars, etc. inside of the Venetian and Palazzo. This included a coupon for Buddy V.'s. So we decided give this place a shot when we saw that this place had opened recently and had received four stars on Yelp. 

We started off on the light side of things with a Caesar salad. There was nothing particularly great about this salad except for the croutons. I'm not really a crouton fan because they tend to be too bland, salty and/or crunchy.  Normally I would pass over them completely. After my wife urged me multiple times and after I had refused multiple times, I saw my wife's fork with a crouton on the end of it right smack in front of my mouth. I succumbed to peer pressure and tasted what was probably one of the best croutons ever. The crouton had a crunchy exterior and then evolved to a smooth and creamy interior with a terrific garlic flavor inside. It was so delicious that I had to fight my wife for the rest.  Looking back, she probably regrets shoving that crouton in my mouth. 

I ordered the Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno which was served in an incredibly hot iron skillet. I think the cheese was still bubbling a little bit when they brought it out to our table. This was probably one of the thickest lasagnas I have eaten in a long time. This lasagna came with generous portions of fresh Italian sausage and ground beef and layered with ricotta, mozzarella and provolone cheeses. The marinara sauce was a perfect blend of sweetness and spiciness and had settled to mostly the sides of the lasagna. The top was sprinkled with a tiny amount of Italian parsley. This was one of the best lasagnas I have had in a long time. Each bite melted in my mouth. There was no doubt I was going to finish dish.

Because of the reviews, tips, and photos of meatballs on Yelp, my wife had to go with the meatball spaghetti. Needless to say, she polished off the dish easily and said it was one of the best meatball spaghettis she had tasted. The meatballs at Buddy V.'s inspired her to go home and cook some meatballs herself. I think that in itself should speak volumes about their meatballs.

We had just enough room at the end to split their Tiramisu which was equally as delicious as our entrees. It was a nice touch to include a side of lady fingers in order to swipe any remaining coffee flavored cream at the end with them.

The service here was top notch. Our waitress was fully knowledgeable about the menu and was ready to offer suggestions. She was great from start to finish! 

Even with the coupon, I agree with the other reviewers that say this restaurant is on the pricey side.
