My family owned an Italian deli/bakery for 26 years (9 of which I worked) so I know what homemade sauce, meatballs, sausage, etc tastes like.
 
With that being said, my girlfriend and I were very happy with our meals and exceptional service. Walked in around 5PM on a Tuesday night. We were quickly seated. We each ordered a sangria which shockingly were only $4 each since it was happy hour. They were delicious. Lots of good fruit in them. They were not cheapened because of HR.
 
We each ordered the same dinner, the rigatoni with lamb, pork, meatballs. and sausage. At a $26 price tag, I was very happy. Most Strip Italian places will charge $18+ just a plate of spaghetti alone. We meats were tender and delicious as was the sauce. The pasta, cook perfectly. Freshly baked bread was served before dinner as well. Again, delicious.
 
I look forward to returning. The service was as stellar as the food.

Came in with group of seven. Said 40 minute wait and was seated around 20 mins (so early).  Took a awhile to order food. And they were out of pizza at 8:30p (so I take it they are frozen)....  So not a good start to the night.

I was all excited to eat at Cake Boss Buddy V's and it was a treat.. The staff is very very friendly and made me at home!! This is a very relaxing place with tables that gives you a killer view of the strip.. I always wanted to try the Grandma's Meatballs that Buddy V is popular for and man they were soooooooo good !! Full of flavour and moist .. Simply an awesome brunch for me!! 

Next is to head to his Shop right in front the Carlo's Bake Shop for the famous Cannolis !!! I am soooo full :) ....

SERVICE 
+  Excellent Service. Super friendly staffs.

AMBIANCE 
+ Fun and loud. 

FOOD
+ Aunt Ninas Mozerella en Carozza $12 // Good
+ Tomato Bique $9 // Good
+ Bucatini Carbonara $24 // Okay 
+ Bone in Veal Parm Chop $42 // Good

DRINK
+ Drago Rosso $14 // Good
+ Sicilian Tea $16 // Skip 

DESSERT 
+ Lobster Tail $9 // Okay 

NOTE
+ Cake Boss!
+ Takes reservation. 
+ Good price.
+ Would like to come back for Sunday Brunch Buffie.

Like I said about the bakery, this place symbolizes overrated businesses glamorized by the media for no justifiable reason:

The spaghetti my sister ordered was extremely sour and the flavor was disgusting. One bite of it and my insides starting screaming. Mid-way through the meal, my sister needed to use the restroom.. for a while. 

My margherita pizza? Equivalent to the taste and thickness of a napkin. Zero flavor and toppings spread so thin, they must have evaporated upon baking.

After dinner, I left it to Lisa's Nutella Cake with Salted Caramel ice cream to save Buddy V's reputation. I mean, there's no way someone can mess those flavors up - the title alone is perfect. I was wrong. Overly sweet, dense, rich - one bite was too much (and must have contained at least 75g of sugar). The ice cream had nothing salted or caramel about it. I am a huge lover of desserts - and this made me so so sad.

Summary:
+long wait, pricey, not good - Why would you come here?

This joint was classy and service was great. Located in the Venetian Hotel, this is one of many great Italian restaurants that offer a unique dining experience. My mom and daughter and I were all under the weather with a stomach bug and was disappointed that we couldn't get the upmost experience but we ordered the shrimp scampi, served with pasta. The shrimp was huge fresh and delicious. My daughter and I split the Filet served with mash potatoes...fabulous in both flavor and presentation and they divided it for us at no extra charge. We were so upset that we were not feeling well enough to experience anything on the dessert menu. I hope we can get back soon. I only have two complaints: the music was really loud so it was really hard to have a conversation and there were two, I assume, managers, one man in a suit and the other a lady, who cased the joint like they were one of the Sapranos...I understand they are paid to keep the place running smooth but I felt like if you had checked his pockets, you would find a pair of brass nuckles or something worse #RoadtripUSA

First thing first - Standout dishes:

- Buddy's Caprese: I am normally not a fan of Caprese salads, but Buddy really nails this one. High quality ingredients, and finely tuned flavors make this a worthwhile starter.

- Cheese Ravioli: I know what you're thinking. "I can get cheese ravioli anywhere." Yes, you can. The great thing about the ravioli at Buddy V's, however, is that it is a perfect companion to Buddy's outstanding roasted tomato sauce. It's bright, tangy, smooth, and well rounded all at the same time. Definitely memorable fare.

- Cannoli: I am normally not what you would call a "fan" of cannoli, but, once again, Buddy has proved me wrong. Most cannoli, in my experience, are disappointing in their grainy, and under-sweetened filling. Not so with these cannoli. Perfectly sweetened, incredibly smooth filling paired with just the right amount of cinnamon in the pastry make these cannoli worth writing home about. (Added perk: After eating at Buddy V's, you can walk right across the hall, and buy a whole box of cannoli from Carlo's Bakery to eat back at the hotel if you are so inclined.)

Now, to business. There is definitely no shortage of Italian food on the Las Vegas Strip, but Buddy V's is definitely a major standout. Even among all of the other celebrity chef restaurants to be found in Vegas, the Cake Boss is definitely holding his own.

My wife and I stopped by for lunch one afternoon, and had a great time. Our experience was so good, though, that we went back for dinner two days later. For lunch we just stopped by, but for dinner we made reservations through OpenTable. Neither time was the place so busy one would need reservations in order to avoid a wait, however.

Here are some highlights of Buddy V's worth noting:

- The service at Buddy V's is excellent. They are easily on par with restaurants with much higher price points.

- Having worked in food service, I am hyper-sensitive about cleanliness. I had absolutely no complaints here, however. The entire restaurant is very clean, comfortable, and inviting.

- The pricing of most menu items is very reasonable in comparison with many similar Vegas eateries.

- The whiskey/scotch selection at Buddy V's bar is truly impressive. It's not hard to find a bar that serves Johnnie Walker Black anywhere, but one that serves Johnnie Walker Green, Gold, and Blue is tough to find at any price point.

- Unlike most restaurants in the Venetian, Buddy V's is right near an entrance making it an easy place to duck in for a meal without having to stray too far from the strip.

Final pro tip: Be sure to note on your reservation that you are celebrating a birthday, if that is the case. They have some fun, no-loud-obnoxious-singing-involved surprises for birthday-folk. I would imagine the same is true for most other celebrations as well.

What a fun place to dine. We went for lunch. The service was amazing and fast. All employees were very nice. We ate off the lunch express menu which was more than enough. Sangria was delicious. Bloody Mary was good but a bit on spicy side. Would highly recommend this restaurant especially if looking for a place Away from casino. Loved it! Don't forget to go across the hall to Carlos bakery. Get there as soon as they open!

I'm a huge fan of Cake Boss, so I just had to visit the bakery and try the restaurant. I was impressed with the food. Everyone in my group ordered something different: spaghetti, pizza, and chicken parm. The chicken parm was my favorite. Also, the inside of the restaurant looked really neat. It's a fun place to eat at, and it is definitely a place you need to visit if you're a fan of Cake Boss! Also, I recommend the cannoli's! They are to die for! The cannoli cream was delicious and sweet! In fact, even if you're not hungry for a full meal, I recommend stopping by for a cannoli as a snack or dessert.

Awesome atmosphere, awesome food, awesome location. Staff was friendly but not attentive (most into gossiping with each other). 

We ordered the calamari appetiser, chicken pasta and chicken parma. Everything was delusions and the calamari is a must have, however the chicken in the pasta was quite tough as it was reheated and not freshly cooked. Pasta on the other hand was al dente. 

For dessert we got the XL Lobster tail (if you have not tried this, you are missing out on a whole new world). And the trio of donuts (good but not something I would order again).

Had a great meal , very traditional Italian offerings !  I ate the Sunday gravy special & it was perfect - just like grandma's !  The atmosphere, staff, decor was all very friendly & roomy.  If your looking for traditional Italian that's fairly priced - you found it !  I would return for sure.

Impeccable service.

Great ambience!

Fantastic view of the strip.

BEST. FOOD. EVER. 

EVER!

If I could, I would eat the chicken parm here every night for the rest of my life.

I loved this place. It reminded me of the old Villa Penza and other old school joints where the cook or the owner mingles and sits with you for a while and makes you feel at home even though they know you are leaving.  These are the special touches that made the old school joints what they were with tile floors and checkered tablecloths and the food was nectar of the gods and 'ambience' was for people who didnt know anything about food.

These elements gave us the confidence to break some rules like 'never order spaghetti and clam sauce outside of the metropolitan area'.

The simplicity of this dish was a revelation.  The DeCecco macaroni was cooked to perfection, It was the perfect platform for the teeny tiny baby clams that are mandatory for this dish and no substitutions.  The fragrance of the baby clams, the garlic, the textures, it was just magnificent and like no other commercially prepared dish we have had in years.  Kudos!

I dont like sitting on top of the kitchen.  Its too loud and too hot.  This was neither.  It was very entertaining.  They were loving the food they were preparing and it made you that much more excited about how good it was going to be to see this.

The veal marsala was fantastic.  It was good quality veal and the marsala was not cloying and sickeningly sweet as the cheap marsalas are.  This was proper marsala.

The osso buco was great, cooked to perfection, falling off the bone resting on a pool of creamy polenta.

I highly recommend the 'birthday cake' for dessert.  Its an experience.

While many of these authentic homestyle dishes are stylized for presentation, this is the way we really eat in  NJ.  Great meatballs.  

This visit was AFTER Gordon Ramsay Steak and in no way was it a letdown, it was right up there with GR.  

Kudos to Adam Margolies and his exceptional staff.

Staied at Vegas for 3 days with my wife and randomly walked in to this place after check out the pictures of their food. People who gave less than 4 stars probably had better Italian food than we do. This is the best one so far we have ever tasted.

This restaurant is a perfect experience for any Cake Boss fan. The food tastes like you stepped into Buddy's home. Very delicious! And the portions are the perfect size. The garlic bread is amazing and fresh. And you have to go for the lobster tail for dessert!

In Vegas, never sure if you will be gouged by high prices and mediocre food and service. This place delivers high quality on all aspects. Food was delicious. Prices reasonable. But most of all ... The SERVICE. Wow!! Nailed it!  We dine out 3 times a week (let's face it, I have no business being in a kitchen) and this experience has been by far, one of our best. Georgio, out server ... Hats off to you. Thank you for providing is a welcoming and phenomenal dining experience. And Alex ... A busboy ... Another wow in our books!! Nicely done gentlemen!

Hey,  ba da bing, ba da boom, I'm at the Cake Boss's joint.  You gotta problem with that?  Cause if you do,  he knows a guy who knows a guy! 

That said,  and it needed to be, I rarely eat southern Italian in restaurants because growing up in NY, I had the good fortune to eat the real master chefs cuisine,  my grandmother,  father,  aunts and friends parents. Anyway my point is,  I'm seriously biased. 

My goal was to eat something tasty and not heavily laden with sugar,  flour, carbs as I'm in the middle of a book about that stuff which is gross, scary and fascinating all at the same time.  But,  I digress. 

I went for lunch and ordered grandma's meatballs and a side of Tuscan Kale with roasted tomatoes.  While I get that we didn't use real San Marzano tomatoes here,  it did come close to replicating an authentic flavor.  I should point out that meatballs to Italians is a very serious and personal matter. My extended family can argue endlessly on the what constitutes the perfect meatball, whether there should be inclusions such as pignola nuts, raisens and tons of other stuff you can't possibly imagine. 

The Tuscan Kale wasn't on the menu,  but Star, my server,  not wanting to disappoint,  checked with the kitchen and they said they could do it.  I was very happy.  That's service! Problem was,  it came out very tough, chewy and barely edible.  So I appreciate the extra effort,  not the result, and the results are what matters. Once you commit to me, I'm expecting your A game stuff. 

Appropriate classic Italian Frank Sinatra,  Dean Martin, Louis Prima and other legends sang in the background. I'll go back ang give them another try for dinner.

Grand Openings are not always grand.  I get it.  Staff is nervous.  Owners are stressed, etc.  Today was the opening of Buddy V's in the Venetian.  My fellow event planners and I wanted to escape the 3200 person conference we were working on and go somewhere without strobe lights and bass, so we came here.

I will start with the good:  
The decor here is great.  It takes up a corner spot on the Canal Shoppes level and you have a view of TI, the Trump and the strip.  It's rustic and familiar.  Red checkered napkins and rustic wood tables with interesting lighting fixtures.  My favorite was the children's artwork on the walls and the family photos everywhere (especially the dessert menu).

The food was GREAT.  I had the Orechiette with Italian Sausage.  It was flavorful and satisfying.  It had a perfect balance of al dente pasta, savory sausage and broccoli and tomatoes.  I wasn't starving, but I ate ALL of it. My team had the spaghetti and meatballs, the Burratta Salad and the meatballs.  They ALL raved without exception.  If it only depended on food and decor, i would have been more generous with my rating.   However, for me, service trumps it ALL. 

The not so good:
Service was odd.  We arrived for our noon reservation and the restaurant was probably 1/4 full.  There were PLENTY of open booths that would have accommodated us perfectly, but the hostess decided on putting us at a table in the back.  Once seated we waited a bit to be greeted by our server, but he eventually showed and took our order.  Once orders arrived, we all seemed to receive what belonged to someone else.  Then we had an unfortunate situation that involved our waiter spilling ice cold lemonade all over someone in our party.  It was a mistake and I felt terrible for him.  But the problem was he didn't seem prepared for the situation.  He remedied it as best he could by getting help, some towels and eventually a staff tshirt for our young group member (which lucky for him was not someone in an expensive business suit).  At the end of our lunch he announced his apologies and included that his manager was so sorry about the situation that he would be sending over a dessert for the table.  Now I don't know about you, but once I was at BJ's restaurant and there was a spill at our table that hit a few of our shoes and the manager raced over, paid for our dinner AND offered to pay for our shoes and dry cleaning!  and that was at a chain pizza place!  I'm going to take a wild guess and say that if someone spilled ice cold anything all over one of Buddy V's kids, he wouldn't be so keen on getting a hard puff pastry filled with custard as an apology.  While the spill was the waiter's mistake, management could have comped her lunch or at least her drink -- which he still charged us for!   

Unfortuantely, this is what I will remember most about my time at Buddy V's.

We celebrated our daughter Victoria's  21st Birthday with family last night at Buddy's  and we loved it. We had a great server by the name of Peter who recommended family style dishes ( veal parm, chicken marsala, lasagna  & more that were just  amazing !  In addition , Peter and his team of helpers made sure everything was taken care and everyone was comfortable.  It was an amazing experience and I highly recommend Buddy's for your next special occasion . Ps- I ordered my daughters birthday cake from Carlo's Bakery across the hall from the restaurant and it was so delicious!

This review is for the bar only

While my loving, wonderful husband waited in line at Carlo's Bakery, I thought I'd pop over to Buddy V's across the way and try a libation.  Since I had no clue what I wanted, I asked the bartender to "make something up with amarone", and she did.  I like surprises!  

Open space with a nice view - and it's right across from the bakery.  Check! Check!
Great food an great service.  Had the meatball sub  and ny friend had the bolognese pasta.  And Danielle was great!
I was very impressed. Great food and good service. I ordered the Spaghetti Central, had a great flavor to it. Also the fresh bread was a great addition to the meal.

Came here for lunch since we didnt want to spend too much on a buffet. Food was not impressive. Portions are just ok and definitely pricey.

Make sure you ask for tap water so they dont charge you more than $10 on bottled water. Would not go back.
This is a great family style restaurant!  The food is extremely tasty and is set in a relaxed atmosphere. I definitely recommend you stop here while in Vegas .
Amazing food, the ravioli's were to die for!  Excellent service, very professional and friendly.  Crazy good deserts, but that is to be expected!  Wonderful atmosphere with a great price point!
Their macaroni and cheese is the BEST that I have ever had! I wish it came in a dinner portion. Their service was nice and the atmosphere was relaxing.

5 stars for service... We got immediately seated. Initially we had intended to go to Carlos Bakery but the line wrapped around the corner, it had 3 different lines! So we decided to check out Buddy's restaurant instead and it was the best decision as we got to sit down. The restaurant is clean, large and well designed - it has elements of a modern Italian restaurant and they have pics of Buddy and his family on the dessert menu. We ordered the cannoli, tiramisu and large lobster tail. Since we ate lunch, we weren't hungry and thus didn't try the entrees. But the lobster tail dessert was worth 15$ and it can easily feed 4 people. The tiramisu was not good and the cannoli was sub par.

Classic Italian dishes. The benefit of this Italian restaurant is that in Vegas everything is expensive and this spot is reasonably prices.  They do not serve oversized portions so when you order do not prepare to get a giant plate that you can split.  Each person will need their own dish, but you won't really take leftovers with you unless you are staying at the Venetian anyways so it is perfect.  Priced and portioned well.

Positive - Nice view. Nice atmosphere. Polite staff. 

Negative - Too pricey for what you get. I felt the food quality was pretty low. The person I went with didn't care for it either and it was his second visit.

My family and I had lunch at the restaurant,  food was amazing, being from Honolulu you can't get better than Buddy V's, our busboy Ron was awesome, raspberry  iced tea great . Being a chef from Honolulu it's an eye opening experience. Good job Buddy, open one in Honolulu please . Mahalos  Robert Denis

Valastro Sunday Gravy, I was NOT ready for you! When I read the ingredients listing for this dish I just didn't believe it. I honestly took it for a joke. It was no joke. Valastro Sunday Night gravy is one of those thick, rich and hearty Italian dishes that you imagine Sophia would be cooking for the Golden Girls on a cheesecake and ice cream night. So saucy and full of meat, meat,  meat!!! Veal, sausage, pork, meatballs and bones. Ohhh the lovely bones. I ditched the rigatoni for spaghetti and I was soooo satisfied. Shame on me for swooping down on the soft and super tasty basket of bread like a starved hawk. So much bread made for a crowded tummy but I couldn't help myself. Butter and olive oil for sopping weren't necessary. That's just how tasty the bread was. Dessert??? There was no room and no way. This ain't The Olive Garden. The chefs in Buddy V's ristorante were definitely paying attention to their Italian grannies in the kitchen. I'm sure of it.

Excellent staff and food. Only gripe would be please put bread on table not the bread sticks. Especially if crowded. We had chicken parm and veal marsala. Both very good. They serve whole wheat pasta which is nice.

This a casual place.  Background music was 70's and 80's, which was fine by me; as I walked in, Tom Jones was playing followed by The Who.  And the beat went on.

Ordered Grilled Octopus; broth was spicy and tasted good.  The problem was the rest.  Actual octopus was fine; only thing was, there was only one bite and rest was filled by greens and potatoes!

Then ordered Shrimp Scampi for main course.  It was with angle hair pasta which was fine.  Taste was fine.  Here again, there were only 4 medium size shrimps with tails on to make them look bigger than actually they were!

I understand this is Vegas and understand this was inside of a casino; but, by no means one gets his/hers money's worth.  There are many other Italian places in the same casino that serve great Italian food and one gets close to reasonable amount for his/her money!

BEST DINNER OF THE TRIP!!!!! I got a caesar salad to start, the carbonara, and Lisa's Nutella cake! OUT OF THIS WORLD. The only problem was I was so stuffed by the time dessert cake I couldn't eat the whole thing lol. The ambience was very laid back, with piano music playing as we were overlooking the Las Vegas strip. The musician even came over to the tables to see how we were enjoying ourselves. I eat Italian food very regularly as I am Italian and from Boston, and this was up there with the best Italian dishes I've ever had!!! 

The busser was so sweet and attentive we thought he was our server at first! Could not bring us enough bread or help us enough!! However the waitress had no personality, was rude when we asked about the happy hour specials and really did nothing for out experience. Overall I would recommend this to all!!!!!

great meal, and great service.  authentic Italian food.
go and enjoy the wonderful dishes, and grab a canoli for dessert

The food was great, must try the garlic bread, calamari and can't skip out on dessert, the cannoli is absolutely delicious. Service was a little slow but they were great which made up for it. They have a $22 lunch special which offers an appetizer, main entree and dessert.

Holy cow, this was the best experience yet! We always go to Buddy V's for lunch when in Vegas. Delicious food, great ambiance and made to order. 

Joy was our server and she's quite an amazing bartender too! Joy's upbeat and positive energy rubbed off as soon as we were seated. She was very attentive, and had excellent customer service skills. She recommended we try her espresso martini to compliment our dessert plate. WOW. BEST MARTINI I've ever had!!! Ask for Joy!

Jose was also kind and attentive. He took photos of us and made sure we were comfortable. 

We gave Joy high accolades to one of the managers (Sean?), sadly he didn't seem interested in hearing our feedback and left the table right away. His attitude was less than impressive. 

Thank you Joy and Jose! Thank you to the chefs and kitchen staff for a wonderful meal!

I love a home style Italian meal. The food at buddy v's is simply perfection in this catagory. We had a special birthday lunch here. What can I say, service was oecable. Our waiter t.j. Was highly versed on the options we had a couple if starters the fried mozzarella left us speachlesd, and the calimari was a great compliment. The best part was their adaption if chop salad for a lunch salad it was huge! Save room for dessert, we had the famous lobster roll and the most Devine Italian rum cake served in a miniature cake stand complete with candles for the birthday girl! We can hardly wait for the bakery to open trust we will be the first in line! Yes this will be someplace to come again and again - oh I almost forgot auto pilot parking if you love valet pull in hop out and a quick elevator ride and you are there! This is a winner! Hands down.

5 Stars for Food. 2 Stars for Service.

The food was absolutely delicious!

From the reviews I expected it to be really good but it was excellent. My husband who isn't a big "food" person, was actually quite giddy. I got a Caesar Salad and Chicken Parmesan. The Chicken Parmesan and the Spaghetti it came with, was the best I have ever had. My husband had the Panzanella Salad and Orecchiette Pasta. He said both were amazing. We also shared the Warm Nutella Cake. It was magical. 

I could tell that they took great pride in the way the food was made.

The service was really spotty. Maybe it's because they just opened. But the food was so good it all worked out.

Excellent food. The waiter was really good as well. He took real interest in our food preferences and suggested food/wine. During booking the reservation, I had told them it was my girlfriend's birthday, which they remembered and surprised her (and me) with a cake and candle. The ambience is really good as well.

My wife and kids love watching "Cake Boss" and I usually always stay at Venetian/Palazzo so when I heard Buddy opened up a restaurant there I knew I had to go.  They had only been open about 10 days or so when my friends and I went so I did take that into consideration when writing this review.  Upon entering the restaurant I felt that the decor was quite nice.  They have framed family photos all around the walls which gives it a "homey" feel.  Even though some of the prices may be creeping close to fine dining prices the cuisine is not fine dining (which I like btw).  The whole table had the Jersey City style fried Mozzarella, margarita pizza, chicken parm, warm nutella cake, and XL lobster tail dessert.  I really enjoyed the fried mozzarella as it was not breaded like traditional fried mozzarella but rather sandwiched between two prices of bread.  The pizza is nothing special to me and did not stand out compared to the same style of pizza at other restaurants.  The chicken parm was a good portion which came with pasta that really did taste homemade.  My friends thought the Lisa's warm nutella cake was the best dessert they have had in their lives!  The service was spoty and our waiter would be gone for long periods of time but the busboy always made sure we had what we needed.  I chalk that up just to being a new restaurant.
Pizza was not good at all. Service had to be reminded to bring drinks and spoons returned because they were dirty. Recommend you skip and find another place to eat.   Highlight was the spaghetti.
Great family friendly restaurant on the strip, good food and service, variety in the kids menu and an all around great meal.  Chaz was a great server, and is a dead ringer for the Rock!

My friend and I went here because our flight landed earlier, and we wanted to find a decent restaurant to eat in. We got there at around 4 and ordered a meatball sub and caprese salad. 

I didn't like how they didn't give us bread but instead some type of cracker. We were hungry, so we munched on until we saw our entrees.

The meatball sub was decent looking with seasoned fries. The fries were tasty, but the meatball sub wasn't worth the money. It was tiny and tasted like it had been heated in the microwave. It was still passable if it was about $10.

The caprese salad was not worth the $16 we paid. From left to right were a whole tomato, a small blob of caprese, about 12 cherry tomato halves drenched in dressing, and a spinach leaf. It was the tiniest salad I've ever eaten. Wasn't that good and definitely not worth the money.

If you're hungry and don't want to spend over $30 for two people, try somewhere else!

Place is actually better than I expected.  Classic Italian food with huge portions and prices. Carbonara like spaghetti was awesome.

Squid was excellent also.  Desert here was good. Had some kind of chocolate hazel nut cake with coffee ice cream. So creamy and fulfillling.

Then We Walk Over To Carlos bakery.  :)

Good ambience and decent prices.  The food is cooked perfectly, compliments to the chef!  And on top amazing service from our waitress and table runner (Tammy).  They did such an amazing job with getting our orders in a timely wander and making sure we had excellent service.  Two thumbs up!  A must visit in Vegas.

Let me start off by stating the positive, the service was excellent. Our waiter was very attentive, efficient and friendly. The food was  average, a bit overpriced. I probably won't go back but had to try it.
Best Happy hour food, service & ambiance we've had in Vegas. Definitely would recommend!

We visited the  restaurant during brunch buffet. This was s great way to sample what a variety of the menu without ordering everything at once. It's fair to say the food was good but the desserts were amazing. I ate 3 cannolis. 
After getting extremely full we walked across the way to the bakery called Carlos Bakery. This is just the retail bakery side of the Buddy V. I am not sure what the deal is but there is always a line down the hallway with stantions. The wait was 45 minutes. You get up to the pastries and wait another 15 minutes to get your name called to pay. It a bit insane to have only 2 cashiers that can ring you up and keep this line control thing going. The people who put the pastries into a box and out your name on it then stand around to get rung up is inefficient.

Service...slow
Meatballs are excellent! (That is the only reason why I would give this place a 4 star)
Our table had lasagna, chicken parm and vodka rigatoni. 
The lasagna received raves from my niece. The rest of the food was sub par at best. I definitely would not get the rigatoni again...ever! 

Loud, yet fun atmosphere. Friendly staff. The management was helpful.

The best meatballs. We always order it. We also get the garlic cheese bread. We also ordered the Tiramisu~~~amazing !!!!!!
We always come here when we come to Vegas.

Meatballs great flavor. Nice texture 
Ceasar salad v nice. Can taste the anchovy and served w fried polenta instead of croutons. 
Tomato soup, too salty but otherwise good. Very rich. 
Carbonera excellent and also rich. Nice contrast of texture with some crunch too.
Excellent service with effective waitress and water was always filled. 
Nutella dessert puts most molten lava desserts to shame. Must get it.
Too loud.

Very nice atmosphere, attentive staff and pretty yummy and authentic food. Not too expensive given it's Vegas. I recommend the carbonara. If you want drinks too I recommend pre-drinks next door at rock house!

The restaurant's web site shows that it opens at 11:00 a.m. That is incorrect. We arrived a bit after 11, and that, in and of itself, was a trial. Then, we waited...and waited. Finally, a bit after 11:30, the gate was rolled back. Second in line, we asked for a table by the windows (remember: empty restaurant). The er, um, "hostest" told us that THOSE seats were only for groups of 6 or more. By the time we left, 3 of those tables were occupied (out of about 10), all with parties of 4 or less.  Our waitstaff was attentive, as was the person who filled the water glasses and actually brought out the food. Both orders had been left under a heat lamp too long, and the one order, a pizza, was less than warm. The other order had much to be improved. We will not be returning, nor will we suggest it to out of town guests.

Buddy designed a restaurant that made you feel like you were having a meal in his family kitchen.  Service was incredible and the meal didn't disappoint.  Chicken parm, meatballs, and meat/cheese board were all awesome! Atmosphere and attention to decorative detail was impressive.  Will be back!

Amazing!!! The wait staff was kind and attentive. Even though the place was packed, we were never unattended. I had the scallops and they were easily the best ive ever had. My mom had the turkey lasanga and it was so good. Definetely reccomend those two things.

The service was excellent, food was good on Valentine's day until the AGM Adam Marguiles( not sure of the spelling) Decided to interrupt or experience by chasing his server/bartender around yelling at her and chasing her around the bar...Then he screached at her she was cut, right next to my ear.I was shocked to see how the employees are treated there.Buddy V would not approve ,I'm sure...Someone control this situation, it was horrible.We will never go back.

While vacationing in Vegas with family we decided to check out Buddy V's at the Venetian.  It was a very pleasant experience for our party of seven.  The restaurant itself is lovely with a tastefully decorated interior and comfortable seating.  The service was excellent, very professional and courteous from our waitress to the bussers. The complimentary bread with Olive Oil and Balsamic Dipping plate was delicious, the bread warm and fluffy and the olive oil and balsamic very flavorful.  The Garlic Bread Appetizer was so tasty, warm and very cheesy...we ate every crumb.  The Salumi & Cheese Board Appetizer was outstanding...very flavorful, quality, thinly sliced Proscuitto, Cappicolla and Salami along with Grana Padano and Parmeggiano, and Gorgonzola Cheeses and delicious olives. The entrees were a home run for all seven of us.  The Veal Marsala, Chicken Parm, Chicken Picatta, Steak Pizzaiola ...all perfectly cooked, good portion size and the accompanying Broccolini and/or Buttered Spaghetti Noodles just made the dishes even more pleasing.  The Sunday Gravy signature dish was excellent, the sauce authentic Italian and the combination of meats reminded us of our mother's and grandmother's typical Sunday dinners.  The wine selection was impressive and our Pinot Grigio and Chianti choices did not disappoint.  Loved this restaurant ... the best dinner we had in Vegas during our trip.

Delicious! Highly recommend the salmon and Cesar salad! The bread is so soft and warm, freshly made. Quality of food is great and portions are more than enough! Price is $$$$ of 5 plan to spend $100 per couple, but I definitely think it's an experience one must try if your in Vegas! 
Cons: No restrooms, restrooms are outside the restaurant not far but an inconvenience. Lasagna had a little too much Rosemary and same with the Cesar salad to many herbs. Other than that great serve and super friendly staff!

Delicious. The food was delicious. I had the Sunday sauce and it was amazing. Probably enough for two, so I had food waste guilt. The caesar was good, weird croutons, not really croutons but slightly crisped focaccia pieces... not so good. But the salad and dressing were great. But that sunday sauce......  yum.

I came here the other day for their Sunday buffet brunch special.

 My experience was very enjoyable, from the good food to the excellent service.

Since it was a buffet, I ended up trying a lot of the food they had to offer. Some of the food that stood out to being especially good was the Sunday eggs, the chicken parm, panetone French toast, the caesar salad, the chicken apple sausage, and meatballs. There was mac and cheese there as well. This was the first time I had mac and cheese at a buffet or all you can eat setting, and it tasted exceptional. The noodles weren't over cooked, and the cheese sauce was tasty and creamy, there was a bread crumb like topping on it that help bring it all together. There was even some partially peeled shrimp there. Unlike some places, it was properly cleaned and deveined, on top of it not being over cooked and mushy. I wish the cocktail sauce that accompanied it had some more flavor and horseradish in it. The, what I were to assume, mini cannoli were excellent, even though they were already filled, the shell was still crispy and crunchy while the filling wasn't overly sweet.

All of the food I tasted had flavor, and was appealing to the eye, which tends to be a lacking attribute for a lot of buffet places. While you saw the cooks actually make the food, it actually tasted and looked like it was made from scratch, not something that came from a bag, frozen, or reheated from the day before.

The service was top notch. My glass was never less that 1/3 empty, and the busser made sure I always had fresh forks and knives when I came back with more food. The waitress and busser were very attentive, always making sure I was comfortable, enjoying myself, and asking if there was anything they could do for me.

For the price, selection and quality of food, and service, I was very satisfied with my experience at Buddy V's Ristorante. Not only will I most definitely be coming back for the brunch special, I would recommend the place to other people that I know.

Brunch Boss

Parking:

Located at the Grand Canal Shoppe closer to the Palazzo side so it is nice stroll from the Venetian Parking structure. Where parking can sometimes be a pain but usually plentiful.

Establishment:

Service was okay it was a tad bit slow but not annoyingly so. *3 stars*

Food (Brunch):

To begin there is an all you can drink for about $15 which is probably worth it if you plan on having more than 1 drink. Bringing your total to about $50 a person. 

The concept of quality over quantity definitely applies here there is probably about 10 dishes of breakfast items and some Italian dishes some of their Italian dishes were just okay though but nothing I regretted trying.

What shines here though is their dessert. They have a glorious display of desserts that will be sure to satisfy your sweet tooth. *4 stars*

Overall:

First brunch in Vegas so nothing to compare to but for the price I thought it was very enjoyable especially after 3 sangrias.

Pretty pricy for what you get. $35 each for brunch. $10 for bottled water at the table. Very little at the carving station. Chicken parm was out, but they did replenish it eventually. It was pretty good. I didn't see much else that I liked. Got some pizza from the kids section to try to fill up. Dessert was the highlight, but it didn't blow me away. Service was very good.

Unexpectedly, one of the best meals I have had in Vegas.  The focaccia brought out first was delicious with oil and balsamic vinegar.  Grilled octopus as a starter was to die for.  So tender and flavorful, with a slice of grilled bread to soak up the sauce.  Followed by sea bass simply prepared with a super fresh salad alongside.  He had the veal Marsala and ate it all up.  The big downside was the live music, it was so freaking loud even though we were 2 rooms away, it really detracted from the dining experience.  The singer wasn't bad, just way too loud!
Food was awesome. The service even better. The cost will put you in the poor house. Welcome to Vegas!

Wow, we loved everything we ate here! The lasagna was the perfect balance of cheeses, sausage, pork, and tomato sauce. The chopped vegetable salad was loaded with veggies and garbanzos and perfectly dressed. Don't even let me get started on the heavenly meatballs. I just kept eating even after I was full because I rarely get food this good. Thank you, Buddy!

Items selected:
Focaccia
Margherita Pizza
AUNT NINA'S MOZZARELLA EN CAROZZA - Jersey City style fried mozzarella, crostini, tomato ragu, genovese pesto
MACARONI & CHEESE CARBONARA - smoked mozzarella, fontina, egg, pancetta, sweet peas
NONNA'S LASAGNA AL FORNO - Italian sausage, beef and pork, ricotta, mozzarella, provolone, parmesan
VALASTRO SUNDAY GRAVY (Buddy's family recipe) - meatballs, sausage, lamb, pork, bowl of rigatoni
PARMESAN POLENTA - Peperonata
CHICKEN PARM - oven-baked, provolone, mozzarella, spaghetti marinara
ITALIAN BIRTHDAY CAKE - rum soaked sponge cake, cannoli filling chocolate pastry cream, toasted almonds
LISA'S WARM NUTELLA CAKE - chocolate sauce, hazelnut praline crunch, salted caramel ice cream
CANNOLI - cinnamon pastry, sweet ricotta cream cocoa drops, pistachios
BUDDY'S XL LOBSTER TAIL - custard cream, flaky pastry shell, seasonal fresh fruit
Espresso on Ice

No stranger to making dining recommendations for friends both novice and gourmand it was admittedly with some reservation that I suggested Buddy V's to three Phoenix based friends during their visit to Sin City yet having never seen a single episode of Cake Boss and thus entering the restaurant with neither preconception nor bias aside from a personal love for red-sauce Italian and traditional pastry I can honestly say I came away impressed - the food, service, and restaurant itself all an "experience" fully fitting the swanky Las Vegas Strip locale.  Completely revamped and redesigned from "First Food" with clever flourishes befitting the Chef's roots throughout it was with the space fully reserved and full of energy that we arrived and after a brief wait in the bar a banquet built for six would serves as our seats for the next three hours - time that seemed to fly by under the care of a professional captain working alongside an enthusiastic back-server named Patrick, both who provided stellar recommendations pertaining to both the menu and local dining in general from start to end.  Speaking next to the food and beginning first with appetizers including a crisp, flatbread pizza with a touch of char and excellent acidity beneath the smooth mozzarella it was actually that the carbonara stole the show amongst the small plates as the tender noodles provided a toothsome backdrop to smoky smoothness while peas and pancetta added a one-two punch of sweet and savory reigning the dish back from being 'too rich' or one-dimensional in the least.  Continually tempted by the excellent focaccia it was not long after the appetizers had been cleared that main courses arrived and selecting largely based on Italian-American classics the trio that arrived along with a rich bowl of perfectly sticky polenta was anything but subtle, the enormous portions and big flavors all the result of family recipes and excellent ingredients - the Lasagna one of the best I've ever had while the chicken parm and Sunday gravy were relatively standard fare save for the gamey and supple slow cooked lamb, every bit of which was enjoyed with focaccia dipped in the sauce as the rigatoni was a bit past al dente for my tastes.  Moving last to desserts, a quartet ordered even as my fellow diners were throwing in the towel, suffice it to say that amongst my few steadfast dining rules is that I never leave a good dessert on the table...and when we walked out those plates were empty, the lightly boozy rum cake alone worth the price of entry and more than enough to get me excited for the opening of Carlo's Bakery in 2014.
Best Italian I have had.  The Sunday pasta dish was incredible and I would fly to Vegas to have it again.

Second time here for another visit to vegas, and I absolutely love this place!  The portions are huge (the first time there was just too much leftovers), so order an entree per person if you really want to stuff yourselves.  Be sure to save room for dessert.  The tiramisu is very unique and not too sweet -- perfect for me, maybe for you?

What a treat!  I made reservations for two the day before we decided to go.  We walked up and were seated quickly.  Our server greeted us shortly thereafter.  The menu has such a great variety of classic  Italian staples. It was hard to decide what we were going to eat.  For the appetizer, we ordered Mozzarella en Carozza ("mozzarella in a carriage").  Hands down, this was the most delicious appetizer we've had in such a long time.  The crust was nice and crispy.  But the gravy (sauce) just took it over the top.  It was so full of flavor.  It was a nice balance of tomatoes and basil.
 
For the main course, my hubby ordered the Sunday Gravy.  I loved the presentation.  They served the meat in a separate metal pot.  Plenty of sausage, lamb necks, pork and meatballs.  It's served with rigatoni.  This entrée was so tasty that we immediately started looking for the recipe on the internet.  I ordered the Linguini with Clams.  It came with plenty of clams.  The portion sizes were perfect.

We were pretty stuffed by the time we were done with our meals.  However, we wanted to try a dessert while we were there.  I loved the dessert menu. It looks like a family photo album with pictures of Buddy and his family.  We selected the Italian Wedding Cake.  I didn't think I had any room for dessert.  But this little cake was so good that we knew we had to finish it all. Luckily we had a long walk ahead of us. The restaurant was at the far end of the shops in the Venetian.  We will definitely make this a must the next time we're in Las Vegas.   You should too.  We plan to try the chicken parm.  The atmosphere was what were looking for.  It was like a huge Italian farmhouse kitchen.  And you could see into the kitchen.  Loved the whole experience.

We decided to try this new LV restaurant because we are huge Cake Boss fans. We should have asked for the dessert menu first because the appetizers and entrees were just okay. I'd recommend just coming for the desserts! Sorry Buddy. The food was fair. Location is very nice- can't beat the Venetian. Nice atmosphere. A tad pricey for our family's budget, but expected for a LV strip restaurant.

Went to happy hour and sat in the bar. The staff was nice but there was confusion about getting the happy hour menu. Ordered drinks and watched them sitting on the bar until I got up to get them. 

Finally spoke to the assistant general manager, Adam who listened to our concerns & he was kind enough to buy us a second round of cocktails. Service suddenly approved dramatically. The meatball sliders were fabulous & the drinks generous. 

No place is perfect, but I respect a place that goes out of its way to make things right. I'll definitely return.

My husband and I had lunch here the other day.
We weren't as thrilled as some of the other Yelpers, it may be because we didn't choose Italian items... But honestly, I didn't see it as an Italian restaurant when we walked in.
We were also in quite a hurry, so we were looking to be in-and-out people.

That being said, our waiters were terrific - polite and kept our sodas filled. My husband ordered the meatball sandwich, which he enjoyed. His one complaint was that the bread was toasted and made it very hard. I ordered the Chicken BLT, which also had avocado on it. It was quite yummy. It came with a tiny tiny Caesar Salad... So tiny, you can't help but wonder what the point is? 

All in all, tasty and a good experience!

Good all-around experience. Came here with a group of 7 business colleagues. We decided to go with their special "family style". This was a great call as we got many, many plates of appetizers, mains, and desserts. Very good value for money when you have many folks sharing!

The ambiance was an enjoyable one. A touch loud on the music, but hey it's Vegas, that's petty much the norm. Good for families and business groups alike. Good options for wine and cocktails as well!

Excellent! Service was great, very friendly and entertaining. Good wine list, reasonably prices- menu with good variety of classic Italian meals- we had the octopus with fingerling potatoes- very good, tender with orange, rather than the usual lemon
  Also had the caprese salad with small tomatoes and fresh mozzarella-very good 
  Chicken Marsala was excellent, with side if pasta, lasagna was incredible, a veritable brick if meats and cheeses! Plop, you will jot leave hungry
  Ended the meal with lobster tail, split ingest 4 people- very good with its flakey crust and creamy goodness

Overall, great meal, reasonably priced - would definitely return

I've been here twice now, but didn't review the first time 2 years ago.  Now 2 years on taking another family trip (2 adults, 2 kids) we wanted to try this place again as we had such a great experience the first time.  Thought this place would be a big disappointment and all hype due to him being a TV personality. But food is amazing and even better, the price is right!  Highly recommend if you want good Italian on the Strip.
Hands down the best Italian food I've ever had! Makes me curious about the bakery now, the lasagna is a must have.

If you like the Olive Garden and Buca Di Peppo then you'll love this place.  if your idea if a good Italian meal is something you'd get in a large northeastern city, you'll find this place very average

So, I'm not crazy about the whole celebrity chef thing. I have seen Cake Boss, but I didn't know they had branched out into regular Italian food. But my friend wanted Italian for dinner so we went to Buddy V's. She was excited about it. 

My absolute favorite, I order it wherever I go, Italian dish is eggplant parmesan. Somehow at Buddy's it is an appetizer, not an entrée. Luckily I asked the server and she was able to make it an entrée and add a side of pasta. I was nervous, not knowing what appetizer eggplant my look like, but it was delicious. It was layered slices of perfectly fried eggplant with a chunky tomato sauce and cheese. Honestly, I was half starving from walking all day, but I would say this is one of the best eggplant dishes I've ever had. I cleaned my plate. 

So, food was fantastic. Our server was pretty mediocre, but I was so happy with the eggplant I don't even care. They get 5 stars from me. I may have to give this celebrity chef more credit.

Terrible customer service and food was bland.

They couldn't even make a chicken btl correctly, they "forgot" the slice of bread .  No apology fr the manger or chef.

I don't recommend this place

I'm giving it a lower grading this time because we did the brunch buffet and it wasn't that grand.  I had to come back here because of that AMAZING carbonara mac n cheese, but it was on the verge of awful this time.  The stuff in the brunch is not good at all compared to when they make it fresh for you!  It is to die for when it's fresh.  In the brunch, it's been sitting around etc, and isn't very good.  The salads were good.  The Caesar salad croutons are very different.  There almost like a cornmeal texture.  The arugula salad was delicious.  Chicken Parmesan was ok, but I'm sure it would be excellent if made fresh.  All around, the pastas were kind of disappointing.  It's cool to have a bottomless mimosa/Bloody Mary option.  Roughly $15, but it's bottomless.  Service from the bartender Emily was fantastic!  Not a remote complaint in that department.  We would come back, but won't do the brunch.
Best service ever. They treat you like family. And the food is to die for. It's amazing all the way from the antipastos to the main entree. So so delicious.

This restaurant was really great! I went with my family at 11:30 for brunch and was very satisfied with my experience. The restaurant is huge and the little details make it special. You can tell that it is inspired by Buddy's family which gives it a homey and comfortable feel. The coffee and food was fantastic as well as the service. We ordered the eggplant Parmesan, buddy's pizza, pasta carbonara, calamari, caprese, spaghetti and meatballs, and the tomato soup. Everything was so delicious and satisfying. The dessert menu was a nice touch as well because it is like a family photo album which I thought was a nice detail. Service was excellent and our wait staff was very attentive. We ordered in advance from Carlo's bakery and ate in in the restaurant along with our coffee. Overall this place was excellent and I will probably be back in the future.

Buddy V's was fantastic!  We had the meatballs, grilled octopus, salami and cheese plate, osso buco, veal parm chop and the "lobster" for dessert.  Great service, no wait with reservations!  Will return!  We live in Vegas and some strip restaurants are over rated.  However I do recommend Buddy's!!

My husband and I were so excited to come here, we were really hungry after a long day of sightseeing and it was our last night in Vegas. Ready to indulge one last night. We were seated in the couch/lounge. I thought it looked cozy, only to sit on an extremely awkward, low, deep sunken in seat. Odd. But can be overlooked. 

Our server Christin was nice enough, not really helpful when we asked for an opinion of favorites. So I ordered the veal marsala and my husband ordered the ravioli. (How can you mess up ravioli?) Well... after a long wait for food to roll out, his ravioli was disappointing and very very salty. Same salt issue with the veal. My pasta on my plate tasted like pasta roni, and was cold. My veal, extremely hot. The ravioli portion was small and didn't even begin to fill him up even though he tried to stomach the saltiness. 

Our birthday canolli was a nice thought, but we didn't really eat it. Maybe we ordered the wrong items? But this felt like a dressed up version of the olive garden. A bit disappointed to end our trip this way. My favorite meal was at B&B downstairs.

My little sister watches a lot of Cake Boss, so we decided to come here and try Buddy's restaurant as a treat to her. The place is very family-friendly with a relaxed and cozy ambiance. Food is good, but I wouldn't say it was memorable. My family ordered different dishes (chicken parm, caesar salad, buddy's favorite pizza), and I got to try each of them. They were all good and the portion sizes are great, but they weren't rave-worthy.

The service, however, was fantastic. Our waiter was so friendly and helpful, and we really felt like the restaurant was a cozy, family-oriented establishment. The service really made the whole experience more enjoyable - probably enough to come back a second time when I'm in Vegas again with friends or family.

So the wife and I went to Buddy V's last night and here are my thoughts.  Overall it was a good dining experience, but not a great one.  I wasn't bowled over by either the service or the food, (except for the desert).  It was just kind of okay and most likely won't go back.
First off, the restaurant is tucked away in a spot that has a fantastic view of the Strip, but the internal design was emotionally cold.  I want an Italian-American restaurant to be warm and inviting and this place was trying too hard to be fancy, (which is most likely a result of its being in the Venetian). 
We didn't order any appetizers but for entrees my wife had the Veal Marsala and I had the Chicken Parm.  My wife and I both loved the taste of our meals.  They were both well prepared but both were a bit on the small side for the money they are charging. The Chicken Parm had only two cutlets and the side of spaghetti was only about a half a cup's worth.  Same with the wife's dish.  Like I said both tasted real good, but not really any better than any other Italian joint in town. Also, they give you fancy Focaccia bread with dinner.  Sadly they offer no butter or Olive oil to go with it and really, the bread had a distinctive taste to it, which made it non-optimal for dipping.  I'd rather have warm, fresh, and plain Italian bread over the fancy stuff. 
For desert we shared a Tiramisu and that was fantastic.  The quality and taste of it was spot on.  
As far as the service, the wait staff was very attentive.  Our waiter was professional but a bit stoic.  
We probably won't go back because I can get just as good Italian food from a local spot 10 minutes from my house but the desert was great so maybe it's worth it to try lunch there instead of dinner paired with desert.

Wow!!  I am so happy we decided to try Buddy's.  I had a feeling it would be good but it was way better then expected!  My hubby and I both got the early special for $38.  You choose a starter, entree, and dessert.  Hubby got the meatballs and I got the Caesar salad.  The meatballs we so freaking moist! And the sauce was perfect!  The salad...probably some of the best dressing I have ever had and the polenta croutons! OMG!  Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, so yummy!

Then for our entree hubby got the carbonara and I got the chicken parm.  Both were amazing!  Pasta was cooked perfectly, the carbonara was creamy and rich, the chicken was moist and crispy, just...yes!  And then there was dessert.  I couldn't even finish my meal so we got the warm Nutella cake there and the cannoli to go.   The Nutella cake with ice cream was like heaven on a plate!  And we are still so full so we haven't tried it yet but I'm dreaming about it haha!  This is a must try!

Terrible service! People that work there really unhelpful!! Don't recommend at all!!  We came there to get a desert and they gave us a table at lounge area, after we gave the order they asked for my ID which I didn't have with me and told us that we can't seat in that area, first of all we didn't even ask to seat there and they told us to leave and didn't even give us a different table. Why would they even give us a table make us do an order and then tell us to leave? Terrible !!! Terrible service!!

Horrible service. Bland food that was  ridiculously over priced for the portion size. The staff was extremely unaccommodating and unfriendly with a large group. They refused to split the check which was ridiculous. Overall it was a very disappointing experience for an establishment with Buddy's name on it. I wouldn't recommend it to friends and I will definitely not go back.

I have been wanting to try this place and finally glad we did! Their happy hour from 4:30-6:30pm everyday is by far my favorite in Las Vegas right now. They have $4 drink specials including sangria and bloody Mary's that were delicious. They're appetizers were $5 plates and everything we have was amazing. What made my mouth drool was the meatball sliders with ricotta cheese. I don't usually like ricotta cheese but it totally made these sliders out of this world. The calamari was also a favorite with having deep fried banana peppers mixed in as well. If you are looking for a good happy hour, this is your place to go!

Excellent location with great service. The food was delicious and I enjoyed every bit of it. The tomato & basil soup was really great way to start off things and make sure you end it with their popular canoli. No complaints and honestly one of the better friendly services.
How about 0 stars. What a dumbchet must Buddy be to let these bimbos ruin his name. this is nothing but a horrrr house with horrrs as hostesses. rudest cheap horrrrz on the plant here .puck u horrz.
Everything was delicious and service was great. I most enjoyed Mama's Meatballs but not the polenta croutons that came with the caeser salad. Do not get the polenta croutons unless you like polenta.

My wife and I decided to drop in Saturday night to see if we can get a table without a reservation.  Unfortunately they were booked for the night, but the hostess asked if we'd like to sit at a high top at the bar.  Since they offered the full menu we readily agreed.  Within minutes of sitting down we had waters and our waitress greeted us.  The service was great and she happily gave recommendations.  We started with the calamari and it was excellent, the fried anahiem peppers were a great counterpoint to the calamari, which was cooked excellently.  I ordered  the chicken parm and my wife had the chicken picata.  My chicken parm was delicious!  It was two chicken breasts fried to perfection topped with mozeralla and a side of spaghetti with marinara.  I'm very picky about my marinara, I can't  stand when it's sweet, and this was done really well.  Very savory and went perfect with the chicken.  My wife's picata was cooked wonderfully as well but was lacking in the citrus.  She asked for a plate of lemons and was able to season to get desire.  We finished off the meal with a lobster tail dessert.  The pastry was beautifully done, the cream rich and smooth, and the berries tasted very fresh.  

All in all it was a great meal, my only gripe was the decor / ambiance.  It was like they couldnt figure out what they wanted to be.  The decor was that of a nice italian restaurant, low lighting and dark wood.  But their menus looked so cheesy like something from Farrels and the busers all wore bright red shirts but the hostesses wore little black dresses.  They need to go either elegant or cheesy, either would be fine but straddling the line is kinda weird.

A great meal at a reasonable price. 

Loved the decor, loved the food, loved the cocktails, loved the service. Just LOVED IT.

We stopped in and found out they had a Happy Hour Menu with small bites for $5. Must have is the Mac and Cheese. Very very flavorful, creamy and oh so DELISH!!! The peas were perfect and POPPED in your mouth. The panchetta was a perfect contrast to the silky smooth sauce and the crunchy bread crumb top provided a great texture to the top. The meatballs were fantastic and the bread with ricotta cheese was fantastic. Ask for Olive Oil and Balsamic Vinegar on the side. I ordered a melon martini off the drink menu. It was light, bright and strong! Had a wonderful bit of mint and citrus zest throughout. Lastly we rounded out the dinner with the Nutella Cake!! Oh my GOSH!!! I am not a BIG fan on Nutella and ate around the dollop in the center. The cake was extremely moist! The Salted Carmel ice cream that is made in house at their other restaurant was SUPERB!!! Loved the peanut brittle on the bottom. Try each one seperate and after all together you will NOT be disappointed! We sat in the bar by the window and the view was great. Loved the decor with the rolling pins hanging throughout and HUGE beaters mixed in with the lights. We had a great night! Enjoy!

The food was good. The service was ok. We had a group of 10 people eating for dinner. The waiter argued with us when we didn't order what he thought we should order, Including drinks. At the end of the meal he wouldn't separate our checks. He said that they couldn't do separate checks, but after We had to figure out each persons portion of payment he took everyone's cards. Made no sense. Would not recommend to a big group.

We had a nice and delicious dinner earlier tonight. We had the spaghetti with clams and prawns, fried scallops, spaghetti carbonara, and a cannoli for dessert, all to share among 3 of us. The only thing that I don't like was the ambience. It's a noisy restaurant. Service was good and helpful.

We had our holiday luncheon there this past week. It was a hit with all of us. Bryan Forgionne,the executive chef, is incredible. My boss has not stopped talking about the good food and service.  I highly recommend checking it out.

Decided to try Buddy V's when I was out with one of my friends since we both had been wanting to go. When we arrived, they told us that they didn't have any tables available. I could see that there were open tables, so I'm not 100% sure this was true. My friend mentioned that he was an employee at the Venetian, so the hostess said she could seat us in about 10 minutes. They put us at a table in the back corner of the restaurant with empty tables all around. I wasn't a fan of being put back in the corner. It took a bit for our server to come to our table, so the experience didn't start out too great. 
I thought that the food was okay, but nothing to write home about. 
I haven't been back since, and I honestly didn't even think about Buddy V's last time I was thinking about going to an Italian restaurant on the strip. 
It's possible I might give it another shot.

First off the menu is not very impressive, kind of reminds me of Quick stop Italian joint, not a sit down restaurant. Your better of going to the polazzo and eating at carnivore. 

We started off with the mozzarella sandwich in marinara sauce which was pretty good. Very hearty and pleasantly seasoned. Then my wife ordered the chicken parm which she enjoyed. I ordered the meatball sub, I know what your thinking "meatball sub how can you judge off of that" well the waitress told me it was a signature and it sounded good for lunch. Well my take on the sub was the bread was great, a little butter action with the melted mozzarella, but the meatballs were not so good. The texture was not there for me, it was like the microwaveable meatballs, honestly if you blind folded me and but a subway sub in comparison I would probably pick the subway sub.

Lasagna was great , caesar salad had these incredible croutons made from polenta. Service staff was really great but our waiter was pushy and a little rude. Kept trying to force us to have the family meal, when we declined dessert he kept telling us full or not we had to have it. When one of the kids asked about a dish he told them when he was young you ate what was put in front of you and explained to us how we care to much what they (children) think. Overall food and atmosphere was great ...maybe we just weren't getting the waiters spence of humor.

We had the opportunity to visit the new Buddy V's at the Venetian Las Vegas. We found the outside menu to be very interesting and the offer of happy hour irresistible!  unfortunatly, the man we met at the front desk did not share our excitement.  He acted irritated with our presence, but when asked, directed us to the upper level of the restaurant as the appropriate area for happy hour values.  after selecting a place to sit, we were accosted and told not to sit "there" as "that" isn't happy hour seating, "this" is happy hour seating.  (beware the hi top tables as they angle your drinks to the floor). Our poor waitress (April) seemed very unhappy to see us. She described a few of the beverages when asked, but after ordering "bellinis", she told us the Bellini machine was broken. When asked if the drink could be served on the rocks, she acted shocked and said it was impossible as it was made from a mix. We heard the bartender say the machine wasn't quite ready. When quizzed, the waitress said it wouldn't be ready for "hours!". We settled for the house red, and let me tell you, i do mean settled.  the transparency of the liquid lent itself more to watery cool-aid, with legs and bouquet to match. We did sample a pasta appetizer, which might have lead us to believe the food was worth putting up with the service, but a smart phone app lead us to better Venetian opportunities. Our party was met with a hostile glare as we were fleeing the establishment, and i was forced to resort to mad dogging the man(ager?) to make good our escape. 
greeting cold, directions sketchy, service irritated, food potential but unknown, farewell hostile.  1/2 star....

Way good!  The chicken parm was fantastic.   Very tasty and much better than Otto down the street.  I couldn't be more pleasantly surprised by this meal.  The chicken was cooked through but not over cooked.  The breading was NOT soggy, was firm and crunchy.  Just a well executed dish.  The pasta was good too.

Services was attentive and nice!  I never had an empty glass and before I could ask for something like extra cheese, they were asking me.

Awesome!  Just awesome!

The grilled octopus is probably the best I have ever had. My husband and I still talk about it. The drinks are great and the pasta is the real deal here. The service was excellent! This is another restaurant on our list of favorites in Las Vegas.

Great service. Great food. Great atmosphere. My husband and I were looking for a place for lunch and stumbled upon this place. While I know of his show I can't honestly say I've ever watched it. The capresse salad was delicious! I had the penne alla vodka and it was too die for! And my husband had the meatball sub, which he also loved. We shared the Nutella cake for dessert and it was also good, but the salted carmel ice cream was the true star! I would highly recommend stopping in here for a meal!

Omg YUM. This place is so good. Perfectly cooked pasta. Fresh Cesar salads with homemade croutons. The decor is adorable and the service is wonderful. Not overly expensive either. Then you can go across the walkway and get homemade desserts from Carlos Bakery. I wish we had Buddy V's in So. Cal!

I went with my family for lunch, and was not disappointed. We had the meatballs for an appetizer. They were delicious and the sauce was so tasty.  All the food was made very well and the restaurant is very nicely decorated. I loved the dessert, so much better here than across the ways at Carlo's Bakery.  Service was great too.

We had dinner reservations and arrived 30 minutes early. We requested a window table and were immediately seated. The table had a great view overlooking Las Vegas Blvd. 
Service was prompt and friendly. 
The meal started with a basket of bread along with Olive Oil and Balsamic. 
In support of Restaurant Week we ordered off the special menu.

The Caprese Salad was perfect. Nice variety of heirloom tomatoes, silky burrata, and the green beans was an interesting addition

The entrée of Spaghetti Bolognese was just the right size. The meat was very tasty and the sauce flavorful.

Dessert was Zeppole coated with spiced sugar and served with a raspberry dipping sauce. A great finish

Thanks Buddy V for your support of Restaurant Week.
This place is excellent!  Great service, great food, great atmosphere!  A must try whenever you are in Vegas!

Honestly all I do is really check in to pecs now a days but decided to write a review because the food and service was so good. Ordered prosseco, lemon chicken piccata (?), and an Italian birthday cake for dessert. I NEVER eat the pasta but it was so good. I'm crying at the workouts I'm going to have to do for this. Everything here is exactly what Buddy V would want it to feel like...family. The food is homey the service people the ambience I will come back!! Highly recommend :)

Service:  Wonderful.  For the first week of a new operation, the waitstaff was friendly, helpful and efficient.  The servers had issues figuring our who ordered what, but this was probably because we were four sitting at a booth that could seat six.  Extremely accommodating.

Decor: Great views of the strip from the window booth. Nicely laid out with not too many tables and not too close together.  However, the cold air was blowing on us the entire time and I didn't go to Vegas for the cold weather.  Please fix this.

Food: Turkey meatballs were wonderful.  Chicken Parm was chewy and probably overcooked.  We came for the desserts and were disappointed that there isn't a more traditional cake.  I realize you have to spice things up, but if you are going to have funky desserts, you should also have at least one boring chocolate cake.

3 words: Creekstone Farms Burger. Amazing. Cooked to perfection, flavorful, and delicious. I seek out Creekstone Farms meat because it's open range, organic, and also happens to be Halal. I called and was told quickly that they do indeed serve Creekstone Farms Beef burgers. 

Locating the restaurant was a little tricky but a couple directions later we made it. Inside is beautifully laid out, while not overly fancy, it is classy. 

We were seated in a clean red booth immediately and drinks brought right away. The burger was $16. I asked to have the meat cooked away from pork and the server kindly let me know that the only pork they cook is in the meatballs in a pot. The grill only cooks shellfish and steak. Super nice. 

Burgers came out with Parmesan fries. Asked for pickles and had them right away. Drinks filled automatically. No breadsticks or other food while you wait. There are some really thin straw like bread sticks on the table that are average. 

But all in all, a fantastic experience for lunch. Will definitely be returning on my next trip to Vegas.

Amazing meal! Went for husbands 50th bday. When I booked the reservation I asked for a table with a view. Got a fantastic table with a great view. Georgio was the best server, great personality, lots of advice. 

Will definitely go back!

Lisa

The food is phenomenal ! One of only 2 restaurant that I would recommend in Vegas. I ordered off the lunch express menu which gives you a 3 course meal for $22. I had the meatballs for an app. You get 3 in a small boat of gravy (pasta sauce ) And they were spot on east coast Italian meatballs. They use the holy trinity of meat which is hard to find on the west coast and the sauce can't be beat . This is the kind of sauce that makes me want to step up my game because it Puts my gravy to shame !! For the meal I ordered the bucatini carbonara - again it knocks your socks off. The pasta is cooked perfectly , pancetta is crispy and the sauce light and creamy.. Simple and elegant . For dessert I ordered the tiramisu which came in a 2 oz canning jar and 3 lady fingers .. What a divine way to end a perfect meal. As a side note my husband ordered the 3 course meal as well. He ate it before I could get a pic , and I didn't get to try anything he ordered except his dessert . So we will have to take his word for it when he says the tomato basil soup was fantastic , and his chicken Parmesan  was the best he's ever had . He stated that the chicken had a light breadcrumb coating (he hates when it's thick like some sort of chicken bird sweater )  and his side of spaghetti was cooked perfect and served with the same type of sauce as my meatballs . For his dessert he ordered the cannoli.. Oh holy cannoli was that amazing!! I ended up eating it for him as he is lactose intolerant .. A good wife would have explained that cannoli are stuffed with marscapone cheese ! But.... Here we are ..

I was so excited to see this restaurant listed in RESTAURANT WEEK!! I've been wanting to come here anyway & this was the perfect opportunity. A 3 course dinner for only $30.14!! I had Grandma's Meatballs for my app & Chicken Parm as my entree. Restaurant week's portion came with 4 meatballs. 2 pieces of chicken & a small but good size spaghetti. Both were just amazing. So much flavor in the meatballs & you can see the herbs when you cut into it. The breading on the chicken parm was perfect. Not too thick so it's not filling. The spaghetti sauce was simple & delicious. Mini donuts as the dessert with a chocolate & raspberry I think it was sauce to dip. 5 small pieces I believe. Spiced sugar coating the outside of the donut. 

The specialty cocktail list was awesome! Everything looked good! I ordered the DRAGO ROSSO-absolut ruby red, pomegranate, jalapeño & mango. A spicy treat! I've always wanted to try a spicy cocktail & this one was amazing. I had to take small sips cause my throat burned a little! The jalapeño seeds were floating at the top too. I think I should have asked the bartender to not make it that spicy. But it was good! Priced at $14. 

The restaurant is beautiful! It's huge. The kitchen was open so you can watch them cook (love that). Brick walls & floor to ceiling windows with great views of the Strip. There are old pictures everywhere & cool decor. Unique chandeliers & a great wine shelf! We had a great table next to the window :) 

Service was great! Everyone was so nice. I even got a birthday dessert from them with a sparkler attached! I will be coming back!
The chicken parmesan is delicious. Beware their dinner plate is very large. They have friendly staff as well. A bit pricey.

Above average scallop dinner, however surprised when I receive a bill for $16 beer. I was asked when seated if I wanted small, medium or large, I went with medium. When questioning the $16 charge, I was told this was because I can keep the glass.  I don't want a cheap glass to take home, I want a reasonably priced beer.

Today my friend and I were craving Italian food, and im glad that we chose this place. It definitely hit the spot! 

The restaurant was super clean, and not overly crowded. We were seated immediately. This was refreshing since Vegas tends to be crowded everywhere. We had a nice view of the strip and some of the surrounding hotels. 

I ordered the chicken parmesan, it was very good. The chicken had good flavor, and I substituted the marinara sauce for a cream sauce with penne pasta. 

The whole staff seemed to stop to offer us refills on drinks and bread. Everyone was working together to make sure we had everything we needed. 

No complaints, I will definitely be back.

The first impression I had was "housekeeping" they need to do some serious cleaning in that place! The chandeliers although very pretty were dusty as hell. There was a display of fake food on the right hand side... It was covered in black dust. I work in the customer service industry and I'm sure that the dust that had been accumulating was there for months. 

When I go to a establishment of that caliber, I expect it to be spotless. No excuses. 

About the food, the pasta was great but the portions were rather small. The chopped summer corn salad was a fiasco. It tasted like if the corn and green beans were poured out of a can directly to the plate. If the story was different than the one I'm telling, well taste and appearance didn't make the trick. 

Needs a lot of improvement. Definitely underwhelmed.

I like the food here. Definitely a go-to spot when guests are visiting and need a family friendly spot for dinner where we can just meet them on the strip. The only thing is that they need new bust boys or more training. My first visit, they just weren't up to par esp on refilling the water. I don't remember too much on the last visit what my complaints were. It just wasn't good. 

Although tonight, it was crappy. My son was eating the cracker sticks and we placed the opened packet on top of the plates. The guy comes to pass out the plates but dumps the cracker onto the table. Literally took the plate and dumped it. Hello...my son was eating that and what kind of table manner/service is that. 

Then they came around with oil. He left and then a few minutes later came with bread. Our waitress finally asked if we wanted balsamic vinegar with it. I said yes, of course. I never had bread with just the oil! I guess the guys did that to the same table as well. 

Our waitress was good it's just the bust boys. They're not what I expect for a restaurant like that.

This was a very pleasant surprise. Better than I expected. Very authentic Italian good that reminded me of home (New York). The meatballs and eggplant parmigiana were like my Mom used to make - delicious! The cannoli was to die for! My kids loved it too.
Can't wait to come back tomorrow!   Michele, Adam and the entire staff are fantastic!

I am a Las Vegas local who is originally from New Jersey and boy was I impressed. I did not even care for any of the pastries at Carlo's Bakery back in Hoboken, but we wanted to try a little taste of Jersey in Sin City. 

The Sunday Gravy (have no fear, you can get this every day) reminded me of those many Sunday dinners back in NY/NJ that started at 2 and ended around midnight. It almost brought a tear to my eye eating that food because it tasted so much like what my grandparents would make for us.
