Those grand meals are unfortunately a thing of the past, but Buddy V's brought it back to life. The meats in the Sunday Gravy were perfect, the pork was so tender, and you can taste the flavor in every bite of the sausage and meatballs. It was quite a feast and a pretty good value considering that you are right on the Strip. My wife had the lasagne and it was massive. The service was excellent, attentive, but not overly. 

Buddy, your pastry shop may not be great, but your Italian restaurant is. Great job! Thank you for bringing a taste of New Jersey to Nevada. The location is tricky, it is on the side of the Venetian between the Palazzo, but once you make it there, you will be back.
Slow service ( we were super hungry and wait about 35 minutes) bread is burned, bad experience!

A little disappointed as I had expected great food! Do not order grilled cheese pesto sandwich! Awful ! Meatballs were average ! 
The orange sponge cake on the other hand was awesome! One of the best cake I've e ever had!

Brunch Review: fresh, delicious, attentive staff.. Even the strawberry lemonade was freshly made by the bar and taste amazing, not too sweet -added perk it comes in a keepsake glass.. HIGHLIGHT OF THE DAY!! Buddy Valastro walks in mid brunch and says hello to everyone, and takes pictures with us.. Very sweet and humble!

I must say, I ate one of the best Italian dishes in my life at bobby's V last night. From the moment you walk in service is great. Had a great view of the last Vegas strip. One good thing was that they didn't have any dress code which was important because i sure didn't feel like dressing up and walk a casino with heels on. 
 
There was live music performed by 2 incredible guys. The singer song need amazing and very classy.  Now back to the food. To start of I had grilled octopus and cheesy garlic bread. I was a bit skeptical about the octopus but it was really good. After that I had the mamas linguine and shrimp pasta. I ate a lot more that I'm reviewing. All I must say is if you come to Vegas and your in the mood for some home made Italian food come to this place.

Excellent service,  delicious food and live music for dinner (specific evenings)!  The best chicken picatta I've ever had and the desserts are divine.   The creme Brule is unlike any other.   The Nutella cake with the star of the plate. ..salted caramel ice cream.  The mac and cheese is also very unique with crunchy topping and decadent smokey flavor.

I came to visit for the first time for Restaurant Week for my sister's birthday. I'm pretty impressed Buddy. I have to admit that so far, your dishes taste just as good as your cakes (well...the cakes look good so maybe as good as your cakes look?) 

I booked reservations for seating on Open Table for my sister's birthday. Told them the occasion and requested a nice little "surprise". They did more than that. They gave us the best seat (take note here because this seat is the seat you want) in the house. You walk past kitchen, past the bar, and the main floor. You'll see these big windows that help open up the room with natural sunlight. In front of that window lies a simple yet perfect table for four. You can look right out and see the strip from above, and if I'm correct the pirate show at TI also!

My sister and I ordered the garlic bread, caprese salad, meatballs, and Chicken Parmesan. 

The MEATBALLS are definitely one I recommend, but beware! These come as appetizer and can be very filling! So if you intend to make it to dessert, I'd be careful with this one. One order would be good to share with your party. It's so full of flavor, juicy, and tender. Major noms. I think it's because of the veal. 

The GARLIC BREAD. Oh the garlic bread is also a major 5! Extra cheesy, extra buttery, and extra extra garlicy. An extra 5 points if I could because it tastes just as good as a leftover. It came with 4 HUGE pieces and one is a good size to split in half with another (that is if you're a light to medium eater). 

CAPRESE SALAD is also a great recommendation if you're looking for a nice salad to eat. Full of color and flavor. They have like 3-4 different types of tomatoes in it. There was cherry tomatoes and some tomato that is red, purple, and green (it's good I swear!). It was topped with a perfect ration to cheese and drizzled around with a light olive oil and balsamic vinegar. 

**CHICKEN PARMESAN two extra stars because Buddy V's chicken parmy will probably become that GO-TO-MUST-HAVE dish. I mean it's just chicken parmy right? I know...but it was perfect. The sauce wasn't too much nor thick or overpowering. The breading on the chicken had that perfect crunch to their tender chicken. It had that nice bed of creamy melted cheese topped with a wonderful POW of garlic flavor and herbs and spices. I'm a variety seeker so I always go to different place and try different things, but once I find THAT DISH it's hard to steer me away from it. That dish is THIS PARMY.

**DRAGO ROSSO-It hasabsolut ruby red, pomegranate, jalapeño & mango. It's divine! I love spice. This has a whole lot of spice. If you're into bloody mary's or the mexican drinks with the clamato juice. You have to try it. WARNING though. It is really spicy so if you only like a lighter taste of spice for your palette I recommend you pass.

BUT! Service was great, the ambiance was amazing. Casual, but upscale? More for business meetings, lunch, and special occasions. Lastly, it was cute after my request they surprised my sister with bakery made cookies with a light up sparkler.

See Jojo S. review for photos: http://www.yelp.com/biz/buddy-vs-ristorante-las-vegas#hrid:pp5PFMp8IqNGvdkgnQe5HQ

We didn't expect much from Buddy's. We figured, ah, another TV personality restaurant. Like, whatever. However, we stopped in for a late-night dinner after seeing the Beatles Cirque show at the Mirage, when not much else (even in Vegas) was open at 9:30pm on a Sunday. And Buddy's turned out to be the Boss. As in, very NJ Italian.

Caesar salad usually has hard-as-rock bread croutons. Not here. Buddy's croutons were amazing, soft, warm polenta/cheese cubes. Loved that! The Chicken Piccata was also very tasty, a generous portion with lots of capers and lemon. Very nice. Cute Italian breadsticks-in-wrappers on the table. Surprised and pleased with our meal. 

Finally, don't get the weirdly-frosted cupcakes at the Carlo's bakery across from Buddy's (the ones with gobs of over-colored icing on the top). Instead, DO get their authentic Italian/NJ "lobster claw" pastries filled with cream. You could die. They were that good.

Stopped by the bar for a quick drink. Joy, the bartender, was awesome! Best customer service in the whole casino hands down. Oh and not to mention she makes a hell of a drink. I told her to get me whatever and I was not disappointed. She knows her way around a bar inside and out. Not only was she great, the whole restaurant was amazing. Very relaxing, and a great view if you get a window table. I recommend this place to anyone going to the strip looking for a relaxing time with superb individuals!

This place is a must eat has to be the best Italian restaurant is Vegas if the not best overall. The service and environment are second to none. From the time we walked up to the hostess stand to the time we paid we felt we were the the most important customers there and they were quite busy. The food, was absolute amazing the best Italian food I have ever eat. Our waiter was the most patient caring and professional waiter ever (Giorgio) is a must ask for! I would give 12 out of 5 stars!

The food was great. I had the cheese ravioli with chicken added. It came within 10 minutes and was amazing! Our waiter was also friendly. He made sure we had everything we needed! Great cheese bread with vinegar and oil before the meal!

I ate here for Restaurant Week Spring 2014 and again the following night from their regular menu. The portions here are nice and the different types of dishes on the menu make it hard to decide what to order. Our server, Perry is fantastic! He checked on us often and made sure everything was to our liking. Managers, Adam and Christopher also stopped by our table at different times to introduce themselves and make sure we were enjoying everything. I could tell that not just the managers care about the experience of every customer, but the servers and rest of the employees do too.

The cost for the RW week dinner was $30.14 per person which I found to be a very fair price considering what I got. I had the following:

Buddy's Caprese

Chicken Parm & Spaghetti

Zeppole

The next day I at the following:

The meal started out with warm bread and oil and balsamic. Nice start!

Buddy's Caprese ($16) - This salad is sooooo good! It had charred green beans, burrata, tomatoes and balsamic. The variety of tomatoes and different colors of them were nice. The tomatoes tasted so fresh. The burrata was fantastic! So soft and tasted great. 

Buddy's Salumi and Cheese Board ($21) - Prosciutto, spicy capicola, genoa salami, gorgonzola, pecorino, grana padano, pickled veggies, olives and grilled bread arranged beautifully on a cheese board. The meats had such great flavor and the olives (they contain pits) had a nice garlic flavor to them. All the cheeses were good, but the gorgonzola was my favorite. It was creamy and easy to spread on the garlic toast. Delish!

Chicken Parm & Spaghetti ($23) - This is oven baked with provolone and mozzarella. I thought mine from the night before was soggy, so I asked that it be cooked longer this time and it was just perfect. Nice and crispy were is should be and the cheeses tasted good. The spaghetti on the side had marinara on it and parmesan and even though I barely had room, I couldn't let it go to waste! I did take half of my chicken parm home and it reheated nicely. 

Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake ($9) - The cake was warm and baked perfectly. It also came with a scoop of salted caramel ice cream that was excellent. 

Zeppole ($9) - These are served hot and coated in a spiced sugar. 2 dipping sauces accompany them, lemon raspberry jam and chocolate. The raspberry jam I wasn't crazy about, but the chocolate dipping sauce tasted great. 

They also have a kid's menu as well a lunch menu that offers burgers and sandwiches. I am eager to come back and check some of the sandwiches out. I was very pleased with the service, food and atmosphere. The first night, we sat at a table near the bar area next to a large window that overlooks the strip. The next night we sat at a booth that was closer to the kitchen. Both are different experiences so try them both! They also can host events here.

We were pleasantly surprised by Buddy V's. I had a fantastic Caesar salad with warm polenta cubes and Veal Marsala that was delicious. I'd say that the prices were in line with a standard Vegas restaurant. We sat in the bar area by the HUGE windows which gave us a great view of the strip. If you're in the area and want some Italian food, it's worth your time to check Buddy V's out.

So I never watched the Cake Boss and only ended up at Buddy V's because they had space for our party during a busy Saturday night.  We were seated at the worst possible table in the restaurant right up in the front and the hostess wouldn't budge when I asked to be moved after I saw a lot of tables available since it was 9:30pm (strike 1).  Our waiter was fast talking and nice but he really tried his best to have us order more than we wanted and actually charged us for a salad which he said was going to give us compliments of the house and then forgot all about his promise at the end of the dinner (strike 2).  Those two experiences were the true reason why I brought the score down because the food (except for the salmon) was very fresh and delicious.  
Charred Octopus-amazingly good
Panzanella Salad-fresh combination of flavors
Seared Salmon-overcooked and dry (strike 3).
Buddy V's is a very large and pretty modern restaurant with decent prices but the little incidences along the way had me leaving on a sour note.

I have heard of Buddy V thru his cake boss show but I didn't realized he had a full restaurant.  The kids had mac and cheese and a cheese pizza and my wife had the Shrimp Scampi and I had the 3 course meal with a salad, sea bass and cannoli and cookies for desert.  Everything was very good.  There was so much food we didn't have room for desert!  Good food, good service, can't do wrong here!

Great service! Cool bar with nice views of strip. A little bit of a walk to find the place. But once you do find the place it's very inviting. Chicken parmesan was good. Linguine clams was delicious and had enough to fill you up with a little bit of spice 
The deserts are AMAZING!!! The apple and the lobster things whatever you call them they were soooo good!!!

Picked up 3 things during our stay in Vegas and took it back to our room. (Cant comment on service). 1. The Margarita pizza was the bomb! Very delicious. Decent size for the price.  2. The spaghetti central was so freakin good!!! Second best spaghetti Ive ever had. (First is Mama Depandis at RPM Italian in Chicago.) 3. The parm polenta is the best polenta Ive ever had hands down! Definitely will be coming back to this place on return trips to LV.

Went to Buddy V's today. First let me start off by saying the hostess  tall thin looks like asian descent with ponytail who sat us was not very friendly. We asked to sit at a booth after finding the chairs too slippery and uncomfortable. When we asked to sit at booth it was like we bothered her. 

Once we got to sit down we were promptly served by a great busboy. Our waiter was Rocco.  He did a great job. We were talking and were not quite ready to make our order just yet but the rude hostess came over took all menus but one and said we could share? Does this place not have enough meñus? 

The food was ok. I got the angus burger on brioche and others got pasta items off the menu also said it was ok but not for price. Fries were not savory. It was just ok and overpriced. 

In the past I have tried the zappolis and wedding cake and they were phenomenal!!! But on this trip  I was just here for food. I wanted to give this place a better score but I was not happy with the limited selection, prices and the taste. 

Maybe just a bakery there would of been great.

I'm not a big Italian foodie but everything for dinner that I tasted was amazing. I ended up having the beef tenderloin and I ate every bite. 2 days later I'm still craving it. Wasn't too impressed with the desserts but did like the creme brûlée a lot.

Best part is the view of the strip from the bar. It wasn't super busy. Slow service from the wait staff, arrogant manager on-duty, and one-drink-at-a-time bartender make this restaurant experience drop a couple of stars. The positives are a very nice greeter, fast kitchen and casual Italian ambience. Skip the basics, don't get the spaghetti or lasagna al forno because they are not much better than local joints. It's expensive for what it is, so you might as well go for the good stuff. Try the veal or chicken parm, veal Marsala, and the bar. I'll try it again and hope it gets better.

This was a great Sunday Brunch, my first time there. Flavorful items. They also have a regular menu, for those who prefer there meals served. Delicious Sangria! Kids will love what they offerhave a small appetite and it was enough! I recommend Buddy V's. I will return for the full menu!

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS RESTRAUNT!  Food was so delicious, and the waiters/waitresses were super nice and helpful.  Was great for lunch and dont get me started on the canoli's....  DELISH!  I will deffinately be returning!

I brought my daughter here for her birthday lunch. She has a passion for cooking and baking and Buddy is her idol. She was so excited. We made a reservation for the 6 of us. When we showed up I was automatically taken back by the lack of personality and sheer lack of respect from the hostess. I must have high standards seems how I work in a restaurant but I certainly would expect more from a restaurant of its caliber and popularity. We had no greeting, no hello, no nothing. When we were seated we were handed menus and we knew it was a bit pricy before we went so that wasn't a shocker. It's the Las vegas strip and you're paying for the name. But honestly for the price and because of the name I really pictured a warm, friendly atmosphere. Not a cold environment where we were treated like we intruded and were not welcome. I felt so sad for my daughter. She was excited to go there for the amazing experience she thought she'd have and to have my 12 year old on her birthday feel so let down and disappointed about the service is very disheartening. She felt like she was personally let down by Buddy himself. The food was good but when you feel so unwelcome, it ruins the entire experience. Such a bummer that the Bake Shop service wasn't any better either. Can't say I'll be going back and I Definately don't think this is how Buddy would want people to feel walking into his restaurant because he is such a family guy who's welcoming and makes it feel like home.

One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas!

Excellent happy hour, large amount of seating, welcoming environment and totally tasty! This joint is delish, the hubs and I have been twice and I highly recommend it. Service is great, cocktails are fabulous and food is fantastic. The price is a little high for my usual, but is on point for a quality spot in this city!

The service is also great, the bartender to the hostess are all friendly and on top of it. Our recent experience even had a fab server (Christine?) who said she constantly checks the yelp reviews to ensure quality experiences! She also recommended the creme brulee, but we were so stuffed from garlic bread and pasta that there was simply no room. But, I might have to give it a try next time!

They also have a fantastic happy hour, and supposedly a great brunch. I say yes!
This is a good place to go before you catch a show. Not to pricey for a nice meal in Vegas and the food is good. I enjoyed eating here but it wasn't anything spectacular.
If you come here, ask for Peter!  He was an AMAZING server!!  And hands down, eat the linguine and clams!  Warning: There was a lot of garlic!!

We went to Buddy V's on opening night. Our server was a little nervous but did a good job. Buddy and his family were in the restaurant and were very friendly. I had Caesar salad which featured freshly made croutons that were crunchy on the outside and creamy inside. For a main course I had the chicken parm it was nicely breaded still crunchy just enough sauce and small side of spaghetti. For dessert 3 of us shared the lobster tail and Nutella cake. The lobster tail pastry was a little tough but the filling was great the Nutella cake was amazing. The decor was very welcoming like grandmas house and whimsical with bakery influenced designs.

Delicious Sunday Brunch! Be sure to try the meatballs and Italian Sausage. Decor is simple, but well done and the food is home style, simple, but perfectly executed. ONLY because it has the CAKE BOSS name attached to it - dessert could have been a wider selection.

Only place in The Venetian that disappointed . Felt like the Olive Garden.  Bread had no taste. Very stingy with the pasta. The waiters were nice and desserts were good. Loud and overpriced.  Even the $12 bloody Mary was bland.
I give it a three only because they took forever to bring our food. It did not feel like how Buddy describes it. Very slow service. Did not exceed my expectations for the first time visit.
Lasagna is amazing, Sunday Gravy is also awesome! Will return soon to try other dishes!! Deserts amazing also!

Great food and decently priced. And the service was amazing. The restaurant was about to close and they served us. They were extremely friendly. The live music is pretty good and is somewhat loud but enjoyable. Some people might not like the music though. The view is also pretty good too.

We ate in the bar area, and thoroughly enjoyed the happy hour food and drinks. The atmosphere was pleasant, while the food and drinks were surprisingly good. Highly recommend the meatballs. The only disappointment was the service from server Miko. He was very chatty with a few tables, while short and dismissive with others. He would take your order, but didn't return to the table to check on you, refill drinks, recommend additional food items to order, take new drink orders, etc. On the other hand, the men and women who cleared the tables, refilled water glasses, brought out new utensils, etc were efficient and pleasant. If management reads these reviews, please pass along praises to your staff who work hard and deserve recognition for a job well done, while taking note of the one employee who seriously missed the mark.

My husband and I are huge cake boss fans. We've visited the bakery multiple times, met buddy, and even ordered birthday cakes from Carlo's. He's such a nice guy, and his family is so genuine. 

Of course we had to try one of his newest additions. We showed up on a Friday right when they open, at 11:30a. We were seated pretty promptly. Our server was friendly, but not very authentic... Kinda 'going through the motions'. Too early to be at work I guess.

We ordered a pizza and a sausage and pasta dish. Both were very tasty and average sized, not huge but not small either. 

The decor is very authentic Italian, and has a homestyle kitchen vibe. Really spacious with tons of seating, only the weren't too many people dining , that day at least. 

I'll be back next time in in Vegas! I hope others will too!

Buddy V's is actually quite an interesting place to dine. This joint is not one of the high end Italian joints that you're used to seeing in Vegas, it's more of a casual dining experience in which you can wear shorts and a t shirt and fit right in. The ambiance is actually pretty nice and the location has some decent views of the strip. The food taste was just average, IMHO... Essentially nothing to write home about, the lasagna was just ok and rather small in portion while the Caesar salad was below average but did have croutons that were awesome (warm and soft). Overall, this may be a good spot to go the next day after a long night out, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. 

Pros-
Location
Service
Decor
Menu

Cons-
Average taste 
Pricey

Really great food and service! Our waitress gave us several recommendations of dishes to try and we ate everything! The desserts were just as good as they look on tv, but taste like heaven! Buddy just happened to be in the restaurant and signed an autograph and took a picture with us. My daughter is 10, and watches his show everyday on Netflix, she said this lunch was the best part of our trip to Las Vegas! I have to agree, can't wait to come back!

The food is full of flavor. We decided to eat here after reading a few Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed. My husband had the Veal Marsala and I had the Chicken Parm. Both were delicious! We wish we would have split a dish though, because by the end of dinner we didn't have much room left for dessert, which look so dang good. Sad face. Next time we will definitely split a dish so that we can indulge in some yummy Italian dessert.

Great food and amazing service from Kristi and Alex!

The Gravy is amazing with tons of flavors. And the chicken parm is the best I've ever had. Get a booth that over looks the strip and it's perfect to watch. Don't forget the calamari!

Came in valentines day weekend for a 7:30 reservation. I was worried that they'd be slammed and food would take a while. Pleased to say that was NOT the case at all.
Our server and bus boy were very attentive, made great recommendations and took good care of us. 
We are Las Vegas locals that braced the traffic and tourists to come check this place out because we are big cake boss fans. It was well worth it! 
I think their Mac n cheese was my favorite. It's hard to tell. It was so good we couldn't help ourselves, SO FULL!
Loved it. Great atmosphere, and amazing food. The cannoli was to die for!  The do a brunch on Sunday's or we would have gone back a second time. It's a little hard to locate, but make sure you do!

I had my heart set on Chicken Parm for lunch. I was extra excited to find the best lunch deal i've seen on the Strip here at Buddy's included chicken parmigiana. Boss' Express Lunch for $22 got us an antipasto, main entree and dessert. For a starter, Grandma's meatballs were tender and sat in a bed of tomato ragu. The much anticipated chicken parm was a little on the dry side but nothing a little more sauce could've helped with. It was just the right amount of food. My heavy lunch was offset by the refreshing lemon sorbet with biscotti. Very strong lemon flavor, it was good! I would also suggest the Panzanella - i tried a few bites and it was a really great salad if you're looking for something lighter to start your meal with.

Fun touches related to baking and family incorporated into the decor. Ceiling lightbulbs encased in mixer whisks, rolling pin structures and at home pictures on the brick walls. Big restaurant and comfortable, family vibe. Huge fan of Buddy's show Cake Boss. Was hoping to catch him but maybe next time!

The food was wonderful, but the service was terrible.This restaurant would have had five stars if it were not for the poor service. It took 20 minutes for a waiter to come to our table, Then the waiter asked us if we wanted bread, because they brought bread to everyone's table, but our's was different it was a garlic cheese bread that we did not order and he charged us for it.  So the food was great, service terrible!

Took my 13 year old daughter there for her birthday dinner. She loves cake boss. We however brought our own cake and they were nice enough to store it in back.  Our server Perry was top notch and went above and beyond to please my entire family including finding candles for me because I forgot them. From beginning to end perfect service that complimented the tasty food.  You will not be disappointed.  Get a seat by the window so you can see the strip.  We will eat here again!

The Tiramisu is the best I've ever had in my whole life. I order it every time I am here.   Beware that there is always a line if you come with a big party.  Make reservations in advance or take a chance with the bar area, which can give you a great view of the strip.  When I was previously here, there was live music with people dancing next to the bar area, but they didn't have a band this time. Not sure if this was due to a slow season in December.  Overall a very lovely atmosphere with great food.

We had an early dinner. Stopped in around 4:30 p.m. The restaurant is really nice, open and clean. There are great views. The portions are pretty big. I didn't care for the drinks. But other than that the menu is pretty simple and easy to follow. The prices aren't that bad for being a restaurant in Vegas. Definitely good for either a big family dinner or casual dining.

We tried to go there last night and, if the hostesses don't change their poor customer service, this place won't be there for too much longer.
Walked up at 5:15 p to make a reservation for 8 at 6 p. The restaurant was very light with guests and, there were plenty of open tables in our sight.
One hostess told us the earliest we could be seated was 7:15 p. Then, a 2nd hostess popped up and said it wouldn't be before 7:45.
Not a problem, we went to Cannaletto in the Grand Canal Shops. We were accommodated, the food and wine was superb. It was a great dining experience.
Buddy, you better go visit soon or, you're going to regret it. Your restaurant management is killing your restaurant and, your reputation.

We arrived around 11 to get some desserts at the bakery next door. The line was LONG so we decided on lunch here instead. You can get a Lobster Tail (for $15) and a few other things that you can only get at the restaurant. Prices are decent for a strip meal. The place was pretty empty so we were seated quick. They had a lunch deal which included a salad, entree and dessert for $22. They had enough options to choose from and everything was pretty tasty. I got the salad panzanella, margherita pizza and cannoli. Everything was great. I would have liked more fresh mozzarella on the salad because it was so good. The pizza could have used more sauce but those are my likes when I make that salad and pizza. I would go again for sure and maybe next time get the $15 Lobster Tail.
My favorite Italian restaurant on the strip so far-the orecchiette pasta with Italian sausage was great

The service was FANTASTIC!  We were a table of five and shared our entrees to have a variety of tastes.  Some of us loved the calamari, the other half thought it was too tough.  The eggplant parm was actually hard, so I'm glad it was a shared appetizer instead of a meal. I had read great things about the lasagna...but I must say, I was slightly disappointed.  The portions were huge but if nothing about the dish makes you want to  eat more then who cares?  The chicken parm was GREAT!  But the pasta it came with was OVERLY salty!!!  The Osso Bucco and Polenta were OUTSTANDING as was the Veal in bone parm....although another party at the table complained there was too much cheese on that.  The XL Lobster Tail for dessert is to die for :) ...and I really loved the cannoli.  The ambiance was great....and like I said, the service was stellar!  The portions were great, ... I just have a few complaints....and a few disappointments.  Would still give it another try to taste a few more things before discounting it.
Service was exceptional. Went there for dinner with friends Ina recommendation from our lunch server. The pasta was amazing and desserts were delicious. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

Good buffet. There wasn't a lot of food but the dishes there were above expectations for a buffet. It is worth the price and especially bottomless drinks, alcohol (almost said alcoholic which is how I'm feeling after 4 days in Vegas lol) is worth the $16.99 price.

Stayed at the Venetian and decided to eat here. Food was great. Probably some of the best Italian I've ever had. The service was great. Our cups never went empty and when I spilled a scant amount of tomato sauce on my shirt, the waiter came out of nowhere and gave me club soda to help with the stain and it worked! I will definitely be coming back here the next time I visit Vegas.
Excellent meatball sub - it's huge and good to share so you have room for the super fabulous cannoli! The food is amazing and the service is amazing as well! This is a must in Vegas!

This is 2nd time we came back for Chilean Seabass (only in October).  I am not a fan of fish but this fish is the bomb!!! Simple cookingn with garlic but perfect combination with salad.  Defenitly need to try if you have a cahnce.

I honestly had a hard time finding things to eat here as a vegan. I opted for the whole wheat penne pasta with roasted vegetables - mostly mushrooms! It was delicious, aside from the mushrooms. I'd prefer if it was listed in the description what the veggies were! Otherwise, seems like an average Italian restaurant to me.

From appetizer to desert Buddy V's was a great Italian dinner. The mozzarella en carrozza was delightful, the scallops were seared to perfection and served on the creamiest polenta I've ever had. My wife enjoyed her ravioli and my kids had the pizzas. All delicious. 

Desert: we had the lobster tail and Nutella cake. Both were decadent. The lobster tail was smaller than I had anticipated; but it was flaky and the cream filling wasn't heavy.

Best meal we have had in Vegas! Everything was amazing! The meatballs were incredible and oh that sauce. We loved the manager Stuart! He really made sure we were taken care of the whole evening. I would highly recommend! Great food and even better service. Thanks Stuart for making us feel like family!

Best meal in Las Vegas. Much better than Delmonico's (Emeril's place). 5 star service from Georgio.  We have eaten somewhere different for almost a week and this was the best.  Ask for the family style sampler. We didn't see it on the menu but they bring their signature appetizers, entrees and desserts. Worth the visit!
Great food!! Chicken Marsala is a must try. The rest of my group enjoyed their food as well. The spaghetti was also very good. Check this place out.

Yum yum yum!

Great food and great dessert!
You must try the carbonara pasta!

and their molten cake and Italian bday cake dessert are to die for, I swear!

I ate at the bar for happy hour. We really weren't planning on eating there but after going to Carlos bakery right before we thought we might get a snack here. Our bartender was cool at first and then became a bit pushy. The drinks were good. I got the sangria, my friend had a Bellini. 
So we each ordered a caprese salad and gnocchi to share. We received our caprese salads. It was a pretty good portion. We both agreed our salad needed some more vinegar and a bit of salt. It just tasted so bland. I love caprese salads so this was a real disappointment. We then receive ricotta cheese and bread. Neither of us touch it since we didn't order it. Then we figure out the gnocchi isn't coming. We eat the ricotta and both think the cheese is bland too!
I won't be coming back. But food was a huge disappointment!

If you want touristy low grade Italian food this is the place. Very low quality food and way overpriced. Buddy isnt going to make it in vegas just on his good name. Meat balls were good, chicken parm tasteless , cheap low grade spaghetti side thrown next to it. At the price point should have used linguini with a higher grade sauce.

The setting looks like "mama's kitchen", which was adorable w/ rolling pins hanging from the ceiling and bundt cake pans on the wall. Their food spoke for itself from their appetizers, dinner, to dessert. Their cheese board is a MUST and worth the price. The lasagna had a good balance w/ cheese and tomato sauce, but for dessert.... the Butterscotch Creme Brule was sooooo good from the sugary shell and the vanilla mascarpone cream. Their customer service was just the cherry on top SHOUT OUT TO PETER bruhh! I can't wait to try their brunch (.... bottomless mimosa and bellinis!)
Excellent quick service with delicious food! Everything was cooked perfectly from soup to ente We had a wonderful time in a pleasent atmosphere with an attentive waitress!

Much better than I expected.  Went on a Sunday morning so it was a brunch buffet that I did not partake in, so I only ordered Tomato Basil soup.  The soup was good, though serving size was small for the price and it didn't come with bread.  My wife got the buffet and really liked it and she snuck me some bread for my soup and that bread was also good.  

All in all, for a place founded based on a TV show, it's really pretty decent.  However, it's overpriced.  As a bonus, the Carlo's Bakery is across the hall.

Good food, nice presentation, great service even though it was crowded. But truthfully, for what we spent, I expected it to be a little better than it was. Fun to go once, but probably would not go there again!

Servers are pretty hot and intelligent. Pizza was a little bit too salty. Everything else especially the antipasti tastes great. The main dish medium well steak was somehow pricy. I didn't see one single cow on the way from Los Angeles to Las Vegas. This may explain the tag haha.

Had a yummy dinner here with hubby and a friend during a work conference. We started off with an order of fries and a caprese salad. The fries were excellent, and our waitress had the kitchen made a larger caprese salad for us so we could share it. It turned out it was burrata cheese, which was awesome. Hubby had the enormous veal parmesan chop and it was the size of a dinner plate. Our friend had the lasagna, and I had the scallops. All the entrees were excellent. They miss the mark a little on dessert. Although I had a molten nutella cake which was delish, hubby had the Italian birthday cake which was extremely bland and very disappointing. Our friend had the lemon cheesecake, which had a nice bright lemony flavor, but I'm just not a fan of cheesecake, so I can't impartially rate that. Overall, a great dining experience, although the place is extremely loud and I was hoarse by the end of the meal from trying to be heard over the din! Oh, and Buddy was actually there that night making the rounds saying hello to people. That was kind of fun too!

So let me just start by saying the food here is amazing.  The drinks are meh, but the pasta was DELISH!

The reason why my review is so low is because our server sucked.  I'm not some snooty restaurant goer either.  I used to work in a restaurant, so I know how it's not hard to be an okay server.  However, that being said, we were there for a Bachelorette dinner, and we had maybe 2 small interactions with our waiter.  He was extremely show, didn't check on us once, but decided to charge us extra for some souvenir cups we didn't ask for and failed to inform us that a smaller bottle of water was $10 each.  We waited for 30 min after we were done eating for him to come by to us and check if we wanted anything else or our bill.  Horrible service and really disapointed about this restaurant as I'm a huge Cake Boss and Buddy fan.  If the service improves by a lot, then I'll be back, but until then, I'd rather be checking out other restaurants on the strip.
One of my favorite restaurants in Venetian. Service is good food is even better!! If you watch the show or are a fan of Italian food you need to try it!

We love everything in Buddy V's Sunday brunch! Just the right amount of choices for a buffet. Not overwhelming; Nothing goes to waste  Service was great too!  and there was live feel-good music while we enjoy family time and our scrumptious meal  Thank you for the great experience!

Sunday brunch is overpriced at $34.95 per person.  Food that was provided was good quality as was the service.  Would be improved by including a drink, smoked salmon, omelette station.
Recommended gratuity is calculated including sales tax which is inappropriate.

We were just there last night, and we found it to be great.  Our server was Caleb and he was wonderful, he helped explain everything about our dishes so we could make the best choices for us.  Food was great, service was great, I would go back in a heart beat.  The manager that night was Adam and he was very attentive and funny from the time we walked in to the time we left.  The two of them really made our visit go over the top.Food AAa  Service AAA
Service was great...went there twice during our stay :) Caesar salad was average and the macaroni carbonara was average but everything else was amazing!  Looking forward to next time!

If I could give 3.5, I would. The food was really good! We wanted to dine at the restaurant on my birthday, but they were closed for a private party. So they asked us to make a reservation for the next night and they would take good care of us.  Not so true! We had to wait for a table and the service was bad. The guys in the red tshirts were better than the waiters. As for a bday dessert or a bday wish from the waiter- NOTHING!! Did not make me feel special at all, and to think I was soooo excited to celebrate my birthday there a day late. Very disappointing.

I made reservations mid afternoon on Wednesday for our group of ten.  We were seated shortly after arriving and got sat next to a noisy group.  Our waiter was able to project his voice to go over some of his favorites on the menu.  We ended up ordering two orders of the salumi and cheese board.  I am allergic to fennel and was assured by the waiter that pasta dish I ordered was in the clear.  Several in the group ordered the  Sunday gravy and were in heaven.  The chicken Parmesan was also a hit (a dish I had on my first visit several months ago). One couple in the group ordered the  waiters favorite grandmas meatballs.  The bread and oil/vinegar was amazing as always.  The group was really impressed with the service we had.  Six of them had never been before.  They were very happy with our pick for dinner our first night in vegas!

Make reservations if you want to sit at a real table. We had to sit in the lounge at a high top - not ideal for dinner due to the lack of space. I had the Mac n Cheese Carbonara - delicious, creamy, smoky flavor. Despite sitting in the lounge, they served the full menu and the food was out almost instantly. Great prices for Vegas. Fun eclectic modern decor. Try to get there from 4:30-6:30 for happy hour on appetizers and drinks! I enjoyed a $4 Sangria.

Poor service, small portions, and the red sauce they use was wayyy too salty. Prices are in the higher range. The bread  was good. That's about all that was... Basically your just paying for the name. Never going back.

We grabbed dessert at Carlo's, and realized that there were not very many tables to sit and enjoy dessert, so we headed over to the restaurant bar.
Our server was very nice. She was attentive, nice, and pleasant to speak too. Ordered a few drinks, chowed down on our Canoli and chocolate mousse cheesecake, eventually we ordered some food (mac and cheese, calamari, they are standard off any Italian menu, however they were delicious!). The ambiance of the bar was very nice, it was packed and had a live singer (with a VERY nice voice, Thanks to the Fabulous Baker Boys!) it was so romantic, and straight out of a movie- I was so in love (we were on an anniversary trip:).

Overall I thoroughly enjoyed it all, and look forward to visiting Buddy V's when we in town again! :)
Just had a brunch buffet at this place.  Live music and great foods.  It's one the best in Vegas!

We spent NYE at Buddy Vs at the Palazzo. What a great experience!  The food was great, fresh and tasty and not too much, but enough to share tastes with everyone at the table. I had the linguini and white clam sauce, it was delish. I also appreciated that most dishes were slightly under salted. The flavors really came out. But, if you go for no other reason, go for Giorgio!  Even though the place was crazy busy he took the time to give us special service. I've been in family-run trattorias in Italy and that's how Giorgio made us feel, just as if we were in his family's kitchen. It's Buddy's, don't skip dessert!  We had the Italian birthday cake and, Giorgio you were right. It made me forget about run-of-the-mill tiramisu!
Very hard to find such a friendly place, even the chef came out to greet us! Shoutout to Chef Forgione. Great view and tasty food. The garlic bread and meatballs are a must!

YUMM!!! I can't say enough about how delicious this place is! I wanted a second stomach so I could eat more. The tomato basil soup is AMAZING, the garlic cheese bread is sooooo good. I went with a group of 6 people and everything was incredibly delicious. Seriously come here hungry. We all ordered different things so we could try different items and they were all so yummy. Then of course went across and ordered some desserts ;)

We weren't quite as impressed as a year ago. First, with a reservation, we were seated in the bar area. It was loud, noisy and the a/c was blowing directly on us. The hostess said nothing else was available. We spotted a booth that just opened up lower down and requested the change of table from the server. Great service in the booth that we were moved to. I ordered from their special menu that was all inclusive. I chose the chicken Parmesan. It was tasty but the sauce was a bit more bland than I prefer. I have to say the cannoli and tiramisu were out of this world. I enjoyed the tomato basil soup as well. This experience was ruined by the hostess seating a reservation at a bar table.

Made a reservation through Open Table for my birthday. We arrived right on time and were immediately seated at our table. We were immediately given ice water which was much needed in Vegas! 

My husband ordered the Sunday Gravy and I had the Agnolotti which was a ravioli filled with a mixture of beef, pork and veal covered in a sage brown butter sauce. We also shares the garlic bread which we didn't really need because they bring you this delicious focattia bread fresh from the oven. During our meal the manager came by and chatted with us for quite a while about restaurants in Chicago he and my husband has both visited. He let us know that what I ordered was the best dish on the menu. 

We could have easily shares the Sunday Gravy between the 2 of us because we were so stuffed we had to order dessert to go! Bit the cannoli was delicious in our hotel room a few hours later!

As with most great places in Vegas it helps to make a reservation so you don't have to wait. And I will absolutely bring my family next time we are in town!

I had dinner here early on a Sunday evening. Get here early enough and you can snag one of the tables overlooking the strip.

I had the "Sunday Gravy" which is a variety of things - sausage, meatballs, lamb, etc. served with pasta and red sauce. Great dish and very filling. Dining companion enjoyed her chicken parm. Pricing is reasonable for the strip, but obviously you can get cheaper Italian food in a locals restaurant. Service was good. I'll be back.

We came across the restaurant and I really want it to have dinner their to celebrate my birthday.  When we asked if we need it any reservations the restaurant hostess was very rude. I asked if we can make reservations for a later time and with an attitude she said "well I guess,  I'll try and squeeze you in," although I really want it to eat their didn't feel like dealing with attitude. We decided to eat at a different restaurant.

This is my favorite chicken parm in Vegas!

I think celebrity chefs restaurants get a bad rap on occasion just because a lot of Yelpers don't want to appear "trendy". Buddy V's, IMHO, could be named BLANK and have the crowds it does based on their food alone. As my Uncle used to say when he called us to the table at one of his BBQ's, "It's real good and there's lots of it!". Great service and views along with great Italian food gets 5 stars from me.

WHEN YOU GO- Reservations at night are a must! I recommend lunch and a window seat!

Had the margarita pizza, just ok, the frozen one from Vons is better, not flavored enough (bland), crust a little burnt, had the Cesar salad w/grilled shrimp, it was good, but the fresh croutons was not what I was used too, was still warm and a bit undercooked in the middle, it was very soft w some lemon or sour taste, didn't eat those, didn't mixed well with the chilled salad, also had the fresh garlic bread and tomato basil soup, this was the best! Our waiter was a Jerk, our bus guy was better then the waiter I wish I could have tipped him, I tipped the waiter but trust I didn't want too! I'm not going back, I'll stick to the bakery!

The atmosphere is cool and view of the strip is nice. The bolognese was very good but the meatball sub was so-so at best with bread so hard the stuff in the middle spilled out everywhere. The house salad was nothing more than romain and the lemon vinaigrette was incredibly salty...like bathed in salt. Not sure I'd come back, so many other good options that are in the same general are.
AMAZING!     My friend and I both had the Sunday Dinner Gravy and it was incredible.  Service was impeccable and Joy the bartender was great! Loved conversation with her and had a brilliant time.

Buddy V's is like eating Sunday dinner with my Nona. The food was traditional, impeccably crafted, and amazingly delicious. The service was beyond helpful, informative, and all around pleasant. The general manager Adam, went out of his way to chat with our table and surrounding tables several times. I highly recommend this restaurant for the good and the atmosphere.

Been here about 5 times. Food is either always really good or just a little off -- like too salty -- but still decent. 
The desserts are always ridiculously good, creme brûlée and lobster tail are delicious, the desserts are definitely the best part of the meal. Customer service, not so good. Servers disappear or really rush around to where you only see them 10% of your entire visit when it should be more like 40%. Drinks go unrefilled and putting in orders or requests can take a while. 
Good food, a little pricey. Just wish the servers would slow down and be more attentative to their tables needs. Wouldn't normally say anything but been here 5 times and noticed this every time.

Amazing dinner, great atmosphere and exceptional service! We came here for my moms 60th bday. Our server, Peter, was so incredibly friendly and was joking around with us the whole time. He definitely made the experience an unforgettable one! The surf and turf was SO good, my steak was cooked perfectly medium-rare and that lobster! Yum! We order the garlic bread and mozzarella appetizers and they were both just delicious. The creme brûlée was INCREDIBLE. As was the lobster tail dessert and the Nutella chocolate lava cake thing. We will definitely be coming back! Thanks, Peter for the great service! Oh, and the prices are so reasonable! Between $30-$50 per plate but it has the atmosphere more like a fine dining setting.

Went there for a friends birthday last night. Atmosphere is really comfortable and welcoming. Good crowd and energy. The food 100% delivered. My challenge was with the service. They're new so I'm sure they're working out kinks. But the waiter was so spotty - wouldn't see him for 15-20 minutes at a time. Forgot requests, didnt bring any pens for the checks. Overall great experience and ill be back.

They did a nice job renovating the former First Food space. It feels more homey and approachable. The interior may skew towards an over-the-top, typical Italian restaurant  with red and white checkered tablecloths and a panoply of picture frames, but there are cool touches like the light fixtures and use of rolling pins throughout. The place doesn't reinvent the cuisine, but executes traditional Italian-American dishes with a few subtle modern touches to create one of the better Italian restaurants on the Strip.

The eggplant parm app has plenty of great flavor, but could have benefitted from a crispier exterior. The dough of the aggnolotti was a touch thick, but the crispy texture from being pan fried was a nice touch. The sweetness of the sauce with the savoriness o the pork filling was great. The winner of the night was the huge brick sized portion of lasagna that arrived in a small cast iron dish. The mixture of proteins along with the boldness of the ricotta made for a wonderful combination that was only enhanced by the depth of a red sauce that any Italian grandmother would be proud of. For little ones, there's a kid's menu available. Among the items was a large order of buttered noodles that my kid loved. No meal is complete without dessert, and the nutella cake was a satisfying way to end it. It's their version of a lava cake with a rich, moist cake enveloping a gooey nutella mixture. A scoop of salted caramel ice cream accompanied it with a brittle underneath that added a good contrast in texture.

The execution was solid and the dishes different enough from your typical Italian American joint to make Buddy V's a good choice among moderately priced restaurants on the Strip.

Food was good but overpriced. There are other restaurants in town just as tasty for almost half the price. 

I had high expectations for the Lobster Tail XL and was extremely disappointed. The size, first, and then the shell of the pastry wrapping the custard. It was so hard I could barely chew it, much less finish it. The custard itself was good though. 

The bake shop outside of the restaurant is all I'd ever go back for.  Their cinnamon cannoli's are much more worth the price for their quality.

One word. AMAZINGGGG!!!! Definitely a 5 star restaurant. I came here because I love Cake Boss. I knew it wouldn't be a disappointment at all. My friends and I ordered: chicken parm, mother in law shrimp scampi, salmon, orecchiette & Italian sausage and a margarita pizza. All were on point! I'm def coming here again
Great food! Excellent service! The chicken parm was wonderful! The cannolis were awesome as always!

Visited Buddy's restaurant 5 nights ago. My friend and I sat at the bar and were taken care of by a wonderful bartender Miko. He was pleasant, funny, and totally on his game as far as drink orders (ask him to make you something - he's got a few awesome drinks up his sleeve!). He definitely steered me in the right direction for dinner - the cheese raviolis are out of this world! We also had a few appetizers that ended up being a meal - grandmas meatballs were heaven, the mozzarella cheese appetizer was not like anything I've had before (in all the right ways), and the antipasti plate was this awesome combo of cheeses and meats and olives that I was swooning over. The only bad part? No room for dessert! Guess I'll just have to go back next time I'm in town!!

This placed is SOOO GOOD!!! This was in our
top 3 favorite restaurants on our last Vegas trip. We went for lunch, the atmosphere was pretty casual,
for dinner you would need to be more dressed up. 

My husband got the meatball sandwich and said it was amazing! I got the Buddies Favorite Pizza, it was the perfect size for lunch.

Everything tasted so fresh! I wish I could eat at Buddy's again.... (well sooner than a year from now)

While back in vegas I could not miss Sunday brunch at Buddy V's. Again very Impressed with everything first of all when I arrived I received a welcoming greeting by by Tiffany who does an awesome job! The food is always consistant and the QUALITY of the food amazing. The staff, EVERYONE is so HOSPITABLE and hard working. This time the GM came by to say hi and chat while I was taking photo of food.

We had dinner here last night. The food was excellent and the service was out of this world. Our server was prompt, courteous, and funny. Our drinks, appetizers and entrees were out quick and piping hot. Lots of attention to detail. Overall a great experience!

The staff has their job down to a science and that makes for a very smooth flowing dinner; never had to wait for anything. 
Meatball app was good- perhaps too much for two people. 
Chick parm was decent- not used to baked chick parm. Substituted spaghetti for rigatoni w/ meat sauce. Good flavor.

Excellent top to bottom.  The service at the bar was great.  There were two gentlemen who played music in the bar area and they were talented.  Extensive wine list.  Caesar salad had a nice surprise-and-delight element of warm polenta croutons.  Yum.  Grandma's meatballs...excellent.  I am a tough critic of restaurant meatballs and those balls delivered!  Beef, pork and veal is always the right combination of flavor.  Red sauce great.  And the chicken with rigatoni in vodka sauce with pancetta...delish.  Rich, big flavor.  Huge portions.  The hubs and I split everything so don't be shy about sharing!  Great experience.

Made dinner reservations before going to see the Fortunate Son in Concert.  The cheese bread is good, and I am not a big fan of cheese.  I ordered the linguini  and clam sauce and my wife got the spaghetti with meat balls. We topped it off with the Apple pie ala mode.

Second time going to Buddy's this year. Both times the food and service were great. Went for lunch and the menu isn't huge but the meals were great. Had their meatball sub (meatballs were great!) and their chicken sandwich and we really liked both. Finished it off with a cannoli - lets just say you can tell why he's famous for his cannolis.

I teetered between a 3 and 4... the four because the portion size was good (my linguine with calms had clams in the shell AND chopped inside the pasta,) not huge 5 pound plates of pasta; however, spending $26 for a plate of pasta may turn off a lot of customers - but you're in Vegas. A four because my Drago Rosso cocktail was very good, a touch of spice and the mango garnish was delish. Also enjoyed a regular Caesar salad, but the "croutons" were actually yummy, warm, cubes of polenta, right on! Now for the "eh..." Sunday gravy plate - loved meat variety, but couldn't look over salty sauce. Service was okay, couldn't find her half the time, but when she was there she was attentive and kind, without being over the top. Lastly, I made a reservation, confirmed the next day, and when I showed up at five 'till then said they couldn't find it. A 4 because they said they'd sit us anyway, and we did within 5 minutes, but how do you lose my reservation? Doesn't make me feel like my time was worth it to you if you can't even find my name in your records. Will come back, because that was my second visit and I craved to go back last night. But I will be more open to try a new restaurant next time.

We went to Buddy V's on our last night in Vegas recently and had a great meal and terrific service.  Our server was Melissa - she was right on with her recommendations and clarifying portion sizes (we were trying to avoid leftovers).  The two team members working with her (unfortunately, I didn't get their names) were also very attentive and friendly.  

We had the calamari appetizer and Sunday Gravy entree and both were outstanding.  Certainly enough for two to share and leave a little room for desert.  The Tiramisu has a great chocolate cake layer in the bottom which was a great surprise and very good.  We'll definitely go back.

My husband and I come to Vegas frequently so of course when Buddy's opened we had to try it.  We experienced the best service of our lives, and we've eaten at 99% of the restaurants on the strip.  Our server Deanna was very attentive and friendly.  I will definitely request her table during my next visit.  The food was top notch quality food.  The caprese had amazingly fresh mozzarella, and the chicken parm was tender and delicious.  The cannolis are to die for....melt in your mouth amazing.  I can't wait to come back!

As good as American Italian type food as you can get. Spaghetti and meatballs were home-made tasting, in my book that means you can taste the true tomato flavor and it is not overwhelmed by the many spices normally found in spaghetti sauces. 5 medium size meatballs complement the pasta in a heavenly smelling and tasting treat. Garlic bread was buttery, crispy, garlicky, and substantial. Calamari crispy, peppery, with lots of tentacles. This is how calamari should be.

Wait staff amazing, in my book. I had technical questions about the tomato sauce, as in how their Bolognese is prepared. Suffice it to say, it tasted great...not too infused with basil and oregano. Polite and courteous, all staff were pleasant and kind.

The breadsticks were wrapped in separate packages. Just ask for more if you want more. Real grissini torinesi, as they are long and thin, with a hint of olive oil taste.

As good as it gets now...if you've read my reviews, I only give 5 stars to any place only after it has consistently shown, after many visits, that their quality and commitment never wavers.

Omg...I was caught off guard here. Being Italian and a pretty good cook myself I was surprised by how delicious, flavorful and well prepared everything was. Had the meatball appetizers which were like my grandma used to make and a little better shh don't tell. ;-) next I had the shrimp scampi....it was perfection for me, jumbo shrimp with spinach, tomatoes in a divine sauce. Buddy you hit this one out of the park for me. On side note, atmosphere is great, comfortable restaurant, excellent service. Will be returning, perhaps once more before I head home.

The pasta is fresh and  I love that.  The meatballs are flavorful and really do taste homemade, like mom used to make.  The cannoli for dessert, which my husband loves, tasted good to me too, even though I just had one bite.  I do not like cannoli but I sure liked theirs!  The service was horrible.  Absolutely positively horrible.  Nice people, don't get me wrong, but horrible service.  The "bread guy" needed to be told what to do in his job but why couldn't he remember on his own you fill up the water glasses and you keep offering the focaccia?  The waiter was sure to tell me that it was his helper's 19th birthday, but who cares?  Do your job and party later.  The floor manager with the dark black hair and who I believe was dressed too casually for this type of price point restaurant wasn't doing much of anything.  He barely looked up from his texting while showing a waitress what he was texting and laughing about to mumble "Good night.".  Help your waiters out man!  Be a team! I believe the waiters have too many tables to be able to give you the service you deserve for paying those "on the strip" prices.  My hubby did state his linguini with white clam sauce was not flavorful at all.  He ended up asking for a lot of cheese on top, which you have to wait for also since it is not on the table.  Don't be cheap Buddy, put the cheese on the table!

Food = 5 stars
Overall = 3 stars

We had a very uneven experience at Buddy V's. The room was nice, but you really want a booth, as the tables had very uncomfortable-looking, unpadded chairs. Service was scattered and disorganized. Our server, Kacie, while very nice, seemed to be kinda all over the place, we had just sat down when she asked us if we were ready to order (??) and the bread service didn't arrive til after the entrees were served -- disappointing, as the restaurant had been open for long enough to smooth out those kinds of issues.

On the bright side, the food was excellent, we started with the meatballs, which were surprisingly light and tasty, with a nicely seasoned red sauce. I had the whole wheat penne pasta with pesto and veggies, delicious with a lot of flavor but still light. Hubby had the shrimp scampi with perfectly cooked shrimp and angel hair pasta and a light and flavorful sauce. 

The prices were pretty good for Vegas so we felt we had a good value, but it was really too bad that the overall experience didn't match the quality of the food. With so many options in Vegas, I doubt we would be back.

The service at Buddy V's was some of the best I've had in Las Vegas. Everything about the restaurant is very warm and welcoming. The staff are friendly and attentive without being overbearing they where knowledgeable of the Menu and made useful suggestions.
 I had the Sunday gravy it was a nice assortment of meats sausage, lamb, and pork in marinara sauce. My girlfriend had the sea bass and gave it high marks. I don't eat fish so I can't vouch for it personally. We finished with the Italian birthday cake. It was very moist and flavorful without being too sweet. The price was a little high, but this is a celebrity chef with a restaurant on the vegas strip what would you expect. In the end we left satisfied and happier than when we went in.

Hearing so much about Buddy V's cake boss, I was eager to try out his restaurant as well and it was so perfectly placed right across from the cake boss.  It was perfect timingly as there was absolutely no wait time when we went and we were seated right away.  So my husband and I both decided to try his pasta, but we first started off with his meatballs as an appetizer.  They were decently sized but to our disappointment, there was not much flavor to it.  We were expecting a burst of flavor but there wasn't much to it except for ground meat.  Not much seasoning to it at all and it was honestly, something that I make better at home.  For the main course, I ordered the chicken regatoni "alla vodka," which I always have to try at all italien restaurants.  It was pretty good except a bit on the salty side.  My husband ordered the "my dad's bucatini carbonara" which he thought was just ok.  Our waiter was very helpful and did suggest the meatballs for us to try.  Everything else about the restaurant was great.

Not as pleased as I thought I would be!

Came here for a birthday celebration while in Vegas and was let down.

Got here on a Saturday evening ready to feast and was seated promptly after waiting for the rest of my party to arrive. The hostess lead my group to a table by the window and we were seated and given menus.

The items on the menu seemed really good. I knew I wanted something with sausage while the rest of group went with the steaks and spaghetti. The first issue came when everyone had decided on what they wanted and they server took 20 minutes to come back to the table to take our order. That was somewhat odd especially since when the drink was taken he overlooked my order, seriously!!!! I had to ask another waiter who was helping another table to grab my drink, that's not good.

Next, when the waiter did eventually come over to take our orders he insisted on orders rather than giving recommendations, hmmmm, not smooth! The issue with the orders was that everyone's order was taken except for one but that member of my party could not order because the waiter has walked away after getting the 5th order. Why would you do that when there is another person at the table!!! Once again, we had to get another waiter to add another steak to our order because our waiter was unable to do that the first time!!

As for the food, my meal was great. Everyone that ordered a steak loved their food. However, the spaghetti, I was informed, was a bit sour! I did not try it but I told by another member of my dinner party. 

Once finished with our food. We had to wait another 20 minutes before we could get the check. Getting the check went like this. In finally getting the attention of the waiter I got two words out asking for the check and then he interrupted and didn't let me finish to offer dessert. Seriously, usually there is a back and forth in communication but this guy had to speak over me, confusing to me! Again, he was insistent about getting a dessert rather than suggesting or recommending. 

Once I finally got the check everyone was ready to go because this waiter was just no helpful in explaining anything or being attentive to our party. Not a memorable birthday dinner for the birthday girl after talking with her about her dinner. She liked the food but the service a bit aggressive. I guess working here causes the workers to be impatient and overbearing. I don't think so because the other waiters that I talked to were very gracious about assisting my table. I think the gentleman that helped us that evening was just trying way to hard and no making a good impression. 

The food was fine but the service was below what I expected based the reviewed I have heard about Buddy V's. I wanted to 5 star this place but the service killed that potential rating. I hope this situation does not happen to anyone else. But, kudos to the chefs in the kitchen who worked hard to prepare the food.

#buddyvhelpmeout

This restaurant is the noisiest place in Las Vegas (the casino is quieter). 
There is absolutely NO option for a conversation, the wait staff is so rushed you get your food handed from all different directions and from different staff each time. 
There is NO atmosphere only a mad rush of feed and fee then flee. 
The food is mediocre to poor and sadly the dessert was the worst plate of all!
What a let down.

We had Sunday Brunch here and it was a wonderful experience.  The food was all excellent and our waiter was fantastic.

The Sunday Eggs were our favorite, and my wife isn't much of a fan of scrambled eggs.  The frittata had a lot of huge chunks of vegetables, especially asparagus.  The meatballs, chicken apple sausage, freshly smoked bacon, chicken parmesan, and mac-n-cheese were all excellent.  Of course, there were croissants, fresh breads, pastries, cannolis, tiramisu, zonuts, and other desserts.  The food was all delicious and far exceeded our expectations.

We also had all you can drink alcohol.  My wife had bellinis, sangrias, and mimosas.  I had a few beers which, unfortunately, was cheap domestics, but whatever.

I definitely recommend Buddy V's, which is right across the hall from Carlo's Bakery, and the next time we're in Vegas, we'll definitely be back.

Came for lunch and had the express lunch deal. $22 for 3 courses. You do have to ask for it and I was told it's not offered everyday so call before you go.

The chicken parm and the pasta that came with it was one of the best I ever had. I also had the carbonara. It was good, not great. Meatballs were great as well. Had to ask for bread so I can soak up the sauce. Panzanella was good but the croutons in it was great. They were warm and crunchy.

Surprisingly I was disappointing with dessert. I tried the cannoli, tiramisu and lobster tail. The super hyped lobster tail just didn't have the right texture for me. I expected a flaky crisp outside but it was hard and chewy (not in a good way). Just not my thing.

Service was ok. Had to ask for soda/iced tea refills a few times. The raspberry iced tea was great.

I'll be coming back for the meatballs and chicken parm!
No stars..... Had Reservation at 9:15. We just walked out at 9:48 after not one person came for our order.  Worst service ever experienced. Restaurant was not busy by any means.

Two stars because the service was horrible. We waited for over 20 minutes when we were first seated to have a waitress come over. Food was good. Trying to pay bill was a nightmare. 20 minutes and still waiting!

Let me start out by saying that if you come here without trying the calimari you are making a mistake.. In fact you will want to come hungry and order more than one because you may not want to share... I ordered the smashed meatball sandwich with parmigian fries.. This was a 10! Great flavor and healthy portion size. I haven't been this pleasantly surprised by a meal in a long time. 2 thumbs way up to buddy v's

If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would. The food was amazing and our server was excellent! Georgio was absolutely incredible. He made dinner so much fun and even sang me happy birthday in Italian! He was awesome! I will definitely be back!

This was hands down one of the top places I've ever eaten. Amazing food, beautiful cozy and inviting atmosphere and the service was phoenomial to say the least! I believe our servers name was Georgio? Not positive on the name but he was spectacular! SUPER friendly, helped us find great drink and food choices based on what we were looking for. Answered  every question we had thoroughly, he was quick and effiecient, even made us laugh and took a picture for us before we left! Of course knowing this is the 'Cake Boss' restaurant, needless to say the dessert was on point. The drinks...they were certainly not messing around with a lack of alcohol but it wasn't so much to ruin the flavor of the drink! With their current special, depending on what drink you get, you can take the glass home. Overall lovely experience and I wish we had on in Kansas City!

This restaurant was okay. There weren't a ton of people and it took FOREVER to get served. Also,there is no bathroom in the restaurant so you have to schlep out into the hotel which is a pain. 
The food was fine, not really memorable. The decor was odd, it was like old home comfort mixed with a modern feel? Either go old home comfort to match your food or go modern? The server was nice and personable.
BEST. FOOD. EVER. and the red bull drink is absolutely addicting. I will return to vegas JUST for buddy v's.
My family and I really enjoyed everything we ate. The macaroni and cheese was super creamy and the meat and cheese plate was excellent.

Went for Sunday brunch last week and I would go again if I was in the mood for a treat.  Very friendly waitstaff and managers.  Pretty much a nonstop flow of people refilling our drinks, taking our plates, checking in on us and making conversation.  There was kind of a weird moment at first when our group first came in and went up to the hostess podium and two young guys up at the front literally just turned and walked off without saying anything, but later on made up for it.  

Most of the food was delicious (a few hot items were cold already due to there being too much AC in here, as other reviewers have mentioned, but it's not under their control).  They have mini cronuts!  And really excellent french toast.  Our whole group was very satisfied - there was something for everyone - seafood, veggie items, fancy meats, lots of sweet stuff.

Some of the best Italian I've had!! Got the lasagna and chicken parm, unbelievable!! Was worried, Italian can be done REALLY wrong, this is old school basic Italian perfected! Will definitely be back!

It was good, but $24 for spaghetti and meat balls should have been closer to $17/18. The Caprese salad was also pretty unique and comes with a large tomato you slice yourself as well as cherry tomatoes.

We showed up for a snack just as happy hour started. The waitress really sold us on the sangria, but it ended up tasting pretty bitter. 
The gnocchi was weird. Very bread-like, not your typical starchy pasta. The taste was forgettable. 
The wife thought the mac&cheese carbonara just tasted like bacon, but the other two at our table thought it was great (maybe they just like bacon lol).
And the sliders were pretty normal. Nothing to write home about. 
I found it weird that the happy hour specials were only available in the lounge. Maybe that's normal in Las Vegas/America but it caught us off guard.

I am still in love with Buddy V's. 
I have been to this restaurant several times, and EVERY single time the service is perfect, and the food is paramount. 
I always get the Caesar Salad, I just can't get enough of the polenta croutons. I tried the Steak Pizzaiolo, and IT WAS PHENOMENAL!! The steak was cooked perfectly, the sauce had a delicious Cacciatore flavor, and the cheesy polenta it came with was supreme. For dessert I tried the Butterscotch Creme Brûlée (it was the only one I hadn't tried yet) it's my new favorite dessert. 
When you come to Vegas and your craving Italian try Buddy V's, you won't be disappointed.

Absolutely LOVED everything here! We asked for a table by the window and had a nice view. The drinks are all really great. Highly recommend the chicken parm. We ended the night with a cannoli which was PERFECT!!

The calamari was truly the best I've ever had!  Hot and Tender as butter with a  wonderful dipping sauce!  The lasagna was huge, 7 layers, cheesy deliciousness 

The grilled salmon was divine and the scallops were tasty.

Great view, service and ambiance, however it was a little loud.

Do Not Miss the butterscotch creme brûlée!!

Came here for Sunday Brunch. Expectations were low.The last brunch I had was at Yardbird, and if you read my review on that, you may understand why. 

Buddy V's offers about 25 food items, and 10 dessert items for a $35 price tag. They also offer a selection of unlimited alcoholic beverages for another $15. 
They also have a limited al la carte menu that offers pretty much everything that is already on the buffet, but why would you pay $23 for just chicken parm?

Here we go...

As we walked in, the aroma of GARLIC just punches you in the face! 

My! How quickly expectations can change. 

We were warmly greeted buy 2 pretty hostesses, and immediately sat at a table. I couldn't wait to look around. Our server greeted us, and went over the workings of the Sunday Brunch. We also got the unlimited alcoholic beverage option.

My lovely wife got sangria, I started with a domestic beer, then went a red wine. Sangria was great, and so was the vino. We stuck with that for most of the meal. 

As a foodie, I have to say ALL the food offered was FANTASTIC. If you like Italian comfort food, this brunch will satisfy all your needs, and make you eat way too much. 

I ate so much, I did not eat again till the following day. 

The italian sausage on the carving station (see pic) was luscious. The fritatta delish, orecchiette pasta amazing, the french toast unlike anything I've had before. Chicken parm was tasty. They put fried polenta croutons in that amazing fresh, cold, caesar salad. Meatballs were nice. My wife loved the ham on the carving station. 

EVERYTHING was so good, so good, so good. 

I visited the dessert station and discovered a totally different Tiramisu than what  I'm used to. This one was done with love. It was light, wet, and beautiful. The bread pudding and red velvet cake changed my mind about not liking bread pudding and red velvet cake. Hey, the cake boss apparently ain't no joke. These desserts were great. I can't wait to go back to try the Italian wedding cake.

I thought I was done after dessert, but went back to get more of that sausage and meatballs. With a little garlic bread of course. Also had a bloody caesar that was very good also. 

Did I mention how good everything was? Man! this place is my new Sunday after church brunch spot!

I've been to buffets on the strip that offer 3 times as much of a selection for about the same price. You know what though? No one could possibly try that much food. Even if you could, not EVERYTHING would be fantastic. The other thing I dislike about buffets is that the food is almost NEVER hot. 

Buddy V's Sunday brunch offers a smaller selection of fantastic HOT, FRESH food in a buffet style setting. 

The food is so good, that when you float out of there on a euphoric foodie coma trip the last thing you think about is the price. A total value experience.

Food is fresh, served quickly and delicious. I had the free range chicken which was good; but that was it. The potatoes, mushrooms and artichokes served with it were very little. My mom had the chicken Parmesan and it had pasta and two huge pieces of chicken. Much better value at a dollar less than the free range.
Came here for happy hour, it was great! Service was frendly! Will come back to try their dinner! We tried everything at the happy hour menu!!! They were all good!!
Quite possibly the best eggplant Parmesan I have ever had!!!!  Def try it as an app or a small main.

Gr8 restaurant hidden away in the Venetian. Went for lunch and service was fast and friendly. Ordered the chicken parm and it was awesome!! Not the biggest portion of pasta but more than enough chicken. Didn't make it to the pastry side but it was very busy over there. Def will go again.

Ce restaurant a tout faux ! Dès l'accueil on vous place selon votre tenue si vous n'êtes pas chemise et pantalon vous serez placé au bar en vous faisant croire que c'est pour patienter le temps qu'une table se libère. Le bar avec ses tables bancales et son chanteur qui se prend pour franck Sinatra est un endroit insupportable, impossible de tenir une conversation. Finalement on vous apporte vos plats (seul point positif car bien cuisiné). Vous payerez 24 dolls pour des pates ou des lasagnes merci ! En bref un mauvais moment

Great meal here last night. Salads were top notch, bacon Mac n Cheese excellent, and each of our three entrees was superb (the lasagna was exceptional). Not a ton of cutting edge dishes here; just classic Italian fare done right! The dessert menu is inventive and excellent- the hot Nutella cake is a winner!

Can we talk about that chicken parm?! Can we talk about it?! G'DAMN!

This was the best chicken parm I've EVER had. Period. I wanna book a flight back to Vegas rynah just to have that dish one more time. They give you two huge chicken breasts covered in sauce and cheese along with perfectly proportioned pasta coated in just the right amount of marinara. I am drooling just reminiscing.
