Take me back, please! Someone take me back!

If you're gonna eat anything in Vegas, eat that. Do it for yourself, but more so... for me. Cause I miss that parm, man.

Came here for lunch yesterday and was pleasantly surprised with how good the food was. Arrived around 2:30 pm and the place was pretty dead. I didn't have high expectations for this place because it had a very chain restaurant feel. SO WRONG. 

Ordered:
x Panzanella Salad w/ Shrimp (buffalo mozzarella, focaccia croutons, tomatoes, arugula, balsamic red onions) - Salad with lots of flavor. Wait, what? It was perfect with the added shrimp, but I think if you order it without protein it'll feel more like a side salad. LOVED this salad. Croutons were amazeballs.
x Grilled Salmon (Mediterranean chickpea & artichoke salad, roasted tomato vinaigrette, balsamic) - L-L-LOVEEEEE! I like salmon, but I don't LOVE cooked salmon. kinda tastes the same for me everywhere I order it, but this one was excellent. Highly recommend for a healthy option from the menu. All the components complimented each other very well.
x Butterscotch Creme Brulee - My favorite dessert in the world. I didn't really care for the cookies or the vanilla cream it came with, but the creme brulee itself was perfection! Probably one of the best ones I've ever had. 10/10 would recommend.

Service was extremely slow, but the food made up for it. Ask to sit by the window and enjoy A+ food with a strip view :0)

Cake boss knows wssup.

Revision -  oops, Buddy V not Bobby V!  

My sister's nephew said they serve great burgers here for lunch.  So we came for lunch and three of the five of us had the burger.

Angus beef burger served on a brioche bun.  Cooked to order.  Good but I'm not sure I'd come back just for a burger.

Attentive service at lunch.

You can access the restaurant which faces the Strip.  You don't even have to step into the casino.

Directly across the restaurant is the Cake Boss shop.

FYI - this restaurant is across from Carlos' Bakery. I made a reservation for dinner beforehand. Pros... Super friendly service, great ambiance, and the food was tasteful (the cheese ravioli = yummy)! The only slight complaint: the server picked up my friend's unfinished plate too early and didn't bother to ask if she wanted to take it to-go (she's a local). Anyway, I must return for the Italian Birthday Cake!

Just went tonight with my husband for our anniversary. We were both nervous trying such a new restaurant but we were impressed. We had a great server, Daniel, who was very knowledgable about the wine and food. We bought a bottle of wine that turned out being amazing. My husband had
the chicken Parmesan and I had the chicken rigatoni with vodka sauce. Everything was so good and the only thing we could say is it didn't taste like restaurant food, it tasted homemade. We also had to order the lobster tail. Even after a bottle of wine and our dinner it was so light and airy. Amazing. When Daniel found out it was our anniversary he brought out a plate of Italian cookies and bottle of sparkling dessert champagne. It was such a great experience all around and next time we come to Vegas we will be coming back to Buddy V's!

We had a very nice family dinner with my parents at Buddy V's restaurant. We shared the appetizers family style - Cesar salad with yummy polenta croutons, calamari fritti and scrumptioius Grandma's meatballs.  

We had the following entrees:
1) Linguine with clams
2) Mediterranean sea bass
3) Grilled salmon
4) Chicken Parm
5) Classic cheese pizza

For dessert, we had the butterscotch creme brulee with vanilla mascarpone cream, pecan nib shortbread and the apple pie with caramel cinnamon apples, oatmeal & raisin crubmle and vanilla ice cream. The dessert menu was in a mini photo album with shared memories of Buddy growing up and his family. Overall it was delicious authentic Italian food, fresh pasta and flavorful meatballs, chicken and seafood. The service was excellent.

Had chicken parmesan and it was amazing, big, thin, lightly breaded and juicy. We also had grandma's meatballs which were great as well.

I'm def coming back here next time im in vegas.

Amazing !! Our waitress was so awesome. We told her we had a show to make and she said she would tell the back we were in a hurry. Our food came out in 10 mins and was so good. She was attentive and vey friendly could not have asked for better service. Completely impressed.

Great food...wonderful service.  Had the opportunity to take a picture with Buddy.  Thrilled to hear that he may be opening up in Chicago.  What a nice change from some of the chef owned restaurants...they are very accommodating and strive to please the customer.

My friend Katie from Calif. chose dinner at Buddy V's to celebrate her 50th birthday, we are so glad she did! We are obliged to express our amazing experience of the service we received by our server Peter on the evening of November 14, 2015. We have always been pleased with excellent food and service we receive at Buddy V's. However, this time Peter's professionalism and attention to details (serving 5 women, each requesting something different) exceeded our expectations and he made the celebration dinner even more memorable. Such commitment to great customer service is to be commended! We highly recommend Buddy V's as a place to celebrate, and request Peter as your server if you want the 5 star dining experience.

The service was totally awesome, our waiter Randy was very knowledgeable about the menu and the wine selection, and the buss boy Jamal was super attentive and very helpful. I didn't feel rushed, even though our order was complicated and had a few special requests. The food was the best Italian food I have had in a long time. We had 3 dishes with a range of steak, seafood, and pasta, and it was all amazing. I am very impressed with the whole experience, and I think Buddy V should be proud of this place. The management is obviously doing a great job here!

We had a great time at Buddy V's for dinner! The wait on a Saturday night was a little long (45 min when we came at 8:30 pm), but we were able to get a seat by the window which we requested. 

We ordered the lasagna and grilled salmon. The lasagna is huge and big enough for 2 to share. The salmon lies on a bed of salad and was light and enjoyable. 

We also tried the specialty cocktail with the lemon sorbet and it was delicious! 

The view of the strip is a great addition to the food. Service was perfect. Would love to come back to try other menu items!

I had got the chicken rigatoni alla vodka and a kale salad. Of course it was a meal that is a little pricey because it is at a hotel/casino. Its hard to share these dishes because they are more individual portions. The kale sald was very flavorful and good. I enjoyed the texture of the kale and it was way to eat. I didnt really like the rigatoni. I think it was undercooked because the rigatoni was hard and very difficult to chew. The sauce was good though. Our waiter was cool to talk to and welcoming. Nice to try because i do like buddy from cake boss, but I'm not planning to come back.

This was not just a dinner this was an EXPERIENCE!!! Food was incredible especially veal parmigiana! Omg I don't even eat veal GLAD WE TRIED IT! Big enough for left overs that are just as good later THE SAUCE IS AMAZING. I'm more impressed each time we go eat there! The eggplant appetizer amd calamari are like nothing I have ever experienced- anywhere! Butterscotch creme brûlée (even though I was stuffed) I could not stop eating! Fantastico!!!!!well done Peter Nick the manager and especially chef Bryan Forgione and entire kitchen crew! Love this place more and more

Came Here From California And Had To Stop By Carlos ' Bakery didn't even know that his restaurant was across the hall. only a 20 minute wait and they texted us when our table was ready which was very convenient.  

all the staff is great, very nice and always made sure our water was full ! everything on the menu looked great and our part ordered a little bit of everything. 

the pastas are really good and full of flavor.  of course we had to try desert since the line at the bakery was too long and with my lack of patience I just figured we could eat at the restaurant and order some desert . BAMM best of both worlds.  wrong not all the deserts are available at the restaurant, BUT there are some good ones on the desert menu.

the bathroom isn't in the restaurant, it's actually down the hall from the bakery across the hall, seems inconvenient but there wasn't a line any of the two times I went. 

Of course we had to try a canoli and of course we were not disappointed!  overall great restaurant with even better deserts.

Great food, poor service.  Sunday gravy was delicious and loved the piccata.  Birthday cake, cannoli, and lobster tail were on point.  The beef tenderloin was on the rare side for a medium.  Kudos to the kitchen.

For the service, I'll keep it short. Just our luck as first time diners to get the waitress in training on a Saturday night.  It would have been tolerable if she had any personality or acted if she even cared about our experience there.  Never engaged us, we had to continually ask for refills on water,  and brought me the wrong drink.  Trainer right at her side, for what? I blame the management and trainer for this.   Servers in training should be up to speed for the weekend dinner service before being put there.  When customers leave satisfied with the food but disgruntled over the service after paying nearly three bills for a mediocre dining experience, you end up losing a repeat customer.  

You want great reviews and repeat business? Then don't use the trial by fire method with new servers and send them to charm school first.

Ate at this restaurant with a group 9 last Wednesday night. I had heard great things about this restaurant & being a foodie I was excited! First problem was they pushed 2 tables together resulting in them being uneven with each other = disaster when putting wine glasses down. Unacceptable .. Not even an apology or offer to correct the problem. 

Service was extremely slow and the restaurant was NOT full. We got our wine & beverages &'appetizers approx. 10 min before our meal came!! We couldn't even get a waiters attention to bring us wine! 

The food was average. Nothing I couldn't cook as well in my own kitchen. The dessert was a treat.. I will say the Cake Boss knows his desserts. That was about it. Sad to say I won't be returning to Busdy V's
Love this place.  I was with the chef Bryan Forgione for a Guns N Roses concert at T-mobile arena.  Private box.  He is a cool guy and knows how to cook!

We were quickly seated for lunch. Prices were average for Vegas, but the food was so delicious I would have paid more. Eggplant parm amazing! Salad and carbonara what dreams are made of. The waitstaff was very attentive, great meal

Booked a reservation for my anniversary here, they sat us by a wall in the bar. In the bar?? Really!!?? We couldn't get a regular table or booth after booking a reservation? On top of that I mentioned that is was a special occasion as I booked and they never made any mention of it or brought out dessert for us. Service was awful, food was almost too salty to eat and way overpriced for the quality. I was extremely disappointed and embarrassed for taking my fiance here on our special day. Will never ever return!!

Best Italian food I have had in a while. Rigatoni Allan vodka was very good. Good service. The only thing I didn't like was the music. On occasion the music went to 80s death love depressing ballads that kind of slowed down the vibe.

We came here for the brunch. The quality of food was top notch. I am not a big cheese person but I enjoyed the cheese here. The olives were something else!!!
Overall great place to eat.
Great dinning experiene. Ask for Peter for service....great prices and value, not to mention tasty food and the best service.
Soo excited to go to the Cake Boss restaurant and bakery! The food and atmosphere was great! service was excellent!! The chocolate mousse cake was the most amazing cake I've ever eaten!!

My boyfriend and I were looking for somewhere special to celebrate our anniversary. We spent a good hour narrowing down Italian food restaurants based on reviews and the menu, and we were very disappointed with our experience at Buddy V's. When you walk in the atmosphere is very welcoming, dimly lit, guy playing the piano, and nice decor. That's where the nice experience ends. Once we sat down, our waiter tried to hard sell us on this wine that was clearly the wine the restaurant wanted the waiters to sell that night. We had to tell him "not interested" at least 3 times. I don't expect to get hassled and given the "hard sell" by our server at a really nice restaurant. The food we received tasted like it had been frozen and reheated. Definitely did not taste fresh. We started out with the Meatball appetizer. The meatballs had no "crispiness" to the outside. The sauce was thin and had no flavor.  My boyfriend got the Lasagna (which was supposed to be their signature dish), and I got the Pasta alla Vodka (normally very yummy if done right). The sauce with the Lasagna was runny and had no flavor. He even commented that the Lasagna I made at home tasted better than what he got at Buddy V's. As for my Pasta alla Vodka, the sauce was runny and had no flavor, the chicken was tough, and the pasta wasn't cooked enough. I went to an Italian food restaurant in Shenzhen China that had better Pasta alla Vodka. To top it off, the menu prices were $25+, which is kind of what you expect from Vegas, but I expect top quality food at that price, and especially from a celebrity chef. Do not eat here.
Awesome all around. The food is amazing. Service spectacular and view is perfect. I give my highest rating and will come every time I am in Vegas.
I really liked the lasagna!  Very nicely done!  The chocolate molten lava cake was to die for too!!!

Stopped in for a small dinner and was blown away by the food and the service. The Eggplant Parmesan was absolutely amazing and the Garlic Bread was just fantastic. The service was wonderful and very attentive, and the live music was a wonderful bonus.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

Best food I've ever eaten in my life.  We tried beef medallion, carbonara, Mac and cheese, shrimp linguini, Italian birthday cake, warm Nutella cake, creme brûlée, homemade lemonade. Wow wow wow, best food and drink I've ever had. Even the coffee was good. Everything was authentic. Staff were friendly and good looking. I absolutely love this place. Kudos to the chef. Thank you to our servers Caleb and Angelo for a wonderful night at your restaurant.

Excellent service!!!
Came here for lunch on Labor Day. There was no wait to be seated which was great.

The Food is soooo good !!!!!! We ordered the 
Aunt Nina's mozzarella en carozza for an antipasto. Let me tell you that is a definite order again next time we go back. My husband ordered the Lisa  V's linguine & white clam sauce and I ordered the chicken parm. The servings are big that I could not even finish one of the pieces of chicken parm after the app. and of course saving room for the lobster tail for dessert that we shared between the both us because it is huge. It is bigger than the ones you get at the bakery across the from restaurant. 

Everything we had was soooo good and can't wait until we go back in the future to try something different on the menu but this time it will be for dinner to have a bigger selection to choose from than the lunch menu.

A revisit here did not quite replicate our earlier 5-star experience.  The restaurant was not as accommodating as before, and did not honor our reservation request for a booth.  Instead we were seated at a table where one-half of my party of four was temporarily blinded by the sun near sundown.  Then we settled in, and things soon improved.

Grandma's Meatballs covered in Red Sauce (Sunday Gravy) were authentic classic Italian meatballs, and Aunt Nina's Mozzarella en Carozza was a hot and cheesy confection once again.  Calamari Fritti was another nice starter.  And the complimentary Focaccia Bread was great.

A big side of Caesar Salad was good.  And Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno was again one of the best lasagnas I have ever tasted--besides Diane's vaunted cheesy and saucy concoction which won the 2014 Ardiente Lasagna Baking Championship in a blind tasting by judges.  This time I did not even bother to finish the whole rich lasagna dish.  I filled up on half of what was presented to me, and took the other half home.  Alas, Diane failed to persuade the chef to make her Veal Parm Alfredo, and had to settle for a good Veal Marsala instead, which unfortunately arrived late to the table.

For dessert we were served great Cannoli compliments of the chef, to make up for the late arrival of Diane's dinner entree.  Service was excellent except for the ordering miscue, no peppers offered on the side of the Calamari Fritti, and no available Roasted Potatoes this particular evening.

4-1/2 stars overall!

What can I say about Buddy V's except that it was absolutely amazing.  My wife and I dined here with my mom and her partner durning a recent trip to Vegas.  We were greeted by a smiling Italian server who explained to us that we could enjoy the food one of two ways.  The first way being just ordering our own thing off the menu and enjoying it like that or secondly we could close our menus sit back and let the restaurant take us on a culinary experience.  We had to go with a culinary experience.  We were amazed.  The firsts course had meatball, calamari a meat and cheese board and a great salad.  Entree was sea bass, chicken and pasta, lasagna and filet and for dessert a Italian cake and their signature lobster tail.  Everything was so good good and service.  Didn't expect a pastry guy to have such good dinner food

Best Italian food I've had!  The sauce tasted just like my grandmas. Almost like she was in the back making it!  The atmosphere is fun. We didn't order drinks because we're recovering from the previous night but the bread to the entree was delicious! Would definitely return when in Vegas!

Restaurant week provided the perfect excuse to try Buddy V's. We dined with a group of nine. Service was a bit sluggish at times, but otherwise attentive. They started us with delicious herbed focaccia which paired well with oil and vinegar. I only wish they left the bottles on the table so we could help ourselves. We didn't know upon ordering, but draft beers in the 20 oz and Liter sizes come in a souvenir glass with $9 refills (the cost of a pint). So, that was a nice surprise when ordering a second round. 

The restaurant week menu is $40.15 and it came with choice of appetizer, entree and dessert. The majority of the table ordered Grandma's Meatballs, made with beef, veal and pork. They were tender and juicy, the marinara sauce was nicely balanced and flavorful. I was quite pleased. Likely, the second best meatball in town. Those that had the Panzanella Salad seemed satisfied, the mozzarella was very fresh. 

The table tried each available entree: Pasta Bolognese, Sea Bass, Carbonara, and Chicken Parmesan. Each were beautifully prepared and damn tasty. My Sea Bass was perfectly seasoned and brightened with a spritz of lemon, the side salad was fresh and light, which was welcomed since I was already pretty full. The chicken parm came with a nice helping of pasta and two lightly breaded baked cutlets topped with mozzarella and provolone cheeses. The pasta across the board was the ideal al dente. 

And for dessert we had a choice of tiramisu or cannoli. Both were well executed and scrumptious. I loved dipping the lady fingers into the layers of the creamy tiramisu. The cannoli was filled end to end with sweet ricotta; no hollow center. 

I was a little skeptical, but dinner was delicious. Many celebrity chef restaurants fail to deliver, but that's not the case here. It has good eats and casual charm. If you have the opportunity, there's still time to check out the restaurant week menu which is an absolute steal. It's well worth navigating the labyrinth that is the Venetian. Don't park at Venetian like we did, I believe Palazzo self parking would provide better access.

First off, the food is not bad here, not great but would give it B+.

The problem is the noise level; it is horrific.  We sat in banquets by the kitchen and heard every order 3 times and every pan bang.  As if this is not enough noise, they play cheesy music soooo loud.

I have been here every time I visit Vegas because we like it that much. The food is your typical italian food, but so much better tasting. I always get the three course meal they offer for $40 a person. It gives you some pretty good options for the appetizer, main dish, and dessert. The chicken parm is by far my favorite. The portion sizes are relatively large too which is great! Also, the service was fantastic as usual and we are never forgotten for too long. While it can be a pricey meal it is worth the food and restaurant setting. I would recommend trying this place on your visit to Vegas.

Do not bother...... simple simon way over priced.  All dried pasta, no fetucini alfredo, meat balls had bone chips. It was a tourist trap joke. 
  There are far better choices at venetian

Note to Buddy, rethink it bro, dried pasta, at least cook it perfect.  It cod not be simpler to make your own pasta.

I
Got spaghetti and meat balls 30.00
Enjoyed the lasagna and the chicken parm. I'm not a fan of canollis, but these were especially good. Also enjoyed the Italian bday cake dessert.

For the good:

The bus staff was the best thing about this place, making sure your drink was filled and bread was on  the table.  The ones to clear as well.

For the bad:

I know there is over 300 different types of pasta, but the waitress should at least learn the names of the ones where they work.  She didn't know the difference in the dishes, when I had a question.  I asked for the dessert menu up front, so I could decide if i wanted salad verse dessert, she never brought it.  (finally got it from the bus staff).  Slow to do service, waited a long time to pay my bill at the table.

I ordered the carbonara, was not happy with the type of pasta, but more important way too much "cracked" pepper on it.    The bread/focaccia was just average.  

For the real bad:

About an hour later, made my stomach very ill.

BEST ITALIAN IN VEGAS!!!!
I had reservations for Friday (11/28/14) night at 6:15. They had a table for me but it was not in the main dining area. I asked to be moved to the main area but was told I would have to wait. The GM Adam came right over and asked if we could wait about 5 minutes and he personally would get find me a table. He found one for us in about 3 minutes. 

Adam spent about 5 minutes with us going over the menu with us and telling us the history of the restaurant and Buddy. After we got our drinks, Adam came buy again and was going to take our order but we told him we could wait for our server. Adam was very personable and made sure we were taken care of. Way beyond your typical GM.

Now the food, we both ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. I am Italian and am very picky about my Italian food but it was excellent!!! The best I have had in Vegas in years. We also had the awesome Buddy V's special Lobster Tail (pastry) for dessert.A MUST TRY!!!!

Expected way more then what was received.the restaurants decor itself needed help. Very plain Jane nothing special. Looked like a country restaurant serving Italian food. Food itself was bland and plain. Services was just down right disgusting. The waitress and hostess are judgment and rude. Not worth the trip.

Went here yesterday and I was so excited to find a place with bottomless mimosas, sangria, and bloody Mary's.  It is a great brunch spot with a great ambience.  The meatballs were delicious and the build your own crepe was cool. Definitely will be coming back!

I had the linguini with clams, my husband had the parm and my son had the spaghetti with meatballs.  It was all delicious!! The service was great and very family friendly not like some restaurants in Las Vegas that could be intimidating.  We also
had the hazel nut dessert with the salted Carmel ice cream and it was just the best!  Love this place.

Love this place! Their chicken parmesan is unbelievable!  It is a great environment and fun place to go.  For desert the lobster tail pastry is a must and is definetly enough for a few people.  So good!!
the pre fixed meal between 5-7 is a GREAT deal... appetizer meal and desert for $38... great views of strip and meatballs that melt in your mouth!!!!  excellent service and wonderful food...

Always have heard about this place so my husband and i decided to check it out. Service was great...but the back waiter was right on. He pretty much took care of everything. My husband had thr shrimp scampi he said it was ok nothing to brag about. There was not much of a robust flavor to it and the pasta was very starchy as in they didnt rinse it very well. I had the Caprese salad and I have to admit that it was amazing. We also had the meatballs which were tasty. The garlic bread was ok but not fond of the cheese on it. The atmosphere was laid back which was nice. We sat in the bar area because there werent any seats available in the dining area.

So I give this place 3 stars because it wasnt amazing but it always wasnt that bad. Average i would say. Minus that Caprese salad that was amazing.

Loved this place!  Peter our waiter was great. The chicken parm was excellent. Would definitely go here again. Portion was just right.  Meals came out quickly. Definitely make a reservation because they had long wait time if you didn't have one
Excellent food. Thought I was going to have a mediocre lunch that was "mall food" but i was pleasantly surprised. Definitely a must if you are in the Venetian in las vegas

This review is for their Spring 2014 Restaurant Week Menu.

Can I tell you how much I enjoy this place? I don't watch "Cake Boss," but I'm a fan of Buddy V's Ristorante. Its setting: rustic and contemporary with a homey ambiance that's reflected in its decor. The tall windows open up the space, providing view of Las Vegas Boulevard below. All right, enough of the interior design, on to the food!

Appetizer - Caesar Salad with Polenta Croutons, Parmesan, and Eggless Garlic Dressing: During Restaurant Week, I ate my share of Caesar salads from one restaurant to the next, and this one was the best because of the polenta croutons that were crunchy and soft at the same time. I wish I could eat this salad every day. 

Main Course - My Dad's Bucatini Carbonara with Pancetta, Cracked Black Pepper, and Egg: One word: Divine. Ok, maybe a few more descriptive terms like creamy, pleasing to the palate. I would lick the entire bowl if no one was looking. 

Dessert - Cannoli: Good, but not the best that I've had. It definitely packs a crunch and isn't too sweet as is, but there's always the option to sweeten it up further by dipping it into the chocolate sauce that it's paired with. 

Not on the Restaurant Week Menu. 

Appetizer - Garlic Bread: Topped with melted fontina and mozzarella cheeses. Makes a good, tasty starter. 

Dessert - Lobster Tail: Filled with buttercream and garnished with fresh berries. Pretty yum, though difficult to cut into. 

Service - Staff members were always aware of our table, never missing a beat.

Overall - This has quickly become a new Strip favorite of mine, and I'm already looking forward to my next meal here.

All the servers were excellent I believe the main servers name was Gianni but his two helpers and the hostesses were fantastic too. This is one of my new favorite restaurants. I have to drink tonic water for my leg cramps and they made sure my glass was never empty. Also the main server recommended a fantastic drink we enjoyed every moment of the evening. Great job and the service was second to none.

brought my family for the Sunday brunch which we have enjoyed many times before. The food...still outstanding...the service...mediocre at best. the host actually made us choose at the hostess stand if my family wanted brunch or A La Carte before we sat. when i suggested we choose at the table.."No..I do it this way". Then the pay me no mind severs refilling all our drinks wrong takes away from the overall experience. Still, the best "East Coast"  Italian food in Vegas.
Very casual place. The food was delicious, we had Caesar salad, eggplant parmigan and chicken parmessan. The food took awhile to come out, but the wait staff were very attentive and friendly.

Place is roomy, food is good. A bit overpriced but it's worth it. Kinda hard to find inside the hotel and casino. If you have someone that can't walk too much I wouldn't recommend it cause it might take a few minutes to find it inside all the Vegas chaos.

The lasagna is simply delicious, chicken parm as well.  Chicken Caesar is ok. Some stuff is overpriced overall kids had good experience and enjoyed their food. Service is great they are on top of things

Had visit as soon as I saw the ad walking through the canal shoppes..this place did not disappoint!!! The salad is out of this word good and fresh. Buddy's signature pizza is great.. And the cannoli is what we came for especially. It was way better than expected..can't wait for Carlo's to open across the way...so coming back!!

Went to buddy v's on another recommendation from my fellow yelpers. Good solid food. Great service. 

My sister got the lasagna and said yes it tasted like home and I got the chicken parm which was also delicious. Both were good and I think next time I'm in Vegas I will stop in.

The prices were pretty reasonable as well as we both got wine and I think our bill was only about $80.

Huge fan of Buddy and his family and this restaurant did not disappoint. The bread they bring you is delicious. Our waiter (wish I got his name) was extremely kind and made small conversation with us which I loved. I got the cheese ravioli and it was amazing. My mother got the meat lasagna which was absolutely amazing. Definitely recommend that. My brother got the scallops and fell in love with it. The portions weren't huge (the turkey lasagna was a pretty good portion but the ravioli and scallops weren't huge), but were very filling! We had Canolis and lobster tails for dessert which were amazing. We had a great experience and it was 100 % worth it. So good in fact we are going back tomorrow for brunch!

Food and service were on point. Servers worked as a team. Someone was checking in every 10-15 minutes, to make sure I was ok.

I had the tomato soup which was very rich and a nice start, their lasagna was filling but could not stop me from their Nutella dessert and salted caramel ice cream. Delicious!

I wish there was 0 star bc this place deserves it. We went here to order cannolis for Xmas tomorrow. We ordered 8 and had them put the cream separate. They charged us then 15 min later while we were waiting charged us an extra 33.00 bc we asked for the cream separate! They never told us this when we ordered or we would of told them just to leave the cream inside. On top of this the staff Jacqueline was so rude. Then we came home and realized they only gave us 6. We called them they never called back. I plan on calling my Amex. It's the principle on this. Bad business and bad ethics

This review is based truly on the service and not the food.  My husband and I ate here on 3/9/14 during Restaurant Week while visiting Las Vegas.  I would like to start off and say that we are lenient when it comes to services.  It is a very hard job and not everyone is cut out for the job and unfortunately Perry M. at Buddy V's is one of them.  
Our evening started out with us walking up to the hostess station around 5:15 that Sunday evening.  We asked the two ladies if we could have a window table.  They stated it was going to be about 20 to 30 minutes.  We stated no problem that we will go to the bar and have a drink to please come over and get us when the table was ready.  They stated that was fine.  We ordered two drinks at the bar and about 20 minutes later we saw two tables being cleaned at the window area.  So my husband was paying close attention and before we knew it the hostess was taking up a couple that had just arrived.  Luckily a table was being cleared up behind them so my husband had to go grab the hostess to remind her of our table.  She then remembered we were waiting and sat us down.  Point being, if my husband wasn't keeping an eye out we would have lost those window seats we were waiting on.  
Now on to our next adventure, we meet our waiter Perry M., he asked if we wanted water and we stated we did.  The assistant waiter came through and gave us bread and I stated thank you to him, but got no response back.  Perry then came back and got our food order.  The food came out as scheduled and was delivered by a young gentleman from the kitchen.  Our assistant waiter came by and gave us more bread and again I said Thank You with no response.  I come from the south and when someone says thank you, your response should be Your Welcome or My Pleasure.  To me this is plain rude.  Again, we are just holding our tongues in the whole situation.  My husband wanted another beer.  Ever since Perry ordered our food we never saw him again at the table to ask how everything was.  I told my husband to put the empty glass on the edge of the table maybe he will notice it and walla' he did.  My husband asked for another beer and he went on his way.  At this time our water glasses are now empty.  Well after 10 minutes still no beer has arrived at the table.  By this time the dessert has arrived and my husband and I are sharing a glass of water since we have not been refilled or asked if we wanted any.  Again, we are not saying anything.  We don't ask for much.  We know it is hectic sometimes doing this job.  We were going to let go not getting the beer, but we do like for our water to be filled up WITHOUT having to ask.  So we just asked for the bill and were just going to chalk it up to bad experience and not return.  Until our bill came, the first two charges are for the restaurant week special at 30.14 per person (which is correct).  Then two additional entrees where added and the kicker was he added the beer that never arrived.  Our total check should be in the range of 60+ change, but the total was 122.00.  So that is the point my husband lost it and grabbed the manager.  
The manager that night was Sean Fiori whom assisted us.  We explained everything to him expect the experience with the hostess earlier.  We explained our experience with Perry M and his assistant.  We showed him the bill and he immediately apologized and said he will fix the bill and gave us an after dinner drink to make up for not getting the beer.  We are not people to complain.  We put up with a lot from waiters/waitress, but this was awful.  We are simple people and want to be acknowledged and respected and just fill up our drinks every now and then.  Literally he orders our food and gave us the messed up bill.  That was all and wants us to tip you on this service.  Don't get me wrong.  We had no problems with the food, but the service made this experience awful.  Hopefully he gets continued training or he needs to find another profession.
Yummy food here! We ordered lasagna and chicken parmesan- two great choices! Large orders that we could not finish but definitely took it to go to experience it all over again the next day.

!!!So good I tipped the Chef responsible for my Chicken Parm plate $20!!!
 It was the best spaghetti I've had. Not the typical American style spaghetti swimming in sauce. It was true Italian full flavored perfection. Service was very good and attentive as well.

The appetizers were good but the sea bass was a disappointment as it was dry and over cooked. At the $29 price I would expect more. The manager did not seem to care about our complaint and was rude.  There are by far better places to eat in Vegas.

I was craving Italian food and stumbled upon this place when walking around in The Venetian.  This is Buddy Valastro's (celebrity chef from Cake Boss) restaurant, so I figured it has to be good and it did live up to my expectations.  I ordered the Chicken parmesan and spaghetti. It's oven-baked, provolone, and mozzarella.  It was crispy and with the perfect amount of cheese.  The spaghetti was with marinara sauce-$22
             
My wife ordered Lasagna Al Forno, which apparently is what they're known for.  The lasagna contains italian sausage, beef, pork ricotta and baked cheese on top. My wife was a fan.  It was $22.

The portion was big enough to share, which we should have done, since we had food coma shortly after. The customer service was great and our server was attentive.  I just think the food is pricey for Italian food and it didn't even contain any seafood, but then again anytime you have a celebrity chef attached to the restaurant's name then expect to pay more, so excuse my rant.

The portions are large enough to share...which allows you to share and try more. The service was just fine. It wasn't the best meal I've ever had but fed not the worse... If your in the area stop by but I wouldn't make my way over here just for Buddy Vs

Ate here for lunch with the Wife. We shared the smashed meatball sandwich. I started with a caesar salad and I do not know what they do to those croutons, but damn they are good. Head up on the salad, they are heavy with the anchovies. I did not mind it and almost licked my salad plate clean. 

Then the meatball sub came out. The meatballs were awesome, the bread nice and crunchy, and the right amount of cheese(more mozzarella than ricotta). 

We both enjoyed the meal and left full. 

The waiter seemed like he was in pain, the way he was moving around, almost like he through he back out of something. So maybe that was why we did not seem to be in that great of a mood. 

All and all a great meal and will try it again on another trip.

Best pasta carbonara I have eaten to date. The rest of my family also seemed very pleased with their dishes. I'll be coming back in the future. My family has been there once before without me and said the service was incredible. I didn't necessarily get that experience but the food was wonderful. 

Tip: the garlic bread is phenomenal

All I can say is WOW!  The food was amazing! We had the whole wheat penne and the orecchiette with Italian sausage. Really good. We also split the Nutella cake with salted Carmel ice creme. One of the best deserts I have had.

As a NJ expat, I can say one of the few things I miss most living in Hawaii is exceptional Italian food. Luckily, my boyfriend comes from a line of Italian chefs and isn't afraid to be super critical when it comes to Italian, and I can say he would have approved and I can't wait to take him here. The eggplant Parmesan was mouth watering my delicious, and caprese salad had the freshest ingredients. The four sides we ordered (polenta, asparagus, kale, and mashed potatoes) were a bit too over seasoned or cheesy, but the main dishes were phenomenal. Highly recommend the cheese/cured meat board. Friendly atmosphere with a great view of the strip.

I've dined at Buddy V's twice now and both times it's been consistently good for both food and service. 

My husband had the meatball sub once for lunch which was the best we've ever had and the other time he had the bone in veal parm chop which was bigger than the size of your head! The octopus and tuna caponata are also delicious and the polenta croutons on the Caesar Salad are delicious! I've never seen polenta croutons in all the Italian restaurants I've dined in. Very creative!

Dessert is also a must, I mean it is the Cake Boss' restaurant. The lobster tail is light and crispy and the tiramisu is soooo good with the chocolate cake on the bottom. 

A trip to Buddy V's is definitely a must and the food was so much better than what I had at Carnevino at a fraction of the cost!

I loved it! Disclaimer: I am a huge fan of Buddy and his shows, so I'm a lil biased.

I came in for a late lunch, the staff was friendly and attentive. It was pretty quiet, not too many people around which was nice, I didn't feel like competing or waiting for a table.

I really loved the decor, it was decorated like a nice italian kitchen; I thought the rolling pins that decorate one of the walls was a cute and creative idea. There were family pictures on the walls that gave it that homey feel, and I have to say I really appreciated that the restaurant was spacious, so it didn't seem cluttered.

My friend and I ordered Aunt Nina's Mozzerella en Carozza, which was fried mozzerella with crotini in a tomato sauce.....OMG!! So Freakin good!!!! We were tempted to order another one, but decided to wait till we had tried the rest of the food we ordered. 

We also order the linguine in white clam sauce that was also pretty good, it had lots of clams yummy!

For dessert, we got a lobster tail and a cheesecake. The lobster tail was too f*ckin good!!! We were in heaven, the flaky pastry filled with fresh custard cream and fresh berries, it was perfect balance! Not too sweet, not too tart, the berries complimented the pastry perfectly.

Needless to say after that we were stuffed, so we had to take the cheesecake to go.

This place is a must for Cake Boss fans!

Where do I begin? The food was to die for, the service was even better. Big shout out to Giorgio who educated us not only on the menu choices themselves, but on what wine to try with our meals and even dessert. He checked in frequently, as did the young gentleman who was refilling water glasses (I regret not asking his name). If you like Italian food at all, Buddy V's is a must try!

This was just bad. Charged us for meals we sent back and for a slice of birthday cake that we didn't want but they insisted we should get. $300 for a meal where only one dish was actually good (the chicken vodka). Went to Tao for nearly the same price and had the best sushi of my life... Buddy V's was just a waste of money.

What a pleasant surprise! We went on Christmas Eve because it was one of the few with reservation still available that had good reviews. We loved it!! Service was on point, we got our meals fast, food tasted delicious. The pizza sauce is great!
Awesome food, large portions and Stewart is a great manager. Talked with us for some time. Definitely going back!!

This place was amazing! My father and I went for my 21st birthday and had brunch! We met the assistant manager and he was the most down to earth guy. Remembered us when he saw us the next day in the grand canal shops as well. The food... well it was the absolute best I have ever had. Must go for anyone in vegas!!
Really fantastic food! We ordered the cutting board, Burrata, Charred Octopus salad, eggplant parm, Nutella cake and washed it all down with a bottle of Far Niente Chard!! What a day!!!

I wasn't too impressed. But to be honest, I didn't expect to be either. While I had my moment watching Buddy master cakes on the Cake Boss, to attach his name to a restaurant wasn't as exciting as say, having a bakery with his name on it.

I will say the meal started strong with the meatball appetizer. You get large meatballs in sauce and both were very good. So it set the standard high.

One of my favorite items at Italian restaurants is the pasta vodka. While it was good, it wasn't great by any means. Just okay. I did appreciate the al dente noodles though. 

But the most surprising thing was the desserts. I get it, you want to include some family favorites like cannoli's, but still. No cake? What about featuring mini cakes that are decorated? Just something to play off the show. I just expected more than just three plain jane choices of sweets. 

I'll admit I sought it out, having the name attached and being new, but I wouldn't urge anyone else to visit this spot while in Vegas.

First time here and it was an overall great experience. Our waiter Charlie was fun, energetic and knowledgable on the menu. Tried "My dads bucatini carbonara" which was excellence. The Nutella cake was super delish! Will be going back for sure

Excellent service. We were seated quickly not know that the were closing. All staff members were accommodating and friendly. A member of our party had a gluten allergy and the staff went out of their way to make sure she found something on the menu despite all the Italian carb/wheat options. They do apparently have a gluten free penne pasta option. The food came out quickly and was delicious! I would recommend and come back. Oh... And prices very reasonable. #winning

Great meal at Buddy V's! The Grilled Octopus app was the most tender I've ever had. The Chicken Marsala was savory, the way it should be. Too many restaurants use sweet Marsala wine and ruin the dish. Buddy V's was right on, and a good portion size too. My wife's Capellini Shrimp Scampi was terrific. Very nice wine selection by the glass. By the way, the Caesar Salad with polenta croutons is a must have as well.

Loved the pasta (tried the ravioli,  carbonara,  and spaghetti).  The bread with olive oil and vinegar was tasty too.  There were tiny sticks on the table too.  I have had better chicken parmesan at Maggianos.  The caeser salad was probably the best I have ever had.  By the time our desert came I was already bursting at the seams.....
Customer service is top notch here. Food options not so much to choose from but everything we ordered seemed good. Great portion size and food came out quick. Would eat here but only for lunch.

When I was booking the Palazzo as the hotel for NYE 2016 I noticed they offered a $25 dining credit for Buddy V's. As I was choosing from several options the Buddy V's credit sealed the deal as I can always fall back on this restaurant to serve delicious "homemade" comfort Italian food. With this I convinced my family to dine here for dinner.

Dinner is a different beast from lunch. With lunch the No1DP and I are able to have a pretty quiet meal with plenty of natural sunlight. There's also not much activity going on in the middle of the day. Come dinner, especially on the day before NYE, the place was swamped and the tables were loud. There were also plenty of people in line to get a table or in line for the nearby Carlo bakery.

The 3-course pre-theater menu ($38/person) was a hit with everyone in my family. It made ordering a lot easier and since I was covering the dinner tab, along with the $25 credit made a Vegas dinner more reasonably-priced (but still expensive for regular casual Italian). What made it particularly appealing for me was that the menu options included my favorites: Grandma's Meatballs, My Dad's Bucatini Carbonara and Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake. These were the standout dishes I stated in previous reviews and I was very happy I could have all my favorites in one sitting. This was a lot of food - I remember eating cold bucatini carbonara the next day for breakfast (which BTW is still very good if you don't mind eating it cold).

In summary I've enjoyed both lunch and dinner at Buddy V's though the situations that I'll recommend both are different. I'll recommend doing small plates for lunch as the portion sizes are more manageable if you want to save your appetite for a big and fancy dinner. This is currently the arrangement for the No1DP and I whenever we're in Vegas. I'll recommend dinner as a non-date or casual date option if all a party wants is just some good comfort Italian food.

LUNCH: 4/5.
DINNER: 4.5/5.

This isnt SPECTACULAR Italian food but it is pretty close. We went with two 70 year olds plus a 9 & 11 yr old and everyone liked their meal. This is one of the few restaurants on the strip that actually has real windows to the outside world (no fake ceiling here) which was refreshing. A little loud in the dining room - but then is Vegas known for being quiet? 
We had:
Salumi plate- salumi was terrific, cheeses better than average, olives OK
Eggplant parm- on app menu & can be shared even though waitress said it was too small for sharing. Easily enough for 6 to share
Scallopps- not very Italian, was it bacon? too over cooked but polenta & scallopps were perfect
The lasagne was HUGE & very good.
Kids chix parm was a large sized portion and excellent. 
Chix marsala came with 3 pieces of chicken!
Ceasar Salad was tastey but way over dressed. Very soggy. Ask for less dressing.
With a bottle of wine & tip our meal for 6 was $300. Not an inexpensive night out so don't be misled by the lower $ on yelp. 

Perfect if you have a mixed crowd & need something for everyone. Can't beat the Ventitian atmosphere either.

First of all, very hard place to find. It's tucked in a lone hallway across from RockBar and of course Carlos Bakery. Went to Carlos to get a couple pastries and decided to poke in and see what this place has to offer.

Went for an early dinner with my wife and was seated by the window in the back next to what im guessing is a party room. View was amazing, service mediocre, food a little high priced (the strip) but overall not bad at all. I had the osso buco my wife had the carbonara and we started with a panzanella salad. Server was pretty absent for the most part, but the view made for good conversation and weren't in any hurry. Overall i wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if i found myself stuck in the Venetian i might wonder back over.

Great atmosphere!! The waitress, Deanna was awesome. She was very helpful, gave a great recommendation for what we were hungry for and kept our glasses full.  The piano and band were very good in the background adding to the ambiance. We definitely recommend this place to anyone. Prices were fantastic compared to other places we ate at. We will be back for sure!  Thanks Deanna for making it a successful dinner!!!

The service was outstanding! Our 8 year old girls were cold and the Venetian sets the thermostat so there is nothing they can do about it. The manager brought over two tablecloths for them to wrap up in!

The Sunday Gravy is very good. The cheese board is a bit average. The Italian fish was liked and so were the meatballs.

The lower rating is due to the dessert menu. It is limited and not very good. We ordered the apple turnover, tiramisu, cannollis, ice cream, lemon blueberry cheesecake and the hazelnut chocolate cake. The ice cream is great, but not home made and the only other great dessert was the hazelnut chocolate cake. Everything else was very average. What a surprise!

You have to walk by their bakery across the hall and you see the pastry chefs make these amazing looking desserts through a glass window, but none of them are on the menu! I expected fabulous dessert, but it was pretty disappointing.

Well we didn't get to actually eat here because the hostess wouldn't seat us. I had promised my kids a treat from Carlos' Bakery but the line was huge, so we decided to get a table here instead & have dessert & drinks. It was around 3:30 & as it was between lunch & dinner the restaurant was mostly empty. The hostess informed us that since we weren't actually eating a meal she couldn't seat us at a table reserved for people who were eating a meal.  Hmmm, in a mostly empty restaurant. We would have had a few cocktails each as well as desserts, & we always tip well because regardless of how much or little we eat, the staff still has to do their job. So I guess my one star rating is for the hostess. Maybe we'll be back some day...
Short wait for lunch. Service was good and the drinks are strong. The salmon was excellent and had a balsamic reduction which gave it a nice sweet crust. Overall good experience.

Absolutely enjoyed it. We went with reservations (pardon the pun) expecting the food to rest on the tv show. We were happily surprised. Our waitress found out we were from Virginia as she was too. The personal touch was very nice. Food was great, served at the right time, tasted great, and ample portions. The price was very reasonable as well.

Decided on Buddy V's after looking into all the great restaurants on the Strip. Prices are reasonable for a "famous person's'" restaurant. Sat at a table with a view of the open kitchen.  Thin breadsticks individually wrapped at each table.  Great calamari fritters appetizer. Crispy and nice marinara sauce on the side. Ordered Clams and linguini.  They were ok.. chewy clams, very light on garlic, but substantial portion. Friend ordered vodka sauce rigatoni with chicken.  Good sauce, chicken breast a little tough but all around not bad. We opted not to have dessert with our meal since we were full and instead went 'across the street' to Carlo's Bake Shop. I've never been to the original one in New York, but I'm guessing they serve many of the same items in Vegas. It was just as crowded as the restaurant if not more.  There is a large window to view the pastry chefs/bakers decorating the cakes - a great way to pass the time while you are waiting to get your desserts.

Restaurant is huge, doesn't give you the warm feeling that an Italian restaurant should have in my opinion.

Food and drinks took forever, server was very polite but could make up the fact that everything took a very long time to get to the table.

We had the caprese and the panzanela salad, both were ok, nothing out of the ordinary.

For an entree I had the veal Marsala, comes with a side of linguine which was flavorless. Veal itself was decent but nothing that would impress.

Desserts was the only salvageable items that we had, cannoli and lobster tail made me give them 2 stars.

Would not return to this place, there's other Italian places that are much better.

I came here for an early dinner one night and I enjoyed a good service.

I wasn't really hungry when we walked in here as I just ate gelato not too long ago. So I just ordered scallop dinner.  It was cooked well but flavor was less, I think I was supposed to eat with bacon served with the dish for flavoring, but I put bacon aside and I think I wasn't supposed to do that to fully enjoy the dish.

They had good drink menu including variety of wine.  While the list wasn't extensive it was easy for me to spot what I liked.

Ambiance is really casual, for being casual restaurant, I thought it was a bit pricy. 

Service was great. He was professional with nice smile. The way he presented the desert menu to me, for a moment I thought I was at a fancy restaurant.

out of the world Italian food
servers were extremely nice and made you feel very comfortable
complimentary freshly baked focaccia bread with olive oil and vinegarette for dipping
(you may ask for more, they don't bite)

the lasagna was very cheesey (good thing) and you get a bit of everything in each and every bite

kid's meals were a good deal also especially their chicken parm

pizza was good but not my taste 

nice and dim atmosphere

The food was great. Had the chicken a la Vodka, Panzanella, bruschetta, carbonara Mac n cheese, and a lobster tail to finish things off. Food wasn't really bland as a prior review said. The apps needed a little salt, but all else was good. Service was great and not slow as mentioned in other reviews. Prices are reasonable and portions aren't gargantuan so you have some room for desert. Very neat place and I'd go again for sure. The wife liked it as well. I'd give it 4 1/2 stars if it was an option.

Absolutely amazing food, ate here two nights in a row because it was THAT good!

Sunday Gravy is incredible, sorry to say but better than my mom and grandmas...and I'm Italian!
Garlic Bread is killer!

Excellent place to get authentic Italian, service is great and vibe is not stuffy like most Vegas celebrity restaurants. 

Lobster tail for desert!!

This place was ok, but nothing out of this world.  We wanted to try his pastries and have a drink. The line was super long so we sat at the cake boss restaurant to save time since they sell the same pastries in both. We had two pastries and a drink and water and the bill was $41dll I don't mind the price if it's good, but this was just ok, average. if you ask me its terribly over priced :( maybe my expectations were to high and that's why I seem harsh Lol. Save your self some money and just make the huge line for his bakery and don't waste your time and money at the restaurant. Line is about 20 minutes long. Service was terrible,  the waiter took forever to take our order and after he did  he took even longer to bring the drinks out, we just paid for the bells and whistles, which soumded more like beeps and toots, Lol

Overall a great experience and wonderful food! We were early for our reservation, so we started with drinks in the bar. Sangria was good, it's a blend of white and red wine which was different. Only complaint was service was slow.

When we moved into the restaurant area, our experience just got better from there. Service was fabulous! All of the wait staff were very attentive. We ordered grandma's meatballs, lasagna and the chicken parm. The meatballs were absolutely delicious! Best restaurant meatballs I've ever had. My husband raved about the lasagna and talked about it the rest of the night. We would definitely go back just to have that. Chicken parm was good, but not the best in LV. The sauce on all the food had great flavor and consistency. Being Italian and growing up in NY, this restaurant exceeded my expectations. We will definitely be back!
Best dining experience you can get in Vegas for great taste, generous portion, and chic ambience. Outstanding service

Wanted a good, affordable meal while in Las Vegas and Buddy V's filled the bill. It's a bit cramped and, of course, touristy (you should see the line for the bake shop across the way), but all in all was an enjoyable, casual Italian meal.

I had the clams with linguine and hubby had the lasagna. We started with mozzarella en carozza. All really tasty and fresh. I took cannolis to go - MY GOODNESS those were awesome!!!

We came in for a early dinner around 4 pm. Excellent service today from our server Brittney.  She knew the menu and gave us good recommendations. All our orders were excellent. We had the Lisa warm Nutella cake for desert that was awesome!!

We went to eat at Buddy V's Ristorante, not knowing what to expect, neither my husband or I really follow his show. However, we were starving and figured since it was newer to Vegas it was worth a try...

Absolutely delicious!!!! Everything we ordered was really good. The brick oven pizza was the best I ever had! We could tell that only the freshest and best ingredients were used. 

I liked the interior as well, it was modern looking but felt also had an old world Italian feel to it!

We went to Buddy V's for a late lunch around 2:30. The restaurant was less than half full, plenty of seating, no wait. There were 4 of us, with two more on the way. The not so pleasant manager said they do not sit incomplete parties...are you joking, there were so many open tables!! We said we'd like to be seated to order drinks, they refused. So we waited a few minutes, went back up to the host stand asked if they really couldn't seat us with all the open tables, it seemed a little ridiculous.  Still a very rude no. We left went to another Venetian Italian restaurant, got seated right away.  Will never go back, horrible service. I understand if your busy, but they weren't, just very rude and unaccomadating.

Excellent service!  Food was incredible.  Location is super convenient. I had spaghetti & meatballs & hubby had meatball sandwich w parmesan fries. Everything was superb.  Highly recommend if you are in Vegas

Wasn't sure where to eat with my husband and two young teen daughters buy took a chance.  This food reminded me of my great grand mother's table.  Meatballs were authentic and loved the veal Marsala.  My girls had the kids chicken parm with was perfect.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  We finished with cupcakes from the Carlos' Bakery for the girls.

We went to Buddy's on our first night in Vegas.  The atmosphere was great and I really liked the decor.  Our waiter looked just like Buddy's cousin and had a great personality.  I started with a Caesar salad that had more dressing than lettuce.  the best part was the soft croutons on top.  A bowl of those would have been awesome.  Salad, not very good.
I then just wanted meatballs and the waiter talked me into pasta and meatballs.  The balls were small and not very flavorful.  My wife had chicken marsala.  there were 4 full breasts in the order.  it was a huge portion.  She liked it.
We passed on dessert in order to gamble sooner.  Overall, the food was ok but the price for what we got was too expensive.  
The next night we went to Lavo in Palazzo and spent $20 more per person and had a way better eating experience.  Do yourself a favor, and stick to Buddy's Bakery across the hallway and skip the restaurant. Too many better options in and around the Venetian.

So I can't say I love the fact that Buddy's feels very much like its part of a mall. I think it's due to the fact that the entranceway is huge. The open floor plan just makes the restaurants main Dining area feel like it's right in the middle of the mall. However despite this minor flaw the food here is authentic. Our waiter was from Naples and had a true passion for the food he was serving. Our apps were delicious including the Caesar salad and calamari. The meatballs were top notch. For dinner I ordered the mixed meats with pasta. The dish had a name but I can't remember for the life of me what it was called. The lamb was fatty though which is why I can't go to five stars. Plus the dish was missing a component in my opinion. Like maybe some cheese or vegetables. My friends dishes all looked good. No one seemed   blown away but we were definitely satisfied and impressed by the cleanliness and authentic Italian cuisine we were served.

Carlos bakery was too packed so we decided to go to Buddy V's Ristorante instead to taste some of the desserts. We sat in bar area and our waitress/bar tender was not good. She barely spoke, her hair was in my drink and she really didn't do anything more than what she had to. We witnessed another customer, 2 women waiting to be served. They started at the bar, moved to a table, moved to another table and waited and waited and the waitress/bar tender never helped them so they left. It wasn't busy either. As far as food, I had the Italian cake and I wasn't impressed. I'm not a cream person so maybe that's why I didn't like it.

In LV for business and this was my attempt at branching out for dinner. The service was very good and we didn't wait for anything; drinks, bread, appetizers, refills. I ordered the calamari and it was ok. A bit too salty for my taste, but my dinner partner liked it well enough. He ordered the caprese salad and loved it. My other dinner partner ordered the meatballs and was gaga over them. I don't eat meat, so I couldn't taste it.  The wine choices were varied. We all got something we liked. Dinner was phenomenal. I had the shrimp scampi and I was bowled over. Crisp, flavorful, tasty pasta and 5 nice sized shrimps. I had plenty for breakfast the next day.  

Two of us ordered dessert. I had tiramisu and he had Nutella cake. I thought he'd lick the plate. I wasn't in love with the tiramisu, but the mason jar presentation was cute.

If you like pasta, give this place a go!

Side note: The live music was wonderful! The waiter kept pushing wine refills on my dinner partner after he says no more, emphatically.

Hands down, best Italian restaurant I've experienced. Italian food is my absolute favorite food and I have been to A LOT of Italian restaurants, but Buddy V's is by far the best. Everything about it was authentic...even our server! He was awesome! I had the Sunday Gravy. It's a pasta with sauce full of different meats. Everything about it was amazing. The Lamb was the best and most tender I've ever tried and the Italian sausage was amazing. The food was so delicious that we passed all of our plates around the table so everyone in our group could try each dish. The Mac and Cheese and lasagna are to die for as well! This is definitely a restaurant worth trying during your trip to Vegas!

First thing I am going to say is" I am so sorry Buddy! I love you, I love your show! I love your charisma, but unfortunately the food at your Las Vegas restaurant is very disappointing. ;( We came here on Dec. 24 to celebrate my daughters first birthday, this i will give you though, your staff is excellent! Great customer service and great ambiance! They were very accommodating and on top of things, Kudos on that! We ordered various things from desserts to appetizers, the most disappointing item was the veal, it tasted funky and it had a weird smell to it, so i returned it and they graciously took it off my bill. the tastiest item we ordered was the linguini with clams, but it wasn't amazing, the other items like calamari, osso buco, grilled cheese, was ok, but not great as well. The lobster tail dessert was just horrible, it was as hard as a rock! I am sorry to say that my expectations were a bit higher, especially since the menu was a bit pricey, but even if the menu was more reasonably priced, the taste was just not exciting my palate. I mean overall it was a fun time, I don't regret celebrating my baby's first birthday there, hey at least the baby loved the free bread sticks, but would I come back? Maybe if somebody else paid, i would be willing to give it another shot, also keep in mind that they just opened this location, and every restaurant will always have its growing pains, that's why these reviews are necessary.

Mamma Mia!!! Wow!!! Way to go Buddy Valastro! This feels like a classic Italian home the second you walk in. Family photos of the Valastro family, hodgepodge furniture, comfy sofas and chairs...only thing missing is the vinyl and plastic covers, but honestly who misses them? 

Teaming up with Kim Canteenwalla & Elizabeth Blau, who have created beautiful restaurants here in Vegas (Society Cafe + Honey Salt), the trio came together to make the Cake Bosses culinary debut a real knockout, start to finish. 

I went with my Italian buddy to try it out and we were really impressed (to say the least)! Straight forward and diverse food menu, doesn't overwhelm; drink menu follows the pattern of the food menu with good wine choices by the glass.

I chose the agnolotti which was seasoned perfectly and was in season with the sage brown butter sauce. My buddy went to spaghetti central with a rigatoni and meatball bowl and he couldn't hold back the tears knowing the impending rejection his mother would give him after finding a better meatball. 

The meatballs came really really really close to beating my Italian grandmother's secret recipe, but that leads to a lifetime of questions and heartache on my nonna. So, its easier to say that grams are better and avoid the remaining years of rejection by telling her a little white lie.

Dessert was the highlight (as expected) as my Tiramisu was not only flavorful but semi deconstructed as the lady fingers were on the side that you could dip into the cake and creme combo. My friend's salted caramel ice cream came loaded with bits of dark chocolate and an awesome biscotti.

If the restaurant wasn't in the Venetian/Palazzo's Grand Canal Shoppes: A) It would be way busier and the menu prices wouldn't be so high; and B) it wouldn't have awesome floor to ceiling windows facing the strip that make the space even more visually enjoyable.

Mangia!

Great Place to eat!
My husband and I were staying at the Venetian and stopped in Buddy V's for lunch. 
I would highly recommend this place, reasonable prices and amazing food!
The server and hostess were so sweet I asked their names and it was Joy and Emily. So friendly and made great suggestions. 
Next time we are in Vegas this is a must for us!
You will not be disappointed or feel ripped off with the prices!

Been here for dinner before and loved it, so when I read about the Sunday brunch, I just had to come back and indulge.
I'm here to share with everyone that this brunch for under 35 dollars is a steal!
Fantastic fresh foods to meet everyone's needs. Charcuterie, cheeses, garlic breads, 5 carving station meats, panetone French toast, eggs, pastas, chicken parm, meatballs, killer tiramisu and other desserts. It's kid friendly too with a kids station even an adult would enjoy.
The staff is on top of things and Asst. GM Adam Margolies is visible and easy to talk to.
Sean was great to us last time for dinner, so from top to bottom, Buddy's has it all!

Food is absolutely amazing!! Perfect portion sizes and unique twists to traditional recipes. Try the mozzarella sticks as an appetizer. Delicious!! And not what you expect!! Service is personalized and impeccable!!

This food is like Ragu.  Really, I am losing trust in Vegas yelpers.  :P
I got the special sauce with meat, the one with lamb, meatballs, sausage in sauce which came with some type of tube pasta.  The sauce was so bland.  Maybe add some oregano, basil, less tomato paste, I don't really know what it is.  The lamb was okay, the balls were okay, the sausage wasn't bad.  The pasta was nothing special.  Though if you go, hubby enjoyed the chicken parmesan, so give that a go.  We didn't stay for dessert, I wasn't feelin' it.

But the waitress was fantastic!  She was really polite and I noticed she had a rude customer and she kept smiling.  The drinks were okay, the bread was eh and the Cesar salad was heavily dressed, but wasn't bad.  I enjoyed the croutons in the salad.

Very good food and service. It taste like good homemade Italian food. Huge portions 2 people could split a dinner.  
I only gave 4 stars because. We were trying to have a nice dinner of just us 2. 
And the hostess puts a party of 8 right next to us when there were available tables not right on top of us. Plus they were extremely loud. It really took away from our celebratory dinner!

Came here for late drinks with a huge party so this is really about the bar service and menu.

They didn't have a huge cocktail menu but whatever they served was pretty darn good.  It's good to see that even the Cake Boss knows you gotta spice up your drinks to make people get sloshed (like we did for a big reunion party).  I had a berry mohjito that was absolutely kick ass.  The bartender was also very friendly and did a good job of making sure the drinks kept flowing.

The ambiance of this place is really nice and there's a good amount of space that can accommodate a large number of guests, making it a great meeting spot if you're part of a big party or celebration.
Love the meatballs, veal Parmesan, lobster tail and warm Nutella chocolate cake

Everything is good, from their savory butter garlic bread to their Octopus salad to their non-rich but so damn good four layers tall tiramisu! The atmosphere is pretty darn special too (giving you a warm holiday feeling)!
So happy I stopped by for lunch! The chicken Parmesan is AMAZING! Came in after a client told me how good the food was, hands down will be back. Probably after we found that client her dream house!

Great if you like pasta and Italian food. 

I think this would be a great fine dining experience if you like cheese and carbs.  I would have given this place 5 stars when I was a teenager. So take your kids here and buy them a cupcake at Carlos after.

This restaurant is exemplary. The waiter told me that the Philly Cheesesteak was voted one of the best outside of Philadelphia. He was exactly right. I also had the Nutella cake and it was divine. The service was fast, attentive, and friendly. I would return here in the future.

Restaurant week lunch menu 2015 review 

The Skinny: maybe I just don't get it but the food is okay,  not great... Surprisingly their dessert was the worst course and cannot recommend. (3) service is good and prompt (3) value: it was okay for Restaurant week special but I would skip this place at regular prices. 

We came in to try their restaurant week lunch menu which serves a 3 course lunch for $20.15. 

I got her Caesar salad,  grilled salmon over a cucumber/chickpea/artichoke salad while the hubs got the tomato basil soup and spaghetti and meatballs.  Both came with a dessert course of cannoli and cookie selection. 

The tomato basil soup was a little too bland and needed more basil. The texture was good.

I liked the Caesar salad better albeit it was a little heavy on the dressing and needed more acidity. The hubs thought there was a little too much anchovy in the dressing but I kind of like that. The polenta croutons were a great addition textural and flavorful. 

Spaghetti and meatballs was really nothing special and the sauce was too bland -  there really wasn't enough tomato flavour to really make this dish stand out. The meatballs were under seasoned. The spaghetti itself was cooked a bit beyond al dente which in a dish like this,  makes it disappointing. 

My salmon dish fared better. The grilled salmon was done perfectly. However the salad of cucumber,  arugula,  chickpea and artichokes was a bit underwhelming and needed more acidity/brightness to bring the flavors together. 

The worst course was dessert. It each came with a cannoli and 3 cookies -  oatmeal, chocolate chip and sugar cookie. The cinnamon cannoli was okay albeit rich...there wasn't enough cinnamon in there to really distinguish itself. The cookies were really bad -  they did not have that rich buttery taste to them. The sugar cookie especially tasted more like shortening and artificial flavors. I think they also skimp out and use cheap artificial vanilla extract.

After we finished lunch I was watching the bakers at Carlos bakery. Guess what I saw? A half used package of pre-made manufactured Rice Krispies treats with the shiny blue foil packaging and Kelloggs branded elves (see the pic). Seriously. As a bakery,  you cannot make rice krispie treats yourselves? (Just FYI, all you need is a microwave,  marshmallows,  butter,  rice krispie cereal, a bowl,  a spatula and 10 minutes to make this dessert). To me,  that is just bad form. 

At the end of the day, I give the dining experience a 3 star -  it's okay but nothing I would return for. As for Carlos bakery -  just the cookies and the aforementioned shortcut I saw are enough for me to stay far away.

Ambience was good 
Ordered fried calamari and lasagna. 

Fried calamari: 
Portion was okay for 2 to share. 
Could have been more deep fried. 
Came out a tad bit soggy 
The breaking fell off for the most of the pieces. 
Too salty 
Size of calamari was food 

Lasagna- 
Good portion for two to share
Taste is home made- which is what they are going for.

After wanting to try this restaurant, we finally had lunch there recently. So glad we did!!
Our party of four started with calamari fritte and cheesy garlic bread. So good!! The most tender calamari we had ever had!! The bread was hot and cheesy with the perfect blend of herbs and garlic. 
The smashed meatball sandwich with Tuscan fries were delicious!! The most tender flavorful meatballs I've ever had!! The applewood bacon turkey club was also delicious!! Perfect amount of everything with good balance of flavors. The Caesar salad served with the turkey club was just okay. The dressing was mediocre. Overall, great experience!! We'll be back!!!

The food is average, but the desserts...oh oh oh!!! Some of the best I've ever tasted! The Italian birthday cake and Lobster Tail are to die for. Skip Carlo's bakery and order the desserts at Buddy V's!!!!

Let me start off by saying that the food was amazing! And the portion sizes are crazy.  I went here with a group for a friends birthday and she absolutely loved the place. We were all pleasantly suprised with the food. The reason I gave this place only four stars is because of the service. The staff there were really nice but at times were too attentive (refilling the water after a simple sip...wait till my cup is at least half gone). All in all though I loved the place and so did all of my friends. We will definately be going back there next time we are in Vegas!!!

While I still think dinner is a solid three, their Sunday brunch buffet is five stars all the way! 

I really don't like traditional breakfast food, and Buddy V's Sunday brunch had two egg dishes and one French toast dish at the buffet. Perfect! 

The buffet is divided into five stations: starters (charcuterie, shrimp, antipasto, soup, Caesar salad); carving station (props to the bacon and the spicy Italian sausage); Kids corner (Mac n cheese, pizza, candy); entrees (loved the meatballs, chicken Parmesan, carbonara Mac n cheese) and DESSERTS! Delicious tiramisu in mason jars, cannoli, and zonuts were my favorite. 

The buffet is $34.95. I opted for the extra all-you-can-drink mimosa deal for $14.95 and you can choose from mimosa, Bellini, sangria, beer or wine. The Bellini was tasty but that sangria tho! I'm embarrassed to say how many glasses I had. 

My fiancé got the Bloody Mary deal for $18.95 in which they bring the vodka and you craft your own Bloody Mary from a different station. He had fun doing that (and adding shrimp from the appetizer station) and he also got to choose from all my drinks. He ended up switching to the sangria as well and drank as much as I did. He got to keep his glass as a souvenir. 

We got seated right away with no wait (even during March Madness weekend) and I can't wait to come back. Wish it was served every day!

Had a really good experience at Buddy V's.  Nice Italian food and truly HUGE portions.  On a Wednesday night, it was kind of like family night with a lot of kids in the room.  Speaking of kids, the kid menu portion were also huge.  As it turns out, 3 of us could have easily gotten a way with a single entree.  These were heavily cheesy meals with pasta to perfection.  

What keeps the place from being a 5 is that the actual quality wasn't that special but it's a definitely above average offering and experience

Went to dinner at Buddy V's last night for a friend's birthday dinner. I had been there before, she had not but i raved about it. 

We had a 7:30 reservation and showed up a few minutes early. We were seated right away which is always nice. We had a great table with a view of the open kitchen. 

Our server came over to bring our drinks but it seemed to take him a rather long time. This would be indicative of the rest of the meal.  As we watched our server he seemed to have tables all over the restaurant so every thing we asked for took a long time. 

Come to find out the server did have a servers assistant but it would have been nice if he introduced this gentleman to us so we knew who to ask for what. 

The food was good but I would not go back again any time soon.
Amazing service and even better food.  Went there with a large wedding party.  If you like Italian, and even if you don't, this is the best restaurant in town.

Had another outstanding dinner here; I stop every trip to Vegas. (Twice a year).   The lasagna was so big and filling, and tonight the spaghetti bolognese was great.    Don't forget the Sunday gravy as a tasty option.   Alexis, our waitress, was delightful and made dinner perfect.   Thank you!!

I LOVED Buddy V's and cannot wait for my next trip to Vegas to go back. The atmosphere in the restaurant was great, but the food was what set this restaurant apart.
