I had the shrimp scampi and my husband had the chicken parm. Both were simply outstanding. Had I been wearing a looser dress, I would have been tempted to finish off the entire bowl of pasta.

I went here for a small meal with my parents before departing for the airport.  Among us 3 we split a Buddy's pizza and a pasta carbonara.  Pizza was quite tasty and good, very flavorful, but I thought it was too salty for my full and complete enjoyment.  The pasta arrived in a small-lookin portion, for the price we were paying . . (~$23?).  It's not like I was expecting Cheesecake factory portions, but given the price, the pasta could have either used a bit more pizzaz or a larger serving size.  It was a very .. bland okayish dish overall, something I feel that I could have made at home.  Definitely a skippable dish.

Made a reservation and was given the worst table there! Stuck at a small table when there was plenty of seating. This angered my bf who preceded to order something small for the both of us. Food was good but restaurant seating sucked!!

WHO: I know all of you are TLC Cake Boss fans like I am, who wouldn't be?! So, for everyone in the world who LOVES Buddy V as much as I do, be a NERD and come eat here (Don't forget the pictures, lol!)

WHERE: Located inside of the Grand Canal Shoppes of the Venetian and or Palazzo.

WHEN: Monday through Sunday from 11:30am-10pm; Friday & Saturday from 11:30am-11pm. & most importantly, Happy Hour from 4:30-6:30pm! =D

WHY: BECAUSE EVERYONE'S DOING IT! Lol, just kidding. Wouldn't you like to take part in a sit-down lunch or dinner with your friends and or family in Buddy V's first restaurant in Las Vegas?! & also because Carlo's Bakery is going to open in a few weeks to months just right across the restaurant! SO PERFECT!

WHAT: The first time I came here, my family and I did dinner. As I walked into the restaurant and to the table, I noticed the perfectly dim ambiance that filled the entire room. I love ROMANTICKLE restaurant settings! It makes me HAPPY! 

Random Tangent: Sometimes I make words up so don't dictionary.com them because it most likely won't be in there. Haha

So as my family and I were seated, we were handed the menus and ordered. I love dinner with family because we purposely order something different so that we can try each other's food! Too good!

FOOD:
Chicken Parm- I personally got the chicken parm, and it was excellent! I wish there could have been a tad bit more spaghetti with it, but overall Yummy!
Margherita pizza- My younger cousin chose this pizza, and I'm glad he did because there were slices for every single one of us! SHARING IS CARING!
Nonna's Lasagna al Forno- My older cousin ordered the lasagna. From the bite I took, I remember wishing I ordered it! It was definitely a hearty meal because there were leftovers! Thumbs up!

DESSERT:
Buddy's XL Lobster Tail- As I was scanning the dessert menu, my eyes suddenly zoomed into this dessert! I absolutely love the flaky pastry shell that enclosed the yummy, creamy, and PERFECT custard cream! (Everytime I go to NY, I search for Lobster Tails!!)
Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake- My cousin is addicted to chocolate, as this made his eyes light up! I loved the hazelnut praline crunch, good touch to the chocolatey goodness!

I still want to try the rest of what's on the dessert menu!!! GIMME GIMME GIMME!

HAPPY HOUR: My cousin and I just made it in time for HH the other day, and we went HAM!
Grandma's Meatballs- The perfect tasty, softy GOODNESS! I love these meatballs!
Macaroni & Cheese Carbonara- I am a mac&cheese fiend! This mac was pretty good. I've never had it with peas, but it actually gave it a sweet taste, GOOD COMBO!
Calamari Fritti- Loved the grilled lemon pinwheels, banana peppers, and the tomato aioli! AIOLI!!
Meatball sliders- We couldn't get enough of the meatballs, so we had to order it in bread!

Lastly, try the "CAKE BOSS" chocolate martini! If you love chocolate & alcohol, it was a really good mix! Tasted exactly like a chocolate cupcake... the only difference is it is in LIQUID FORM, and you may not be able to walk straight after! Lol

Before I continue typing, I am going to STOP and leave you with one thing... ENJOY!! & LET ME KNOW WHEN CARLO'S BAKERY OPENS! HOLLER! =D

Not impressed at all with the food. Everything was extremely salty. It's like they tried to make up for flavor with salt. And the service was absolutely horrible from the hostess that's nipples were showing through her see through dress to the rude waiter. This place is a def SKIP
Good southern Italian style cooking.  good meatballs which is key!  bone in veal parm was great.  reasonable prices and one of the few restaurants in large hotels with a window view of the strip

I am so glad we stopped by here... we were famished for lunch.

Best chicken Parmesan I've ever had.. Seriously.  The spaghetti served with it was al dente unlike so many places in the USA.  We split it and it was good size for my bf and I.  Wait staff was wonderful to do it without us even asking.

We also had the cheese plate with sliced meat which was really good.. A lot in quantity.  My fav was the salami and blue cheese.  Pickles weren't bad either.

Shared the meatballs as well which were good.  Not the best ever.. Six small meatballs come in the order with marinara.

Calamari is mediocre, like many other places in Vegas it is overhyped. They are not flexible. Bread is very tasty with oil and vinegar. The main attraction is the desserts. The Caesar salad has delicious cornbread croutons that are soft. Chicken Parmesan is well made not anything special. The chicken piccata is excellent and very flavorful. Tomato Basil soup is well but not anything special. The lasagna is on par with several franchise locations nothing extravagant. The Nutella cake taste like any other chocolate cake I could faintly taste the Nutella. The salted carmel Ice cream and raspberry sherbet is excellent and has a unique flavor. The cannoli is very good as well and is a must to order if you come here
I will say the service is excellent. Waiters are very attentive and are aware of their customers desires and level of drinks. The service is very friendly and insightful on the menu.      
In conclusion many of the dishes are very normal tasting. The desserts are very good overall. It is overpriced for what you get in respect to food but I say it's good to try once. If you are in for the deserts the bakery across has the same ones but will have a long wait.

This could be the first time I have ever said that a dinner on the strip was a bargain. Not only was it a bargain it was excellent. We had a family dinner with 6 people and did family style dinning. It was wonderful. Tons of food and a wonderful selection of tastes. If you go and have a chance to do the family dinning you would be crazy not too.  The only negative I can say is that it was a bit loud making conversation a tad difficult.

Phenomenal Italian food, which is what you might expect from a unique restaurant owned by an Italian family. The staff was wonderful as well, from the hosts at the front all the way to the manager who greeted us and had a minute or two conversation with us. 

The menu suits itself to family style dining. My wife and I each had drinks, split garlic bread with oil and vinegar, and the pollo rigatoni alla vodka, which is one of the best dishes I've ever eaten. The polenta croutons on the Caesar salad must be tried to be believed. The salad looks so simple that you might be disappointed when it comes to the table vs. my wife's house salad with beautiful heirloom tomatoes, but both were exceptional.

Contrary to many of the reviews I read, they do bring some small bread. Thinking that we didn't, we ordered the garlic bread, which could easily be split between 4-6 people. It was a little much, and if I did it over, I'd leave off the garlic bread and order dessert. We were simply too full! 

I'd you're looking for phenomenal food that's not terribly expensive (with drinks and all we were under $80), don't even give it a second thought, and come here. You may want to reserve your table through open table or something similar to get in quickly. Our reservation was delivered exactly on time.

Not the greatest... Back to the basics!
I was told the there was a steak/arugula salad as an option for dinner. I am not a fan of arugula, so I asked to have it on romaine (as they had a Caesar salad on the menu).  He asked the chef and the chef said no. I then said, can you just give me the Caesar salad and place a filet on it. He said sure. The entree came as follows... One plate with a filet (6oz) and one small bowl of Caesar salad. I asked what is this??? The server proceeded to tell me that the chef did not think a filet would go nicely on a Caesar. I told the server that I ordered the meal and not him. This really frustrates me. Cater to the customer, especially when this is a middle of the road restaurant. I also had (2) vodka and soda with a lime. The third one came with lemon. I asked why and where was my lemon. The server said that he did not want the drinks messed up? What?!? This place needs some flavor added to the meals, re-training of the staff and the chef to have a new attitude. I miss the First!!! The First was the restaurant prior.

UPDATE: 

Last night in Las Vegas, for this trip. It was uncertain room service, Table Ten or????? Well I went back to Buddy's. Sat at the bad this time. Again the service (Danny) was stellar, the food was delicious and again, I ate too much and had no room for dessert. Gonna miss this place! 

Staying at the Palazzo we saw a show about the owner, his love for desserts. We checked it and thankful that we did. The restaurants pretty spacious but not a whole lot of tables yet we were able to get a reservation for two. Service was top-notch full bar there's enough there to please everybody. We ate so much from bread, salad to entree that it's a shame we didn't save room for desserts. What were we thinking! I feel like we got robbed by our own decision to eat it all because it was so good. 

Guess it means we have to go back! Great wine selection too!

Great ambiance, service and food. Meat and Cheese plate to start. Meatballs and chicken Parmesan to follow. Mac and cheese melts in your mouth. I only wish they had spoons so I could get every last drop off the plate. Family oriented for the afternoon and adult ready for the evening. Desert is steps away Carlo's Bake Shop. Our server (William aka Raspberry) was excellent. Worth the $.
Great service. Did get our order mixed, however let us keep the dish we didn't order free of charged. Food was very good.

let me first state the food was good to very good, the service was lame. our server "Kristi F." left us waiting to the point we had to ask a person who cleared tables to have her come by and take our order. She rarely came by never checked on us. We had ordered several fixed menu items, that included desert, yet after the table was cleared from the dinner course she spread out desert menus saying, this and that were good.. We told her we had ordered the fixed menu that was inclusive of such and it seemed rather a  surprise to her, as she collected those desert menus Luckily the two young girls with us were entertained during the obscenely long 2.5 hour meal fest. I am not impressed.

Do not misunderstand me the food was good, the service was quite poor. I did not see a manager walking around, critiquing the troops on their performance and yet obviously it was needed.

The restaurant did NOT appear full, several tables were unoccupied. This adds to my confusion of tonight's performance. Perhaps we caught a bad night for our server and her customer skillset? 

We had a table of 7, 5 adults 2 children and 2.5 hours is well too long for a restaurant dinner, that is NOT a  dining experience.

It was lame.  

2 stars for food 0 for service..
Jolie déco et bon service, mais c'est tout : garniture annoncée non présente dans le plat, cher pour la qualité et la quantité, se dit italien mais ne sait pas faire de carbonara italienne.
Always the best experience when we go there. Great food, Great Service, Fabulous company.

Food was great! Our server, Chaz was spot on. The water and bread guys were always there. Oh and the decor is fabulous. Split your meal. The portions are way too big. We ate off our veal chop for 2 days once we brought it home.

While we waited 30 minutes for a table (we did not have a reservation) it was well worth the wait. The two of us split everything - meatball appetizer (to die for), ice cold crisp Caesar salad, and Chicken Penne a la Vodka, and Buddy's Lobster Tail for dessert. Our waitress pointed us in the right direction from start to finish. Oh! And they served this warm cheesy bread - awesome!

Oh my goodness we had the best salad (Buddy's Caprese) to start and were smart enough to share the salad and meatball sandwich.  The salad had the most unbelievable croutons in it.  I almost filled up on those alone.  Oh and the cheese in it... stop it.  So delicious.  We then shared the meatball sandwich and fries.  The sandwich is a bit messy just as any good Italian should be.  I thought the meatballs were very good and authentic.  I am surprised by the low reviews from various people because my experience could not have been better.  I also went to the bakery across the way and bought a cookie and brownie and both tasted homemade.  I really dislike "bakery" tasting cookies and to my surprise these were as if I had baked them in my own kitchen.  I'd highly suggest this place.  Also, I noticed a great room for big parties which I might use when in town again on business down the road.  The bar has a cool ambiance although I was there during the day on a Monday so it wasn't crowded.  I'll go back for sure!

My girlfriend and I went to Buddy V's Ristorante on May 10, 2014. I'm a fan of Cake Boss so I knew in advance of our trip that this would be one of the first places we would eat at. She ordered Nonna's Lasanga al Forno which we both enjoyed. I ordered the Valastro Sunday Gravy which also was pretty good. To be honest I expected a little more from the restaurant before arriving there, but at the same time it is what it's described as. A casual Italian restaurant with a famous owner and I'm ok with that.

Best Italian food I have had, we order the grilled garlic bread that we so moist and cheesy makes me want more just thinking about, the shrimp scampi that was awesome as well, the chicken parm was probably the best could not taste the fried taste which is great, and the carbonara that was great as well. We also tried there itailian beer is was smooth and had a great taste we also got to keep the cup another plus.

We stumbled upon Buddy V's looking on Yelp for an Italian dinner while in Vegas.  We lucked out that it was restaurant week too, so we were able to try quite the variety of options.

The restaurant is located in the front of the Venetian, so overlooks the strip making for a nice view at night.

We started out with the cheesy garlic bread, which was huge and quite good.  We also had the meatballs, which were very flavorful and the red sauce was delicious.  For dinner, the other half had the chicken parmesan, which he loved. I had the linguini vongole, which is my go to usually, and I thought it was fresh and well flavored, and not overly oily (my sometimes complaint).

We finished with a plate of all of their desserts, and every single one was good.  I think the cannoli may have been my favorite.

I did not realize until know that this is the Cake Boss' restaurant, but now that I know that, I think he should be the Boss of an Italian dinner too.

I was excited to try this place, especially bc the owner is the star of TLC's reality show 'Cake Boss.' I had high expectations, but unfortunately, they were not met. 

I took the safe route and ordered Chicken Parmesan. This dish is pretty difficult to mess up since it's so common and every Italian restaurant has it. But to my surprise, it was just....Bleh. Nothing spectacular about it. Tasted better everywhere else. 

I was with 7 other girls, who ordered a variety of dishes. All didn't seem wow'ed at all, too. Two girls ordered the same thing (forgot what they ordered), but one girl's dish was way more salty than the other. We all had a taste of both girls' dish and agreed. 

Service was also just.... Bleh. Whenever we asked our waiter for something, he had a lame excuse why it couldn't be done or if it can be done, he would take forever to do so. One thing I don't like is how they can't split up checks. Even very small restaurants don't have problems with splitting checks now a days. I also don't like paying a lot for food that's less than mediocre. 

I must add though that their dessert menu looked amazing. Too bad none of us were in a mood to try anything. I MIGHT be back to try out a dessert or two when I make it out here again to L.V.

Wow...
Had mozzarella and meatballs for appetizers that was good had a bottle of pinot noir.
Main meal: chicken parmigiano. ..ok
Scallops. ..boooo...this was terrible. ..fish taste like on verg of going bad, bacon tasted like old grease, the sauce don't even know what that was supposed to be, and for 32 bucks...booooooo. 
Lasagna was good..
Service was good 
I make better itialian at home

Was really skeptical when my husband told me we were meeting friends here for dinner. So many times famous television chefs have a restaurant and it is not very good...this was not the case with Buddy's!
The service was exceptional. She recommended three different meals: Chicken Parm, Lasagna, and Chicken Rigatoni. We had the Chicken Parm, the Chicken Rigatoni, and I went for the Chicken Marsala, as it is one of my favorites. Each meal was delicious! There was not a speck left on our plates! 
I will definitely return AND recommend it to all,

I've been in Vegas 4 days and have eaten here 3 times and will be back for lunch tomorrow. My husband doesn't like Italian food, so I don't get my fill, but this place changed that. Twice I've been here alone and the service and food has just been fantastic.  I've gotten the pizza, lasagna, tomato basil soup and caesar salad and liked the salad least of all. Both desserts - the cheesecake and creme brulee- were fantastic.  I wish we had one of these in Austin!!!!

My husband and I enjoyed our last dinner in Vegas at Buddy V's. The service was excellent and we were seated right away with our reservation. The live music was also enjoyable. We split a Caesar salad and the croutons were warm and stuffed! I had the orchiette pasta and my husband had the chicken parm. Both entrees were big portions. I recommend getting a table next to the window so you can enjoy the view of the strip.

These guys are a solid 3.5.  The service is very good, it is Vegas after all.  It is though a chain-like, more modern casual Olive Garden.  The food is a bit better than Olive Garden with some good items like the Sunday Gravy.  If you're expecting high quality Italian food this might not be the best stop. If you want some comfort food at a decent price, this is a good choice. 

Sadly they don't have much from the Carlo's bakery dessert menu though.

Did enjoy my food with the exception of the chicken parmigans burnt ends. Luckily portion was a good serving that I didn't feel that I was robbed of my meal will go again likely to try another menu item.
